fields.name: Ash of War: Through and Through
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

"Through and Through: Powerful archery skill using a greatbow held in an oblique stance. Ready the greatbow, then twist the bowstring to fire a mighty greatarrow that can penetrate through enemies."

Usable on greatbows.
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region, near the Stormhill Shack site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside nearby ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Barrage
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

"Barrage: Archery skill using a bow held horizontally. Ready the bow, then fire off a rapid succession of shots faster than the eye can see."

Usable on light bows.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside the ruins, near a group of enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Mighty Shot
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

"Mighty Shot: Archery skill performed from an oblique stance. Ready the bow, then pull the bowstring to its limit to enhance the power of the shot, penetrating the enemy's guard."

Usable on light bows and longbows.
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region, near the Stormhill Shack site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside nearby ruins.

fields.name: Leather Trousers
fields.description:
Well-made leather trousers.

The lower legs are each bound in cord for ease of movement.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Bandit class. After progressing in the game, the set can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant in the Weeping Peninsula, south of Limgrave.

fields.name: Kaiden Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by Kaiden sellswords.

These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback.
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.
fields.location: Dropped by Kaiden Sellswords—large, heavily armored enemies often found on horseback in Limgrave and along roads in West Limgrave. The best farming spot is the camp between Agheel Lake North and Murkwater Coast sites of grace, where several Kaiden Sellswords patrol.

fields.name: Ash of War: Hoarfrost Stomp
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Cold affinity and the following skill:

"Hoarfrost Stomp: Stomp hard to spread a trail of freezing mist on the ground. The mist applies the frost status effect."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, near the Ancient Snow Valley Ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside a ruined tower.

fields.name: Ash of War: Storm Stomp
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

"Storm Stomp: One of the skills that channel the tempests of Stormveil. Stomp hard on the ground to kick up a momentary storm."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Located in the Mountaintops of the Giants, near the Ancient Snow Valley Ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside a ruined tower.

fields.name: Ash of War: Kick
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"Kick: Push an enemy back with a high kick. Effective against enemies who are guarding, and can break a foe's stance. Sometimes a simple tool is the most effective."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Determination
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

"Determination: A knightly skill. Hold the flat of the armament to your face and pledge your resolve, powering up your next attack."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region. From the Gatefront Ruins site of grace, head north to a group of ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Royal Knight's Resolve
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

"Royal Knight's Resolve: Skill of the knights who once served the Elden Lord. Hold the flat of the armament to your face and pledge your resolve, greatly powering up your next attack."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the East Capital Rampart site of grace, descend the elevator and explore the city streets. The ash is on a corpse near Leyndell Knights.

fields.name: Ash of War: Assassin's Gambit
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Occult affinity and the following skill:

"Assassin's Gambit: Skill that masks the user's presence at the cost of a self-inflicted wound. Grants near-invisibility and silences footsteps."

Usable on small and medium straight swords and thrusting swords.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau. From the Abandoned Coffin site of grace, head east and look for a corpse near the cliffs. The ash is on this body.

fields.name: Ash of War: Golden Vow
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

"Golden Vow: Skill passed down from antiquity among the knights of the capital. Raise armament aloft and pledge to honor the Erdtree in battle, granting self and nearby allies increased attack power and defense."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Purchased from the Nomadic Merchant near the Bellum Church in Liurnia.

fields.name: Drake Knight Helm (Altered)
fields.description:
Black iron helm worn by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.

From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.
fields.location: Located in Crumbling Farum Azula. From the Dragon Temple Rooftop site of grace, head into the nearby church-like building, descend the ladder, and find the set inside a chest at the end of the path.

fields.name: Drake Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Black iron armor worn by drake knights.
Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion.

From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.
fields.location: Located in Crumbling Farum Azula. From the Dragon Temple Rooftop site of grace, head into the nearby church-like building, descend the ladder, and find the set inside a chest at the end of the path.

fields.name: Ash of War: Quickstep
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

"Quickstep: Skill prized by the crafty and fleet of foot.
Perform a quickstep maneuver that allows for circling around lock-on targets."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Bloodhound's Step
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

"Bloodhound's Step: Skill that allows the user to become temporarily invisible while dodging at high speed. Moves faster and travels farther than a regular quickstep. This skill can be used to circle around lock-on targets."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: The Bloodhound Step Ash of War is dropped by an invisible Night’s Cavalry boss found patrolling the road in the northeastern part of Caelid, near the Lenne’s Rise bridge. Defeat this boss to obtain the Ash of War.

fields.name: Ash of War: Raptor of the Mists
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

"Raptor of the Mists: Duck into a low stance, momentarily vanishing. If an enemy attack connects, avian wings will allow for a quick escape into the air."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The ash is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Scaled Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by Old Knight Istvan.
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.

Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.
fields.location: The Scaled Set is obtained as a reward after completing the first assassination contract for Volcano Manor. From the manor’s drawing room, accept the contract to kill Old Knight Istvan in Limgrave. Defeating him will reward you with the Scaled Set.

fields.name: Scaled Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan.
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.

Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.
fields.location: The Scaled Set is obtained as a reward after completing the first assassination contract for Volcano Manor. From the manor’s drawing room, accept the contract to kill Old Knight Istvan in Limgrave. Defeating him will reward you with the Scaled Set.

fields.name: Perfumer Hood
fields.description:
Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.
fields.location: The Perfumer Set (Hood, Robe, Gloves, Trousers) is dropped by Perfumer enemies. These enemies are commonly found in the shaded areas of the Altus Plateau, especially in the Perfumer’s Ruins and around Leyndell, Royal Capital. Defeat Perfumers in these locations to collect the full set

fields.name: Perfumer Robe
fields.description:
Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

The thick front apron embroidered with a depiction of the Erdtree is proof of mastery of the apothecarial arts, and its weight symbolizes the onus of both pride and responsibility.
fields.location: The Perfumer Set (Hood, Robe, Gloves, Trousers) is dropped by Perfumer enemies. These enemies are commonly found in the shaded areas of the Altus Plateau, especially in the Perfumer’s Ruins and around Leyndell, Royal Capital. Defeat Perfumers in these locations to collect the full set

fields.name: Perfumer Gloves
fields.description:
Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.
fields.location: The Perfumer Set (Hood, Robe, Gloves, Trousers) is dropped by Perfumer enemies. These enemies are commonly found in the shaded areas of the Altus Plateau, especially in the Perfumer’s Ruins and around Leyndell, Royal Capital. Defeat Perfumers in these locations to collect the full set

fields.description:

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

The thick front apron embroidered with a depiction of the Erdtree is proof of mastery of the apothecarial arts, and its weight symbolizes the onus of both pride and responsibility.

These enemies are commonly found in the shaded areas of the Altus Plateau, especially in the Perfumer’s Ruins and around Leyndell, Royal Capital. Defeat Perfumers in these locations to collect the full set

fields.name: Traveler's Hat
fields.description:
Hat of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.
fields.location: Unknown

fields.name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb
fields.description:
Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

The thick front apron, the badge of a perfumer, has been replaced with a more simple one made from soft leather.
fields.location: The Perfumer Set (Hood, Robe, Gloves, Trousers) is dropped by Perfumer enemies. These enemies are commonly found in the shaded areas of the Altus Plateau, especially in the Perfumer’s Ruins and around Leyndell, Royal Capital. Defeat Perfumers in these locations to collect the full set

fields.name: Traveler's Gloves
fields.description:
Gloves of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.
fields.location: Unknown

fields.name: Traveler's Slops
fields.description:
Slops of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.
fields.location: Unknown

fields.name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb (Altered)
fields.description:
Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

The thick front apron, the badge of a perfumer, has been replaced with a more simple one made from soft leather.

These enemies are commonly found in the shaded areas of the Altus Plateau, especially in the Perfumer’s Ruins and around Leyndell, Royal Capital. Defeat Perfumers in these locations to collect the full set

fields.name: Alberich's Pointed Hat
fields.description:
Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.
fields.location: Same as above, in the main hall of the Fortified Manor in Leyndell.

fields.name: Alberich's Robe
fields.description:
Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.
fields.location: Same as above, in the main hall of the Fortified Manor in Leyndell.

fields.name: Alberich's Bracers
fields.description:
Mad Tongue Alberich's bracers.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthen thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.
fields.location: Inside the main hall on the first floor of the Fortified Manor in Leyndell, Royal Capital, alongside the rest of the Alberich’s Set.

fields.name: Alberich's Trousers
fields.description:
Mad Tongue Alberich's trousers.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.
fields.location: Same as above, in the main hall of the Fortified Manor in Leyndell.

fields.name: Alberich's Pointed Hat (Altered)
fields.description:
Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.
fields.location: Same as above, in the main hall of the Fortified Manor in Leyndell.

fields.name: Alberich's Robe (Altered)
fields.description:
Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.
fields.location: Same as above, in the main hall of the Fortified Manor in Leyndell.

fields.name: Spellblade's Pointed Hat
fields.description:
Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.
fields.location: The Spellblade Set is obtained after completing Sorcerer Rogier’s questline or after he dies at the Roundtable Hold. First, meet him in Stormveil Castle, then progress through his story until he passes away at the Hold. The set will be found on his body where he rests.

fields.name: Spellblade's Traveling Attire
fields.description:
Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.
fields.location: The Spellblade Set is obtained after completing Sorcerer Rogier’s questline or after he dies at the Roundtable Hold. First, meet him in Stormveil Castle, then progress through his story until he passes away at the Hold. The set will be found on his body where he rests.

fields.name: Spellblade's Gloves
fields.description:
Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's gloves, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthen glintstone sorcery skills.

Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.
fields.location: The Spellblade Set is obtained after completing Sorcerer Rogier’s questline or after he dies at the Roundtable Hold. First, meet him in Stormveil Castle, then progress through his story until he passes away at the Hold. The set will be found on his body where he rests.

fields.name: Spellblade's Trousers
fields.description:
Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's trousers, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthen glintstone sorcery skills.

Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.
fields.location: The Spellblade Set is obtained after completing Sorcerer Rogier’s questline or after he dies at the Roundtable Hold. First, meet him in Stormveil Castle, then progress through his story until he passes away at the Hold. The set will be found on his body where he rests.

fields.description:
Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.
fields.location: The Spellblade Set is obtained after completing Sorcerer Rogier’s questline or after he dies at the Roundtable Hold. First, meet him in Stormveil Castle, then progress through his story until he passes away at the Hold. The set will be found on his body where he rests.

fields.name: Bull-Goat Helm
fields.description:
Great Horned Tragoth's helm, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provides high poise.

Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.
fields.location: The entire Bull-Goat armor set is obtained by defeating Great Horned Tragoth. You can invade him as part of Patches’ questline. After reaching Volcano Manor and completing the first two assassination contracts, speak to Patches and he’ll give you a red invasion sign. Use it to invade Tragoth near the Ruin-Strewn Precipice. Defeat him to receive the full Bull-Goat set.

fields.name: Bull-Goat Armor
fields.description:
Great Horned Tragoth's armor. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.

Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.
fields.location: The entire Bull-Goat armor set is obtained by defeating Great Horned Tragoth. You can invade him as part of Patches’ questline. After reaching Volcano Manor and completing the first two assassination contracts, speak to Patches and he’ll give you a red invasion sign. Use it to invade Tragoth near the Ruin-Strewn Precipice. Defeat him to receive the full Bull-Goat set.

fields.name: Bull-Goat Gauntlets
fields.description:
Great Horned Tragoth's gauntlets, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provide high poise.

Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.
fields.location: The entire Bull-Goat armor set is obtained by defeating Great Horned Tragoth. You can invade him as part of Patches’ questline. After reaching Volcano Manor and completing the first two assassination contracts, speak to Patches and he’ll give you a red invasion sign. Use it to invade Tragoth near the Ruin-Strewn Precipice. Defeat him to receive the full Bull-Goat set.

fields.name: Bull-Goat Greaves
fields.description:
Great Horned Tragoth's greaves, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provide high poise.

Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.
fields.location: The entire Bull-Goat armor set is obtained by defeating Great Horned Tragoth. You can invade him as part of Patches’ questline. After reaching Volcano Manor and completing the first two assassination contracts, speak to Patches and he’ll give you a red invasion sign. Use it to invade Tragoth near the Ruin-Strewn Precipice. Defeat him to receive the full Bull-Goat set.

fields.name: Iron Kasa
fields.description:
Iron kasa of the man who calls himself Shabriri.
Crafted to imitate the woven straw hats worn in the Land of Reeds.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.
fields.location: Sold by the Isolated Merchant in the Weeping Peninsula, at the merchant’s shack on the western edge of the region.

fields.name: Ronin's Armor
fields.description:
Armor of the man who calls himself Shabriri.
Highly functional and heavily worn.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.
fields.location: The Ronin Set is dropped by Ronin enemies, who are wandering samurai-like foes found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, especially near the Church of Repose. Defeating these agile warriors grants their full armor set, which features a traditional samurai aesthetic.

fields.name: Ronin's Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets of the man who calls himself Shabriri.
Highly functional and heavily worn.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.
fields.location: The Ronin Set is dropped by Ronin enemies, who are wandering samurai-like foes found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, especially near the Church of Repose. Defeating these agile warriors grants their full armor set, which features a traditional samurai aesthetic.

fields.name: Ronin's Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves of the man who calls himself Shabriri.
Highly functional and heavily worn.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.
fields.location: The Ronin Set is dropped by Ronin enemies, who are wandering samurai-like foes found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, especially near the Church of Repose. Defeating these agile warriors grants their full armor set, which features a traditional samurai aesthetic.

fields.name: Ronin's Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor of the man who calls himself Shabriri.
Highly functional and heavily worn.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.
fields.location: The Ronin Set is dropped by Ronin enemies, who are wandering samurai-like foes found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, especially near the Church of Repose. Defeating these agile warriors grants their full armor set, which features a traditional samurai aesthetic.

fields.name: Guilty Hood
fields.description:
Coarse hooded cloak of olive brown.

The garb of those accused of lesser crimes, indicated by the collar of sharpened branches.
fields.location: The Cloth Garb and Cloth Trousers are found in Murkwater Cave in Limgrave. The Guilty Hood is sold by the Nomadic Merchant on Mt. Gelmir.

fields.name: Cloth Garb
fields.description: Clothing made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.
fields.location: Both pieces are found together in a chest at the end of Murkwater Cave, located in central Limgrave. After defeating the cave’s boss, open the chest in the final chamber to collect both items.

fields.name: Cloth Trousers
fields.description: Trousers made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.
fields.location: Both pieces are found together in a chest at the end of Murkwater Cave, located in central Limgrave. After defeating the cave’s boss, open the chest in the final chamber to collect both items.

fields.name: Black Wolf Mask
fields.description:
A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf.

Relic of an assassin who assumed the guise of Ranni the Witch's loyal shadow. The likeness is striking.
fields.location: Dropped by the Bloodhound Knight Darriwil in the Forlorn Hound Evergaol, Limgrave. Defeat Darriwil to obtain the mask.

fields.name: Blaidd's Armor
fields.description:
Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd.

The pelt serves as a cape, protecting from cold.
Blaidd was the blade of Ranni, but the cold bothered him anyway.
fields.location: Received after completing Blaidd’s questline, found on his body at the Forlorn Hound Evergaol in Limgrave after certain story events.

fields.name: Blaidd's Gauntlets
fields.description:
Well-worn black gauntlets of the man-wolf Blaidd.

Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.
fields.location: Received after completing Blaidd’s questline, found on his body at the Forlorn Hound Evergaol in Limgrave after certain story events.

fields.name: Blaidd's Greaves
fields.description:
Well-worn black greaves of the man-wolf Blaidd.

Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.
fields.location: Received after completing Blaidd’s questline, found on his body at the Forlorn Hound Evergaol in Limgrave after certain story events.

fields.name: Blaidd's Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd.

Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.
fields.location: Received after completing Blaidd’s questline, found on his body at the Forlorn Hound Evergaol in Limgrave after certain story events.

fields.name: Black Knife Hood
fields.description:
Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.
fields.location: Dropped by Black Knife Assassin enemies, most reliably by the one in the Black Knife Catacombs in Liurnia.

fields.name: Black Knife Armor
fields.description:
Scale armor used by the Black Knife Assassins, forged to make no sound.

Traces of power yet remain in its concealing veil, which muffles the sound of footsteps.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.
fields.location: Dropped by Black Knife Assassin enemies, most reliably by the one in the Black Knife Catacombs in Liurnia.

fields.name: Black Knife Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets used by the Black Knife Assassins.
Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.
fields.location: Dropped by Black Knife Assassin enemies, most reliably by the one in the Black Knife Catacombs in Liurnia.

fields.name: Black Knife Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves used by the Black Knife Assassins.
Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.
fields.location: Dropped by Black Knife Assassin enemies, most reliably by the one in the Black Knife Catacombs in Liurnia.

fields.name: Black Knife Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor used by the Black Knife Assassins.
Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.
fields.location: Dropped by Black Knife Assassin enemies, most reliably by the one in the Black Knife Catacombs in Liurnia.

fields.name: Exile Hood
fields.description:
Deep red hood that covers the whole head.

Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies, who were required to keep their faces hidden.
fields.location: Dropped by Exile Soldiers, who wield large swords and axes and can be found throughout Stormveil Castle. Each piece has a chance to drop from these enemies, especially in the castle’s outer courtyards and ramparts.

fields.name: Exile Armor
fields.description:
Damaged armor draped with a large deep-red cloth.
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.
fields.location: Dropped by Exile Soldiers, who wield large swords and axes and can be found throughout Stormveil Castle. Each piece has a chance to drop from these enemies, especially in the castle’s outer courtyards and ramparts.

fields.name: Exile Gauntlets
fields.description:
Damaged iron gauntlets.
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.
fields.location: Dropped by Exile Soldiers, who wield large swords and axes and can be found throughout Stormveil Castle. Each piece has a chance to drop from these enemies, especially in the castle’s outer courtyards and ramparts.

fields.name: Exile Greaves
fields.description:
Damaged iron greaves.
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.
fields.location: Dropped by Exile Soldiers, who wield large swords and axes and can be found throughout Stormveil Castle. Each piece has a chance to drop from these enemies, especially in the castle’s outer courtyards and ramparts.

fields.name: Banished Knight Helm
fields.description:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

Perhaps the deep-red scarf was used to block the winds, for on the outskirts, the winds bite with a stinging fierceness.
fields.location: Dropped by Banished Knights, most reliably found in Stormveil Castle and the Dragon Communion Cathedral in Caelid.

fields.name: Banished Knight Armor
fields.description:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body.
This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.
fields.location: Dropped by Banished Knights, most reliably found in Stormveil Castle and the Dragon Communion Cathedral in Caelid.

fields.name: Briar Helm
fields.description:
Battered iron helm from a foreign land.
Worn by Elemer of the Briar.

The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty, and typically indicate a sentence of death. They also cause this armor to deal damage when performing dodge rolls.

Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.
fields.location: Dropped by Elemer of the Briar in the Shaded Castle, Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Page Hood
fields.description:
Hood worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

The unassuming sack-like appearance befits their unseen and unknown stature.
fields.location: Dropped by Page enemies, who are found in Raya Lucaria Academy (especially near the Church of the Cuckoo and Debate Parlor) and in Caria Manor. Farm these agile, crossbow-wielding foes for each piece.

fields.name: Page Garb
fields.description:
Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.
fields.location: Dropped by Page enemies, who are found in Raya Lucaria Academy (especially near the Church of the Cuckoo and Debate Parlor) and in Caria Manor. Farm these agile, crossbow-wielding foes for each piece.

fields.name: Night's Cavalry Helm
fields.description:
Pitch-black helm with flowing black hair.
Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.
fields.location: Dropped by Night’s Cavalry bosses patrolling roads at night. The full set is obtained by defeating the duo in Consecrated Snowfield.

fields.description:

Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

fields.name: Blue Silver Mail Hood
fields.description:
Chainmail hood crafted with blue silver.
Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.
fields.location: Dropped by Albinauric archers in the Consecrated Snowfield.

fields.name: Blue Silver Mail Armor
fields.description:
Chainmail armor crafted with blue silver.
Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.
fields.location: Dropped by Albinauric archers in the Consecrated Snowfield.

fields.description:

Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

fields.name: Nomadic Merchant's Chapeau
fields.description:
Chapeau of the nomadic merchants.
Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors.

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.
fields.location: Dropped by Nomadic Merchants if killed. Merchants are scattered at campfires, such as the one near the Weeping Peninsula’s Castle Morne Rampart.

fields.name: Nomadic Merchant's Finery
fields.description:
Finery of the nomadic merchants.
Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors.

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.
fields.location: Dropped by Nomadic Merchants if killed. Merchants are scattered at campfires, such as the one near the Weeping Peninsula’s Castle Morne Rampart.

fields.name: Nomadic Merchant's Trousers
fields.description:
Trousers of the nomadic merchants.

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.
fields.location: Dropped by Nomadic Merchants if killed. Merchants are scattered at campfires, such as the one near the Weeping Peninsula’s Castle Morne Rampart.

fields.name: Malformed Dragon Helm
fields.description:
A malformed golden helm.
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.
fields.location: Dropped by the Draconic Tree Sentinel guarding the entrance to Maliketh’s arena in Crumbling Farum Azula. Defeat this boss near the Beside the Great Bridge site of grace to obtain the full set.

fields.name: Malformed Dragon Armor
fields.description:
Malformed golden armor.
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.
fields.location: Dropped by the Draconic Tree Sentinel guarding the entrance to Maliketh’s arena in Crumbling Farum Azula. Defeat this boss near the Beside the Great Bridge site of grace to obtain the full set.

Malformed golden gauntlets.
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

fields.location: Dropped by the Draconic Tree Sentinel guarding the entrance to Maliketh’s arena in Crumbling Farum Azula. Defeat this boss near the Beside the Great Bridge site of grace to obtain the full set.

fields.name: Tree Sentinel Helm
fields.description:
Golden helm of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Very few are permitted to wear a golden wood crest of such size as seen on this helm.
fields.location: The Tree Sentinel Set is dropped by the Draconic Tree Sentinel in Farum Azula. Defeat this formidable boss to obtain the set, which features golden armor and a flowing cape.

fields.name: Tree Sentinel Armor
fields.description:
Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Adorned with a cape featuring the mark of the sacred tree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.
fields.location: The Tree Sentinel Set is dropped by the Draconic Tree Sentinel in Farum Azula. Defeat this formidable boss to obtain the set, which features golden armor and a flowing cape.

fields.name: Tree Sentinel Gauntlets
fields.description:
Golden gauntlets of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.
fields.location: The Tree Sentinel Set is dropped by the Draconic Tree Sentinel in Farum Azula. Defeat this formidable boss to obtain the set, which features golden armor and a flowing cape.

fields.name: Tree Sentinel Greaves
fields.description:
Golden greaves of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.
fields.location: The Tree Sentinel Set is dropped by the Draconic Tree Sentinel in Farum Azula. Defeat this formidable boss to obtain the set, which features golden armor and a flowing cape.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.
fields.location: The Tree Sentinel Set is dropped by the Draconic Tree Sentinel in Farum Azula. Defeat this formidable boss to obtain the set, which features golden armor and a flowing cape.

fields.name: Royal Knight Helm
fields.description:
Silver helm of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.
fields.location: The Royal Knight Set is dropped by Royal Knight Loretta, the boss of the Chapel of Anticipation in the Liurnia region. Defeating her rewards you with this elegant knightly armor, known for its polished metal and regal design.

fields.name: Royal Knight Armor
fields.description:
Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta was once a royal Carian knight, and her lapis-lazuli blue cape is the emblem of the knightly pride that continues to guide her.
fields.location: The Royal Knight Set is dropped by Royal Knight Loretta, the boss of the Chapel of Anticipation in the Liurnia region. Defeating her rewards you with this elegant knightly armor, known for its polished metal and regal design.

fields.name: Royal Knight Gauntlets
fields.description:

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.
fields.location: The Royal Knight Set is dropped by Royal Knight Loretta, the boss of the Chapel of Anticipation in the Liurnia region. Defeating her rewards you with this elegant knightly armor, known for its polished metal and regal design.

fields.name: Nox Monk Hood
fields.description:
Silk hood worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
fields.location: Dropped by Nox Monks in Nokron, Eternal City. Farm the monks near the Ancestral Woods site of grace.

fields.name: Nox Monk Armor
fields.description:
Armor worn by the monks of the Eternal City, with a silk cape attached.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
fields.location: Dropped by Nox Monks in Nokron, Eternal City. Farm the monks near the Ancestral Woods site of grace.

fields.name: Nox Bracelets
fields.description:
Monastic bracelets of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
fields.location: Dropped by Nox Monks, Nox Swordstresses, and Night Maidens in Nokron, Eternal City, and Nokstella, Eternal City. The best farming spots are near the Ancestral Woods site of grace for Monks and Swordstresses, and near the Sellia Under-Stair site of grace for Night Maidens.

fields.name: Nox Greaves
fields.description:
Monastic greaves of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
fields.location: Dropped by Nox Monks, Nox Swordstresses, and Night Maidens in Nokron, Eternal City, and Nokstella, Eternal City. Farm these enemies in the same locations as above for a chance to obtain the greaves.

fields.name: Nox Monk Hood (Altered)
fields.description:
Hood worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
fields.location: Dropped by Nox Monks in Nokron, Eternal City. Farm the monks near the Ancestral Woods site of grace.

fields.description:

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
fields.location: Dropped by Nox Monks in Nokron, Eternal City. Farm the monks near the Ancestral Woods site of grace.

fields.name: Nox Swordstress Crown
fields.description:
Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and the silk hides their eyes.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
fields.location: Dropped by Nox Swordstress enemies in Nokstella, Eternal City. Found near the Nokstella Waterfall Basin site of grace.

fields.name: Nox Swordstress Armor
fields.description:
Armor worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and wear silk capes.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
fields.location: Dropped by Nox Swordstress enemies in Nokstella, Eternal City. Found near the Nokstella Waterfall Basin site of grace.

fields.name: Night Maiden Twin Crown
fields.description:
Twin crowns worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City.
Indicates the highest clerical rank, and hides the eyes with silk.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
fields.location: Dropped by Night Maidens in Sellia, Town of Sorcery (Caelid). Farm the maidens near the Sellia Under-Stair site of grace.

fields.name: Night Maiden Armor
fields.description:
Armor worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City.
Indicates the highest clerical rank, and includes a silk cape.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
fields.location: Dropped by Night Maidens in Sellia, Town of Sorcery (Caelid). Farm the maidens near the Sellia Under-Stair site of grace.

fields.name: Nox Swordstress Crown (Altered)
fields.description:
Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
The silk eye covering is removed, flaunting convention.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
fields.location: Dropped by Nox Swordstress enemies in Nokstella, Eternal City. Found near the Nokstella Waterfall Basin site of grace.

fields.name: Nox Swordstress Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City.
These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
fields.location: Dropped by Nox Swordstress enemies in Nokstella, Eternal City. Found near the Nokstella Waterfall Basin site of grace.

fields.name: Great Horned Headband
fields.description:
Headband decorated by a pair of great horns.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.
fields.location: Dropped by Ancestral Follower enemies, most commonly found in Siofra River and Nokron, Eternal City. The headband is a rare drop from these horned warriors.

fields.name: Fur Raiment
fields.description:
Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.
fields.location: Dropped by Nomadic Merchants after defeating them. These merchants are found throughout the Lands Between, often near campfires on the main roads.

fields.name: Fur Leggings
fields.description:
Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts.
Worn by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.
fields.location: Dropped by Nomadic Merchants after defeating them. These merchants are found throughout the Lands Between, often near campfires on the main roads.

fields.name: Shining Horned Headband
fields.description:
Headband decorated by a pair of shining horns.
Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

Horns with buds that also shine are ideal ceremonial items for ancestral worship. Strengthens Ancestral Infant's Head.
fields.location: The Shining Horned Headband is a guaranteed drop from a specific Ancestral Follower Shaman found north-east of the Ancestral Woods site of grace, near the ruins with a moose corpse in Siofra River. This shaman is often seen singing and is easily recognizable by the headband’s unique horns.

fields.name: Shaman Furs
fields.description:
Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt.
Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.
fields.location: The Shaman Furs are worn by the Ancestral Follower Shamans in the Siofra River region. To find them, journey to the Ancestral Woods or Hollowhorn Grounds and defeat the shamans who guard these areas. The furs are often dropped by these enemies, and they are crafted from bristly pelts.

fields.name: Shaman Leggings
fields.description:
Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts.
Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.
fields.location: These leggings are part of the Shaman Set and can be looted from the Ancestral Follower Shamans in the Ancestral Woods area of Siofra River. After defeating a shaman, there’s a chance they will drop the leggings, which are fashioned from the same pelts as the furs.

fields.name: Duelist Helm
fields.description:
Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.
fields.location: Dropped by Duelist enemies, most reliably found in the Colosseum area of Leyndell and near the entrance to the Auriza Hero’s Grave in Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Gravekeeper Cloak
fields.description:
Thick, bristly cloak that is the symbol of an underground gravekeeper.

Those who once fought for a living were driven from the colosseum, and becoming guardians of Erdtree Burial.
fields.location: Dropped by skeletal Gravekeeper enemies in the Consecrated Snowfield and the Mountaintops of the Giants. These cloaked skeletons are often found near graveyards and mausoleums in snowy regions.

fields.name: Duelist Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves encircled by bronze snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.
fields.location: Dropped by Duelist enemies, most reliably found in the Colosseum area of Leyndell and near the entrance to the Auriza Hero’s Grave in Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Gravekeeper Cloak (Altered)
fields.description:
Defensive wear encircled by bronze snakes.
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.
fields.location: The altered version is obtained by altering the standard Gravekeeper Cloak at a site of grace, provided you have a Sewing Needle and Tailoring Tools. (No separate drop location; it’s a modified version of the base cloak.)

fields.name: Sanguine Noble Hood
fields.description:
Hood of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery.
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.
fields.location: To acquire the Sanguine Noble Set, you must defeat the Sanguine Noble invader in the Consecrated Snowfield. Reach this area by using both halves of the Haligtree Secret Medallion at the Grand Lift of Rold. When you explore the ruins near the Inner Consecrated Snowfield site of grace, the invader will appear and drop the set upon defeat.

fields.name: Sanguine Noble Robe
fields.description:
Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery.
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

The grand metallic pattern on the shoulder is a signifier of the noble rank they intend to claim upon the advent of the new dynasty they are working to install.
fields.location: To acquire the Sanguine Noble Set, you must defeat the Sanguine Noble invader in the Consecrated Snowfield. Reach this area by using both halves of the Haligtree Secret Medallion at the Grand Lift of Rold. When you explore the ruins near the Inner Consecrated Snowfield site of grace, the invader will appear and drop the set upon defeat.

fields.name: Sanguine Noble Waistcloth
fields.description:
Waistcloth sewn from black cloth.
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.
fields.location: To acquire the Sanguine Noble Set, you must defeat the Sanguine Noble invader in the Consecrated Snowfield. Reach this area by using both halves of the Haligtree Secret Medallion at the Grand Lift of Rold. When you explore the ruins near the Inner Consecrated Snowfield site of grace, the invader will appear and drop the set upon defeat.

fields.name: Guardian Mask
fields.description:
Engraved golden mask.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.
fields.location: Dropped by Guardian enemies near Minor Erdtrees across the Lands Between. The best farming spot is on the large branches outside the Erdtree Sanctuary in Leyndell.

fields.name: Guardian Garb (Full Bloom)
fields.description:
Engraved golden garb.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

Raises the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears, but greatly lowers fire damage negation.

It is said that the blood-red flowers blooming on their backs mark the senescence of their ancient pact. Perhaps the guardians are part tree already.
fields.location: Dropped by Guardian enemies near Minor Erdtrees across the Lands Between. The best farming spot is on the large branches outside the Erdtree Sanctuary in Leyndell.

fields.name: Guardian Bracers
fields.description:
Engraved golden bracers.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.
fields.location: Dropped by Guardian enemies near Minor Erdtrees across the Lands Between. The best farming spot is on the large branches outside the Erdtree Sanctuary in Leyndell.

fields.name: Guardian Greaves
fields.description:
Engraved golden greaves.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.
fields.location: Dropped by Guardian enemies near Minor Erdtrees across the Lands Between. The best farming spot is on the large branches outside the Erdtree Sanctuary in Leyndell.

fields.name: Guardian Garb
fields.description:
Engraved golden garb.
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.
fields.location: Dropped by Guardian enemies near Minor Erdtrees across the Lands Between. The best farming spot is on the large branches outside the Erdtree Sanctuary in Leyndell.

fields.name: Cleanrot Helm
fields.description:
Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.
fields.location: Dropped by Cleanrot Knights in the swampy Inner Aeonia region of Caelid. Farm these knights for a chance at each piece; you may need to defeat several before collecting the full set.

fields.name: Cleanrot Armor
fields.description:
Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.
fields.location: Dropped by Cleanrot Knights in the swampy Inner Aeonia region of Caelid. Farm these knights for a chance at each piece; you may need to defeat several before collecting the full set.

fields.location: Dropped by Cleanrot Knights in the swampy Inner Aeonia region of Caelid. Farm these knights for a chance at each piece; you may need to defeat several before collecting the full set.

fields.description:

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles the fiercest of all.

fields.name: Fire Monk Hood
fields.description:
Mail hood of iron links covering a headband
engraved with flames. Attire of the Fire Monks.

The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.
fields.location: Dropped by Fire Monk enemies, who patrol roads and camps in eastern Liurnia and the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Fire Monk Armor
fields.description:
Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth.
Attire of the Fire Monks.

The grotesque face sculpted on the chest is said to depict the corrupt ancient god of the flame.
Taboos transform into lasting obsessions by virtue of the fear that they inspire.
fields.location: Dropped by Fire Monk enemies, who patrol roads and camps in eastern Liurnia and the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Fire Monk Gauntlets
fields.description:
Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Fire Monks.

The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.
fields.location: Dropped by Fire Monk enemies, who patrol roads and camps in eastern Liurnia and the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Fire Monk Greaves
fields.description:
Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Fire Monks.

The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.
fields.location: Dropped by Fire Monk enemies, who patrol roads and camps in eastern Liurnia and the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Blackflame Monk Hood
fields.description:
Mail hood of iron links covering a headband
engraved with flames. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.
fields.location: Dropped by Blackflame Monks, most commonly found in the Divine Tower of Caelid and near the Godskin Apostle boss in the Windmill Village, Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Blackflame Monk Armor
fields.description:
Black iron armor adorned with ashen cloth.
Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.
fields.location: Dropped by Blackflame Monks, most commonly found in the Divine Tower of Caelid and near the Godskin Apostle boss in the Windmill Village, Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Blackflame Monk Gauntlets
fields.description:
Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.
fields.location: Dropped by Blackflame Monks, most commonly found in the Divine Tower of Caelid and near the Godskin Apostle boss in the Windmill Village, Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Blackflame Monk Greaves
fields.description:
Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif.
Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.
fields.location: Dropped by Blackflame Monks, most commonly found in the Divine Tower of Caelid and near the Godskin Apostle boss in the Windmill Village, Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Fire Prelate Helm
fields.description:
Helm engraved with a sacred countenance and housing a cauldron.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

It is said the cauldron perched atop the head was originally furnished with embers, and would surge into flames when the wearer's faith reached its zenith. The fire of this cauldron has since died out, however.
fields.location: Dropped by Fire Prelate enemies, large hammer-wielding foes found at Fort Laiedd on Mt. Gelmir and in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Fire Prelate Armor
fields.description:
Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."
fields.location: Dropped by Fire Prelate enemies, large hammer-wielding foes found at Fort Laiedd on Mt. Gelmir and in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Fire Prelate Gauntlets
fields.description:
Black iron gauntlets with the appearance of flames.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."
fields.location: Dropped by Fire Prelate enemies, large hammer-wielding foes found at Fort Laiedd on Mt. Gelmir and in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Fire Prelate Greaves
fields.description:
Black iron greaves with the appearance of flames.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."
fields.location: Dropped by Fire Prelate enemies, large hammer-wielding foes found at Fort Laiedd on Mt. Gelmir and in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Fire Prelate Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Black iron armor.
Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame. "Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."
fields.location: Dropped by Fire Prelate enemies, large hammer-wielding foes found at Fort Laiedd on Mt. Gelmir and in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Aristocrat Headband
fields.description:
Valuable headband featuring fine goldwork.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.
fields.location: Dropped by Wandering Nobles, commonly found in Liurnia and the Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Aristocrat Garb
fields.description:
High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.
fields.location: Dropped by Wandering Nobles, commonly found in Liurnia and the Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Aristocrat Boots
fields.description:
Boots made from tanned leather.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.
fields.location: Dropped by Wandering Nobles, commonly found in Liurnia and the Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Aristocrat Garb (Altered)
fields.description:
High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.
fields.location: Dropped by Wandering Nobles, commonly found in Liurnia and the Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Aristocrat Hat
fields.description:
Leather hat decorated with a withered feather.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.
fields.location: Dropped by Wandering Nobles, most commonly found in Limgrave, Liurnia, and the Altus Plateau. These hats are rare drops, but farming groups of nobles along roads or near ruins in these regions is the best approach.

fields.name: Aristocrat Coat
fields.description:
Tanned leather coat adorned with fine gold embroidery.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.
fields.location: Dropped by Wandering Nobles, commonly found in Liurnia and the Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Old Aristocrat Cowl
fields.description:
Cowl made of soft cloth.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.
fields.location:
These pieces are all part of the Old Aristocrat set and are dropped by Old Noble enemies who wander various roads throughout the Lands Between. The Old Nobles are recognizable by the banners they carry. Reliable farming spots include:

Church of Vows: Three Old Nobles can be found nearby, with one to the north and two to the east of the site of grace.

Agheel Lake South: Head north from the site of grace to find Old Nobles along the road, especially near the Troll-pulled Carriage’s caravan.

Altus Plateau: Old Nobles can be found close to the Rampartside Path site of grace.

fields.name: Old Aristocrat Gown
fields.description:
Gown of soft cloth adorned with fine gold embroidery.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.
fields.location:
These pieces are all part of the Old Aristocrat set and are dropped by Old Noble enemies who wander various roads throughout the Lands Between. The Old Nobles are recognizable by the banners they carry. Reliable farming spots include:

Church of Vows: Three Old Nobles can be found nearby, with one to the north and two to the east of the site of grace.

Agheel Lake South: Head north from the site of grace to find Old Nobles along the road, especially near the Troll-pulled Carriage’s caravan.

Altus Plateau: Old Nobles can be found close to the Rampartside Path site of grace.

fields.name: Old Aristocrat Shoes
fields.description:
Hard-wearing shoes made of leather.
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.
fields.location:
These pieces are all part of the Old Aristocrat set and are dropped by Old Noble enemies who wander various roads throughout the Lands Between. The Old Nobles are recognizable by the banners they carry. Reliable farming spots include:

Church of Vows: Three Old Nobles can be found nearby, with one to the north and two to the east of the site of grace.

Agheel Lake South: Head north from the site of grace to find Old Nobles along the road, especially near the Troll-pulled Carriage’s caravan.

Altus Plateau: Old Nobles can be found close to the Rampartside Path site of grace.

fields.name: Vulgar Militia Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

The upward extension serves to create an appearance of larger size, however slightly.
fields.location: The Vulgar Militia Set is dropped by the small, masked enemies known as Vulgar Militia. These enemies are found in the Bestial Sanctum area of Caelid and near the Minor Erdtree in the Weeping Peninsula. Repeatedly defeating them will yield the full set.

fields.name: Vulgar Militia Armor
fields.description:
Armor worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.
fields.location: The Vulgar Militia Set is dropped by the small, masked enemies known as Vulgar Militia. These enemies are found in the Bestial Sanctum area of Caelid and near the Minor Erdtree in the Weeping Peninsula. Repeatedly defeating them will yield the full set.

fields.name: Vulgar Militia Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.
fields.location: The Vulgar Militia Set is dropped by the small, masked enemies known as Vulgar Militia. These enemies are found in the Bestial Sanctum area of Caelid and near the Minor Erdtree in the Weeping Peninsula. Repeatedly defeating them will yield the full set.

fields.name: Vulgar Militia Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.
fields.location: The Vulgar Militia Set is dropped by the small, masked enemies known as Vulgar Militia. These enemies are found in the Bestial Sanctum area of Caelid and near the Minor Erdtree in the Weeping Peninsula. Repeatedly defeating them will yield the full set.

fields.name: Sage Hood
fields.description:
A burgundy pointed hood.
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.

Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.
fields.location: The Sage Armor Set is found inside Stillwater Cave, located in Liurnia of the Lakes. To reach it, travel northwest of Stormveil Castle and find the cave entrance on the southeastern edge of the lake. Inside, navigate past poison pools and defeat the enemies to find the set on a corpse in the deeper chambers.

fields.name: Sage Robe
fields.description:
Thick burgundy robe.
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.

Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.
fields.location: The Sage Armor Set is found inside Stillwater Cave, located in Liurnia of the Lakes. To reach it, travel northwest of Stormveil Castle and find the cave entrance on the southeastern edge of the lake. Inside, navigate past poison pools and defeat the enemies to find the set on a corpse in the deeper chambers.

fields.name: Sage Trousers
fields.description:
Thick burgundy trousers.
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.

Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.
fields.location: The Sage Armor Set is found inside Stillwater Cave, located in Liurnia of the Lakes. To reach it, travel northwest of Stormveil Castle and find the cave entrance on the southeastern edge of the lake. Inside, navigate past poison pools and defeat the enemies to find the set on a corpse in the deeper chambers.

fields.name: Pumpkin Helm
fields.description:
An oval helm large enough to cover any head.
Very heavy and very hard.

Reduces damage from headshots and impacts.

The inside of the helm is pitch black, keeping the crazed warrior within from panicking.
Perhaps its rather roomy interior also helps alleviate feelings of pressure and claustrophobia.
fields.location: The Pumpkin Helm is a rare drop from the large, headless enemies known as Mad Pumpkin Heads. These enemies are commonly found in various locations, such as the Waypoint Ruins in Limgrave and the Caelid region. Repeatedly defeating them increases your chances of obtaining the helm.

fields.name: Elden Lord Crown
fields.description:
Crown of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.
fields.location: Awarded for defeating Godfrey, First Elden Lord (the golden spectral version) in Leyndell, Ashen Capital. After the boss fight, the full set can be purchased from Enia at the Roundtable Hold.

fields.name: Elden Lord Armor
fields.description:
Armor of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.
fields.location: Awarded for defeating Godfrey, First Elden Lord (the golden spectral version) in Leyndell, Ashen Capital. After the boss fight, the full set can be purchased from Enia at the Roundtable Hold.

fields.description:

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.
fields.location: Awarded for defeating Godfrey, First Elden Lord (the golden spectral version) in Leyndell, Ashen Capital. After the boss fight, the full set can be purchased from Enia at the Roundtable Hold.

fields.description:

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

fields.description:
Armor of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield.

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

fields.name: Radahn's Redmane Helm
fields.description:
Helm of the golden lion, with flowing red hair.
Worn by General Radahn.

Radahn inherited the furious, flaming red hair of his father Radagon, and is fond of its heroic implications.

"I was born a champion's cub. Now I am the Lord of the Battlefield's lion."
fields.location: This helm is dropped by General Radahn himself after defeating him in his boss fight at Redmane Castle. It features a distinctive red plume and is a symbol of Radahn’s fearsome presence on the battlefield.

fields.name: Radahn's Lion Armor
fields.description:
Armor depicting the golden lion.
Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.
fields.location: Purchased from Enia at Roundtable Hold after defeating Starscourge Radahn in Caelid. The full set becomes available for sale after the boss is defeated.

fields.name: Radahn's Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets depicting the golden lion.
Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.
fields.location: Purchased from Enia at Roundtable Hold after defeating Starscourge Radahn in Caelid. The full set becomes available for sale after the boss is defeated.

fields.name: Radahn's Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves depicting the golden lion.
Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.
fields.location: Purchased from Enia at Roundtable Hold after defeating Starscourge Radahn in Caelid. The full set becomes available for sale after the boss is defeated.

fields.name: Radahn's Lion Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor depicting the golden lion.
Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.
