fields.name: Lord of Blood's Robe
fields.description:
Attire of Mohg, Lord of Blood, embroidered with an extravagant gold emblem on black cloth.

The dress of a Luminary, the reigning lord and hierarch of the coming dynasty of Mohgwyn. Or perhaps, of a raving lunatic.
fields.location: Dropped by Mohg, Lord of Blood, after defeating him in Mohgwyn Palace. The robe is found on a corpse in the boss arena after the fight.

fields.name: Lord of Blood's Robe (Altered)
fields.description:
Attire of Mohg, Lord of Blood, embroidered with an extravagant gold emblem on black cloth.

The dress of a Luminary, the reigning lord and hierarch of the coming dynasty of Mohgwyn. Or perhaps, of a raving lunatic.
fields.location: Dropped by Mohg, Lord of Blood, after defeating him in Mohgwyn Palace. The robe is found on a corpse in the boss arena after the fight.

fields.name: Queen's Crescent Crown
fields.description:
A tall crown depicting the moon.
Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. Increases intelligence.

When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.
fields.location: The Queen’s Crescent Crown is found deep within the Cathedral of Manus Celes, located in the Mountaintops of the Giants. To reach it, begin at the Foot of the Forge site of grace and make your way through the frozen mountain paths until you find the cathedral ruins. Inside, explore the upper chambers and defeat the enemies guarding the area to claim this elegant crown adorned with a crescent moon.

fields.name: Queen's Robe
fields.description:
Robe indicating the highest order of sorcerer.
Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon.

When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.
fields.location: This cloak is located near the same Cathedral of Manus Celes as the crown. After securing the crown, continue exploring the cathedral’s inner sanctum. The cloak is resting on a corpse in a side chamber, often guarded by spectral knights. Approach carefully to avoid ambush and loot the cloak to complete the regal ensemble.

fields.name: Queen's Bracelets
fields.description:
Bracelets indicating the highest order of sorcerer.
Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon.

When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.
fields.location: The Queen’s Bracelets are part of the Queen of the Full Moon set. After defeating Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, you can purchase these gauntlets from Enia at the Roundtable Hold for 7,000 Runes. They are worn by Rennala herself and symbolize her status as head of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

fields.name: Queen's Leggings
fields.description:
Leggings indicating the highest order of sorcerer.
Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon.

When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.
fields.location: Similarly, the Queen’s Leggings can be bought from Enia at Roundtable Hold once Rennala is defeated. These leggings complete the regal sorcerer look of the Queen of the Full Moon set, offering magical defense and a distinctive design that reflects Rennala’s status and tragic story.

fields.name: Godskin Apostle Hood
fields.description:
Hood made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Worn by the Godskin Apostles.

The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.
fields.location: Found in the Windmill Village in Altus Plateau. After defeating the Godskin Apostle boss at the top of the village, the full set will be in a chest in the boss arena.

fields.name: Godskin Apostle Robe
fields.description:

fields.location: Found in the Windmill Village in Altus Plateau. After defeating the Godskin Apostle boss at the top of the village, the full set will be in a chest in the boss arena.

fields.name: Godskin Noble Hood
fields.description:
Hood made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft.
Worn by Godskin Nobles.

Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.
fields.location: Dropped by the Godskin Noble boss in the Temple of Eiglay, Volcano Manor. After defeating the boss, the set is found in a chest in the boss room.

fields.name: Godskin Noble Robe
fields.description:
Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.
Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft. Worn by Godskin Nobles, known for their seven-face aprons.

Strengthens the Noble Presence incantation.

Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.
fields.location: Dropped by the Godskin Noble boss in the Temple of Eiglay, Volcano Manor. After defeating the boss, the set is found in a chest in the boss room.

Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.
fields.location: Dropped by the Godskin Noble boss in the Temple of Eiglay, Volcano Manor. After defeating the boss, the set is found in a chest in the boss room.

fields.description:

Subcutaneous fat makes them plump and soft.
Worn by Godskin Nobles.

Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

fields.name: Depraved Perfumer Headscarf
fields.description:
Headscarf worn by depraved perfumers.

These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

fields.name: Depraved Perfumer Robe
fields.description:
Robe worn by depraved perfumers.
The embroidery on the apron is itself a curse upon the Erdtree.

These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.
fields.location: Unknown

fields.name: Crucible Axe Helm
fields.description:
Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The axe ornamentation is the knight Ordovis's mark, displayed also by his men.

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.
fields.location: The Crucible Axe Set is obtained by defeating Crucible Knight Ordovis, the boss of the Auriza Hero’s Grave dungeon in eastern Leyndell, Altus Plateau. After overcoming Ordovis and his fellow Crucible Knight, you can loot the full set from the boss room. This set includes the Crucible Axe Helm, Armor, Gauntlets, and Greaves.

fields.name: Crucible Axe Armor
fields.description:
Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

Worn by the knight Ordovis and his men.

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.
fields.location: The Crucible Axe Set is obtained by defeating Crucible Knight Ordovis, the boss of the Auriza Hero’s Grave dungeon in eastern Leyndell, Altus Plateau. After overcoming Ordovis and his fellow Crucible Knight, you can loot the full set from the boss room. This set includes the Crucible Axe Helm, Armor, Gauntlets, and Greaves.

fields.name: Crucible Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

Hold the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthen Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

In time, the strength shown by these knights, and even their appearance, was seen as chaotic and deserving of scorn.
fields.location: https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/eldenring/images/7/77/ER_Icon_Armor_Crucible_Axe_Helm.png/revision/latest?cb=Dropped by Crucible Knight Ordovis, the boss of Auriza Hero’s Grave in eastern Leyndell, Altus Plateau. Defeat Ordovis and his fellow knight to obtain the full set.

fields.name: Crucible Greaves
fields.description:

fields.location: Dropped by Crucible Knight Ordovis, the boss of Auriza Hero’s Grave in eastern Leyndell, Altus Plateau. Defeat Ordovis and his fellow knight to obtain the full set.

fields.name: Crucible Tree Helm
fields.description:
Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

The great tree ornamentation is the knight Siluria's mark, displayed also by her men.

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.
fields.location: The Crucible Tree Set is found in Deeproot Depths. To acquire it, travel to the area behind Crucible Knight Siluria, who serves as a boss in this region. After defeating Siluria, open the chest located behind her to claim the entire set, which consists of the Crucible Tree Helm, Armor, Gauntlets, and Greaves.

fields.description:

Worn by the knight Siluria and her men.

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

fields.name: Lusat's Glintstone Crown
fields.description:
The giant blue glintstone crown worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer.

This crown replaced Lusat's brain and skull altogether, and now, removed from his body, it is all but dead. What power remains within raises the potency of Lusat's primeval current sorceries at the cost of additional FP consumption.
fields.location: Found on the body of Sorcerer Lusat in Sellia Hideaway, Caelid, after progressing Sellen’s questline. The set appears on his corpse after the quest concludes.

fields.name: Lusat's Robe
fields.description:
A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Corroded by blue glintstones.

Since the grand masters Azur and Lusat were driven from the academy, no one has achieved their formerly-held rank.
fields.location: Found on the body of Sorcerer Lusat in Sellia Hideaway, Caelid, after progressing Sellen’s questline. The set appears on his corpse after the quest concludes.

fields.name: Lusat's Manchettes
fields.description:
Manchettes corroded by blue glintstones.
Worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer.

Lusat had reached a near-inorganic state.
fields.location: Found on the body of Sorcerer Lusat in Sellia Hideaway, Caelid, after progressing Sellen’s questline. The set appears on his corpse after the quest concludes.

fields.name: Old Sorcerer's Legwraps
fields.description:
Ragged waistcloth that extends to the thighs.
Common amongst old-fashioned sorcerers.
fields.location: After completing Sorceress Sellen’s questline, return to either Lusat’s location in the Sellia Hideaway or Azur’s spot in the Hermit Village. The Old Sorcerer’s Legwraps will be present at these locations, along with the rest of their respective armor sets.

fields.name: Azur's Glintstone Crown
fields.description:
Crown of Azur, primeval current sorcerer, set with a prominent blue-green glintstone.

This crown replaced Azur's brain and skull altogether, and now, removed from his body, it is all but dead. What power remains within raises the potency of Azur's primeval current sorceries at the cost of additional FP consumption.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Raya Lucaria Academy, near the Church of the Cuckoo site of grace. The crown is located on a body in a small chamber accessible after navigating the rooftops and dropping into a lower area.

fields.name: Azur's Glintstone Robe
fields.description:
A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Corroded by blue-green glintstones.

Since the grand masters Azur and Lusat were driven from the academy, no one has achieved their formerly-held rank.
fields.location: Dropped by Thops after completing his questline, or after defeating him if you choose not to give him the Academy Glintstone Key. He is found in the Church of Irith, Raya Lucaria Academy.

fields.name: Azur's Manchettes
fields.description:
Manchettes corroded by blue-green glintstones.
Worn by Azur, primeval current sorcerer.

Azur had reached a near-inorganic state.
fields.location: Dropped by Thops after completing his questline, or after defeating him if you choose not to give him the Academy Glintstone Key. He is found in the Church of Irith, Raya Lucaria Academy.

fields.name: All-Knowing Helm
fields.description:
Helm set with countless eyes and ears.
Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.

Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear.

At the end that should not be.
fields.location: Dropped by Sir Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing, after defeating him in Leyndell, Ashen Capital.

fields.name: All-Knowing Armor
fields.description:

fields.name: Twinned Helm
fields.description:
Helm depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

The two known as D are inseparable twins.
They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another.

Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.
fields.location: Can be obtained early by killing D, Hunter of the Dead, when first encountered east of Summonwater Village in Limgrave. Alternatively, progress Fia’s questline at Roundtable Hold: after giving D the Weathered Dagger, reload the area and collect the set from a newly opened room near Smithing Master Hewg.

fields.description:

fields.name: Ragged Hat
fields.description: Helm pieced together from scavenged metal.
fields.location: The Ragged set and its altered variants are found in the Abandoned Cave, located in Caelid. To reach this cave, head to the Smoldering Wall site of grace and explore the nearby caverns. The altered versions are obtained by defeating the cave’s boss, which transforms the original ragged pieces into their altered forms. The set has a worn, tattered look, reflecting the harsh conditions of its wearers.

fields.description: Armor pieced together from scavenged metal.

fields.name: Prophet Blindfold
fields.description:
Blindfold of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

Why hesitate, if the path leading to the future is clear? Just close your eyes, and walk.
fields.location: The Prophet set can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant located in the eastern part of the Weeping Peninsula. Travel south from the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace and look for the merchant’s camp near the coastline.

fields.name: Corhyn's Robe
fields.description:
Robe of Corhyn the cleric.

Even after exile, Corhyn refused to recant his prophecies. And for this, he was blessed with the guidance of grace. 

Since then, the cart wheel draped on his neck has served as a reminder. That true guidance awaits those with iron wills. Those with unwavering faith.
fields.location: Found on Brother Corhyn’s body after completing his questline. His final resting place is near the base of the giant statue in Leyndell, Ashen Capital, where you can loot his robe.

fields.name: Prophet Trousers
fields.description:
Trousers of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

Made from rough fabric that scrapes against the skin like a sharpening file.
fields.location: The Prophet set can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant located in the eastern part of the Weeping Peninsula. Travel south from the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace and look for the merchant’s camp near the coastline.

fields.name: Prophet Robe (Altered)
fields.description:
Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

Made from rough fabric that scrapes against the skin like a sharpening file.
fields.location: The Prophet set can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant located in the eastern part of the Weeping Peninsula. Travel south from the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace and look for the merchant’s camp near the coastline.

fields.name: Prophet Robe
fields.description:
Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune—and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

The shackles around the neck warn passersby not to lend an ear to their sermons.
fields.location: The Prophet set can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant located in the eastern part of the Weeping Peninsula. Travel south from the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace and look for the merchant’s camp near the coastline.

fields.name: Astrologer Hood
fields.description:
Hood fashioned from supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Astrologer class. Also sold by the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold after obtaining the appropriate Bell Bearing.

fields.name: Astrologer Robe
fields.description:
Robe fashioned from supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Astrologer class. Also sold by the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold after obtaining the appropriate Bell Bearing.

fields.name: Astrologer Gloves
fields.description:
Gloves fashioned from fine, supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Astrologer class. Also sold by the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold after obtaining the appropriate Bell Bearing.

fields.name: Astrologer Trousers
fields.description:
Trousers worn inside a robe.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Astrologer class. Also sold by the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold after obtaining the appropriate Bell Bearing.

fields.name: Astrologer Robe (Altered)
fields.description:
Robe fashioned from supple cloth.
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Astrologer class. Also sold by the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold after obtaining the appropriate Bell Bearing.

fields.name: Lionel's Helm
fields.description:
Round iron helm with a distinctive large brim.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the Lower Capital Church site of grace, head outside and look for a small bedroom with a large bed. The entire set is on a corpse lying on the bed.

fields.name: Lionel's Armor
fields.description:
Round iron armor with a banner extending from its back.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the Lower Capital Church site of grace, head outside and look for a small bedroom with a large bed. The entire set is on a corpse lying on the bed.

fields.name: Lionel's Gauntlets
fields.description:
Rounded iron gauntlets.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the Lower Capital Church site of grace, head outside and look for a small bedroom with a large bed. The entire set is on a corpse lying on the bed.

fields.name: Lionel's Greaves
fields.description:
Rounded iron greaves.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself her father.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the Lower Capital Church site of grace, head outside and look for a small bedroom with a large bed. The entire set is on a corpse lying on the bed.

fields.name: Lionel's Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Round iron armor.
Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the Lower Capital Church site of grace, head outside and look for a small bedroom with a large bed. The entire set is on a corpse lying on the bed.

fields.name: Hoslow's Helm
fields.description:
A twin-tailed silver helm decorated with flowery adornments. Symbol of the head of the revered House of Hoslow.

Juno Hoslow had a younger brother who was all talk and no trousers.

His inability to commit to action was such that Juno inherited the Hoslow legacy without resistance, granting him the freedom to shower his little brother with adoration.
fields.location: Awarded for completing the Volcano Manor assassination questline, specifically after defeating Juno Hoslow, Knight of Blood, in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Hoslow's Armor
fields.description:
Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments.
Passed down through the Hoslow family.

When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused.

"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."
fields.location: Awarded for completing the Volcano Manor assassination questline, specifically after defeating Juno Hoslow, Knight of Blood, in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Hoslow's Gauntlets
fields.description:
Garish silver gauntlets decorated with red embellishments.
Passed down through the Hoslow family.

When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused.

"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."
fields.location: Awarded for completing the Volcano Manor assassination questline, specifically after defeating Juno Hoslow, Knight of Blood, in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Hoslow's Greaves
fields.description:
Garish silver greaves decorated with red embellishments.
Passed down through the Hoslow family.

When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused.

"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."
fields.location: Awarded for completing the Volcano Manor assassination questline, specifically after defeating Juno Hoslow, Knight of Blood, in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Diallos's Mask
fields.description:
Replica of a twin-tailed silver helm with flowery adornments. Only, without the twin tails.

Diallos Hoslow had an older brother who was a stern, self-possessed man of few words. His achievements made him seem out of reach.

And so the younger aspired to be like the older. Yearning for the day that he would tell the tale of House Hoslow, in blood. Knowing full well that it would break his brother's heart.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in Jarburg, Liurnia of the Lakes, after completing Diallos’s questline. Once Diallos’s story concludes, revisit Jarburg and search the village to find his mask on a body near the jars.

fields.name: Hoslow's Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments.
Passed down through the Hoslow family.

When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused.

"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."
fields.location: Awarded for completing the Volcano Manor assassination questline, specifically after defeating Juno Hoslow, Knight of Blood, in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Vagabond Knight Helm
fields.description:
Helm of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

The visor is broken and can no longer be lowered.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.
fields.location: The Vagabond Knight Set is the starting armor for the Vagabond class. If you did not choose this class, the set can be found on a corpse inside the Church of Pilgrimage in the Weeping Peninsula. Enter the church and look for the body near the altar to collect the full set.

fields.name: Vagabond Knight Armor
fields.description:
Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

The crest emblazoned on the front is worn and dingy, no longer able to evoke sentiment.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.
fields.location: The Vagabond Knight Set is the starting armor for the Vagabond class. If you did not choose this class, the set can be found on a corpse inside the Church of Pilgrimage in the Weeping Peninsula. Enter the church and look for the body near the altar to collect the full set.

fields.name: Vagabond Knight Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets of a knight banished from their motherland.
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.
fields.location: The Vagabond Knight Set is the starting armor for the Vagabond class. If you did not choose this class, the set can be found on a corpse inside the Church of Pilgrimage in the Weeping Peninsula. Enter the church and look for the body near the altar to collect the full set.

fields.name: Vagabond Knight Greaves
fields.description:

Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.
fields.location: The Vagabond Knight Set is the starting armor for the Vagabond class. If you did not choose this class, the set can be found on a corpse inside the Church of Pilgrimage in the Weeping Peninsula. Enter the church and look for the body near the altar to collect the full set.

fields.name: Vagabond Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.description:

The crest emblazoned on the front is worn and dingy, no longer able to evoke sentiment.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.
fields.location: The Vagabond Knight Set is the starting armor for the Vagabond class. If you did not choose this class, the set can be found on a corpse inside the Church of Pilgrimage in the Weeping Peninsula. Enter the church and look for the body near the altar to collect the full set.

fields.name: Blue Cloth Cowl
fields.description:
Cowl of a nomadic warrior.
The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer.

Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay.
Warriors must remain ever drifting.
fields.location: Dropped by Exile Soldiers, commonly found in Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Blue Cloth Vest
fields.description:
Vest of a nomadic warrior.
The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer.

Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay.
Warriors must remain ever drifting.
fields.location: Dropped by Exile Soldiers, commonly found in Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Warrior Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets of a nomadic warrior.
Crafted from sturdy leather.
fields.location: The Warrior Set is the starting gear for the Warrior class. If you did not select this class, the set can be found on a corpse at the Agheel Lake South site of grace in Limgrave. Look for a body near the edge of the lake to collect the armor, gauntlets, and greaves.

fields.name: Warrior Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves of a nomadic warrior.
Crafted from sturdy leather.
fields.location: The Warrior Set is the starting gear for the Warrior class. If you did not select this class, the set can be found on a corpse at the Agheel Lake South site of grace in Limgrave. Look for a body near the edge of the lake to collect the armor, gauntlets, and greaves.

fields.name: White Mask
fields.description:
Bloodstained, faintly grinning white mask.
Worn by war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

The Lord of Blood's curse enlivens the wearer when bloodletting occurs. Slightly raises attack power when there is blood loss nearby.
fields.location: The White Mask is dropped by the Nameless White Mask invaders in the Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum area. To reach this region, use the Pureblood Knight’s Medal or follow Varre’s questline to access the underground blood swamp. Defeating the white-masked invaders here will reward you with the mask.

fields.name: War Surgeon Gown
fields.description:
Bloodstained white gown of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.
fields.location: The War Surgeon Gown is dropped by the same Nameless White Mask invaders in the Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum. After traveling west from the Palace Approach Ledge-Road site of grace, enter the blood lake and engage the invaders near the lake’s edge and the Blistered Giant Crow. Defeating one of these NPCs will grant you the gown.

fields.name: War Surgeon Gloves
fields.description:
Bloodstained white gloves of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.
fields.location: To obtain the War Surgeon Gloves, you must defeat one of the three Nameless White Mask invaders found in the Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum. Start from the Palace Approach Ledge-Road site of grace and head west into the blood-filled lake. Each invader appears near prominent landmarks, such as the large stone pillar beside the Blistered Giant Crow. The gloves will be among the pieces dropped after successfully defeating one of these invaders.

fields.name: War Surgeon Trousers
fields.description:
Bloodstained trousers of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.
fields.location: The War Surgeon Trousers are also obtained from one of the three Nameless White Mask invaders in the Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum. Ride through the blood lake west of the Palace Approach Ledge-Road site of grace, triggering each invasion in turn. The trousers will be included in the set dropped by the invader you defeat.

fields.name: War Surgeon Gown (Altered)
fields.description:
Bloodstained white gown of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood.
None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.
fields.location: The War Surgeon Gown (Altered) is directly received from the Nameless White Mask invader drops, appearing as the default version of the gown in your inventory. To alter it back to the standard War Surgeon Gown, use Tailoring Tools or visit Boc the Seamster at any site of grace after progressing his questline.

fields.name: Royal Remains Helm
fields.description:
Helm graced with gold human bones.
Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.

It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord―the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.
fields.location: The Royal Remains Set is located in the Royal Capital of Leyndell. To find it, start at the Outer Wall site of grace and proceed into the city’s underbelly. Explore the sewers and catacombs beneath the city, where the set is hidden on a corpse in a dimly lit chamber. This armor reflects noble origins but shows signs of decay.

fields.name: Royal Remains Armor
fields.description:

Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.

fields.name: Brave's Cord Circlet
fields.description:
Warrior's headband of woven leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

The small flags, white cloths and sheaves of wheat
often found hung from these headbands are
prayers of farewell from the people of their home.
In bidding farewell to warriors departing on
a journey from which they aren't like to return,
this small act offers only meager relief.
fields.location: Dropped by wandering Albinauric enemies, most reliably found in the Village of the Albinaurics in southwest Liurnia.

fields.name: Brave's Battlewear
fields.description:
Battlewear fashioned from leather armor
adorned with a large sheet of cloth.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

The red cloth signifies participation in the
Long March long, long ago and this ceremonial
garb beseeches the favor of the Warrior King
who led them.
fields.location: Dropped by wandering Albinauric enemies, most reliably found in the Village of the Albinaurics in southwest Liurnia.

fields.name: Brave's Bracer
fields.description:
Gauntlets wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

Has a fur lining which excels at keeping
the cold at bay.
fields.location: Dropped by wandering Albinauric enemies, most reliably found in the Village of the Albinaurics in southwest Liurnia.

fields.name: Brave's Legwraps
fields.description:
Greaves wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

Has a fur lining which excels at keeping
the cold at bay.
fields.location: Dropped by wandering Albinauric enemies, most reliably found in the Village of the Albinaurics in southwest Liurnia.

fields.name: Brave's Leather Helm
fields.description:
Battlewear wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.
fields.location: Dropped by wandering Albinauric enemies, most reliably found in the Village of the Albinaurics in southwest Liurnia.

fields.name: Brave's Battlewear (Altered)
fields.description:
Helm wrapped in thick leather.
Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.
fields.location: Dropped by wandering Albinauric enemies, most reliably found in the Village of the Albinaurics in southwest Liurnia.

fields.name: Beast Champion Helm
fields.description:
Silver helm engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

The beasts, their eyes and ears covered, represent an oath: "See nothing, hear nothing, doubt nothing, and carry on, along the path set in stone."
fields.location: Dropped by Knight Bernahl at Crumbling Farum Azula if you defeat him, or given as a reward if you complete his Volcano Manor questline.

fields.name: Beast Champion Armor
fields.description:
Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.
fields.location: Dropped by Knight Bernahl at Crumbling Farum Azula if you defeat him, or given as a reward if you complete his Volcano Manor questline.

fields.name: Beast Champion Gauntlets
fields.description:
Silver gauntlets engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.
fields.location: Dropped by Knight Bernahl at Crumbling Farum Azula if you defeat him, or given as a reward if you complete his Volcano Manor questline.

fields.name: Beast Champion Greaves
fields.description:
Silver greaves engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.
fields.location: Dropped by Knight Bernahl at Crumbling Farum Azula if you defeat him, or given as a reward if you complete his Volcano Manor questline.

fields.name: Beast Champion Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts.
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.
fields.location: Dropped by Knight Bernahl at Crumbling Farum Azula if you defeat him, or given as a reward if you complete his Volcano Manor questline.

fields.name: Champion Headband
fields.description:
Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest.
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.

Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.
fields.location: The full set is the starting gear for the Hero class. Alternatively, all pieces can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant in southern Caelid.

fields.name: Champion Pauldron
fields.description:
Pauldron reserved for the badlands' bravest.
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.

Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.
fields.location: The full set is the starting gear for the Hero class. Alternatively, all pieces can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant in southern Caelid.

fields.name: Champion Bracers
fields.description:
Bracers reserved for the badlands' bravest.
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.

Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.
fields.location: The full set is the starting gear for the Hero class. Alternatively, all pieces can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant in southern Caelid.

fields.name: Champion Gaiters
fields.description:
Gaiters formed only with leather straps.
Common wear in the badlands.
fields.location: The full set is the starting gear for the Hero class. Alternatively, all pieces can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant in southern Caelid.

fields.name: Crimson Hood
fields.description:
A hooded cloak of vivid crimson.
Worn by expatriated royalty.
Increases vigor.

Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on journeys without specific orders, to faraway lands from which they would never return. In other words, the gift of a cloak made it easier for undesirables to be on their way. 

Roderika never once saw the guidance of grace.
fields.location: Located in the Church of the Plague in Caelid. After completing Millicent’s initial quest steps, return to the church and find the Crimson Hood on a chair near where Millicent was seated.

fields.name: Noble's Traveling Garb
fields.description:
Traveling attire fashioned from metallic white silk thread. Worn by expatriated royalty.

A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.
fields.location: Dropped by Wandering Nobles in Limgrave and Liurnia. The Noble’s Slender Sword is a rare drop from the same enemies.

fields.name: Noble's Gloves
fields.description:
Gloves of plush leather.
Worn by expatriated royalty.

A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.
fields.location: Dropped by Wandering Nobles in Limgrave and Liurnia. The Noble’s Slender Sword is a rare drop from the same enemies.

fields.name: Noble's Trousers
fields.description:
White trousers of superior craftsmanship.
Worn by expatriated royalty.

A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.
fields.location: Dropped by Wandering Nobles in Limgrave and Liurnia. The Noble’s Slender Sword is a rare drop from the same enemies.

fields.name: Navy Hood
fields.description:
A hooded cloak of deep navy.
Worn by expatriated royalty.
Increases mind.

Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on missions to faraway lands, from which they would never return. But what choice did they have, having seen the guidance of grace?
fields.location: Found at East Windmill Pasture in the Altus Plateau. Travel northeast from the Forest-Spanning Greatbridge to reach the pasture. There, you’ll find a circle of dancing women surrounding a burning pile of corpses. The Navy Hood, along with the rest of the Noble’s Set, is on a corpse in the center of this group.

fields.name: Maliketh's Helm
fields.description:
Beast's helm made of black iron and decorated with gold.
Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.
fields.location: Purchased from Enia at the Roundtable Hold after defeating Maliketh, the Black Blade.

fields.name: Maliketh's Armor
fields.description:
Beast's armor made of black iron and decorated with gold.
Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.
fields.location: Purchased from Enia at the Roundtable Hold after defeating Maliketh, the Black Blade.

Indeed, that is what made them champions.
fields.location: Purchased from Enia at the Roundtable Hold after defeating Maliketh, the Black Blade.

fields.description:

Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.
fields.location: Purchased from Enia at the Roundtable Hold after defeating Maliketh, the Black Blade.

fields.description:

Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

Champions knew what was at stake.
Indeed, that is what made them champions.
fields.location: Purchased from Enia at the Roundtable Hold after defeating Maliketh, the Black Blade.

fields.name: Malenia's Winged Helm
fields.description:
Winged helm made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."
fields.location: Purchased from Enia at the Roundtable Hold after defeating Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

fields.name: Malenia's Armor
fields.description:
Armor made of unalloyed gold.
Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."
fields.location: Purchased from Enia at the Roundtable Hold after defeating Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

fields.description:

Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."
fields.location: Purchased from Enia at the Roundtable Hold after defeating Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

fields.description:

fields.location: Purchased from Enia at the Roundtable Hold after defeating Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

fields.description:

fields.location: Purchased from Enia at the Roundtable Hold after defeating Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

fields.name: Veteran's Helm
fields.description:
An old helm that has seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.
fields.location: The Veteran’s Set is dropped by Commander Niall at Castle Sol in the Mountaintops of the Giants. Defeat Commander Niall during the boss fight to obtain this heavy armor set, which is favored by experienced warriors.

fields.name: Veteran's Armor
fields.description:
Old armor that has seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.
fields.location: The Veteran’s Set is dropped by Commander Niall at Castle Sol in the Mountaintops of the Giants. Defeat Commander Niall during the boss fight to obtain this heavy armor set, which is favored by experienced warriors.

fields.name: Veteran's Gauntlets
fields.description:
Old gauntlets that have seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.
fields.location: The Veteran’s Set is dropped by Commander Niall at Castle Sol in the Mountaintops of the Giants. Defeat Commander Niall during the boss fight to obtain this heavy armor set, which is favored by experienced warriors.

fields.name: Veteran's Greaves
fields.description:
Old greaves that have seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.
fields.location: The Veteran’s Set is dropped by Commander Niall at Castle Sol in the Mountaintops of the Giants. Defeat Commander Niall during the boss fight to obtain this heavy armor set, which is favored by experienced warriors.

fields.name: Veteran's Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Old armor that has seen many battles.
Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.
fields.location: The Veteran’s Set is dropped by Commander Niall at Castle Sol in the Mountaintops of the Giants. Defeat Commander Niall during the boss fight to obtain this heavy armor set, which is favored by experienced warriors.

fields.name: Bloodhound Knight Helm
fields.description:
Metal helm with a pointed beak.
Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.

The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.

Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.
fields.location:
This armor set is dropped by Bloodhound Knight Darriwil, who is found in the Evergaol south of Agheel Lake in Limgrave (Forlorn Hound Evergaol). Defeat Darriwil, and you’ll receive the Bloodhound’s Fang weapon, but not the armor set.
The actual Bloodhound Knight Set is found in the Lake of Rot. From the Lake of Rot Shoreside Site of Grace, head south to a ruin with a Bloodhound Knight inside. Defeat him to obtain the full set.

fields.name: Bloodhound Knight Armor
fields.description:
Metal armor with a jutting breastplate.
Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.

The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.

Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master.
Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.
fields.location:
This armor set is dropped by Bloodhound Knight Darriwil, who is found in the Evergaol south of Agheel Lake in Limgrave (Forlorn Hound Evergaol). Defeat Darriwil, and you’ll receive the Bloodhound’s Fang weapon, but not the armor set.
The actual Bloodhound Knight Set is found in the Lake of Rot. From the Lake of Rot Shoreside Site of Grace, head south to a ruin with a Bloodhound Knight inside. Defeat him to obtain the full set.

fields.name: Festive Hood
fields.description:
Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Decorated with many-colored flowers.
fields.location: Dropped by Albinauric enemies wearing festive attire in the Village of the Albinaurics, southwest Liurnia. Farm these enemies for each piece.

fields.name: Festive Garb
fields.description:
Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Faintly bloodstained.
fields.location: Dropped by Albinauric enemies wearing festive attire in the Village of the Albinaurics, southwest Liurnia. Farm these enemies for each piece.

fields.name: Festive Hood (Altered)
fields.description:
Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Decorated with a stunning array of flowers.
fields.location: Dropped by Albinauric enemies wearing festive attire in the Village of the Albinaurics, southwest Liurnia. Farm these enemies for each piece.

fields.name: Festive Garb (Altered)
fields.description:
Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Faintly bloodstained.
fields.location: Dropped by Albinauric enemies wearing festive attire in the Village of the Albinaurics, southwest Liurnia. Farm these enemies for each piece.

fields.name: Blue Festive Hood
fields.description:
Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Use of this hood, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.
fields.location: Dropped by Albinauric enemies wearing festive blue attire, most commonly found in the Village of the Albinaurics in southwest Liurnia.

fields.name: Blue Festive Garb
fields.description:
Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills.

Use of this garb, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.
fields.location: Dropped by Albinauric enemies wearing festive blue attire in the Village of the Albinaurics, southwest Liurnia.

fields.name: Commoner's Headband
fields.description:
A headband that holds cloth in place.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in Volcano Manor, in the area overlooking the lava river near the Temple of Eiglay. Look for a statue with a corpse draped over it to collect this variant.

fields.name: Commoner's Garb
fields.description:
Garb with a thick embroidered cape attached.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.
fields.location: Dropped by Commoner enemies, found throughout the Lands Between, especially in Liurnia and Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Commoner's Shoes
fields.description:
Modest shoes made of cloth.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.
fields.location: Dropped by Commoner enemies, found throughout the Lands Between, especially in Liurnia and Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Commoner's Headband (Altered)
fields.description:
A headband with the cloth removed.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.
fields.location: Dropped by Commoner enemies, found throughout the Lands Between, especially in Liurnia and Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Commoner's Garb (Altered)
fields.description:
Garb decorated with intricate embroidery.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.
fields.location: Dropped by Commoner enemies, found throughout the Lands Between, especially in Liurnia and Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Commoner's Simple Garb
fields.description:
Garb with a modest cloth cape attached.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.
fields.location: Dropped by Commoner enemies, found throughout the Lands Between, especially in Liurnia and Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Commoner's Simple Garb (Altered)
fields.description:
Modest garb made of cloth.
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.
fields.location: Dropped by Commoner enemies, found throughout the Lands Between, especially in Liurnia and Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Envoy Crown
fields.description:
The soft bundle worn on the head by Oracle Envoys.
Densely wrapped in several layers of cloth.

Raises the potency of bubble-based skills.

No one knows what the cloth hides, but some claim to have heard a faint whimpering from inside. It must have been their imagination.
fields.location: Dropped by Large Oracle Envoy enemies in Miquella’s Haligtree, particularly near the Haligtree Town area. Farm these trumpet-wielding foes for a chance at the helmet.

fields.name: Twinsage Glintstone Crown
fields.description:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Greatly increases intelligence to the detriment of HP and stamina.

Scholars of the Twinsage Conspectus were the elites of the academy, permitted to study and excel in sorceries of all kinds.
fields.location: The Twinsage Glintstone Crown is found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, head outside and cross the rooftops, then drop down to a ledge to find the crown on a corpse.

fields.name: Raya Lucarian Robe
fields.description:
Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery.

Those who dedicate themselves to the study of glintstones formed from starry amber receive this modest yet elegant deep navy garb after making their vows of virtue and austerity.

But with extended life, one is apt to forget old vows.
fields.location: This robe is found inside the Academy of Raya Lucaria, specifically within the Schoolhouse Classroom area. From the site of grace, explore the classrooms and defeat the sorcerer enemies. The robe is located on a corpse in one of the side rooms, often near the Conspectus Scroll. It is a favored garment among the academy’s students.

fields.name: Sorcerer Manchettes
fields.description:
Manchettes worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery.
Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the forearms.
fields.location: The Sorcerer Set is sold by the Nomadic Merchant at the Hermit Merchant’s Shack in Weeping Peninsula. Travel to the southern part of the peninsula and look for the merchant’s camp near the coast to purchase the set.

fields.name: Sorcerer Leggings
fields.description:
Leggings worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery.
Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the legs.
fields.location: The Sorcerer Set is sold by the Nomadic Merchant at the Hermit Merchant’s Shack in Weeping Peninsula. Travel to the southern part of the peninsula and look for the merchant’s camp near the coast to purchase the set.

fields.name: Olivinus Glintstone Crown
fields.description:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Increases intelligence to the detriment of HP.

The lineage of the Olivinus Conspectus began with the sorcerer Lusat, and its adherents continue his study of meteors.
fields.location: Located within the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, exit the door and turn left into a chamber. Behind a corpse holding the Conspectus Scroll, there is an illusory wall. Breaking it reveals a path to a ledge on the left. Climb up the rocky outcrops to find the Olivinus Glintstone Crown.

fields.name: Lazuli Glintstone Crown
fields.description:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Increases intelligence and dexterity to the detriment of HP.

Scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus study Carian sorceries—a heterodox pursuit that views the moon as equal to the stars.
fields.location: Dropped by Lazuli Sorcerers in Raya Lucaria Academy, particularly on the upper floors and near the Debate Parlor. The Glintstone Crown is a rare drop from these enemies.

fields.name: Karolos Glintstone Crown
fields.description:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Increases intelligence to the detriment of stamina.

The Karolos Conspectus is the oldest of the academy's lineages of study, begat by the sorcerer Azur. Scholars who follow in his footsteps pursue the mysteries of comets.
fields.location: In Raya Lucaria Academy, head to the western side of the main courtyard. Near a corner of the courtyard, you’ll find a Crystallized Crab enemy. Defeat this crab to obtain the crown.

fields.name: Witch's Glintstone Crown
fields.description:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Increases intelligence and arcane to the detriment of stamina.

This gentle-looking crown was granted to a scholar who excelled in her studies, which also merited the title of "witch."
fields.location: The Witch’s Glintstone Crown is found in the Carian Study Hall in Liurnia. After progressing Ranni’s questline and using the Carian Inverted Statue, explore the upside-down study hall to find the crown on a corpse in a previously inaccessible area.

fields.name: Marionette Soldier Helm
fields.description:
Cylindrical helm of plate metal reinforced with a lattice.
Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.

The construction of this helm is remarkably crude.

For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.
fields.location: Farmed from Marionette Soldiers, puppet-like enemies dangling from ceilings in Raya Lucaria Academy (Liurnia). The easiest farming spot is near the Church of the Cuckoo site of grace, where four Marionettes drop from the ceiling.

fields.name: Marionette Soldier Armor
fields.description:
Armor of metal bands arranged in a lattice.
Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.

The construction of this armor is remarkably crude, now rusted over and severely dented.

For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.
fields.location: Farmed from Marionette Soldiers, puppet-like enemies dangling from ceilings in Raya Lucaria Academy (Liurnia). The easiest farming spot is near the Church of the Cuckoo site of grace, where four Marionettes drop from the ceiling.

fields.name: Marionette Soldier Birdhelm
fields.description:
Metal helm formed in the likeness of the face of a bird.
Worn by avionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.

The construction of this helm is remarkably crude.

For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.
fields.location: Farmed from Marionette Soldiers, puppet-like enemies dangling from ceilings in Raya Lucaria Academy (Liurnia). The easiest farming spot is near the Church of the Cuckoo site of grace, where four Marionettes drop from the ceiling.

fields.name: Raging Wolf Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

Vargram's nickname comes from the white wolf's mane that decorates this helm.
fields.location: This armor set is dropped by the Raging Wolf enemies that roam the northern parts of the Mistwood area in Limgrave. These hostile wolves are larger and more aggressive than normal wolves. Defeating one of these rare foes may reward you with pieces of the Raging Wolf Set, known for its rugged and wild aesthetic.

fields.name: Raging Wolf Armor
fields.description:
Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.
fields.location: This armor set is dropped by the Raging Wolf enemies that roam the northern parts of the Mistwood area in Limgrave. These hostile wolves are larger and more aggressive than normal wolves. Defeating one of these rare foes may reward you with pieces of the Raging Wolf Set, known for its rugged and wild aesthetic.

fields.name: Raging Wolf Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.
fields.location: This armor set is dropped by the Raging Wolf enemies that roam the northern parts of the Mistwood area in Limgrave. These hostile wolves are larger and more aggressive than normal wolves. Defeating one of these rare foes may reward you with pieces of the Raging Wolf Set, known for its rugged and wild aesthetic.

fields.name: Raging Wolf Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.
fields.location: This armor set is dropped by the Raging Wolf enemies that roam the northern parts of the Mistwood area in Limgrave. These hostile wolves are larger and more aggressive than normal wolves. Defeating one of these rare foes may reward you with pieces of the Raging Wolf Set, known for its rugged and wild aesthetic.

fields.name: Raging Wolf Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.
fields.location: This armor set is dropped by the Raging Wolf enemies that roam the northern parts of the Mistwood area in Limgrave. These hostile wolves are larger and more aggressive than normal wolves. Defeating one of these rare foes may reward you with pieces of the Raging Wolf Set, known for its rugged and wild aesthetic.

fields.name: Land of Reeds Helm
fields.description:
Helm made from strips of iron fastened together.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to blood-soaked madness, or so it is said.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Samurai class. It can also be purchased from the Isolated Merchant in northwest Caelid, near the Shack of the Isolated Merchant.

fields.name: Land of Reeds Armor
fields.description:
Armor made from strips of iron fastened together.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

The grimy outer mantle is made from withered reeds from the warrior's birthplace.
Perhaps its comforts extend to nostalgic thoughts of home.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Samurai class. It can also be purchased from the Isolated Merchant in northwest Caelid, near the Shack of the Isolated Merchant.

fields.name: Land of Reeds Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets wrapped in tough leather.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Samurai class. It can also be purchased from the Isolated Merchant in northwest Caelid, near the Shack of the Isolated Merchant.

fields.name: Land of Reeds Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves wrapped in tough leather.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Samurai class. It can also be purchased from the Isolated Merchant in northwest Caelid, near the Shack of the Isolated Merchant.

fields.name: Land of Reeds Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor made from strips of iron fastened together.
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds.

The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to blood-soaked madness, or so it is said.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Samurai class. It can also be purchased from the Isolated Merchant in northwest Caelid, near the Shack of the Isolated Merchant.

fields.name: Okina Mask
fields.description:
A wooden mask that depicts an old man baring his teeth. The source of the sobriquet of the great swordsman of the Land of Reeds.
Raises dexterity as it lowers focus.

The more he sharpened his mind, the more the absurdities of the world came into stark relief. And so Okina renounced it all, and rose to a higher plane. There was only himself. His katana. And its mastery.

Before long, Okina became a demon of a swordsman.
fields.location: The Okina Mask is found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, near the Church of Repose. Approach the church from the Foot of the Forge site of grace. As you enter the church’s vicinity, you will be invaded by an NPC named Okina. Defeating him will reward you with both the Okina Mask and the Rivers of Blood katana.

fields.name: White Reed Armor
fields.description:
Armor of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates.
Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.

The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat.
To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.
fields.location: The White Reed Set is worn by the Ronin enemies found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, especially near the Church of Repose. Defeating these wandering samurai warriors will yield their armor, gauntlets, and greaves.

fields.name: White Reed Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates.
Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.

The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat.
To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.
fields.location: The White Reed Set is worn by the Ronin enemies found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, especially near the Church of Repose. Defeating these wandering samurai warriors will yield their armor, gauntlets, and greaves.

fields.name: White Reed Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates.
Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.

The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat.
To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.
fields.location: The White Reed Set is worn by the Ronin enemies found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, especially near the Church of Repose. Defeating these wandering samurai warriors will yield their armor, gauntlets, and greaves.

fields.name: Confessor Hood
fields.description:
Black hood for blending in with the darkness.
Worn by church confessors.

The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.

The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.
fields.location: Starting gear for the Confessor class. Also sold by a merchant in the Mount Gelmir region; look for the merchant’s camp near the site of grace in that area. Each piece can be purchased separately.

fields.name: Confessor Armor
fields.description:
Black leather armor for blending in with the darkness.
Worn by church confessors.

The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.

The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.
fields.location: Starting gear for the Confessor class. Also sold by a merchant in the Mount Gelmir region; look for the merchant’s camp near the site of grace in that area. Each piece can be purchased separately.

fields.name: Confessor Gloves
fields.description:
Black leather gloves of the church confessors.

The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.

The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.
fields.location: Starting gear for the Confessor class. Also sold by a merchant in the Mount Gelmir region; look for the merchant’s camp near the site of grace in that area. Each piece can be purchased separately.

fields.name: Confessor Boots
fields.description:
Leather boots of the church confessors.

The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.

The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.
fields.location: Starting gear for the Confessor class. Also sold by a merchant in the Mount Gelmir region; look for the merchant’s camp near the site of grace in that area. Each piece can be purchased separately.

fields.name: Confessor Hood (Altered)
fields.description:
Cloth headwrap worn under a church confessor's black hood.
Such hoods are made for blending in with the darkness.
fields.location: Starting gear for the Confessor class. Also sold by a merchant in the Mount Gelmir region; look for the merchant’s camp near the site of grace in that area. Each piece can be purchased separately.

fields.name: Confessor Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Black leather armor for blending in with the darkness.
Worn by church confessors.

The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace.

The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.
fields.location: Starting gear for the Confessor class. Also sold by a merchant in the Mount Gelmir region; look for the merchant’s camp near the site of grace in that area. Each piece can be purchased separately.

fields.name: Prisoner Iron Mask
fields.description:
Iron mask forced on a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime.
Thick, heavy, and utterly stifling.

A foul creation designed to torment the wearer, either slowly fermenting hatred within their heart, or a spiritual fervor that is near indistinguishable from it.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Prisoner class. After progressing in the game, the set can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant near the Ailing Village in eastern Liurnia.

fields.name: Prisoner Clothing
fields.description:
Tattered clothing.
Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime.

Never once washed, every fiber is filthy.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Prisoner class. After progressing in the game, the set can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant near the Ailing Village in eastern Liurnia.

fields.name: Prisoner Trousers
fields.description:
Tattered trousers.
Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime.

Never once washed, every fiber is filthy.
The smell is beyond belief.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Prisoner class. After progressing in the game, the set can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant near the Ailing Village in eastern Liurnia.

fields.name: Blackguard's Iron Mask
fields.description:
Iron mask forced on convicted prisoners.
Worn by the blackguard Big Boggart.

To Boggart, the mask made him all the more threatening, and helped him get what he wanted. But it was also a mirror of his emptiness.
fields.location: Dropped by Blackguard Big Boggart if you defeat him at the Boilprawn Shack in Liurnia. Alternatively, he may drop it after completing his questline in Leyndell.

fields.name: Traveling Maiden Hood
fields.description:
Hood worn by traveling maidens.

Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Church of the Pilgrimage, Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Traveling Maiden Robe
fields.description:
Robe worn by traveling maidens.

Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Church of the Pilgrimage, Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Traveling Maiden Gloves
fields.description:
Gloves worn by traveling maidens.

Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Church of the Pilgrimage, Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Traveling Maiden Boots
fields.description:
Boots worn by traveling maidens.

Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Church of the Pilgrimage, Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Traveling Maiden Robe (Altered)
fields.description: Modest garb of traveling maidens, typically worn under their robes.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Church of the Pilgrimage, Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Finger Maiden Fillet
fields.description:
Fillet worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers.

The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.

The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.
fields.location: Found on a corpse at the Church of Inhibition in Liurnia of the Lakes. The full set is on the body seated on a chair inside the church.

fields.name: Finger Maiden Robe
fields.description:
Robe worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers.

The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.

The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.
fields.location: Found on a corpse at the Church of Inhibition in Liurnia of the Lakes. The full set is on the body seated on a chair inside the church.

fields.name: Finger Maiden Shoes
fields.description:
Shoes worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers.

The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.

The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.
fields.location: Found on a corpse at the Church of Inhibition in Liurnia of the Lakes. The full set is on the body seated on a chair inside the church.

fields.name: Finger Maiden Robe (Altered)
fields.description:
Robe worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers.

The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.

The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.
fields.location: Found on a corpse at the Church of Inhibition in Liurnia of the Lakes. The full set is on the body seated on a chair inside the church.

fields.name: Preceptor's Big Hat
fields.description:
Large hat with the movements of the stars drawn on the inside of the brim.
Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals.

Increases mind to the detriment of stamina.

Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.
fields.location: Dropped by Preceptor enemies in Caria Manor. These enemies wear large hats and wield magic staffs, and can be found throughout the manor and its gardens.

fields.name: Preceptor's Long Gown
fields.description:
A long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it.
Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals.

Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.
fields.location: Dropped by Preceptor enemies in Caria Manor. These enemies wear large hats and wield magic staffs, and can be found throughout the manor and its gardens.

fields.name: Preceptor's Gloves
fields.description:
Gloves of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals.
Black and perfectly discreet.
fields.location: Dropped by Preceptor enemies in Caria Manor. These enemies wear large hats and wield magic staffs, and can be found throughout the manor and its gardens.

fields.name: Preceptor's Trousers
fields.description:
Trousers of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals.
Black and perfectly discreet.
fields.location: Dropped by Preceptor enemies in Caria Manor. These enemies wear large hats and wield magic staffs, and can be found throughout the manor and its gardens.

fields.name: Mask of Confidence
fields.description:
Mask with the mouth sewn shut with gold thread.
Increases arcane.

When Radagon married Rennala, he ordered the Carian magic preceptors to don these masks. To make it clear that all of their matters were to be kept strictly private.
fields.location: Found in the inverted Carian Study Hall (Liurnia). After using the Carian Inverted Statue, climb the tower, drop to a ledge on the eastern side, and loot the mask from a corpse tucked into a crevice.

fields.name: Preceptor's Long Gown (Altered)
fields.description: Modest garb, previously worn under a long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it.
