fields.location: Dropped by Preceptor enemies in Caria Manor. These enemies wear large hats and wield magic staffs, and can be found throughout the manor and its gardens.

fields.name: Grass Hair Ornament
fields.description:
A headdress made from wildflowers.
Wearing this might make you less easy to spot.
fields.location: This is a key item, not a wearable armor piece. It is found in the Shaded Castle, in a small room on the upper level, and can be given to Lanya (Rya’s questline) for a reward.

fields.name: Skeletal Mask
fields.description:
Skeletal mask that tightly grips the face.
Worn by the assassins of Ravenmount.

This ritual implement relentlessly digs into the wearer's face, preserving one's human instincts while dressed in imitation of the Deathbirds.
fields.location: The Skeletal Mask is dropped by the Skeletal Mages found in the Sellia Hideaway dungeon in Caelid. Explore the cave and defeat these enemies for a chance to obtain the mask.

fields.name: Raptor's Black Feathers
fields.description:
Robe crafted with the black feathers of a bird of prey.
Worn by the assassins of Ravenmount.

A ritual implement for transforming into a Deathbird, if only by imitation.
Strengthens jump attacks.

"We are birds of prey, bringers of death."
fields.location: These feathers are part of the Raptor’s Black Feathers armor set, dropped by the Raptor enemies found in the Abandoned Cave in Caelid. Defeating these swift foes rewards you with feathers that form this light, feathered armor set.

fields.name: Bandit Manchettes
fields.description:
Manchettes made by simply wrapping dirty cloth around the arms.
Worn by bandits.
fields.location: Dropped by bandit enemies, commonly found in Limgrave and the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Bandit Boots
fields.description:
Leather boots worn by bandits.

Light for ease of movement, and supple for masking sound. In trade, they offer little damage negation.
fields.location: Dropped by bandit enemies, commonly found in Limgrave and the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Bandit Garb
fields.description:
Leather garb worn by bandits.

Light for ease of movement, and supple for masking sound. In trade, they offer little damage negation.
fields.location: Dropped by bandit enemies, commonly found in Limgrave and the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Eccentric's Hood
fields.description:
A pointy, ragged hood.
Worn by the knight Jerren.

The hood hides an aged, bearded mask.

Jerren served General Radahn as a guest commander, and they are said to have sworn an oath of honorable death to one another.
fields.location: Found on Jerren’s body in Redmane Castle after completing his questline or defeating Starscourge Radahn.

fields.name: Eccentric's Armor
fields.description:
Unusually colorful armor.
Worn by the knight Jerren.

Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became a guest commander for General Radahn.

And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.
fields.location: These pieces are obtained by completing Sorceress Sellen’s questline. At the end, side with Sellen during the confrontation at Raya Lucaria Grand Library. After defeating Witch-Hunter Jerren, the full Eccentric set (excluding the hood) is found on his body outside the library.

fields.name: Eccentric's Manchettes
fields.description:
The knight Jerren's manchettes.

Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became the guest commander for General Radahn.

And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.
fields.location: These pieces are obtained by completing Sorceress Sellen’s questline. At the end, side with Sellen during the confrontation at Raya Lucaria Grand Library. After defeating Witch-Hunter Jerren, the full Eccentric set (excluding the hood) is found on his body outside the library.

fields.name: Eccentric's Breeches
fields.description:
The knight Jerren's breeches.

Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became the guest commander for General Radahn.

And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.
fields.location: These pieces are obtained by completing Sorceress Sellen’s questline. At the end, side with Sellen during the confrontation at Raya Lucaria Grand Library. After defeating Witch-Hunter Jerren, the full Eccentric set (excluding the hood) is found on his body outside the library.

fields.name: Eccentric's Hood (Altered)
fields.description:
A pointy, ragged hood.
Worn by the knight Jerren.

The hood hides an aged, bearded mask.

Jerren served General Radahn as a guest commander, and they are said to have sworn an oath of honorable death to one another.
fields.location: Found on Jerren’s body in Redmane Castle after completing his questline or defeating Starscourge Radahn.

fields.name: Fingerprint Helm
fields.description:
Iron helm singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.

No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy.

Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?
fields.location: All pieces are found together on a corpse at the bottom of the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds, behind the Frenzied Flame door (Three Fingers area).

fields.name: Fingerprint Armor
fields.description:
Iron armor singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.

No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy.

Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?
fields.location: All pieces are found together on a corpse at the bottom of the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds, behind the Frenzied Flame door (Three Fingers area).

fields.name: Fingerprint Gauntlets
fields.description:
Iron gauntlets singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.

No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy.

Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?
fields.location: All pieces are found together on a corpse at the bottom of the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds, behind the Frenzied Flame door (Three Fingers area).

fields.name: Fingerprint Greaves
fields.description:
Iron greaves singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.

No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy.

Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?
fields.location: All pieces are found together on a corpse at the bottom of the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds, behind the Frenzied Flame door (Three Fingers area).

fields.name: Fingerprint Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Iron armor singed and blistered by fingers.
Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.

No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy.

Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?
fields.location: All pieces are found together on a corpse at the bottom of the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds, behind the Frenzied Flame door (Three Fingers area).

fields.name: Consort's Mask
fields.description:
Mask worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor, in the image of a foreign queen.
Increases dexterity.

Long ago, when Rykard first set eyes on Tanith, she was working as a dancer in a foreign land. Soon, he made her his consort.
She was the only human to remain by his side when he became the serpent of blasphemy.

In that moment, Tanith was truly charmed by him.
fields.location: After defeating Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy, return to his boss room in Volcano Manor. You’ll find Lady Tanith mourning near his remains. Attack and defeat her (and her summoned Crucible Knight), then loot her body to obtain the Consort’s Hood, Robe, and Trousers.

fields.name: Consort's Robe
fields.description:
Fine robe of white silk worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor.

Long ago, when Rykard first set eyes on Tanith, she was working as a dancer in a foreign land. Soon, he made her his consort.
She was the only human to remain by his side when he became the serpent of blasphemy.

In that moment, Tanith was truly charmed by him.
fields.location: After defeating Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy, return to his boss room in Volcano Manor. You’ll find Lady Tanith mourning near his remains. Attack and defeat her (and her summoned Crucible Knight), then loot her body to obtain the Consort’s Hood, Robe, and Trousers.

fields.name: Consort's Trousers
fields.description: Fine white trousers, perfectly suited for wearing beneath a silk robe.
fields.location: After defeating Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy, return to his boss room in Volcano Manor. You’ll find Lady Tanith mourning near his remains. Attack and defeat her (and her summoned Crucible Knight), then loot her body to obtain the Consort’s Hood, Robe, and Trousers.

fields.name: Ruler's Mask
fields.description:
Mask in the image of a wizened sage.
Customary dress among lords in a smaller nation.
Increases faith.

Such a mask illustrates the qualities of an ideal lord: chiefly, wise and possessing a certain defanged geniality.
One at the center of society often finds these qualities most expedient.
fields.location: These pieces are found on a corpse in the Cathedral of Manus Celes in the Mountaintops of the Giants. The cathedral is accessible after progressing through the region’s frozen paths. The Ruler’s Mask and Robe evoke the solemn dignity of a fallen monarch.

fields.name: Ruler's Robe
fields.description:
Luxurious robe worn by lords in a smaller nation.
Its fine blue mantle serves to prove its wearer's status.
fields.location: These pieces are found on a corpse in the Cathedral of Manus Celes in the Mountaintops of the Giants. The cathedral is accessible after progressing through the region’s frozen paths. The Ruler’s Mask and Robe evoke the solemn dignity of a fallen monarch.

fields.name: Upper-Class Robe
fields.description:
Embroidered, bright green robe worn by noble children.
Donning such a robe is traditionally the child's first show of burgeoning independence.
fields.location: The Upper-Class Robe is a bright green, embroidered robe that can be found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. Starting from the East Capital Rampart site of grace, descend the nearby elevator and climb the ladder just beyond it. Go out the door and follow the path to the left—the robe is on a corpse at the end of this route, near a balcony overlooking the city. Alternatively, you can purchase it from the Hermit Merchant at the Hermit Merchant’s Shack in the Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Marais Mask
fields.description:
Mask in the image of a white-haired young noble.
Customarily worn by the head of House Marais.
Increases arcane.

The Marais family has a dual history spanning generations, serving as both executioners and castellans of the Shaded Castle. This mask bears the likeness of the first of their line.
fields.location: Dropped by Maleigh Marais, an NPC found wandering the western slope of the Shaded Castle (Altus Plateau). He patrols near statues and is accompanied by a Golem. Defeat him for the set and the Antspur Rapier.

fields.name: Marais Robe
fields.description:
Robe with a black mantle across the shoulders.
Customarily worn by the head of House Marais.

The sons of House Marais are all sickly born.
Little wonder that Maleigh Marais would be so beguiled by the beautiful and fierce goddess who was born into rot.
fields.location: Dropped by Maleigh Marais, an NPC found wandering the western slope of the Shaded Castle (Altus Plateau). He patrols near statues and is accompanied by a Golem. Defeat him for the set and the Antspur Rapier.

fields.name: Bloodsoaked Manchettes
fields.description:
Manchettes formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood.

Any protection is welcome for the festering arms beneath.
fields.location: Found on the ground in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds beneath Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the Underground Roadside site of grace, proceed through the main tunnel, turn left, and defeat the first Omen enemy you encounter. The manchettes are on the ground on the right side of the tunnel shortly after this enemy.

fields.name: Bloodsoaked Mask
fields.description:
Mask formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood.

Even the most ghastly cover is more inviting than the festering face beneath.
fields.location: Dropped by certain enemies in the Windmill Village, Altus Plateau, or as loot in the village area after defeating the Godskin Apostle.

fields.name: Official's Attire
fields.description:
Grubby blue robe worn by magisterial officials to carry out their grim tasks.

Surveillance, executions, gruesome rituals… The darkest duties drive the wheels of mankind.
fields.location: To obtain the Official’s Attire, travel to the Forbidden Lands site of grace. From here, move back towards the elevator that leads to the outer regions. Before activating the elevator, look to the southwest for a hidden passage. Carefully jump into this concealed area to discover a corpse holding the Official’s Attire and the Blade of Calling.

fields.name: Omen Helm
fields.description:
Malformed helm resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

Worn by the Dung Eater, its form is a vision of the landscape of his mind, and of his appearance as he wished to see it.

The heart of an Omen without the body to match; could there be any crueler existence?
What does it matter, then, if the curse claims it all?
fields.location: The Omen Set is obtained by defeating the Dung Eater in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds beneath Leyndell, Royal Capital. You can either kill him after giving him Seluvis’s Potion or after completing his questline. His armor will be found on his body at these locations.

fields.name: Omen Armor
fields.description:
Malformed armor resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

Worn by the Dung Eater.
The heavy, sun-shaped medallion represents both the guidance he once saw, and the ring to which it will one day lead.
fields.location: The Omen Set is obtained by defeating the Dung Eater in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds beneath Leyndell, Royal Capital. You can either kill him after giving him Seluvis’s Potion or after completing his questline. His armor will be found on his body at these locations.

fields.name: Omen Gauntlets
fields.description:
Malformed gauntlets resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

Worn by the Dung Eater, their form is a vision of the landscape of his mind, and of his appearance as he wished to see it.

The heart of an Omen without the body to match; could there be any crueler existence?
What does it matter, then, if the curse claims it all?
fields.location: The Omen Set is obtained by defeating the Dung Eater in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds beneath Leyndell, Royal Capital. You can either kill him after giving him Seluvis’s Potion or after completing his questline. His armor will be found on his body at these locations.

fields.name: Omen Greaves
fields.description:
Malformed greaves resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

Worn by the Dung Eater, their form is a vision of the landscape of his mind, and of his appearance as he wished to see it.

The heart of an Omen without the body to match; could there be any crueler existence?
What does it matter, then, if the curse claims it all?
fields.location: The Omen Set is obtained by defeating the Dung Eater in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds beneath Leyndell, Royal Capital. You can either kill him after giving him Seluvis’s Potion or after completing his questline. His armor will be found on his body at these locations.

fields.name: Carian Knight Helm
fields.description:
Helm of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family.

The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.
fields.location: Dropped by Carian Knights patrolling Raya Lucaria Academy, typically found near the Debate Parlor or Church of the Cuckoo.

fields.name: Carian Knight Armor
fields.description:
Armor of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family.

The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.
fields.location: Dropped by Carian Knights in Raya Lucaria Academy, especially those guarding key areas such as the main courtyard and halls.

fields.name: Carian Knight Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family.

The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.
fields.location: Dropped by Carian Knights in Raya Lucaria Academy, most reliably from those found near the Debate Parlor or Church of the Cuckoo.

fields.name: Carian Knight Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family.

The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.
fields.location: Dropped by Carian Knights in Raya Lucaria Academy, typically found patrolling the main courtyard or halls.

fields.name: Carian Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family.

The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.
fields.location: Dropped by Carian Knights in Raya Lucaria Academy, especially those guarding key areas such as the main courtyard and halls.

fields.name: Hierodas Glintstone Crown
fields.description:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Increases intelligence and endurance to the detriment of FP.

The crown of Hierodas was granted to scholars who engaged in nomadic study away from the academy.
fields.location: Hierodas Glintstone Crown is found in Hermit Village, located in Mt. Gelmir. To obtain it, head to the south side of the village and look behind a house; the crown is on a corpse lying there.

fields.name: Errant Sorcerer Robe
fields.description:
Commonplace robe made of thick cloth.
Worn by the Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm, one of the first Tarnished to visit Roundtable Hold.

A silent seeker of sorcery, who had gone so far as to make contact with the primeval current, Wilhelm was led by guidance into confrontation with his friend Vargram, and it is said that he was then taken prisoner in Roundtable Hold.
fields.location: Dropped by Errant Sorcerer enemies, who are most commonly found in the Sellia Crystal Tunnel in Caelid and the Raya Lucaria Academy in Liurnia. Farm these sorcerers for a chance at each piece.

fields.name: Errant Sorcerer Manchettes
fields.description:
Commonplace leather manchettes.
Their hands are inlaid with dulled glintstone.
fields.location: Dropped by Errant Sorcerer enemies, who are most commonly found in the Sellia Crystal Tunnel in Caelid and the Raya Lucaria Academy in Liurnia. Farm these sorcerers for a chance at each piece.

fields.name: Errant Sorcerer Boots
fields.description: Commonplace leather boots, sturdy enough to withstand a long journey.
fields.location: Dropped by Errant Sorcerer enemies, who are most commonly found in the Sellia Crystal Tunnel in Caelid and the Raya Lucaria Academy in Liurnia. Farm these sorcerers for a chance at each piece.

fields.name: Errant Sorcerer Robe (Altered)
fields.description:
Commonplace robe made of thick cloth.
Worn by the Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm, one of the first Tarnished to visit Roundtable Hold.

A silent seeker of sorcery, who had gone so far as to make contact with the primeval current, Wilhelm was led by guidance into confrontation with his friend Vargram, and it is said that he was then taken prisoner in Roundtable Hold.
fields.location: Dropped by Errant Sorcerer enemies, who are most commonly found in the Sellia Crystal Tunnel in Caelid and the Raya Lucaria Academy in Liurnia. Farm these sorcerers for a chance at each piece.

fields.name: Dagger
fields.description:
A standard dagger with a straight blade.

Though modest in reach and capacity for harm, this weapon is light enough to jab in rapid succession and delivers devastating critical hits.
fields.location: Starting equipment for some classes or purchased from the Twin Maiden Husks.

fields.name: Battlemage Robe
fields.description:
Robe worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

Whenever war broke out and the academy sealed its gates, only Haima's scholars dared venture outside.
Seclusion is no way to foster discovery; it is only a convenient form of escape.
fields.location: Dropped by Battlemage enemies, most reliably found in the Altus Plateau near the Windmill Village or in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Battlemage Manchettes
fields.description: Manchettes worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.
fields.location: Dropped by Battlemage enemies, most reliably found in the Altus Plateau near the Windmill Village or in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Battlemage Legwraps
fields.description: Legwraps worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.
fields.location: Dropped by Battlemage enemies, most reliably found in the Altus Plateau near the Windmill Village or in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Black Knife
fields.description:
Dagger once belonging to one of the assassins who murdered Godwyn the Golden on the Night of the Black Knives.

A ritual performed on the oddly misshapen blade imbued it with the power of the stolen Rune of Death.
fields.location: Dropped by Black Knife Assassin in Sainted Hero’s Grave.

fields.name: Snow Witch Robe
fields.description:
Witch's robe in the color of snow.

Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries.
It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her.

That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.
fields.location: After advancing Ranni’s questline and retrieving the Fingerslayer Blade for her in Nokron, return to her tower and continue the quest. Eventually, you will be directed to Renna’s Rise, a tower northeast of Ranni’s Rise. Climb the ladder inside to find the Snow Witch Set in a chest at the top.

fields.name: Snow Witch Skirt
fields.description:
Witch's skirt in the color of snow.

Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries.
It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her.

That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.
fields.location: After advancing Ranni’s questline and retrieving the Fingerslayer Blade for her in Nokron, return to her tower and continue the quest. Eventually, you will be directed to Renna’s Rise, a tower northeast of Ranni’s Rise. Climb the ladder inside to find the Snow Witch Set in a chest at the top.

fields.name: Snow Witch Robe (Altered)
fields.description:
Witch's robe in the color of snow.

Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries.
It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her.

That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.
fields.location: After advancing Ranni’s questline and retrieving the Fingerslayer Blade for her in Nokron, return to her tower and continue the quest. Eventually, you will be directed to Renna’s Rise, a tower northeast of Ranni’s Rise. Climb the ladder inside to find the Snow Witch Set in a chest at the top.

fields.name: Traveler's Clothes
fields.description:
Light yet sturdy clothes.

Worn by young women who set off into the world to confront their fate.
fields.location: The Traveler’s Set is found on a corpse in the Shaded Castle in Altus Plateau. Enter the castle and explore its upper floors to find the set among the remains of a traveler.

fields.name: Traveler's Manchettes
fields.description:
Light yet sturdy leather manchettes.

Worn by young women who set off into the world to confront their fate.
fields.location: The Traveler’s Set is found on a corpse in the Shaded Castle in Altus Plateau. Enter the castle and explore its upper floors to find the set among the remains of a traveler.

fields.name: Traveler's Boots
fields.description:
Light yet sturdy leather boots.

Worn by young women who set off into the world to confront their fate.
fields.location: The Traveler’s Set is found on a corpse in the Shaded Castle in Altus Plateau. Enter the castle and explore its upper floors to find the set among the remains of a traveler.

fields.name: Miséricorde
fields.description:
Dagger favored by military physicians in white.
The pointed blade is hard and sharp, making critical hits especially potent.

Medicine is mercy, and mercy upon the battlefield is ruthless. Beware the killers clothed as men of compassion.
fields.location: Found in Stormveil Castle, in a room behind a Grafted Scion.

fields.name: Juvenile Scholar Robe
fields.description:
Robe worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy.

Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections, and thus do they repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it.

Rebirth is as sleep to them, and with each awakening, memory fades into oblivion.
fields.location: The Juvenile Scholar Robe is obtained by first collecting the Resurrection Painting from the Artist’s Shack in eastern Liurnia of the Lakes. After acquiring the painting, head to the graveyard east of Caria Manor (accessible only after completing the manor). In the graveyard, interact with the ghost sitting on a chair; the spirit will vanish and leave behind the Juvenile Scholar Robe, Juvenile Scholar Cap, and a Larval Tear on the ground.

fields.name: Reduvia
fields.description:
Jagged dagger with a distinctive curved blade.
Used by the noble servants of the Lord of Blood.

This dagger rips the flesh as it enters, inflicting blood loss with sickening efficacy. A proud testament to the success of its vicious design, this weapon is perpetually coated in blood.
fields.location: Dropped by Bloody Finger Nerijus, an invader near Murkwater Cave.

fields.name: Goldmask's Rags
fields.description:
Worn rags that just barely cover the body.

Lord Goldmask felt no draw to the vain excesses of clothing; what use is finery to one who seeks greater brilliance?
fields.location: The Goldmask is found on a collapsed bridge north of the Writheblood Ruins in Altus Plateau. The rest of the set is found on Goldmask’s body in Leyndell, Ashen Capital, after completing Brother Corhyn’s questline.

fields.name: Gold Bracelets
fields.description:
Bracelets made in the image of Erdtree branches.
Minimal adornments made by Lord Goldmask's disciples.

Those disciples have long since left him.
fields.location: The Goldmask is found on a collapsed bridge north of the Writheblood Ruins in Altus Plateau. The rest of the set is found on Goldmask’s body in Leyndell, Ashen Capital, after completing Brother Corhyn’s questline.

fields.name: Gold Waistwrap
fields.description:
Waistwrap made in the image of Erdtree branches.
A minimal adornment made by Lord Goldmask's disciples.

Those disciples have long since left him.
fields.location: The Goldmask is found on a collapsed bridge north of the Writheblood Ruins in Altus Plateau. The rest of the set is found on Goldmask’s body in Leyndell, Ashen Capital, after completing Brother Corhyn’s questline.

fields.name: Fell Omen Cloak
fields.description:
A cloak of ragged fur worn about the exposed body of Margit, the Fell Omen.

Having slaughtered countless champions during the Shattering, the Fell Omen has become a horror to those who harbor ambitions for the Erdtree, or for Lordship.
fields.location: Dropped by Margit, the Fell Omen, if you use Margit’s Shackle during the boss fight and then defeat him. It can also be found later in the game on a corpse in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds beneath Leyndell.

fields.name: Celebrant's Sickle
fields.description:
Sickle decorated with flowers and many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula. Its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard.

Crafted from human bone.
Grants trace amounts of runes on landing attacks.
fields.location: Dropped by Celebrant enemies in Windmill Village.

fields.name: Dirty Chainmail
fields.description:
Chainmail worn by young Albinaurics.
The appearance of a protruding belly provides no benefits worthy of note.
fields.location: Dropped by Commoner enemies, especially those wielding crossbows, found throughout Limgrave and Liurnia.

fields.name: Glintstone Kris
fields.description: Ritual blade once presented to Leyndell by the Academy of Raya Lucaria to celebrate their newfound peace. Though the weapon is embedded with precious glintstones and features Erdtree ornamentation, the undulating blade is symbolic of an ancient ritual.
fields.location: Reward from completing Sellen’s questline.

fields.name: Zamor Armor
fields.description:
Armor worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants.

These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.
fields.location: The Zamor Armor is found in the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave, located in the Mountaintops of the Giants. To reach it, enter the grave from the Snow Valley Ruins Overlook site of grace and navigate the dungeon’s traps and enemies. The armor is looted from a corpse deep within the tomb, often guarded by Zamor Knights.

fields.name: Zamor Bracelets
fields.description:
Bracelets worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants.

These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.
fields.location: The Zamor Bracelets are part of the Zamor Set and are found in the same Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave as the Zamor Armor. Continue exploring the dungeon beyond the main chamber to find the bracelets on a corpse, typically near the end of the grave’s winding passages.

fields.name: Zamor Legwraps
fields.description:
Legwraps worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants.

These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.
fields.location: The Zamor Legwraps complete the Zamor Set and are also located in the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. Proceed through the dungeon, bypassing or defeating the Zamor Knights, and search for a corpse in the final chamber or along the lower paths to collect the legwraps.

fields.name: Scorpion's Stinger
fields.description:
Dagger fashioned from a great scorpion's tail, glistening with scarlet rot.

A ceremonial tool used by heretics, crafted from the relic of a sealed outer god.
fields.location: Found in the Lake of Rot, on a corpse near the southern edge.

fields.name: Imp Head (Fanged)
fields.description:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.

Resembling a fanged demon, it holds trace amounts of bestial strength.
fields.location: Dropped by Imp enemies with cat-like stone heads in various catacombs, such as the Murkwater Catacombs in Limgrave. Farm these specific Imps for a chance at the helm

fields.name: Imp Head (Long-Tongued)
fields.description:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.

Resembling a long-tongued demon, it holds trace amounts of vexatious dexterity.
fields.location: Dropped by Imp enemies with long-tongued stone heads, found in the Road’s End Catacombs in western Liurnia. Seek out the Imps with this distinct head for the helm.

fields.name: Imp Head (Corpse)
fields.description:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.

Resembling the visage of a corpse, it holds trace amounts of lingering faith.
fields.location: Dropped by Imp enemies with corpse-shaped stone heads, most commonly found in the Cliffbottom Catacombs in Liurnia. Look for Imps with the matching head shape.

fields.name: Imp Head (Wolf)
fields.description:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.

Resembling a wolf, it holds trace amounts of lupine endurance.
fields.location: Dropped by Imp enemies with wolf-shaped stone heads, found in the Auriza Side Tomb in Altus Plateau. Defeat the appropriate Imps for a chance at this helm.

fields.name: Imp Head (Elder)
fields.description:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.

Resembling an elder, it holds trace amounts of arcane knowledge.
fields.location: Dropped by Imp enemies with elder-like stone heads, encountered in the Wyndham Catacombs in Altus Plateau. Farm the Imps with this head style for the drop.

fields.name: Great Knife
fields.description:
Large knife with a broad, curved blade.

This weapon is designed to slash and rend, inflicting blood loss upon the recipient.
fields.location: Dropped by Demi-Human Chiefs or found in Murkwater Cave.

fields.name: Wakizashi
fields.description:
Short sword with a tempering pattern on the blade.
A weapon unique to warriors of the Land of Reeds.
Afflicts targets with blood loss.
These swords are considered auxiliary weapons.
Yet, one man is known to wield this weapon in his left hand while using a full-sized katana in his right. A demonic swordsman known only as Okina.
fields.location: Found in Gaol Cave, Caelid, behind a locked door.

fields.name: Chain Armor
fields.description:
Armor made of woven chain.
Standard issue for ordinary soldiers.

Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.
fields.location: Sold by Merchant Kale at the Church of Elleh in Limgrave. Purchase each piece individually from his shop early in the game.

fields.name: Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by ordinary soldiers.

Though plain in appearance, they offer dependable protection.
fields.location: Many sets in Elden Ring have “Gauntlets” as an armor piece. Each set’s gauntlets drop from the same enemies or are found in the same locations as the rest of their respective sets. For example, Godrick Knight Gauntlets drop from Godrick Knights in Stormveil Castle, and Exile Gauntlets from Exile Soldiers in the same area.

fields.name: Chain Leggings
fields.description:
Leggings made of woven chain.
Standard issue for ordinary soldiers.

Though plain in appearance, they offer dependable protection.
fields.location: Sold by Merchant Kale at the Church of Elleh in Limgrave. Purchase each piece individually from his shop early in the game.

fields.name: Greathelm
fields.description:
Sturdy greathelm made from iron.

Though it is uncomfortably heavy and obstructs the vision of the wearer, it provides considerable damage negation.
fields.location: Found on a corpse sitting on a collapsed building’s edge in the northern part of the Capital Outskirts, just outside Leyndell. Look for a body wearing heavy armor and loot the helm directly.

fields.name: Eye Surcoat
fields.description:
Brown surcoat draped over chainmail.

The insignia emblazoned on the front marks out the wearer as the eyes and ears of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.
fields.location: Worn by Raya Lucaria Soldiers. Farm these soldiers, found in and around Raya Lucaria Academy in Liurnia, for a chance to obtain the surcoat.

fields.name: Tree Surcoat
fields.description:
Blue surcoat draped over chainmail.

The tree insignia emblazoned on the front depicts the Erdtree, and is a design beloved throughout the Lands Between.
fields.location: The Tree Surcoat can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant located on the Forest-Spanning Greatbridge in the Altus Plateau. The surcoat features the Erdtree insignia and is available for 3,500 runes.

fields.name: Cinquedea
fields.description:
Short sword given to high ranking clergymen of Farum Azula.
Raises potency of bestial incantations.

The design celebrates a beast's five fingers, symbolic of the intelligence once granted upon their kind.
fields.location: Found in a chest guarded by a giant beastman in the Bestial Sanctum, Caelid.

fields.name: Jar
fields.description:
Jar that fits cleanly over the head when upturned.
Made with pride by Iron Fist Alexander.

In a uniquely jarlike gesture of friendship, it boosts the power of throwing pot items.
fields.location: Awarded for completing Iron Fist Alexander’s questline. After helping Alexander throughout his journey and defeating him in a duel near the Dragon Temple in Crumbling Farum Azula, you will receive the Jar Helm as a reward.

fields.name: Ivory Sickle
fields.description:
Sickle fashioned from ivory.
Weapon carried by aged Albinaurics.

These weapons are evidence of their dedication to the Haligtree, despite never having entered its presence.
fields.location: Dropped by Lesser Burial Watchdogs in the Consecrated Snowfield.

fields.name: Mushroom Body
fields.description:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body.
These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the torso.

To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.
fields.location: In Seethewater Cave (Mt. Gelmir). Use two Stonesword Keys to unlock the cave, then follow the right wall past Giant Miranda Sprout enemies to a hidden chamber.

fields.name: Mushroom Arms
fields.description:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body.
These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the arms.

To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.
fields.location: In Seethewater Cave (Mt. Gelmir). Use two Stonesword Keys to unlock the cave, then follow the right wall past Giant Miranda Sprout enemies to a hidden chamber.

fields.name: Mushroom Legs
fields.description:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body.
These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the legs.

To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.
fields.location: In Seethewater Cave (Mt. Gelmir). Use two Stonesword Keys to unlock the cave, then follow the right wall past Giant Miranda Sprout enemies to a hidden chamber.

fields.name: Nox Mirrorhelm
fields.description:
Helm fashioned from a crystal looking-glass.
One among the Eternal City's ritual implements.
Easily broken and weak against striking attacks.

Worn by those committed to high treason, it wards off the intervention of the Greater Will and its vassal Fingers.
fields.location: Found in the Cliffbottom Catacombs in Liurnia. Use a Stonesword Key to unlock the sealed room near the end of the dungeon, where the helm waits on a corpse.

fields.name: Iji's Mirrorhelm
fields.description:
Helm fashioned from a crystal looking-glass, said to have never left War Counselor Iji's head.
Easily broken and weak against striking attacks.

Worn by those committed to high treason, it wards off the intervention of the Greater Will and its vassal Fingers.

Iji was afraid. Terrified of his own treachery.
fields.location: Sold by War Counselor Iji, the giant blacksmith in western Liurnia of the Lakes. After progressing Blaidd’s questline far enough, the helm is added to Iji’s shop inventory.

fields.name: Black Hood
fields.description:
Hood of lusterless black fabric that conceals its wearer's identity.

In this world, there is very little that must necessarily be known.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the Black Knife Catacombs, Liurnia of the Lakes. The chest is located in the boss chamber after defeating the Black Knife Assassin.

fields.name: Leather Armor
fields.description:
Lightweight and battle-proven leather armor worn by a savvy soldier.

Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Bandit class. After progressing in the game, the set can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant in the Weeping Peninsula, south of Limgrave.

fields.name: Leather Gloves
fields.description:
Lightweight and battle-proven leather gloves worn by a savvy soldier.

Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Bandit class. After progressing in the game, the set can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant in the Weeping Peninsula, south of Limgrave.

fields.name: Leather Boots
fields.description:
Lightweight and battle-proven leather boots worn by a savvy soldier.

Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.
fields.location: Starting armor for the Bandit class. After progressing in the game, the set can be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant in the Weeping Peninsula, south of Limgrave.

fields.name: Bandit Mask
fields.description:
Mask of black cloth that covers the mouth.

Favored by bandits for hiding their faces, it also provides some protection against poison.
fields.location: Dropped by bandit enemies, commonly found in Limgrave and the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Knight Helm
fields.description:
Iron helm of an unknown knight.
It is made of thin iron plate.

Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.
fields.location: Sold by the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold after offering them the first Bell Bearing from a merchant in Limgrave.

fields.name: Knight Armor
fields.description:
Iron armor of an unknown knight.
It is made of thin iron plate.

Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.
fields.location: Sold by the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold after offering them the first Bell Bearing from a merchant in Limgrave.

fields.name: Knight Gauntlets
fields.description:
Iron gauntlets of an unknown knight.
It is made of thin iron plate.

Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.
fields.location: Sold by the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold after offering them the first Bell Bearing from a merchant in Limgrave.

fields.name: Knight Greaves
fields.description:
Iron greaves of an unknown knight.
It is made of thin iron plate.

Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.
fields.location: Sold by the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold after offering them the first Bell Bearing from a merchant in Limgrave.

fields.name: Greathood
fields.description:
Hood far larger than the head it is meant to cover.
A burial shroud of sorts for those who discover, at long last, the truth they sought.

Increases intelligence and faith to the detriment of HP.

"Yes, surely this is the moon that young Rennala gazed upon."
fields.location: Found in the hidden area of the Consecrated Snowfield. From the Apostate Derelict church, head north to a graveyard with a giant walking mausoleum. The Greathood is on a corpse draped over a tombstone near the mausoleum’s legs.

fields.name: Godrick Soldier Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted.
Made from durable iron, layered with a chainmail coif beneath.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Soldiers, who appear in Limgrave, the Weeping Peninsula, and Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Tree-and-Beast Surcoat
fields.description:
Armor worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted.

The surcoat depicts the distant Erdtree and the beast regent, an emblem of the golden lineage.
Both are symbols of glory now past.
fields.location: This surcoat is worn by Godrick Soldiers and can be obtained by defeating them in various locations throughout Limgrave and the Weeping Peninsula, such as Castle Morne and the Tower of Return. The Tree-and-Beast Surcoat depicts both the Erdtree and the beast regent, symbols of Godrick’s lineage.

fields.name: Godrick Soldier Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Soldiers, who appear in Limgrave, the Weeping Peninsula, and Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Godrick Soldier Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Soldiers, who appear in Limgrave, the Weeping Peninsula, and Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Raya Lucarian Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers.
Its brow is adorned with a single cuckoo's feather.
fields.location: Both these pieces are located inside the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, explore the academy’s halls and chambers. The greaves and helm can be found on corpses or dropped by academy sorcerers in the deeper sections of the school, complementing the Raya Lucaria Robe and Gloves.

fields.name: Cuckoo Surcoat
fields.description:
Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers.

The surcoat depicts twinned cuckoos peering into a flourishing mass of glintstone.
To a glintstone sorcerer, the body is a transient thing. The Cuckoo alone knows its insignificance, yet watches over it all the same.
fields.location: Dropped by Raya Lucaria Soldiers wearing this set, found throughout the academy and along the approach to the main gate in Liurnia. Farm these soldiers for each piece of the set.

fields.name: Raya Lucarian Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.location: Also found within the Academy of Raya Lucaria, these gloves are located in the same general area as the Raya Lucaria Robe. Search the classrooms and corridors for a corpse holding the gloves, often near the sorcerer enemies. They complement the robe and are favored by magic users.

fields.name: Raya Lucarian Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.location: Both these pieces are located inside the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, explore the academy’s halls and chambers. The greaves and helm can be found on corpses or dropped by academy sorcerers in the deeper sections of the school, complementing the Raya Lucaria Robe and Gloves.

fields.name: Leyndell Soldier Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.
Made from durable iron, layered with a chainmail coif beneath.
fields.location: Dropped by Leyndell Soldiers, who are scattered across Leyndell, Royal Capital. You can also find groups of these soldiers just west of the First Mt. Gelmir Campsite site of grace in Altus Plateau, where they are gathered around fallen comrades, making them easier to farm.

fields.name: Erdtree Surcoat
fields.description:
Armor worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.

The surcoat bears a majestic likeness of the Erdtree. Its golden backing is an honor bestowed on no other soldiers.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital, on a corpse inside the church near the Erdtree Sanctuary site of grace.

fields.name: Leyndell Soldier Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.location: Dropped by Leyndell Soldiers, who are scattered across Leyndell, Royal Capital. You can also find groups of these soldiers just west of the First Mt. Gelmir Campsite site of grace in Altus Plateau, where they are gathered around fallen comrades, making them easier to farm.

fields.name: Leyndell Soldier Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.location: Dropped by Leyndell Soldiers, who are scattered across Leyndell, Royal Capital. You can also find groups of these soldiers just west of the First Mt. Gelmir Campsite site of grace in Altus Plateau, where they are gathered around fallen comrades, making them easier to farm.

fields.name: Radahn Soldier Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side.
Its visor is fashioned after a lion's fangs.
fields.location: These pieces belong to the armor worn by Radahn’s soldiers, found in the Redmane Castle area in Caelid. You can collect them by defeating Radahn Soldier enemies patrolling the castle grounds and nearby roads. The set is notable for its heavy, battle-worn appearance, fitting the soldiers serving under General Radahn.

fields.name: Redmane Surcoat
fields.description:
Armor worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side.

The surcoat depicts a red-maned lion raising a sword in the image of Radahn. Thus, they were Redmanes, and all proved they were worthy of the name.
fields.location: The Redmane Knight Set is obtained by defeating the Redmane Knight boss found in the Caelid region. This boss patrols the Smoldering Wall area near the Smoldering Wall site of grace. Once defeated, the knight drops his full armor set, which features striking red accents and a lion motif symbolizing strength and valor.

fields.name: Radahn Soldier Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.location: These pieces belong to the armor worn by Radahn’s soldiers, found in the Redmane Castle area in Caelid. You can collect them by defeating Radahn Soldier enemies patrolling the castle grounds and nearby roads. The set is notable for its heavy, battle-worn appearance, fitting the soldiers serving under General Radahn.

fields.name: Radahn Soldier Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.location: These pieces belong to the armor worn by Radahn’s soldiers, found in the Redmane Castle area in Caelid. You can collect them by defeating Radahn Soldier enemies patrolling the castle grounds and nearby roads. The set is notable for its heavy, battle-worn appearance, fitting the soldiers serving under General Radahn.

fields.name: Mausoleum Surcoat
fields.description:
Armor worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

The surcoat depicts the mausoleum bell, which rings in constant mourning for the soulless demigods.
fields.location: Dropped by Mausoleum Knights, who guard the Wandering Mausoleums. The most efficient place to farm these knights is directly outside the entrance to the Black Knife Catacombs in Liurnia of the Lakes, as they respawn and are close to a site of grace. You can also find these knights near the Walking Mausoleum in the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Mausoleum Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.location: Dropped by Mausoleum Knights, who guard the Wandering Mausoleums. The most efficient place to farm these knights is directly outside the entrance to the Black Knife Catacombs in Liurnia of the Lakes, as they respawn and are close to a site of grace. You can also find these knights near the Walking Mausoleum in the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Mausoleum Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.location: Dropped by Mausoleum Knights, who guard the Wandering Mausoleums. The most efficient place to farm these knights is directly outside the entrance to the Black Knife Catacombs in Liurnia of the Lakes, as they respawn and are close to a site of grace. You can also find these knights near the Walking Mausoleum in the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Haligtree Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.
An iron helm graced by a crown of unalloyed gold.

Increases faith.
fields.location: Dropped by Haligtree Soldiers, found just north of the Prayer Room site of grace in Miquella’s Haligtree.

fields.name: Haligtree Crest Surcoat
fields.description:
Armor worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.

The surcoat bears the crest of the Haligtree.
Though watered with Miquella's own blood since it was a sapling, the Haligtree ultimately failed to grow into an Erdtree.
fields.location: Dropped by Haligtree Soldiers, found just north of the Prayer Room site of grace in Miquella’s Haligtree.

fields.name: Haligtree Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.location: Dropped by Haligtree Soldiers, found just north of the Prayer Room site of grace in Miquella’s Haligtree.

fields.name: Haligtree Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.location: Dropped by Haligtree Soldiers, found just north of the Prayer Room site of grace in Miquella’s Haligtree.

fields.name: Gelmir Knight Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard.
Its crest of red feathers symbolizes Rykard's pedigree as Lord Radagon's son.
fields.location: Dropped by Gelmir Knights, who patrol the area around the First Mt. Gelmir Campsite and the approach to Volcano Manor in Mt. Gelmir. Farm these knights for each piece.

fields.name: Gelmir Knight Armor
fields.description:
Armor worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard.

It bears an emblem that none wear any longer, standing as it does for a lord that fell from lofty ambition into gluttonous depravity.
As the lord lost his dignity, so too did these knights lose their master.
fields.location: https://eldenring.wiki.fextralife.com/file/Elden-Ring/fias_robe_(altered)_elden_ring_wiki_guide_200px.png

fields.name: Gelmir Knight Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: Dropped by Gelmir Knights, who patrol the area around the First Mt. Gelmir Campsite and the approach to Volcano Manor in Mt. Gelmir. Farm these knights for each piece.

fields.name: Gelmir Knight Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: Dropped by Gelmir Knights, who patrol the area around the First Mt. Gelmir Campsite and the approach to Volcano Manor in Mt. Gelmir. Farm these knights for each piece.

fields.name: Gelmir Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard.

It bears an emblem that none wear any longer, standing as it does for a lord that fell from lofty ambition into gluttonous depravity.
As the lord lost his dignity, so too did these knights lose their master.
fields.location: Dropped by Gelmir Knights, who patrol the area around the First Mt. Gelmir Campsite and the approach to Volcano Manor in Mt. Gelmir. Farm these knights for each piece.

fields.name: Godrick Knight Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted.
Adorned with a plume of withered, ashen hair.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Knights, encountered in Stormveil Castle and its surrounding areas. Farm these knights for the full set.

fields.name: Godrick Knight Armor
fields.description:
Armor worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted.

Its left breast is emblazoned with a two-headed war axe, an emblem of the golden lineage.
The knights surely boasted of their strength in days long gone.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Knights, encountered in Stormveil Castle and its surrounding areas. Farm these knights for the full set.

fields.name: Godrick Knight Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Knights, encountered in Stormveil Castle and its surrounding areas. Farm these knights for the full set.

fields.name: Godrick Knight Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Knights, encountered in Stormveil Castle and its surrounding areas. Farm these knights for the full set.

fields.name: Godrick Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted.

Its left breast is emblazoned with a two-headed war axe, an emblem of the golden lineage.
The knights surely boasted of their strength in days long gone.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Knights, encountered in Stormveil Castle and its surrounding areas. Farm these knights for the full set.

fields.name: Cuckoo Knight Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.
Its brow is adorned with a single cuckoo's feather.
fields.location: Dropped by Raya Lucaria Soldiers wearing this set, found throughout the academy and along the approach to the main gate in Liurnia. Farm these soldiers for each piece of the set.

fields.name: Cuckoo Knight Armor
fields.description:
Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.

Its left breast is emblazoned with a peering cuckoo, whence came their name.
Perhaps the bird's shrewd gaze is an expression of their refusal to be mere servants of the academy.
fields.location: Dropped by Raya Lucaria Soldiers wearing this set, found throughout the academy and along the approach to the main gate in Liurnia. Farm these soldiers for each piece of the set.

fields.name: Cuckoo Knight Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: Dropped by Raya Lucaria Soldiers wearing this set, found throughout the academy and along the approach to the main gate in Liurnia. Farm these soldiers for each piece of the set.

fields.name: Cuckoo Knight Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: Dropped by Raya Lucaria Soldiers wearing this set, found throughout the academy and along the approach to the main gate in Liurnia. Farm these soldiers for each piece of the set.

fields.name: Cuckoo Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.

Its left breast is emblazoned with a peering cuckoo, whence came their name.
Perhaps the bird's shrewd gaze is an expression of their refusal to be mere servants of the academy.
fields.location: Dropped by Raya Lucaria Soldiers wearing this set, found throughout the academy and along the approach to the main gate in Liurnia. Farm these soldiers for each piece of the set.

fields.name: Leyndell Knight Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.

The golden canopy represents the honor of standing among the tree's defenders.
fields.location: Dropped by Leyndell Knights, who are found in several locations, including along the road between the Grand Lift of Dectus and the western gate of the Capital Outskirts in Altus Plateau, inside the Wyndham Catacombs dungeon, and throughout the streets of Leyndell, Royal Capital. Farm these knights for a chance at each piece of their set.

fields.name: Leyndell Knight Armor
fields.description:
Armor worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.

Its left breast is emblazoned with a symbol of Erdtree Worship, said to have once been imbued with an incantation of protection.
fields.location: Dropped by Leyndell Knights, who are found in several locations, including along the road between the Grand Lift of Dectus and the western gate of the Capital Outskirts in Altus Plateau, inside the Wyndham Catacombs dungeon, and throughout the streets of Leyndell, Royal Capital. Farm these knights for a chance at each piece of their set.

fields.name: Leyndell Knight Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: Dropped by Leyndell Knights, who are found in several locations, including along the road between the Grand Lift of Dectus and the western gate of the Capital Outskirts in Altus Plateau, inside the Wyndham Catacombs dungeon, and throughout the streets of Leyndell, Royal Capital. Farm these knights for a chance at each piece of their set.

fields.name: Leyndell Knight Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: Dropped by Leyndell Knights, who are found in several locations, including along the road between the Grand Lift of Dectus and the western gate of the Capital Outskirts in Altus Plateau, inside the Wyndham Catacombs dungeon, and throughout the streets of Leyndell, Royal Capital. Farm these knights for a chance at each piece of their set.

fields.name: Leyndell Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.

Its left breast is emblazoned with a symbol of Erdtree Worship, said to have once been imbued with an incantation of protection.
fields.location: Dropped by Leyndell Knights, who are found in several locations, including along the road between the Grand Lift of Dectus and the western gate of the Capital Outskirts in Altus Plateau, inside the Wyndham Catacombs dungeon, and throughout the streets of Leyndell, Royal Capital. Farm these knights for a chance at each piece of their set.

fields.name: Redmane Knight Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side.

The red plume is a symbol of Radahn's pedigree as Lord Radagon's son—the mane of the proud Red Lion.
fields.location: The Redmane Knight Set is obtained by defeating the Redmane Knight boss found in the Caelid region. This boss patrols the Smoldering Wall area near the Smoldering Wall site of grace. Once defeated, the knight drops his full armor set, which features striking red accents and a lion motif symbolizing strength and valor.

fields.name: Redmane Knight Armor
fields.description:
Armor worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side.

When they were driven to defeat by Malenia's scarlet rot, the Redmane Knights burned the crest on the left breast of their armor to indicate their resolve.

"Alas, dear home, I shan't see you again! For our duty is to remain here, a bulwark against the blight."
fields.location: The Redmane Knight Set is obtained by defeating the Redmane Knight boss found in the Caelid region. This boss patrols the Smoldering Wall area near the Smoldering Wall site of grace. Once defeated, the knight drops his full armor set, which features striking red accents and a lion motif symbolizing strength and valor.

fields.name: Redmane Knight Gauntlets
fields.description: Black iron gauntlets worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side. Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: The Redmane Knight Set is obtained by defeating the Redmane Knight boss found in the Caelid region. This boss patrols the Smoldering Wall area near the Smoldering Wall site of grace. Once defeated, the knight drops his full armor set, which features striking red accents and a lion motif symbolizing strength and valor.

fields.name: Redmane Knight Greaves
fields.description: Black iron greaves worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side. Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: The Redmane Knight Set is obtained by defeating the Redmane Knight boss found in the Caelid region. This boss patrols the Smoldering Wall area near the Smoldering Wall site of grace. Once defeated, the knight drops his full armor set, which features striking red accents and a lion motif symbolizing strength and valor.

fields.name: Redmane Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side.

When they were driven to defeat by Malenia's scarlet rot, the Redmane Knights burned the crest on the left breast of their armor to indicate their resolve.

"Alas, dear home, I shan't see you again! For our duty is to remain here, a bulwark against the blight."
fields.location: The Redmane Knight Set is obtained by defeating the Redmane Knight boss found in the Caelid region. This boss patrols the Smoldering Wall area near the Smoldering Wall site of grace. Once defeated, the knight drops his full armor set, which features striking red accents and a lion motif symbolizing strength and valor.

fields.name: Mausoleum Knight Armor
fields.description:
Armor worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

The wing-shaped ornaments on its back evoke the Deathbird. A self-inflicted curse that ties the spirits of these loyal knights to the land, having willingly beheaded themselves so that they may serve their masters in death.
fields.location: Farmed from Mausoleum Knights wielding greatshields. The most reliable spot is outside the Black Knife Catacombs (Liurnia), where a knight patrols near the entrance. Reset at the site of grace to farm repeatedly.

fields.name: Mausoleum Knight Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: Farmed from Mausoleum Knights wielding greatshields. The most reliable spot is outside the Black Knife Catacombs (Liurnia), where a knight patrols near the entrance. Reset at the site of grace to farm repeatedly.

fields.name: Mausoleum Knight Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: Farmed from Mausoleum Knights wielding greatshields. The most reliable spot is outside the Black Knife Catacombs (Liurnia), where a knight patrols near the entrance. Reset at the site of grace to farm repeatedly.

fields.name: Mausoleum Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

The wing-shaped ornaments on its back evoke the Deathbird. A self-inflicted curse that ties the spirits of these loyal knights to the land, having willingly beheaded themselves so that they may serve their masters in death.
fields.location: Farmed from Mausoleum Knights wielding greatshields. The most reliable spot is outside the Black Knife Catacombs (Liurnia), where a knight patrols near the entrance. Reset at the site of grace to farm repeatedly.

fields.name: Haligtree Knight Helm
fields.description:
Helm worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree.
Graced by a crown of unalloyed gold.

Increases faith.
fields.location: The Haligtree Knight Helm is found on a corpse near the Elphael Inner Wall site of grace in Miquella’s Haligtree. The rest of the set drops from Haligtree Knights patrolling near that grace.

fields.name: Haligtree Knight Armor
fields.description:
Armor worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree.

Its left breast is emblazoned with the crest of the Haligtree.
Though watered with Miquella's own blood since it was a sapling, the Haligtree ultimately failed to grow into an Erdtree.
fields.location: The Haligtree Knight Helm is found on a corpse near the Elphael Inner Wall site of grace in Miquella’s Haligtree. The rest of the set drops from Haligtree Knights patrolling near that grace.

fields.name: Haligtree Knight Gauntlets
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: The Haligtree Knight Helm is found on a corpse near the Elphael Inner Wall site of grace in Miquella’s Haligtree. The rest of the set drops from Haligtree Knights patrolling near that grace.

fields.name: Haligtree Knight Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree.
Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.location: The Haligtree Knight Helm is found on a corpse near the Elphael Inner Wall site of grace in Miquella’s Haligtree. The rest of the set drops from Haligtree Knights patrolling near that grace.

fields.name: Haligtree Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.description:
Armor worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree.

Its left breast is emblazoned with the crest of the Haligtree.
Though watered with Miquella's own blood since it was a sapling, the Haligtree ultimately failed to grow into an Erdtree.
fields.location: The Haligtree Knight Helm is found on a corpse near the Elphael Inner Wall site of grace in Miquella’s Haligtree. The rest of the set drops from Haligtree Knights patrolling near that grace.

fields.name: Foot Soldier Cap
fields.description: Flanged iron cap widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Foot Soldiers, who are scattered throughout Limgrave, the Weeping Peninsula, and Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Chain-Draped Tabard
fields.description:
Padded cloth armor with a chainmail shawl draped over the shoulders.

Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Foot Soldiers, who patrol the roads and camps throughout Limgrave and the Weeping Peninsula. For efficient farming, seek out the group of three soldiers just south of the Agheel Lake South site of grace in Limgrave.

fields.name: Foot Soldier Gauntlets
fields.description:
Metal gauntlets covered in nicks and dents.
Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Foot Soldiers, who are scattered throughout Limgrave, the Weeping Peninsula, and Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Foot Soldier Greaves
fields.description:
Metal greaves that have already been mended countless times.
Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Foot Soldiers, who are scattered throughout Limgrave, the Weeping Peninsula, and Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Foot Soldier Helmet
fields.description:
Helmet with a protective metal plate.
Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Foot Soldiers, who are scattered throughout Limgrave, the Weeping Peninsula, and Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Foot Soldier Tabard
fields.description:
Padded cloth armor with more than a few stains.
Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Foot Soldiers, who are scattered throughout Limgrave, the Weeping Peninsula, and Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Gilded Foot Soldier Cap
fields.description:
Flanged cap made from gilded iron.
Issued to foot soldiers protecting the royal capital of Leyndell.
fields.location: Dropped by Gilded Foot Soldiers, who patrol the roads and camps in the Altus Plateau. They are recognizable by their gold-trimmed armor and can be farmed near the Altus Highway Junction site of grace.

fields.name: Leather-Draped Tabard
fields.description:
Padded cloth armor with a leather shawl draped over the shoulders.

Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.
fields.location: Dropped by Leyndell Foot Soldiers, who patrol the streets and main thoroughfares within Leyndell, Royal Capital. For efficient farming, look for these soldiers along the main road west of the Outer Wall Battleground site of grace.

fields.name: Foot Soldier Helm
fields.description:
Wholly unembellished iron helm.
Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Foot Soldiers, who are scattered throughout Limgrave, the Weeping Peninsula, and Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Scarlet Tabard
fields.description:
Padded cloth armor with the telltale stains of the scarlet rot.

Worn by foot soldiers in General Radahn's army.
fields.location: The Scarlet Tabard is a chest piece worn by Radahn’s foot soldiers, found throughout the Caelid region. If you head to the Chamber Outside the Plaza site of grace, you’ll encounter a group of these soldiers just outside the chamber. Defeating them grants a chance to obtain the tabard, which is marked by the stains of the scarlet rot.

fields.name: Bloodsoaked Tabard
fields.description:
Padded cloth armor with indelible bloodstains around the neck.

Worn by headless foot soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.
fields.location: Dropped by Mausoleum Foot Soldiers, who guard the Wandering Mausoleums. The most reliable spots to find these enemies are southeast of the Witchbane Ruins in the Weeping Peninsula and south of the Apostate Derelict in the Consecrated Snowfield. Defeat them for a chance to obtain the tabard.

fields.name: Sacred Crown Helm
fields.description:
Flanged iron cap adorned with a crown of unalloyed gold.
Increases faith.

Worn by foot soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.

Who is it that Miquella shall bless, if not the low and the meek?
fields.location: Dropped by Haligtree Foot Soldiers in Miquella’s Haligtree. The helm and tabard drop from Haligtree Foot Soldiers, while the gauntlets and greaves drop from Godrick Foot Soldiers in the same area.

fields.name: Ivory-Draped Tabard
fields.description:
Padded cloth armor with a shawl in the color of ivory draped over the shoulders.

Worn by foot soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.
fields.location: Dropped by Haligtree Foot Soldiers in Miquella’s Haligtree. The helm and tabard drop from Haligtree Foot Soldiers, while the gauntlets and greaves drop from Godrick Foot Soldiers in the same area.

fields.name: Omensmirk Mask
fields.description:
Mask with long, hideously twisted horns worn by the Omenkillers.
Increases strength.

Bears the smirking face of an elder, twisted in wicked delight.

This visage is carved in the image of the evil spirits that haunt the Omen in their nightmares.
fields.location: The Omensmirk Mask is a rare drop from Omen enemies, particularly those found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. It is not guaranteed, so repeated encounters may be necessary.

fields.name: Omenkiller Robe
fields.description:
Robe worn by the Omenkillers, butchers of twisted conscience.

Its thick apron is worn in remembrance of Rollo, the progenitor of the Omenkillers and a perfumer of antiquity.
fields.location: Unknown

fields.name: Omenkiller Long Gloves
fields.description: Long, stiff leather gloves worn by the Omenkillers.
fields.location: Omenkiller Long Gloves are dropped by Omenkiller enemies. These foes are found in several areas, most notably in the Village of the Albinaurics in Liurnia and in Volcano Manor. Defeating them has a chance to drop their gloves.

fields.name: Omenkiller Boots
fields.description: Stiff leather boots worn by the Omenkillers.
fields.location: To acquire the Omenkiller Boots, travel to the Altus Plateau and locate the Perfumer’s Ruins. The ruins are found to the northwest of the Abandoned Coffin site of grace. As you approach the area, you’ll notice poison flowers and perfumer enemies around the crumbling structure. Defeat the Omenkiller enemy that patrols here—he is larger and more aggressive than the surrounding foes. Once defeated, the Omenkiller will drop the Omenkiller Boots, along with the Omenkiller Robe and Omenkiller Long Gloves. These drops are guaranteed, so you do not need to worry about farming for them.

fields.name: Ash-of-War Scarab
fields.description:
Gray scarab worn directly on the head.
These scarabs roll clumps of Ashes of War during their labors.

Slightly reduces the FP cost of skills, but increases damage taken.
fields.location: Not a standard armor piece, but rather a cosmetic headpiece. It is obtained by defeating the boss “Commander O’Neil” in the Swamp of Aeonia, Caelid. After defeating him, the Ash-of-War Scarab will be available as a reward.

fields.name: Incantation Scarab
fields.description:
Golden scarab worn directly on the head.
These scarabs roll clumps of incantations during their labors.

Slightly reduces the FP costs of incantations, but increases damage taken.

As a scarab approaches death, it abandons its rolled treasure and stretches its wings wide for the long journey to its home nest.
fields.location: Awarded for completing the “Testu’s Rise” puzzle in northern Liurnia. Solve the puzzle by defeating the three hidden turtles, then climb the tower to find the scarab helm in a chest at the top.

fields.name: Glintstone Scarab
fields.description:
Blue-green scarab worn directly on the head.
These scarabs roll clumps of sorcery during their labors.

Slightly reduces the FP costs of sorceries, but increases damage taken.
fields.location: Awarded for completing a Sorcerer Thops questline. After giving Thops the second Academy Glintstone Key and exhausting his dialogue, you’ll find his body in the Schoolhouse Classroom at Raya Lucaria Academy with the Glintstone Scarab on it.

fields.name: Crimson Tear Scarab
fields.description:
Red scarab worn directly on the head.
The red scarabs roll clumps of crimson tears during their labors.

Slightly increases the recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears, but increases damage taken.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau, on a corpse atop a rock arch northeast of the Bower of Bounty site of grace. Carefully climb up the arch to reach the body and claim the scarab helm.

fields.name: Cerulean Tear Scarab
fields.description:
Blue scarab worn directly on the head.
These scarabs roll clumps of cerulean tears during their labors.

Slightly increases the recovery effects of the Flask of Cerulean Tears, but increases damage taken.
fields.location: Found atop a roof in the northeastern part of Sellia, Town of Sorcery (Caelid). Reach this area by navigating across the rooftops—look for a corpse on a high roof to claim the scarab helm.

fields.name: Deathbed Dress
fields.description:
Extremely thin and sheer white dress worn by the Deathbed Companion as she embraces the dead.

Slowly replenishes the HP of nearby allies, but not that of the wearer.

The touch of the fabric is exceedingly soft, so as not to harm even the most withered corpse, while still sharing her warmth.
fields.location: Found on a corpse lying on a bed in the lower level of the Divine Tower of Liurnia. Access the tower by using the Carian Inverted Statue at the Carian Study Hall, then descend the tower carefully to reach the dress.

fields.name: Deathbed Smalls
fields.description: Skirt worn by Phia, the Deathbed Companion.
fields.location: Found on a corpse lying on a bed in the lower level of the Divine Tower of Liurnia. Access the tower by using the Carian Inverted Statue at the Carian Study Hall, then descend the tower carefully to reach the dress.

fields.name: Fia's Hood
fields.description:
