Hood of black cloth that covers the whole head.
Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home.

The fabric itself is soft as silk.
fields.location: Fia’s Set (Fia’s Hood and Fia’s Robe) is obtained after completing Fia’s questline. Once you have defeated Lichdragon Fortissax in Deeproot Depths and finished the final dialogue with Fia, return to her room at the Roundtable Hold. You will find her set lying on her bed, ready to be picked up.

fields.name: Fia's Robe
fields.description:
Robe of black cloth that covers the entire body.
Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home.

The fabric itself is soft as silk and thin enough that those embraced can feel every pulse; every bit of her warmth.
fields.location: Fia’s Set (Fia’s Hood and Fia’s Robe) is obtained after completing Fia’s questline. Once you have defeated Lichdragon Fortissax in Deeproot Depths and finished the final dialogue with Fia, return to her room at the Roundtable Hold. You will find her set lying on her bed, ready to be picked up.

fields.name: Fia's Robe (Altered)
fields.description:
Robe of black cloth that covers the entire body.
Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home.

The fabric itself is soft as silk and thin enough that those embraced can feel every pulse; every bit of her warmth.
fields.location: Fia’s Set (Fia’s Hood and Fia’s Robe) is obtained after completing Fia’s questline. Once you have defeated Lichdragon Fortissax in Deeproot Depths and finished the final dialogue with Fia, return to her room at the Roundtable Hold. You will find her set lying on her bed, ready to be picked up.

fields.name: Millicent's Robe
fields.description: Robe worn by Millicent the Rotting
fields.location: Unknown

fields.name: Millicent's Gloves
fields.description: Gloves worn by Millicent the Rotting
fields.location: Unknown

fields.name: Millicent's Boots
fields.description: Boots worn by Millicent the Rotting

fields.name: Millicent's Tunic
fields.description: Tunic worn by Millicent the Rotting
fields.location: Unknown

fields.name: Golden Prosthetic
fields.description: Golden prosthetic forged using ancient techniques
fields.location: This is not a wearable armor piece but a key item used in Millicent’s questline. It is found in the Shaded Castle, in the northern Altus Plateau, on a corpse in an upper room guarded by Cleanrot Knights.

fields.name: Highwayman Hood
fields.description:
Hideously stained and ragged hood.
Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.
fields.location: Dropped by Highwayman enemies in Murkwater Cave, Limgrave. The set uses Foot Soldier Greaves, which drop from Godrick Foot Soldiers.

fields.name: Highwayman Cloth Armor
fields.description:
Hideously stained and ragged cloth armor.
Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.
fields.location: Dropped by Highwayman enemies in Murkwater Cave, Limgrave. The set uses Foot Soldier Greaves, which drop from Godrick Foot Soldiers.

fields.name: Highwayman Gauntlets
fields.description:
Hideously stained and dented gauntlets.
Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.
fields.location: Dropped by Highwayman enemies in Murkwater Cave, Limgrave. The set uses Foot Soldier Greaves, which drop from Godrick Foot Soldiers.

fields.name: High Page Hood
fields.description:
Hood of a page selected for special privileges by the noble they serve.

The unassuming sack-like appearance befits their unseen and unknown stature.
fields.location: Dropped by High Page enemies, first encountered on the second floor of the Church of the Cuckoo in Raya Lucaria Academy. Additional High Pages can be found in various buildings in Leyndell.

fields.name: High Page Clothes
fields.description:
Clothes of a page selected for special privileges by the noble they serve.

Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.
fields.location: Dropped by High Page enemies, first encountered on the second floor of the Church of the Cuckoo in Raya Lucaria Academy. Additional High Pages can be found in various buildings in Leyndell.

fields.name: High Page Clothes (Altered)
fields.description:
Clothes of a page selected for special privileges by the noble they serve.

Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.
fields.location: Dropped by High Page enemies, first encountered on the second floor of the Church of the Cuckoo in Raya Lucaria Academy. Additional High Pages can be found in various buildings in Leyndell.

fields.name: Longsword
fields.description:
A straight sword with a double-edged blade.

In addition to its reliable standard damage, this weapon also boasts powerful piercing attacks. A superbly balanced armament.
fields.location: Starting weapon for the Vagabond class. Can also be purchased from the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold for 1,000 runes.

fields.name: Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak
fields.description:
Thick, bristly cloak eaten through by scarlet rot.

The symbol of an underground gravekeeper's station.
fields.location: The Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak and its altered variant can be found in the Abandoned Cave in Caelid. The original cloak is on a corpse inside the cave, while the altered version is obtained after defeating the cave’s boss. Both cloaks have a tattered, corrupted look.

fields.name: Rotten Duelist Greaves
fields.description:
Greaves wrapped with bronze snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot.

Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum.
The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.
fields.location: These greaves are dropped by Rotten Duelist enemies found in the Caelid region, particularly near the Smoldering Wall and Caelid Highway South. The greaves have a decayed, corrupted design fitting the grotesque nature of their wearers.

fields.name: Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak (Altered)
fields.description:
Cloak wrapped with bronze snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot.

Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum.
The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.
fields.location: The Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak and its altered variant can be found in the Abandoned Cave in Caelid. The original cloak is on a corpse inside the cave, while the altered version is obtained after defeating the cave’s boss. Both cloaks have a tattered, corrupted look.

fields.name: Short Sword
fields.description:
A short straight sword with a short blade.
In addition to its reliable standard damage, this weapon also boasts powerful piercing attacks.

Lightweight amongst straight swords, this weapon is easy to wield, requiring only humble attributes.
fields.location: Starting weapon for the Astrologer class. Also sold by the Nomadic Merchant in northern Limgrave, near the bridge with the pumpkin-headed enemy.

fields.name: Broadsword
fields.description:
A straight sword with a wide blade, suited to slashing attacks.

Horizontal swings boast wide attack range, making it easier to connect with foes.
fields.location: Starting weapon for the Confessor class. Also sold by the Nomadic Merchant in West Limgrave, just south of the Coastal Cave.

fields.name: Lazuli Robe
fields.description:
Robe worn by scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus, singular among the greater Raya Lucaria Academy.

These scholars, who sought to master Carian sorcery, instead learned to see the moon as equal to the stars.
This robe, in the hue of the full moon, signifies their heresy.
fields.location: Dropped by Lazuli Sorcerers in Raya Lucaria Academy, particularly on the upper floors and near the Debate Parlor. The Glintstone Crown is a rare drop from these enemies.

fields.name: Parrying Dagger
fields.description:
A knife with curved handguards.
Designed to parry, turning foes' attacks against them.

For masters of combat who anticipate every enemy strike and counter accordingly, this weapon is all they need.
fields.location: Purchased from Patches at Murkwater Cave or the Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold.

fields.name: Crystal Knife
fields.description:
A knife made by sharpening hard crystal.
Signature weapon of glintstone miners.

Used as tool to extract glintstone from broken rock, and as such a faint magic enwreathes the blade.
fields.location: Located in Academy Crystal Cave, on a corpse behind a boss door.

fields.name: Bloodstained Dagger
fields.description:
Dagger with a bloodstained blade.
Afflicts targets with blood loss.

As blood darkened the dagger through repeated slashing and stabbing, its blade only grew sharper and harder.
fields.location: Dropped by Bloodfinger Nerijus, an invader near Murkwater Cave.

fields.name: Erdsteel Dagger
fields.description:
An erdsteel dagger with a grass crest engraved upon its blade. Carried by the Erdtree royalty for self-defense in times of peace.

Though forged to a high standard, the weapon is difficult to wield.
Attack power also scales with faith.
fields.location: Reward from completing D’s questline or found on his body.

fields.name: Blade of Calling
fields.description:
Dagger given to one who set out on a journey to fulfill her duty long ago. The power of its former owner, the kindling maiden, is still apparent.

The one who walks alongside flame,
Shall one day meet the road of Destined Death.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital, atop a balcony near the Forbidden Lands elevator.

fields.name: Lordsworn's Straight Sword
fields.description:
Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious
design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army.

Though blackened and damaged by years of use,
it appears to have otherwise been kept in a
serviceable condition, despite the soldiers having
long since lost their minds.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Soldiers in Gatefront Ruins (Limgrave) and by undead soldiers at the Fourth Church of Marika (Weeping Peninsula).

fields.name: Weathered Straight Sword
fields.description:
Straight sword with a rather short but wide blade.
Simple to wield, it was known as the sword of the people.

Though the Erdtree styling is still visible, time has not been kind to this sword, now merely a shadow of its former self.
fields.location: Dropped by Commoner enemies throughout the Lands Between, especially those digging or wandering in Limgrave and Liurnia.

fields.name: Ornamental Straight Sword
fields.description:
Slender straight sword patterned after an antique ornament.
Superior swordsmen prefer to wield one in each hand.

After falling from grace, the dregs of the golden lineage sought power and purpose in the past.
fields.location: Reward for defeating the Grafted Scion boss at the Chapel of Anticipation (accessible via a waygate at the Four Belfries).

fields.name: Golden Epitaph
fields.description:
A sword made to commemorate the death of Godwyn the Golden, first of the demigods to die.

Infused with the humble prayer of a young boy; "O brother, lord brother, please die a true death."
fields.location: Found in a locked room in the Auriza Hero’s Grave, east of Leyndell. Requires a Stonesword Key.

fields.name: Nox Flowing Sword
fields.description:
A grim weapon wielded by swordsmen of the Eternal City, this shotel has a blade as fine as a needle.

Forged from the liquid metal of a Silver Tear, it is thoroughly tempered until hardened.
fields.location: Dropped by the Nox Swordstress & Nox Priest boss duo in the Nokron, Eternal City.

fields.name: Inseparable Sword
fields.description:
Sword forged by compounding silver and gold.
A sacred weapon to hunt Those Who Live in Death.
Deals holy damage. 

The inseparable twins found solace in the Golden Order, the only institution not to revile them as accursed beings.
fields.location: Dropped by D, Hunter of the Dead, after certain events at the Roundtable Hold. Defeat him or progress his questline to receive the sword.

fields.name: Coded Sword
fields.description: Hidden sword once granted to the Tarnished of the Roundtable by the Two Fingers. A formless cipher comprises its blade, which deals holy damage no shield can repel. Champions would gather at the Roundtable Hold in days long past, when the Two Fingers were masters of oration, their flesh yet full of vigor.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital, inside the Fortified Manor. Enter through a window on the western side.

fields.name: Sword of Night and Flame
fields.description:
Storied sword and treasure of Caria Manor.
One of the legendary armaments.

Astrologers, who preceded the sorcerers, established themselves in mountaintops that nearly touched the sky, and considered the Fire Giants their neighbors.
fields.location: Found in Caria Manor (Liurnia). Drop down from the rooftops to a locked room in the southeast section of the manor.

fields.name: Crystal Sword
fields.description: Sword fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence. The inscrutable Crystalians have but one clear purpose; to safeguard their crystals unto the end. One theory posits that they yearn for the return of their creator who will carve for them new brethren.
fields.location:
Found on a corpse in the Village of the Albinaurics in southern Liurnia.
On a corpse in the Village of the Albinaurics, Liurnia.

fields.name: Carian Knight's Sword
fields.description:
Straight sword embedded with a blue glintstone.
Weapon of knights sworn to Carian royalty.

These knights' swords could serve as catalysts, letting them wield sorcerous battle skills. Despite numbering fewer than twenty, this power made them a match for even the champions of gold in battle.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in a carriage along the road west of the Four Belfries in Liurnia of the Lakes.

fields.name: Sword of St. Trina
fields.description:
Silver sword carried by clerics of St. Trina.
Inflicts sleep ailment upon foes.

St. Trina is an enigmatic figure. Some say she is a comely young girl, others are sure he is a boy. The only certainty is that their appearance was as sudden as their disappearance.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the Forsaken Ruins in Caelid, requires a Stonesword Key to access.

fields.name: Miquellan Knight's Sword
fields.description:
Sword forged by servants of Miquella of the Haligtree, with a design modeled after those carried by Carian knights. Instead of glintstone however, amber from the Haligtree is embedded in the blade.

A sumptuous piece, yet it has never been offered to any knight—an ill-starred sword with no master.
fields.location: Found in Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree, in a chest behind a group of enemies.

fields.name: Cane Sword
fields.description:
Beloved sword of an aged knight whose last quest was long behind him, repurposed into a walking stick. The tip is rather worn.

Though bent of back and without the brawn required even to raise the sword aloft, still he wished to meet his end with weapon in hand.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the graveyard area of the Rampart Tower section of Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Regalia of Eochaid
fields.description:
Treasured sword of Eochaid, a lesser, long-vanished domain.
The copper coloration is not to be confused for rust, but is a conduit for its wielder to move it by their will alone.

Swords of Eochaid dance through the skies.
fields.location: Found on an altar in the Gaol Cave in western Caelid, behind a boss door.

fields.name: Noble's Slender Sword
fields.description:
Narrow blade carried by wandering nobles.
Made to be easy to wield.

Daubed with gold from tip to tail, it should fetch a good sum.
fields.location: Rare drop from Wandering Nobles, most commonly found in the Altus Plateau region.

fields.name: Warhawk's Talon
fields.description:
Talon-swords are affixed to the legs of Stormveil's warhawks, but this one has been repurposed for human use.

The blade is thin and lightweight so as not to obstruct the hawk's mobility.
fields.location: Dropped by Warhawk enemies in Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Lazuli Glintstone Sword
fields.description:
A sword with a glintstone in its handguards. Wielded by scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus who seek to master Carian sorcery.
Deals magic damage.

Apparently once used as a staff of sorcery, this sword is made of wood.
fields.location: Dropped by Lazuli Sorcerers wielding this sword in Raya Lucaria Academy, Liurnia of the Lakes. The most reliable drop is from the sorcerer found on the rooftops above the Church of the Cuckoo, accessible after progressing through the academy and using the broken rooftops route.

fields.name: Rotten Crystal Sword
fields.description:
Sword fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human.
It festers with scarlet rot.

Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence.
fields.location: Found in Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree. From the Elphael Inner Wall site of grace, head down the stairs and look to your left for a pile of rubble. Climb over the rubble to reach a small area guarded by three Lesser Crystalians. The sword is inside a chest behind them.

fields.name: Bastard Sword
fields.description:
A large sword with a straight blade. This heavy sword is usually wielded with two hands, but for those with enough strength, one is sufficient.

The hefty blade can be swung into multiple foes
at once thanks to the broad, sweeping attack,
making fending off crowds all the easier.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The sword is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Forked Greatsword
fields.description:
Oddly shaped greatsword wielded by imps.

The gently undulating forked blade is known as an "imp's tongue" and causes blood loss.
fields.location: Dropped by Omens in Leyndell, Royal Capital. Defeat these enemies for a chance to obtain the greatsword.

fields.name: Iron Greatsword
fields.description:
Greatsword with a blade of unusually thick steel.
A coarse weapon to which polishing is a foreign concept.

Weighty even among others of its class, the impact of each strike is sure to be felt.
fields.location: Dropped by Iron Virgins at Volcano Manor and other locations. Defeat these enemies for a chance to obtain the greatsword.

fields.name: Lordsworn's Greatsword
fields.description:
Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious
design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army.

Though blackened and damaged by years of use, it appears to have otherwise been kept in a serviceable condition, despite the soldiers having long since lost their minds.
fields.location: Found in the Gatefront Ruins, Limgrave. From the site of grace, search the area for a chest containing the sword.

fields.name: Knight's Greatsword
fields.description:
Greatsword bestowed upon skilled swordsmen in the demigods' service, and yet had no rank or title.

Featuring a long grip enabling dual-handed use, this weapon was designed to dispatch larger foes. Being charged with such a duty was undoubtedly a great honor.
fields.location: Dropped by various knight enemies throughout Limgrave and Liurnia. Defeat them for a chance to obtain the sword.

fields.name: Flamberge
fields.description:
Greatsword featuring a flame-like undulation.
Shreds enemy flesh, inducing blood loss.

Scarlet rot is kept at bay with flame at Redmane Castle, and as such, this beloved sword of Jerren's eventually became the symbol of the castle itself.
fields.location: Found in Redmane Castle, Caelid. From the Chamber Outside the Plaza site of grace, explore the castle’s interior and look for a chest in a side room.

fields.name: Ordovis's Greatsword
fields.description:
Greatsword of Ordovis, one of the two honored as foremost among the Crucible Knights.

This sword is imbued with an ancient holy essence.
Its red tint exemplifies the nature of primordial gold, said to be close in nature to life itself.
fields.location: Dropped by Crucible Knight Ordovis in the Auriza Hero’s Grave, Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Alabaster Lord's Sword
fields.description:
Greatsword forged from a blue-white meteoric ore.
The blade conceals gravity-manipulating magic.

A weapon unique to the Alabaster Lords, a race of ancients with skin of stone who were said to have risen to life when a meteor struck long ago.
fields.location: Found in the Yelough Anix Tunnel in the Consecrated Snowfield. Navigate the tunnel until you encounter the Alabaster Lord boss. Defeat him to receive the sword. Alternatively, another can be obtained in the Lake of Rot by defeating a similar enemy.

fields.name: Banished Knight's Greatsword
fields.description:
A finely-crafted greatsword intricately engraved with an ancient motif.
Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.
fields.location: Dropped by Banished Knight enemies found in Stormveil Castle and Castle Sol. Defeat these knights for a chance to obtain their greatsword.

fields.name: Dark Moon Greatsword
fields.description:
A Moon Greatsword, bestowed by a Carian queen upon her spouse to honor long-standing tradition.
One of the legendary armaments.

Ranni's sigil is a full moon, cold and leaden, and this sword is but a beam of its light.
fields.location: Obtained by completing Ranni’s questline. After finishing her quest, the sword is given to you as a reward.

fields.name: Sacred Relic Sword
fields.description:
Sword wrought from the remains of a god who should have lived a life eternal.

Thoughts on what the weapon portends are many and varied. Some consider it the mark of a great sin, or a sign of great devastation. Some think it as the end of an age, while others; the beginning.
fields.location: Dropped by the final boss, Elden Beast. After the boss fight, the sword is available for purchase at the Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold.

fields.name: Helphen's Steeple
fields.description:
Greatsword patterned after the black steeple of the Helphen, the lampwood which guides the dead of the spirit world.

The lamplight is similar to grace in appearance, only it is said that it can only be seen by those who met their death in battle.
fields.location: Dropped by the Tibia Mariner boss in the Mountaintops of the Giants, near the Snow Valley Ruins Overlook site of grace.

fields.name: Blasphemous Blade
fields.description:
Sacred sword of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy.
Remains of the countless heroes he has devoured writhe upon the surface of this blade.

Now they share the same blood, bound together as family.
Some HP is restored upon defeating an enemy.
fields.effects: Recover a portion of HP upon defeating enemies; Weapon Skill dea
fields.location: Dropped by defeating Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy, in Mt. Gelmir. After the boss fight, the sword is available for purchase at the Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold.

fields.name: Marais Executioner's Sword
fields.description:
Storied sword of House Marais, the family of executioners who presided over the Shaded Castle.
One of the legendary armaments.

Elemer of the Briar, the Bell Bearing Hunter, snatched the sword from the site of his looming execution, and furnished it with battle skills from his home of Eochaid.
fields.location: Found in the Shaded Castle, Altus Plateau. From the Shaded Castle Inner Gate site of grace, proceed through the castle and look for a chest in a side room.

fields.name: Sword of Milos
fields.description:
Sinister greatsword fashioned from a giant's backbone.
Metes out wounds like a lopsided saw-blade, and restores some FP upon defeating an enemy.

Milos was undersized for a giant, and was viewed as sullied and terribly grotesque.
fields.location: Dropped by Dung Eater after defeating him in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds under Leyndell.

fields.name: Golden Order Greatsword
fields.description:
Greatsword made of light, modeled after the Elden Ring itself. Forged by King Consort Radagon to proudly
symbolize the tenets of the Golden Order.
One of the legendary armaments.

Telltale signs betray that this was once the greatsword bequeathed to him by his first wife, Rennala.
fields.location: Dropped by the Misbegotten Crusader boss in the Cave of the Forlorn, Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Claymore
fields.description:
A large sword with a long, straight blade. This heavy sword is usually wielded with two hands, but for those with enough strength, one is sufficient.

In addition to the heavy sweeping attacks, it can also make a heavy piercing thrust, making this a versatile weapon.
fields.location: Found in Castle Morne, Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, proceed through the castle and look for a chest in a tower guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Gargoyle's Greatsword
fields.description:
Bronze greatsword wielded by Valiant Gargoyles.

Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.
fields.location: Dropped by the Valiant Gargoyle boss in Nokron, Eternal City.

fields.name: Death's Poker
fields.description:
Barbed rod carried by Deathbirds.

The birds are graveyard fire keepers; it is said they rake out the ashen remains of the dead from their kilns.
fields.location: Dropped by the Death Rite Bird boss in the Mountaintops of the Giants, near the Snow Valley Ruins Overlook site of grace.

fields.name: Gargoyle's Blackblade
fields.description:
Bronze greatsword wielded by Valiant Gargoyles, mended with blackened corpse wax.
Deals holy damage.

Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.
fields.location: Dropped by the Black Blade Kindred boss in Caelid or in front of the Bestial Sanctum.

fields.name: Greatsword
fields.description:
A coarse iron lump of an ultra greatsword.
Mows down foes by utilizing its incredible weight.

Though handling it likely requires the wielder to have surpassed the realm of the merely human, it is precisely for this reason the weapon is used to slaughter even inhuman foes.
fields.location: Found in a chest on a carriage in western Caelid, along the road northwest of Caelem Ruins, guarded by large dogs.

fields.name: Watchdog's Greatsword
fields.description:
Stone greatsword wielded by Erdtree Burial Watchdogs.

Though decorated with the watchman's eye, the pupil was taken by graverobbers and is now hollow, leaving this sword a mere lump of stone.
fields.location: Dropped by sword-wielding Burial Watchdog enemies in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Maliketh's Black Blade
fields.description:
Maliketh's black blade which once harbored the power of the Rune of Death. A sad shadow of its former glory.

After a fragment of Death was stolen on that fateful night, Maliketh bound the blade within his own flesh, such that none might ever rob Death again.
fields.location: Exchanged for the Remembrance of the Black Blade with Enia at Roundtable Hold after defeating Maliketh, the Black Blade in Crumbling Farum Azula.

fields.name: Troll's Golden Sword
fields.description:
Sword given to the lesser giants who fought for the Erdtree during the War against the Giants long ago.

Though they have lost their minds, they stay inseparable from their swords that are in sad shape—such that the gold plating had flaked away.
fields.location: Found in a chest on a black carriage in Altus Plateau, east of the Erdtree-Gazing Hill site of grace.

fields.name: Zweihander
fields.description:
Just about the largest sword a mere man is capable of swinging.
True to its name, it is designed to be wielded in both hands, but those of merely ordinary strength will still struggle to do so.

The long blade is heavy and sharp, sending foes reeling back with its broader strokes, while also capable of a devastating piercing thrust.
fields.location: Sold by the Isolated Merchant in the Weeping Peninsula for 3,500 runes.

fields.name: Starscourge Greatsword
fields.description:
Curved greatswords of black steel wielded by General Radahn.
A pair of weapons decorated with a lion mane motif.

Radahn earned considerable renown as the Starscourge in his youth, and it is said that it was during this time he engraved the gravity crest upon these blades.
fields.location: Exchanged for the Remembrance of the Starscourge with Enia at Roundtable Hold after defeating Starscourge Radahn in Redmane Castle.

fields.name: Royal Greatsword
fields.description:
Greatsword decorated in royal Carian style.
Favored weapon of Blaidd the Half-Wolf.

In defiance of the fate he was born to, Blaidd swore to serve no master but Ranni. As proof, the sword was imbued with a cold magic at the moment the oath was sworn.
fields.location: Dropped by Blaidd after completing Ranni’s questline and defeating him outside Ranni’s Rise in Liurnia.

fields.name: Godslayer's Greatsword
fields.description:
Sacred sword of the Gloam-Eyed Queen who controlled the Godskin Apostles before her defeat at the hands of Maliketh.

The black flames wielded by the apostles are channeled from this sword.
fields.location: Found in a chest behind the Godskin Apostle boss in the Divine Tower of Caelid.

fields.name: Ruins Greatsword
fields.description:
Originally rubble from a ruin which fell from the sky, this surviving fragment was honed into a weapon.
One of the legendary armaments.

The ruin it came from crumbled when struck by a meteorite, as such this weapon harbors its destructive power.
fields.location: Reward for defeating the duo boss fight (Misbegotten Warrior and Crucible Knight) at Redmane Castle Plaza, after the Radahn Festival or before it starts

fields.name: Grafted Blade Greatsword
fields.description:
The storied sword of Castle Morne. A revenger's weapon, it is burdened with oceans of anger and regret.
One of the legendary armaments.

A lone surviving champion from a country now vanished was so determined to continue fighting that he claimed the swords of an entire clan of warriors.
fields.location: Dropped by the Leonine Misbegotten boss at the end of Castle Morne, on the Weeping Peninsula

fields.name: Troll Knight's Sword
fields.description:
Greatsword embedded with a blue glintstone.
Weapon of the trolls in service to the royal family of Caria. Called into service when the Queen invoked an oath they swore, the trolls are treated as true knights of Caria, and fight arm in arm with their human comrades.
fields.location: Random drop from the Troll Knight enemy in Caria Manor, in the northwest section of Liurnia of the Lakes.

fields.name: Estoc
fields.description:
Large piercing sword with a long, hard bladed edge which is also capable of slashing attacks.

For its large size, it can be wielded rather nimbly, leaving little opportunity for the enemy to counter.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The sword is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Cleanrot Knight's Sword
fields.description:
Piercing sword of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Mainly used as a backup weapon, in combination with a long-handled armament.
fields.location: Dropped by Cleanrot Knight enemies found in Caelid and the Shaded Castle. Defeat these knights for a chance to obtain the sword.

fields.name: Rapier
fields.description:
A piercing sword with a sharp, slender blade.
In addition to this weapon's thrusting attack prowess, it also boasts the ability to be used while guarding with a shield.

As one of the smaller piercing swords, quick successive thrusts are easy to perform, but without a cutting edge, it cannot be used for slashing attacks.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The rapier is on a corpse in one of these chambers.

fields.name: Rogier's Rapier
fields.description:
Piercing sword of superior quality, featuring intricate ornamentation.
Signature weapon of the sorcerer Rogier.

High dexterity is required to wield the blade to its full potential, but mastery is a sight to behold, characterized by a flowing style which excels in successive attacks.
fields.location: Given by Sorcerer Rogier after progressing his questline at the Roundtable Hold.

fields.name: Antspur Rapier
fields.description:
Spur of a giant ant which has been fashioned into a rapier. The blade drips with scarlet rot.

Scarlet rot is an old legend, of which Maleigh Marais of the Shaded Castle was a private believer. And indeed, he eventually found his own personal goddess.
fields.location: Dropped by the Cleanrot Knight invader in the Shaded Castle, Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Frozen Needle
fields.description:
A razor-thin piercing blade of ice.
Forged by Iji, the Carian Royal Blacksmith.

Can inflict frost upon enemies, and launch its blade with a strong attack. The blade immediately regenerates.
fields.location: Found in the Cave of the Forlorn, Mountaintops of the Giants. From the site of grace, proceed through the cave and look for a chest containing the needle.

fields.name: Noble's Estoc
fields.description:
Estoc carried by wandering nobles.
Made to be easy to wield.

Daubed with gold from tip to tail, it should fetch a good sum.
fields.location: Dropped by Nobles in Leyndell, Royal Capital. Defeat these enemies for a chance to obtain the estoc.

fields.name: Bloody Helice
fields.description:
Ominous piercing sword with a winding blade.
Carried by the noble servants of the Lord of Blood.

Designed to bore into flesh, causing severe blood loss at the wound. The extracted blood trickles gracefully down the length of the blade.
fields.location: Looted from a chest in the Writheblood Ruins dungeon, Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Godskin Stitcher
fields.description:
Elegant piercing sword with a celadon colored blade wielded by Godskin Nobles.

The nobles possess skill with the sword unmatched by any lowborn. Despite its size, successive attacks from this weapon are swifter than the eye can follow.
fields.location: Dropped by Godskin Nobles, most reliably found in Volcano Manor’s Temple of Eiglay.

fields.name: Great Épée
fields.description:
Large rapier featuring a thin, sharp blade.
Commonly used in life or death duels.

Like its smaller counterparts, it is made for thrusting attacks, and can be used while guarding with a shield.
fields.location: Found in a chest on a carriage northwest of the Writheblood Ruins in Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Dragon King's Cragblade
fields.description:
Piercing Gravel Stone sword containing primeval lightning.
A portion of the Dragonlord's power, gained from a remembrance.

This weapon commands great power over the paltry, mortal dragons of today.
fields.location: Crafted using the Remembrance of the Dragonlord after defeating Placidusax in Crumbling Farum Azula.

fields.name: Falchion
fields.description:
A curved sword with a single-sided blade.
Delivers slashing attacks with its sharp blade, but is ineffective against thick armor and hides covered in tough scales.

Wielders of the weapon employ a unique style that enhances attacks with spinning motions.
fields.location: Dropped by skeletal enemies in the Sage’s Cave, located in the Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Beastman's Curved Sword
fields.description:
Curved sword forged of dull iron wielded by the beastmen of Farum Azula.

The blade is heavy but well-balanced. Comparatively easy to wield for the damage it delivers.
fields.location: Dropped by Beastman enemies in the Dragonbarrow region, especially in the cave north of the Third Church of Marika.

fields.name: Shotel
fields.description:
Curved sword with a severely hooked blade. Its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard.

Made to hunt down humans, this weapon requires high dexterity to wield effectively.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Lake of Rot, on a raised platform near the shore.

fields.name: Shamshir
fields.description:
Curved sword with a thin blade of ample length.
Light of weight despite its larger size, its slicing attacks come in rapid succession.

A devastatingly powerful weapon in the hands of a skilled swordsman.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the southern section of the Caelid region, inside the Gaol Cave.

fields.name: Bandit's Curved Sword
fields.description:
Curved sword with a light, crescent-shaped blade.
Used by the bandits who ran rampant in the wake of the Shattering.

Most of the blade is now darkened and covered in rust, but with enough dexterity this weapon may still stand up to some use.
fields.location: Description: {{ item.description }}

fields.name: Magma Blade
fields.description:
Curved sword with a blade fashioned from the lava of Mt. Gelmir.
An armament of the man-serpents, impossible for a human to have made.

Deals fire damage.
fields.location: Rare drop from Man-Serpent enemies wielding this weapon in Volcano Manor.

fields.name: Flowing Curved Sword
fields.description:
Legends speak of a master of the sword garbed in blue, and his curved blade that was patterned after flowing water.

Strong attack unleashes a series of strikes akin to a dance, offering a glimpse into the legend.
fields.location: Dropped by the Godskin Noble boss in the Spiritcaller Cave in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Wing of Astel
fields.description:
Sword fashioned from a delicate wing, suffused with the magic of the stars.
Strong attack unleashes a wave of enchanted light.

Crafted from a relic of the Naturalborn of the Void who is said to have assailed the Eternal City.
fields.location: Found on a floating ruin in the upper section of the Uhl Palace Ruins, Ainsel River.

fields.name: Scavenger's Curved Sword
fields.description:
Unique curved sword, notched like shark's teeth.
Weapon carried by corpse pillagers who prowl the sites of old battles.

The blade is tacky with blood and covered in hefty nicks, making it totally uneven. Life can be sinister indeed.
fields.location: Found on a corpse atop a collapsed bridge in Mt. Gelmir, west of the First Mt. Gelmir Campsite site of grace.

fields.name: Eclipse Shotel
fields.description:
Storied sword and treasure of Castle Sol that depicts an eclipsed sun drained of color.
One of the legendary armaments.

In Sol, the sight of an eclipse inspires a dreadful awe, preventing an onlooker from averting his gaze.
fields.location: Found in Castle Sol, on an altar in the church at the north end of the castle.

fields.name: Serpent-God's Curved Sword
fields.description:
Curved sword fashioned in the image of an ancient serpent deity and tool of a forgotten religion practiced on Mt. Gelmir.

Formerly used to offer up sacrifices, this sword restores HP upon slaying an enemy.
fields.location: Found on a corpse atop the ruins at the very end of the Ruin-Strewn Precipice, near the Magma Wyrm boss arena.

fields.name: Mantis Blade
fields.description:
A curved sword with a blade at both ends wielded by the Cemetery Shades, the insect-ridden grave keepers.

The blade is thin and sharp, and strong attack unleashes a far-reaching slash.
fields.location: Found on a corpse on a balcony in the Gelmir Hero’s Grave dungeon, Mt. Gelmir.

fields.name: Scimitar
fields.description:
A curved sword with a single-sided blade.
Delivers slashing attacks with its sharp blade, but is ineffective against thick armor and hides covered in tough scales.

Smaller in size than most curved swords, it carves into enemies with quick, sharp cuts.
fields.location: Starting weapon for the Warrior class, or dropped by skeletons wielding it in Limgrave.

fields.name: Grossmesser
fields.description:
Curved sword boasting a large blade.
This weapon is designed to make use of its weight in combination with its sharp cutting edge.

A thoroughly reliable choice of weapon for those who can master its particulars.
fields.location: Dropped by Banished Knight enemies in Castle Sol, Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Onyx Lord's Greatsword
fields.description:
Greatsword forged from golden-hued meteoric ore.
The blade conceals gravity-manipulating magic.

A weapon unique to the Onyx Lords, a race of ancients with skin of stone who were said to have risen to life when a meteor struck long ago.
fields.location: Dropped by the Onyx Lord boss found at the end of the Sealed Tunnel dungeon, which is located just west of the Leyndell entrance in the Altus Plateau region.

fields.name: Dismounter
fields.description:
This curved greatsword wielded by the brawny sellswords of Kaiden combines the blade of a scimitar with the heft of a hatchet.

A difficult to handle weapon that demands much of the wielder's strength and dexterity, but with practice and ability, it can serve as a versatile weapon even on horseback.
fields.location: Dropped by Kaiden Sellswords in Limgrave. The largest concentration is at the Kaiden camp southwest of the Murkwater Coast site of grace. Additional Kaiden Sellswords can be found patrolling near Agheel Lake North and west of the Warmaster’s Shack. This weapon is a random drop, so you may need to defeat several Sellswords to obtain it.

fields.name: Bloodhound's Fang
fields.description:
Curved greatsword with a gently undulating blade wielded by Bloodhound Knights.

A fearsome blade capable of brutal airborne attacks.
fields.location: Defeat Bloodhound Knight Darriwil in the Forlorn Hound Evergaol, located in southern Limgrave. The weapon is awarded immediately after the fight.

fields.name: Magma Wyrm's Scalesword
fields.description:
Curved greatsword wielded by Magma Wyrms. The shape resembles a dragon's jaw and is covered in hard scales.

It's said these land-bound dragons were once human heroes who partook in dragon communion, a grave transgression for which they were cursed to crawl the earth upon their bellies, shadows of their former selves.
fields.location: Dropped by the Magma Wyrm Makar boss, found in the Ruin-Strewn Precipice in northern Liurnia of the Lakes.

fields.name: Zamor Curved Sword
fields.description:
Weapon wielded by the knights of Zamor who earned great renown during the War against the Giants.

In apparent devotion to winter, the curved blade is styled after an icy wind and imbued with a powerful frost effect.
fields.location: Dropped by the Ancient Hero of Zamor boss at the end of the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Omen Cleaver
fields.description:
Heavy-bladed curved sword of colossal size awarded to Omen as a tool of war. This weapon is made to take advantage of brute strength.

The pattern etched upon the blade is the remnant of a deteriorative malediction. Indeed, when bestowing a weapon, preparations must be made for taking it away.
fields.location: Dropped by Omen enemies wielding this weapon; commonly found in the Village of the Albinaurics and the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds beneath Leyndell.

fields.name: Monk's Flameblade
fields.description:
Curved sword with a flickering flame motif.
Wielded by the Fire Monks who came from the Mountaintops of the Giants.

The monks came to the land of Liurnia in pursuit of a fugitive who stole their fire.
fields.location: Dropped by the hostile NPC “Fire Monk Mok” found in the Consecrated Snowfield, near the inner Consecrated Snowfield site of grace.

fields.name: Beastman's Cleaver
fields.description:
Curved greatsword of colossal size forged of dull iron and wielded by the beastmen of Farum Azula.

The blade is incredibly heavy, but well-balanced. Comparatively easy to wield for the damage it delivers. It's clear the beastmen possess knowledge beyond human ken.
fields.location: Dropped by Beastman enemies wielding this weapon in the Dragonbarrow region, particularly in the cave north of the Third Church of Marika.

fields.name: Morgott's Cursed Sword
fields.description:
Warped blade of shifting hue used by Morgott, the Omen King.

The accursed blood that Morgott recanted and sealed away reformed into this blade.
fields.location: Exchanged with Finger Reader Enia at the Roundtable Hold for the Remembrance of the Omen King, which you receive after defeating Morgott, the Omen King in Leyndell, Royal Capital.

fields.name: Uchigatana
fields.description:
A katana with a long single-edged curved blade.
A unique weapon wielded by the samurai from the Land of Reeds.

The blade, with its undulating design, boasts extraordinary sharpness, and its slash attacks cause blood loss.
fields.location: Starting weapon for Samurai class. Otherwise, found in Deathtouched Catacombs (Limgrave), on a corpse behind a hidden door near the first stairs13.

fields.name: Nagakiba
fields.description:
Katana with a ferociously long blade.
Signature weapon of Yura, hunter of Bloody Fingers.

Reminiscent of a reinforced spear, its imposing length can be put to good use with powerful thrusting attacks.
fields.location: Dropped by Bloody Finger Hunter Yura (either by completing his questline or defeating him), or found at his camp east of the Agheel Lake, after his quest ends35.

fields.name: Hand of Malenia
fields.description:
Blade built into Malenia's prosthetic arm.
Through consecration it is resistant to rot.

Malenia's war prosthesis symbolized her victories.
Some claim to have seen wings when the weapon was raised aloft; wings of fierce determination that have never known defeat.
fields.location: Obtained by trading the Remembrance of the Rot Goddess (from defeating Malenia, Blade of Miquella in Elphael, Haligtree) with Enia at Roundtable Hold3.

fields.name: Meteoric Ore Blade
fields.description:
Katana forged from meteoric ore to dispatch lifeforms born of falling stars.
Deals magic damage.

The blade is weighty, known to deliver slashes of such ferocity that the impact is said to resemble the crash of a falling meteor.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the ruins of Caelid Waypoint Ruins (Caelid), guarded by Servants of Rot15.

fields.name: Rivers of Blood
fields.description:
Weapon of Okina, swordsman from the Land of Reeds.
A cursed weapon that has felled countless men.

When Mohg, the Lord of Blood, first felt Okina's sword, and madness, upon his flesh, he had a proposal, to offer Okina the life of a demon, whose thirst would never go unsated.
fields.location: Dropped by Bloody Finger Okina, who invades at the Church of Repose in Mountaintops of the Giants3.

fields.name: Moonveil
fields.description:
Katana forged of glintstone.
Masterpiece of a Sellian swordsmith.

Light enwreathes the blade when sheathed, explaining its Moonveil moniker.
fields.location: Dropped by the Magma Wyrm boss in Gael Tunnel, on the border of Caelid and Limgrave3.

fields.name: Dragonscale Blade
fields.description:
A weapon made by sharpening a Gravel Stone scale, thought to be the source of ancient dragon immortality, into an unclouded blade.

Alas, the Dragonkin Soldiers never attained immortality, and perished as decrepit, pale imitations of their skyborn kin.
fields.location: Dropped by the Dragonkin Soldier boss in Lake of Rot3.

fields.name: Serpentbone Blade
fields.description:
Sinister katana modeled after a serpent bone.

The densely packed row of spines that jut away from the cutting edge are coated in a lethal poison.
fields.location: Reward from completing the Volcano Manor assassination questline for Tanith3.

fields.name: Twinblade
fields.description:
A sword with blades on both sides of the hilt.
This weapon is difficult to wield and demands high dexterity.

Can be wielded with a single hand, but its true strength is unlocked with dual-handed spinning attacks.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the underground cellar at the Dragon-Burnt Ruins, West Limgrave. Look for a walled-off area on the north side of the ruins and drop down into the cellar to find the chest.

fields.name: Godskin Peeler
fields.description:
Unique twinblade wielded by Godskin Apostles characterized by its disturbing design. One end features a sickle for slicing attacks while the other boasts a winding spike for boring into flesh.

Much skill is required to wield this weapon due to its asymmetric nature.
fields.location: Dropped by the Godskin Apostle boss at the Windmill Village in the Altus Plateau. Defeat the boss at the top of the village to obtain this weapon.

fields.name: Twinned Knight Swords
fields.description:
An attractive twinblade of fine make that prizes the chivalric way.

Can be wielded with a single hand, but its true strength is unlocked with dual-handed spinning attacks.
fields.location: Found in a chest on a carriage in the eastern section of the Altus Plateau, along the main road leading north from the Altus Highway Junction site of grace.

fields.name: Eleonora's Poleblade
fields.description:
Twinned naginata forged in the Land of Reeds.
Chosen weapon of Eleonora, Violet Bloody Finger.

Her mastery of the sword was such that her onslaught was likened to a whirlwind, but now her legacy is stained by accursed blood.
fields.location: Dropped by Eleonora, Violet Bloody Finger, who invades at the Second Church of Marika in Altus Plateau. She appears after progressing Yura’s questline.

fields.name: Gargoyle's Twinblade
fields.description:
Bronze twinblade wielded by Valiant Gargoyles.

Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.
fields.location: Dropped by the Valiant Gargoyle duo boss in Siofra Aqueduct, beneath Nokron, Eternal City. The boss fight is accessed via the aqueducts after defeating Radahn.

fields.name: Gargoyle's Black Blades
fields.description:
Bronze twinblade wielded by Valiant Gargoyles, mended with blackened corpse wax.
Deals holy damage.

Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.
fields.location: Dropped by the Black Blade Kindred boss near the entrance to the Mountaintops of the Giants, just outside the Grand Lift of Rold.

fields.name: Mace
fields.description:
An iron bludgeon with sharp protrusions.

Striking attacks have few drawbacks, potent as they are at breaking through guards and stances. Most suited to head on slugging matches.
fields.location: Starting weapon for the Confessor class. Also sold by the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold after giving them the appropriate bell bearing.

fields.name: Club
fields.description:
A thick, solid lump of wood.
Wielding this striking weapon requires no skill.

A simple, primitive weapon that requires only brute strength and persistence to hammer your foe into the ground.
fields.location: Starting weapon for the Wretch class. Can also be purchased from the Nomadic Merchant in East Limgrave.

fields.name: Curved Club
fields.description:
Hard, curved club, shaped like a crescent moon.

Wielded instead of a curved sword by Albinaurics lacking dexterity. The only point of similarity between the two is the shape.
fields.location: Dropped by demi-human enemies wielding this weapon, especially in the Weeping Peninsula and Liurnia.

fields.name: Warpick
fields.description:
Battle hammer with a hard protruding beak.
A pickaxe designed for combat, in essence.

A simple but highly effective weapon, the weighty piercing attack casually rips through metal armor.
fields.location: Dropped by Miner enemies in tunnels such as Limgrave Tunnels and Raya Lucaria Crystal Tunnel.

fields.name: Morning Star
fields.description:
Battle hammer comprised of a globe attached to a handle. Though a bludgeon dealing strike damage, the appellative star is covered in spikes which cause blood loss.

Ironic given its graceful name, this weapon often reeks of blood.
fields.location: Found in a chest on a carriage along the road south of the Limgrave Bridge of Sacrifice, near the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Varré's Bouquet
fields.description:
A steel mace resembling a charming bouquet of roses. Each petal has a sharpened edge, leaving the roses perpetually colored with blood.

This weapon reflects White Mask Varré's manner of speech rather well, enticing in its splendor, but full of deadly consequence.
fields.location: Reward for completing White-Faced Varre’s questline, received after defeating him at Mohgwyn Palace.

fields.name: Spiked Club
fields.description:
A club with beast fangs wrapped around the striking end. The uneven spread of fangs causes blood loss.

Given only to the toughest of demi-humans, this weapon is a badge of honor. Or so the demi-humans believe.
fields.location: Dropped by demi-human chiefs, most commonly in the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Hammer
fields.description:
Hammer comprised of a large stone affixed to a metal handle. Originally a blacksmith's tool.

The art of smithing is said to have originated among the giants. This weapon's striking attacks boast ample weight behind them.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital, inside the Fortified Manor. Look for it beside the smith’s anvil, in the area that mirrors the Roundtable Hold.

fields.name: Monk's Flamemace
fields.description:
Battle hammer made to resemble flickering flames. Signature weapon of the Fire Monks, who hail from the Mountaintops of the Giants.

The unique strong attack rouses fiery combative spirit.
fields.location: Dropped by Flame Monk enemies wielding this weapon, most commonly found in the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave and the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Envoy's Horn
fields.description:
Golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt.

Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.
fields.location: Dropped by smaller Oracle Envoy enemies in Leyndell, Royal Capital and Miquella’s Haligtree.

fields.name: Scepter of the All-Knowing
fields.description: Scepter in the form of a hand grasping a pearl. Signature weapon of Sir Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. The pearl stands for the world, the heavens, and an eye, representing the many forms of knowledge, never fully attainable. Even knowing that, the All-Knowing's hand grasps for it.
fields.location: Dropped by Sir Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing, near the end of the main story in Leyndell, Ashen Capital.

fields.name: Nox Flowing Hammer
fields.description:
Mace shaped like a suspended metal droplet wielded by monks of the Eternal City.

Forged from liquid metal from a Silver Tear, it is thoroughly tempered until hardened.
fields.location: Dropped by the Nox Swordstress & Nox Priest boss duo in Nokstella, Eternal City.

fields.name: Ringed Finger
fields.description:
Bludgeon made of an enormous finger sheathed in several heavy rings. Thought to have been cut from an ancestor of the Fingercreeper.

Some life yet remains in this legacy of an ancient act of blasphemy, as evidenced by the barely perceptible warmth it still exudes.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the lower section of the Shaded Castle, northwest Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Stone Club
fields.description:
Signature weapon of battlemages, hewn from hard glintstone. This club is much heavier than its size suggests, but has no magic power.

So that they not lose sight of the true essence of combat, battlemages prefer to feel the impact of their blows, fighting their opponents hand to hand.
fields.location: Dropped by larger demi-human enemies in the Altus Plateau and Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Marika's Hammer
fields.description:
Stone hammer made in the lands of the Numen, outside the Lands Between. The tool with which Queen Marika shattered the Elden Ring and Radagon attempted to repair it.

The hammer partially broke upon shattering the Ring, becoming splintered with rune fragments.
fields.location: Exchanged for the Elden Remembrance with Enia at Roundtable Hold after defeating the final boss.

fields.name: Large Club
fields.description:
A thick, solid lump of wood.
Wielding this striking weapon requires no skill.

A simple, primitive weapon that requires only brute strength to swing about.
fields.location: Dropped by club-wielding ogres in the Weeping Peninsula and Limgrave.

fields.name: Greathorn Hammer
fields.description:
Huge thick horn carved with tree ring-like markings adapted into a bludgeoning weapon. Wielded by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancient horn is imbued with the power of ancestral spirits. A small amount of HP is restored upon defeating an enemy.
fields.location: Dropped by Ancestral Follower enemies in Nokron, Eternal City.

fields.name: Battle Hammer
fields.description:
Large iron great hammer designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.

Weighty enough to crush armor and its wearer alike.
fields.location: Dropped by the chariot boss in the Fringefolk Hero’s Grave, just past the starting area in Limgrave.

fields.name: Great Mace
fields.description:
Huge bludgeon with sharp protrusions. An enlarged version of its smaller cousin.

Maintains all the advantages of smaller bludgeons, boasting few deficiencies while being very capable at breaking enemy guards and stances. A shrewd choice for simple slugging matches.
fields.location: Dropped by the knight riding the horse in the Altus Plateau, patrolling the main road.

fields.name: Curved Great Club
fields.description:
Large curved club of hard wood, shaped like a crescent moon.

Wielded by Albinaurics lacking the dexterity demanded by a curved sword, and who prefer the added weight and destructive force.
fields.location: The Curved Great Club can be obtained by defeating large Albinauric enemies found in the watery regions of Liurnia of the Lakes. These particular Albinaurics are most concentrated around the Temple Quarter area, southwest of the Academy of Raya Lucaria, where several can be encountered wielding the club. Defeating them has a chance to drop the weapon, making this area a reliable spot to farm for it.

fields.name: Celebrant's Skull
fields.description:
Large bludgeon decorated with flowers and many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.

The striking end is a skull too large in size to be human.
Grants trace amounts of runes on landing attacks.
fields.location: Dropped by Celebrant enemies in Windmill Village, Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Pickaxe
fields.description:
Large pickaxe designed to crack thick bedrock. Tool of sturdy miners.

Not originally designed as a weapon, but very adept at piercing armor.
"Little wretches, do you think your armor harder than stone?"
fields.location: Dropped by Miner enemies in tunnels, such as the Altus Tunnel and Sellia Crystal Tunnel.

fields.name: Beastclaw Greathammer
fields.description:
Great hammer with a striking end modelled to resemble five beastly claws.

The black nails protruding from golden fur are said to represent Serosh, Lord of Beasts, who went on to become King Godfrey's Regent.
fields.location: Reward for defeating Gurranq, Beast Clergyman, after giving him all Deathroot.

fields.name: Envoy's Long Horn
fields.description:
Long golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt.

Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.
fields.location: Dropped by the large Oracle Envoy enemies in Miquella’s Haligtree.

fields.name: Cranial Vessel Candlestand
fields.description: Candlestand used in worship of Birac, the most hallowed Monk Prelate of the Giants' Flame. Concerned over the lazy arrogance with which the monks treated the Flame, Birac severed his own head as a lesson to the others, intending it be used as a candlestand. His faith yet smolders from within the cranial vessel.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave, Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Great Stars
fields.description:
Huge bludgeon with three stars at the striking end. Though primarily a striking weapon, the stars' spikes cause blood loss.

A blood-stained star is an ill omen, a fact not lost upon those against whom this weapon is brought to bear. Landing attacks slightly restores HP.
fields.location: Found in a chest on a carriage along the road north of the Writheblood Ruins in the Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Brick Hammer
fields.description:
Weapon made from an ordinary stone brick. Wielded by a laborer who lead a rebellion, and later become a champion himself.

Even among other bludgeons of its size, this weapon is especially weighty. The strength of a giant is required to wield it.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in Stormveil Castle, in the area above the Rampart Tower site of grace.

fields.name: Devourer's Scepter
fields.description:
Scepter in the shape of a serpent devouring the world. This weapon will one day become the very symbol of the Lord of Blasphemy.
One of the legendary armaments.

A vision of the future briefly seen by Rykard in his final moments before being devoured by the great serpent.
fields.location: Dropped by Bernahl (Recusant Bernahl) when defeated at Crumbling Farum Azula.

fields.name: Rotten Battle Hammer
fields.description:
Large iron great hammer designed for gladiatorial combat, now festering with scarlet rot.

Weighty enough to crush armor and its wearer alike.
fields.location: Dropped by Rotten Duelist enemies in the Consecrated Snowfield.

fields.name: Nightrider Flail
fields.description:
A flail with two additional bludgeoning heads.
Weapon of the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

The large spikes make it highly effective at inducing blood loss, but also demand higher dexterity to wield.
fields.location: Obtained by defeating the Night Cavalry enemy in the Weeping Peninsula during nighttime patrols.

fields.name: Flail
fields.description:
Weapon consisting of a bludgeoning head attached to a handle by a chain. The iron ball is spiked and induces blood loss.

Blows from this weapon cannot be parried. The charge attack whirls the iron ball around for increased force before striking.
fields.location: Found inside a chest on a carriage near the Gatefront Ruins in Limgrave.

fields.name: Family Heads
fields.description:
Three bludgeoning copper heads attached to a handle by chains. Signature weapon of Necromancer Garris, the heretical sage.

The heads were made to resemble those of his wife and two children.
fields.location: Received after defeating Astel, Naturalborn of the Void, and trading his Remembrance to Enia at Roundtable Hold.

fields.name: Bastard's Stars
fields.description:
Flail which deals magic damage, having been imbued with power by the remembrance of Astel.

Formed of the same many-colored star debris that comprised the form of the Naturalborn of the Void.
fields.location: Reward from defeating Necromancer Garris in Sage’s Cave, located in the Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Chainlink Flail
fields.description:
A spiked iron tube attached by a chain wielded by Mad Pumpkin Heads.

Especially large for a flail, wielding it requires more strength than it does dexterity.
fields.location: Dropped by Mad Pumpkin Head enemies, which appear in Limgrave, Castle Morne, and Raya Lucaria Academy.

fields.name: Battle Axe
fields.description:
A thick, heavy blade attached to a handle. A versatile, standard weapon

Capable of powerful attacks thanks to the weighty blade, these weapons are also regarded for their powerful charge attacks.
fields.location: Starting weapon for the Warrior class. Can also be purchased from the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold after giving them the Bell Bearing from the Nomadic Merchant.

fields.name: Forked Hatchet
fields.description:
Peculiar hatchet wielded by imps.

The gently undulating forked blade is known as an "imp's tongue" and causes blood loss.
fields.location: Dropped by Imps, especially those found in catacombs throughout Limgrave and other regions.

fields.name: Hand Axe
fields.description:
Commonly known as a hatchet, this smaller variety of axe is an everyday work tool.

Despite its short reach, it is easy to handle, exceling in successive attacks.
fields.location: Sold by the Nomadic Merchant in East Limgrave, found near the Coastal Cave. Also a starting weapon for the Hero class.

fields.name: Jawbone Axe
fields.description:
Axe made from a herbivore's skull. Weapon of the ancestral followers who disdain metal.

This axe is more of a bludgeon; it forgoes a bladed edge, instead using the beast's molar teeth to buffet foes, dealing strike damage.
fields.location: Dropped by skeletal Beastman enemies in the Altus Plateau and Gelmir Hero’s Grave.

fields.name: Iron Cleaver
fields.description:
Fairly large iron cleaver, commonly used by the maltreated Misbegotten.

Steeped in resentment, these weapons are swung wildly and relentlessly, often after rushing up to foes.
fields.location: Dropped by the scythe-wielding Misbegotten enemies, commonly found in Castle Morne and Morne Tunnel in the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Ripple Blade
fields.description:
Unique weapon wielded by young Albinaurics, this sword is modelled after the ripples that are thought to be the origin of their species.

Its attack power is greatly enhanced with one's arcane attribute.
fields.location: Dropped by the Albinauric enemies in the Village of the Albinaurics, southwest Liurnia.

fields.name: Celebrant's Cleaver
fields.description:
Cleaver decorated with many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.

Crafted from human bone.
Grants trace amounts of runes upon landing attacks.
fields.location: Dropped by Celebrant enemies wielding axes in the Windmill Village, Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Icerind Hatchet
fields.description:
A hatchet with a frost-coated blade. One of several gifts given by Castle Sol in the distant north.

Known as "freezing fog," the blade is thought to be a dragon's scale. Inflicts a powerful frost effect.
fields.location: Found in a chest inside the Temple Quarter ruins, in the southwestern part of Liurnia of the Lakes.

fields.name: Highland Axe
fields.description:
Single-sided axe used by the warriors of the highlands.

Brave combatants begin battle by crying out their names. Roars are enhanced by this weapon.
fields.location: Found in a house in the Mistwood Ruins, East Limgrave. Look for a corpse sitting in a chair inside the ruined building.

fields.name: Sacrificial Axe
fields.description:
Hatchet used in ancient sacrificial rite. A Deathbird is depicted as a malevolent deity.

The power of the rite yet lingers. A small amount of FP is restored upon slaying a foe.
fields.location: Dropped by Deathbird bosses, specifically the one found in the Weeping Peninsula at night near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace.

fields.name: Rosus' Axe
fields.description:
Usher of Death, Rosus, who shows the path to the catacombs throughout the Lands Between, is depicted on this ritual axe.

The dead easily lose their way, and have always been in sore need of a guiding hand.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the Black Knife Catacombs, in the northeast part of Liurnia of the Lakes.

fields.name: Stormhawk Axe
fields.description:
Battle axe designed to resemble a hawk, with its wings comprising the blade. Signature weapon of warriors who strive to remain one with the storm, despite being so far from their place of birth.

Their hearts are proud, and thereby easily undone.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Chapel of Anticipation, accessible via the waygate at the Four Belfries in western Liurnia.

fields.name: Greataxe
fields.description:
Greataxe akin to a huge lump of iron. Recognized as the weapon of choice of badland chieftains.

Too heavy to be wielded by those of merely ordinary strength, blows from this axe will flatten enemies, and the force of its charged attack is a sight to behold.
fields.location: Found in a chest at the back of a moving carriage pulled by two Trolls on the main road west of Waypoint Ruins in Limgrave. The carriage is accompanied by a group of enemies and must be stopped before you can open the chest.

fields.name: Warped Axe
fields.description:
Oversized double-headed axe with a bizarre, almost melted appearance.

Brute strength is the only thing required to wield this weapon, which appears to have taken quite the beating itself.
fields.location: Dropped by Omen enemies wielding axes in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds beneath Leyndell, Royal Capital.

fields.name: Great Omenkiller Cleaver
fields.description:
The blade of this huge, loathsome cleaver comprises a row of amputated Omen horns. Weapon of slaughter wielded by Omenkillers. 

The hideous horns cause blood loss, adding vibrant colors to the ongoing mayhem.
fields.location: Dropped by Omenkiller enemies, most reliably found in the Village of the Albinaurics in southwest Liurnia.

fields.name: Crescent Moon Axe
fields.description:
Greataxe with a large, arcing blade and long handle. The "Crescent Moon" of its name is said to have been spurred by nostalgia.

Specializes in sweeping through foes by making use of its long handle.
fields.location: Dopped by Omen enemies wielding this axe in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds beneath Leyndell, Royal Capital.

fields.name: Axe of Godrick
fields.description:
Greataxe wielded by Godrick the Grafted. This golden battleaxe is emblazoned with the figure of a beast, representing the strength of Godfrey, First Elden Lord and patriarch of the golden lineage.

"I command thee kneel! For I am the lord of all that is golden!"
fields.location: Exchanged for the Remembrance of the Grafted with Enia at the Roundtable Hold after defeating Godrick the Grafted in Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Longhaft Axe
fields.description:
Large iron axe with a long handle. Weapon of the maltreated Misbegotten.

Making use of the force generated by its length, this weapon's resentment-charged blows are difficult to stop.
fields.location: Dropped by Omen enemies wielding this weapon in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds.

fields.name: Rusted Anchor
fields.description:
A rusty anchor wielded as a weapon. Each of its four flukes is thick and sharp, enabling piercing attacks.

When the Tarnished left the Lands Between with their Lord, one boat alone was said to have been left behind.
fields.location: Found in a chest after defeating the mini-boss in Morne Tunnel, located in the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Executioner's Greataxe
fields.description:
Bulky cleaver welded to a long haft. Said to have been used to dispatch the remnants of defeated armies, felling them like timber.

Perhaps that is the reason it excels at critical hits.
fields.location: Dropped by axe-wielding Skeleton enemies found in the graveyards of West Limgrave and Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Winged Greathorn
fields.description:
Distinctive horn suffused with the power of ancestral spirits. This large, wing-shaped specimen is wielded as a weapon of spirit worship.

In the ancestral spirit-worshipping faith, these are considered envoys' wings, made to reap the lives of beings which experience no sprouting.
fields.location: Dropped by the Death Rite Bird boss in Consecrated Snowfield at night.

fields.name: Butchering Knife
fields.description:
Huge carving knife made to cleanly butcher the human body. Signature weapon of the Ogress Anastasia, known to have eaten countless Tarnished while disguised as a Finger Maiden.

Restores a very small amount of HP when it squarely strikes an enemy.
fields.location: Dropped by Anastasia, Tarnished-Eater, an invading NPC who appears near the Smoldering Church in northern Caelid. She invades when you approach the area for the first time; defeat her to claim the weapon.

fields.name: Gargoyle's Great Axe
fields.description:
Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyles.

Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.
fields.location: Dropped by Valiant Gargoyle enemies wielding this weapon. The most reliable source is the Valiant Gargoyle boss duo in Siofra Aqueduct, beneath Nokron, Eternal City. After defeating them, the axe may be found as a drop.

fields.name: Gargoyle's Black Axe
fields.description:
Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyles, mended with blackened corpse wax.
Deals holy damage.

Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.
fields.location: Dropped by the Black Blade Kindred boss found in the Forbidden Lands, just before the Grand Lift of Rold on the path to the Mountaintops of the Giants. Defeat this boss to obtain the axe.

fields.name: Short Spear
fields.description:
An exceedingly plain spear of modest weight.

Simple to wield compared to many of its peers, its strong attack unleashes a series of successive piercing thrusts.
fields.location: Dropped by miner enemies in Limgrave Tunnels. Also sold by the Isolated Merchant in Dragonbarrow.

fields.name: Spear
fields.description:
Weapon comprised of a blade attached to a long haft.

A far-reaching piercing weapon, it can be wielded from behind the safety of a raised shield. Very effective against mounted foes.
fields.location: Starting weapon for the Vagabond class. Alternatively, dropped by Patches if killed in Murkwater Cave.

fields.name: Crystal Spear
fields.description: Spear fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence. The inscrutable Crystalians have but one clear purpose; to safeguard their crystals unto the end. One theory posits that they yearn for the return of their creator who will carve for them new brethren.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Village of the Albinaurics (Liurnia), near the cliffside ruins

fields.name: Clayman's Harpoon
fields.description:
Harpoon with a tip made from a sharpened meteorite shard. Wielded by the claymen who infest dynastic remains.

The blade emits a faint light and deals magic damage.
fields.location: Dropped by Clayman enemies in underground areas like Ainsel River or Siofra River.

fields.name: Cleanrot Spear
fields.description:
Spear of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

The winged golden blade deals holy damage. The diminutive shield is blessed with an incantation that wards off rot.
fields.location: Dropped by Cleanrot Knights wielding spears, commonly found in the Swamp of Aeonia (Caelid).

fields.name: Partisan
fields.description:
Spear with a wide tip.

In addition to its thrusting attacks, this highly versatile weapon can be swung to sweep through foes.
fields.location: Found in Stormveil Castle, on a corpse in a room behind a Stonesword Key door near the Rampart Tower.

fields.name: Celebrant's Rib-Rake
fields.description:
Rake decorated with many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.

Crafted from human bone.
Grants trace amounts of runes upon landing attacks.
fields.location: Dropped by Celebrant enemies in Windmill Village, Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Pike
fields.description:
A longspear featuring an especially lengthy handle.

Specialized for use from long distances, it boasts the longest reach of any melee weapon. Incredibly useful even against foes on horseback, but hard to wield in cramped spaces.
fields.location: Found on a carriage guarded by soldiers along the main road northeast of the Liurnia Highway South site of grace.

fields.name: Torchpole
fields.description:
Torch fastened to a long pole. Lights up dark areas, but cannot be raised overhead.

Used by soldiers on watch, its attacks set foes aflame.
fields.location: Dropped by Fire Monk enemies patrolling near the Liurnia Highway North site of grace.

fields.name: Bolt of Gransax
fields.description:
Spear whittled from the weapon wielded by Gransax.
One of the legendary armaments.

A great ancient dragon, Gransax once rained calamity upon the Royal Capital—the only time in historical record that Leyndell's walls have fallen. This marked the dawn of the war against the ancient dragons.
fields.location: Found on the giant spear statue in Leyndell, Royal Capital. Must be collected before defeating Maliketh, as it disappears post-Ashen Capital.

fields.name: Cross-Naginata
fields.description:
Weapon consisting of a three-pronged blade affixed to a long pole. The long central blade closely resembles a katana.

A weapon of the Land of Reeds, known for its ability to be wielded as a spear while still being capable of performing slashing attacks.
fields.location: Found in a chest in Gael Tunnel (Caelid), behind the Magma Wyrm boss arena.

fields.name: Death Ritual Spear
fields.description:
Ritual spear used by priests of old who were permitted to come among the Deathbirds.

The priests became guardians of the birds through the rite of Death, which also serves as an oath sworn to their distant resurrection.
fields.location: Dropped by the Death Rite Bird boss in the Consecrated Snowfield, only accessible at night.

fields.name: Inquisitor's Girandole
fields.description:
Instrument of torture used on nobles behind the curtain at the Volcano Manor of Mt. Gelmir.

Its numerous spikes pierce the flesh, then singe the wounds with flame. The smell of burnt blood induces despair in the victim. A candlestick conceived by a thorough mind.
fields.location: Dropped by the Inquisitor enemy in the Volcano Manor prison area, accessible via the Temple of Eiglay.

fields.name: Spiked Spear
fields.description:
Weapon comprised of a spiked cylinder attached to a long pole. Capable of dealing strike damage when swung. The spikes induce blood loss.

Weapon of the Marionette Soldiers employed by sorcerers.
fields.location: Dropped by Marionette Soldiers wielding this weapon in Raya Lucaria Academy.

fields.name: Iron Spear
fields.description:
Commonly used iron spear with no notable traits.
The blade is severely rusted.
fields.location: Dropped by Exiled Soldiers wielding spears in Stormveil Castle, particularly near the Rampart Tower site of grace.

fields.name: Rotten Crystal Spear
fields.description:
Spear fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human.
It festers with scarlet rot.

Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence.
fields.location: Looted from a chest in Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree, guarded by Crystalians near the Prayer Room site of grace.

fields.name: Mohgwyn's Sacred Spear
fields.description:
Trident of Mohg, Lord of Blood. A sacred spear that will come to symbolize his dynasty.

As well as serving as a weapon, it is an instrument of communion with an outer god who bestows power upon accursed blood. The mother of truth desires a wound.
fields.location: Obtained by trading the Remembrance of the Blood Lord to Enia after defeating Mohg, Lord of Blood, in the Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum.

fields.name: Siluria's Tree
fields.description:
Siluria's Tree, weapon of one of the two honored as foremost among the Crucible Knights.

The primordial form of the Erdtree is close in nature to life itself, and this spear, modeled on its crucible, is imbued with ancient holy essence.
fields.location: Reward for defeating the Crucible Knight boss in the Deeproot Depths.

fields.name: Serpent-Hunter
fields.description: Weapon that serves as both greatsword and spear. Thought to have been used to hunt an immortal great serpent in the distant past, it manifests a long blade of light when facing such a creature.
