When their master's heroic aspirations degenerated into mere greed, his men searched for a weapon with which they might halt their lord.
fields.location: Found inside the boss arena for Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy.

fields.name: Vyke's War Spear
fields.description:
War spear singed and blistered by fingers, used by Vyke, Knight of the Roundtable Hold.

Like Vyke himself, it has been tormented by the yellow flame of frenzy from within.
fields.location: Received after defeating Festering Fingerprint Vyke in Liurnia of the Lakes.

fields.name: Lance
fields.description:
Considered a type of greatspear, this weapon has no blade, but instead features a long, conical body designed to pierce.

Though heavy and hard to wield, this weapon displays its worth in horseback combat whether mounted or even on foot.
fields.location: Located in a carriage near the Liurnia Highway South site of grace in Liurnia of the Lakes.

fields.name: Treespear
fields.description:
Golden spear with tree-like design. Wielded by knights employed as palace guards in the Royal Capital of Leyndell.
Deals holy damage.

Requiring superior dexterity to wield, this greatspear can perform consecutive thrust attacks despite its larger size.
fields.location: Found on a corpse northeast of the Warmaster’s Shack in Limgrave.

fields.name: Halberd
fields.description:
A long-handled polearm that combines the functions of both axe and spear.

Can be used to press a single enemy with continuous thrusting attacks, or swept at groups, taking advantage of its great reach and cleaving blade. A versatile weapon for any situation.
fields.location: Sold by the Nomadic Merchant east of Saintsbridge in Limgrave for 1,200 runes .

fields.name: Pest's Glaive
fields.description:
Glaive made from a hard, sharpened shell. Wielded by the pests who emerged from the Swamp of Aeonia.
Slightly increases non-physical damage negation.

Though men might recognize the keen intellect of the pests evidenced by this spear's uncanny design, it will never be understood by them.
fields.location: Dropped by Pest-Carrying Albinaurics in the Abandoned Cave, Caelid.

fields.name: Lucerne
fields.description:
This polearm features a hard, sharpened beak-like spike attached to its head, designed to pierce armor.

Though designed mainly as a thrusting weapon, its long handle can be utilized to get around an enemy's guard with a sideward sweeping attack.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Stormhill Shack, south of the Gatefront Ruins in Limgrave.

fields.name: Banished Knight's Halberd
fields.description:
A finely-crafted halberd intricately engraved with an ancient motif.
Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.
fields.location: Dropped by Banished Knights wielding halberds, commonly found in the Church of Vows area in Caelid and the Salia Backstreets in Liurnia.

fields.name: Commander's Standard
fields.description:
A beaten red battle standard is furled around this time-worn halberd.

Even after his lord was fled, Commander O'Neil continued to brandish this flag in the devastation of the rot-eaten field of battle, the sole veteran who remembers this battle with pride.
fields.location: Dropped by Commander Niall in the Castle Sol boss fight in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Nightrider Glaive
fields.description:
A jet-black glaive with a blade as weighty as a bludgeon. Weapon of the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

This glaive excels at weighty slash attacks that crash into foes, making it a powerful weapon even on horseback.
fields.location: Dropped by the Night’s Cavalry boss patrolling the bridge southeast of East Raya Lucaria Gate in Liurnia.

fields.name: Ripple Crescent Halberd
fields.description:
Weapon wielded by young Albinaurics.

The blade is said to resemble a partial image of a ripple, and its attack power scales with one's arcane attribute.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the Shaded Castle ruins in northern Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Vulgar Militia Saw
fields.description: A weapon comprised of a saw blade attached to a long grip. Brandished by the vulgar militia, its serrated edge is very effective at inflicting blood loss. The saw is said to also be used to cut up bodies to feed the militia, but there are no firsthand witnesses to confirm the dire rumor.
fields.location: Dropped by Vulgar Militia enemies in the Smoldering Wall area of Caelid.

fields.name: Golden Halberd
fields.description:
Weighty halberd forged of gold. Wielded by the Order of Tree Sentinels, heavily equipped knights.
Deals holy damage.

A masterfully crafted weapon that lives up to its heft, but is difficult for one of mere human strength to wield.
fields.location: Dropped by the Tree Sentinel patrolling the path to Church of Elleh in Limgrave.

fields.name: Glaive
fields.description:
Weapon comprised of a sharp blade affixed to a long grip. It is in fact a sickle repurposed to be a tool of war.

This far-reaching weapon excels at slashing attacks.
fields.location: Dropped by Albinaurics wielding glaives in the Abandoned Cave in Caelid.

fields.name: Loretta's War Sickle
fields.description:
Intricately crafted silver war sickle wielded by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree.

Originally given for service as a personal guard to Carian royalty, the weapon's blue glintstone has been replaced with unalloyed gold.
fields.location: Reward for defeating Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree, in Miquella’s Haligtree.

fields.name: Guardian's Swordspear
fields.description:
Weapon comprising a long handle and broad blade sharpened from the hard wood of old trees.

Wielded by guardians of the Minor Erdtrees, known as experts in the arts of combat. The power of this weapon scales greatly with dexterity.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the Abandoned Cave, Caelid, after defeating the boss inside.

fields.name: Vulgar Militia Shotel
fields.description:
A hooked blade attached to a long handle. Wielded by the vulgar militia, its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard.

The vulgar militia are the undecorated stewards of rancid, scorched battlefields that none dare approach, and forbidden domains better forgotten by the rest of the world.
fields.location: Dropped by Vulgar Militia enemies in the Smoldering Wall area of Caelid.

fields.name: Dragon Halberd
fields.description:
Halberd shaped like a dragon, enwreathed with both ice and lightning.

Alas, the Dragonkin Soldiers never attained immortality, and perished as decrepit, pale imitations of their skyborn kin.
fields.location: Dropped by Dragonkin Soldiers in the Lake of Rot area, Caelid.

fields.name: Gargoyle's Halberd
fields.description:
Bronze halberd wielded by Valiant Gargoyles.

Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.
fields.location: Dropped by the Black Blade Kindred boss guarding the Forbidden Lands near Leyndell’s West Capital Rampart .

fields.name: Gargoyle's Black Halberd
fields.description:
Bronze halberd wielded by Valiant Gargoyles, mended with blackened corpse wax.
Deals holy damage.

Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.
fields.location: Dropped by the Black Blade Kindred boss in the Forbidden Lands area near Leyndell’s West Capital Rampart.

fields.name: Scythe
fields.description:
Large scythe featuring a long, slender blade. Designed to reap, this weapon is capable of rapidly inflicting blood loss while also slipping through an enemy's guard.

In the hands of a highly dexterous wielder it is capable of striking fear into the heart of any foe.
fields.location: Dropped by Skeleton enemies wielding scythes, most reliably found in the graveyard near the Church of Pilgrimage in the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Grave Scythe
fields.description:
Greatscythe comprised of a large blade affixed to a crooked stick. Weapon wielded by the aged grave keepers who tend the forgotten graveyards throughout the Lands Between.

This weapon is said to have served as a charm against evil spirits in times of old.
fields.location: Dropped by Skeleton enemies wielding large scythes, commonly found in graveyards throughout Limgrave, Liurnia, and the Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Halo Scythe
fields.description:
War scythe of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

This was the weapon of commanders in Malenia's army, and the half-halo blade deals holy damage.
fields.location: Dropped by Cleanrot Knights wielding this weapon, most commonly found in the Swamp of Aeonia in Caelid.

fields.name: Winged Scythe
fields.description:
Sacred scythe resembling a pair of white wings. Deals holy damage.

According to pagan belief, white-winged maidens are said to be Death's gentle envoys.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the Tombsward Ruins, near the Tombsward Catacombs in the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Whip
fields.description:
A leather whip. Not originally used for combat, but as an instrument of pain.

Though its supple attacks cannot be thwarted by parrying or even guarding, it is incapable of dealing critical hits.
fields.location: Dropped by Exile Soldiers wielding whips, particularly in Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Thorned Whip
fields.description:
Hefty whip covered in crimson thorns. Weapon of the Prelates who lead the Fire Monks. A device of fearsome religious encouragement, it is fashioned in the image of the briars of sin.

Very effective at inflicting blood loss.
fields.location: Dropped by Fire Prelate enemies wielding whips, found in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Magma Whip Candlestick
fields.description:
This ritual implement is a three pronged candlestick with solid flames formed of the magma of Mt. Gelmir.

When wielded as a weapon, the flames become supple whips of lava.
fields.location: Dropped by the Man-Serpent enemy at the top of Volcano Manor, near the Temple of Eiglay.

fields.name: Hoslow's Petal Whip
fields.description:
Metal whip formed of razor-sharp chain-link blades that have the appearance of flower petals. This work of art is handed down through the generations of the illustrious House Hoslow.
High dexterity is required to wield this weapon, but it excels at inflicting devastating blood loss.
"The tale of House Hoslow is told in blood."
fields.location: Dropped by Diallos Hoslow during his questline, or as a reward for completing the Volcano Manor assassination quests.

fields.name: Giant's Red Braid
fields.description:
Hefty whip woven from the flame-red hair of a Fire Giant.

Every giant is red of hair, and Radagon was said to have despised his own red locks. Perhaps that was a curse of their kind.
fields.location: Exchanged for the Remembrance of the Fire Giant with Enia at Roundtable Hold after defeating the Fire Giant in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Urumi
fields.description:
This weapon made of extremely thin, flexible blades of metal is wielded like a whip by Nightfolk warriors.

Though in essence a whip with a cutting edge, it can also be used as a spear to pierce foes.
fields.location: Found in Caria Manor, located in the northern part of Liurnia of the Lakes. From the Manor Upper Level or Lower Level site of grace, descend to the southern ramparts. Navigate crumbling walkways and jump onto a lower rooftop where several Fingercreepers (large spider-like hands) guard a corpse. The Urumi is looted from this corpse.

fields.name: Caestus
fields.description:
A weapon built for striking with the fists, made of tough leather inlaid with iron rivets.

Fist weapons come in pairs, and two-handing this weapon will equip it to both hands.
fields.location: Sold by Gatekeeper Gostoc in Stormveil Castle for 800 Runes after you obtain the Rusty Key. He can be found near the gatehouse or overlooking the cliffside Site of Grace. If Gostoc is killed, you can buy the Caestus from the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold after giving them his Bell Bearing.

fields.name: Spiked Caestus
fields.description:
A caestus with the rivets replaced by blood loss-inducing spikes.

Fist weapons come in pairs, and two-handing this weapon will equip it to both hands.
fields.location: Sold by the Isolated Merchant in Dragonbarrow for 1,800 runes.

fields.name: Grafted Dragon
fields.description:
The embodiment of the power that still remained in the dragon's head that was grafted to Godrick's left arm.

The wielder's arm will take the form of a small dragon, sprouting sharp dragon fangs at the fist.
This weapon cannot be two-handed.
fields.location: Reward for defeating the optional boss Dragonlord Placidusax in Crumbling Farum Azula. Trade the Remembrance of the Dragonlord with Enia at Roundtable Hold to receive this weapon.

fields.name: Iron Ball
fields.description:
Iron manifer of spherical shape. Big Boggart the blackguard's weapon of choice.

Not a weapon to be taken lightly, as its weighty blows shatter bones with ease.
fields.location: Dropped by the NPC “Blackguard” at the Boilprawn Shack in Liurnia after completing his questline.

fields.name: Star Fist
fields.description:
Spherical iron manifer covered in spikes which induce blood loss.

Used in brutal games of pugilism.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell’s Subterranean Shunning-Grounds, in a cell near the Frenzied Flame Proscription site.

fields.name: Katar
fields.description: Imported dagger design with a rather unique handle. The blade can be swung about as the extension of one's fist.
fields.location: Found in a chest in Fort Gael, Caelid.

fields.name: Clinging Bone
fields.description:
Horrific weapon made of a hardened skeletal arm. Wielded by Ensha of the Royal Remains.

Fitted by placing one's hands into the fists' grips until they dig in.
"O clinging creature. A king relinquishes not the hand."
fields.location: Found in the Abandoned Cave in Caelid. After entering the cave, navigate through the area until you reach a chest guarded by enemies; the weapon is inside.

fields.name: Veteran's Prosthesis
fields.description: Bladed prosthetic leg enwreathed with the power of lightning, instead attached to the fist. Commander Niall, veteran of Castle Sol, offered this prosthesis in exchange for the lives of defeated knights held prisoner. He went on to lead these men as an army of no nation.
fields.location: Dropped by Veteran’s Prosthesis enemies patrolling the streets of Leyndell, Royal Capital, especially near the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds entrance.

fields.name: Cipher Pata
fields.description:
One of the weapons originating from the Two Fingers. A formless sequence of ciphers comprise its blade, and as such no shield can repel it. Deals holy damage.

The furtive inscription appears to hang in the air; the language of light spoken by the Two Fingers.
fields.location: Located in a chapel southwest of the Roundtable Hold’s balcony in Leyndell.

fields.name: Hookclaws
fields.description:
Weapon worn on the fist comprised of sharp parallel blades favored by those who lurk in the dark. Lacerations cause blood loss with great effect.

Claw weapons come in pairs, and two-handing this weapon will equip it to both hands.
fields.location: Found in a room behind an Imp Statue (requires Stonesword Key) in Stormveil Castle’s basement.

fields.name: Venomous Fang
fields.description:
One of the weapons designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.

The black fang protruding from the bronze snake head is coated in deadly poison.
fields.location: Dropped by Serpentmen in the Abandoned Cave, Caelid.

fields.name: Bloodhound Claws
fields.description:
Large curved claws used by Bloodhound Knights.

The curve allows the weapon to slip through an enemy's guard.
fields.location: These claws are found in Volcano Manor. From the Prison Town Church Site of Grace, head through the lava-filled area and explore the cells. The claws are on a corpse in a room guarded by a Bloodhound Knight.

fields.name: Raptor Talons
fields.description:
Claw comprised of two sharp, thin blades. Wielded by the assassins of ravenmount, this weapon allows them to imitate the attacks of Deathbirds.

Besides excelling at airborne attacks, its charge attack mimics the vicious swoop of a bird of prey.
fields.location: Found in Sage’s Cave, Altus Plateau, behind an illusory wall near the boss arena.

fields.name: Prelate's Inferno Crozier
fields.description:
Colossal hammer with the appearance of roiling flames. Weapon of the Prelates who lead the Fire Monks. Its heft represents the weight of their guardianship.

The hammer's head is unusually substantial, and strong attacks will fling foes into the air.
fields.location: Dropped by the Fire Prelate enemy inside Fort Laiedd, on the western edge of Mt. Gelmir.

fields.name: Watchdog's Staff
fields.description:
Large stone staff embedded with glintstone. Wielded by Erdtree Burial Watchdogs who protect catacombs.

The Watchdogs, battered and broken over their lengthy tenure, rule the catacombs and are even said to command the imps.
fields.location: Dropped by the Erdtree Burial Watchdog wielding a staff in the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave, Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Great Club
fields.description: An enormous club of hard wood. Wildly hammering foes with this striking weapon requires no dexterity; only brute force. While it may seem sacrilegious, this weapon is said to be a withered branch of the Erdtree. Imbued with holy power, this weapon will never snap.
fields.location: Dropped by the Large Miner enemies in the Consecrated Snowfield, near the cave entrance.

fields.name: Envoy's Greathorn
fields.description:
Fanned golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt.

Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.
fields.location: Dropped by the Large Oracle Envoy enemies in Miquella’s Haligtree.

fields.name: Duelist Greataxe
fields.description:
Greataxe designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.

A weapon reserved for duelist champions, the charge attack is particularly ferocious.
fields.location: Dropped by the Duelist mini-boss just outside the entrance to the Auriza Hero’s Grave in Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Axe of Godfrey
fields.description: Weapon of Godfrey, Elden Lord. It was broken in a battle fought as leader of the Tarnished during the Long March. This weapon is symbolic of Godfrey's vow to conduct himself as a lord, later becoming an emblem of the golden lineage. In the days of the past, a crown was warranted with strength.
fields.location: Exchanged for the Remembrance of Hoarah Loux with Enia at the Roundtable Hold after defeating Godfrey, First Elden Lord.

fields.name: Dragon Greatclaw
fields.description:
Weapon said to have been whittled from the claw of a great, ancient dragon, wielded by grotesque Tree Sentinels who yet serve the Erdtree.

The claw is enwreathed with lightning, and tears through the dragons' feeble descendants with ease.
fields.location: Dropped by the Draconic Tree Sentinel boss guarding the main gate to Leyndell, Royal Capital.

fields.name: Staff of the Avatar
fields.description:
Ceremonial staff depicting the Erdtree in its historic radiance. Wielded by the avatars who protect the Minor Erdtrees.

The avatars, emerging in the wake of the Elden Ring's shattering, were determined to protect the withering Erdtree's offspring.
fields.location: Dropped by the Erdtree Avatar boss in the Deeproot Depths.

fields.name: Fallingstar Beast Jaw
fields.description:
Part of a Fallingstar Beast's jaw, hard and shining black, fashioned into a weapon.

With its sharp point, this colossal weapon can skewer foes.
fields.location: Dropped by the Full-Grown Fallingstar Beast boss in Mt. Gelmir, near the Ninth Mt. Gelmir Campsite Site of Grace.

fields.name: Ghiza's Wheel
fields.description:
Great iron wheel lined with flesh-flaying blades. Device of torture used by Inquisitor Ghiza. As the wheel spins it causes severe pain and blood loss.

The design was adopted for use as the iconic weapon wielded by Iron Virgins.
fields.location: Found on the upper floors of Volcano Manor after defeating Inquisitor Ghiza.

fields.name: Giant-Crusher
fields.description: A hammer made from a boulder, used in the War against the Giants. One of the heftiest weapons in the entire Lands Between. After the giants were quelled, and man turned against man in violence, this weapon was all but forgotten. Man has grown feeble in comparison to his forebears.
fields.location: Found in a chest in a carriage south of the Outer Wall Phantom Tree Site of Grace in Leyndell, Royal Capital.

fields.name: Golem's Halberd
fields.description: A great halberd of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Wielded by the Guardian Golem.
fields.location: Dropped by Golem enemies wielding this weapon, found near the Limgrave Tower Bridge and other locations.

fields.name: Troll's Hammer
fields.description:
Mining tool of stonedigger trolls used to crack bedrock.

Trolls are descended from the giants, and these were supposedly once used as ceremonial smithing tools. In the distant past, smithing was considered divine.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the Old Altus Tunnel, located in the Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Rotten Staff
fields.description:
Ceremonial staff depicting the Erdtree in its historic radiance. It festers with scarlet rot.

Wielded by the avatars who protect the Minor Erdtrees.
fields.location: Dropped by the Rotten Avatar boss in the Consecrated Snowfield.

fields.name: Rotten Greataxe
fields.description:
Greataxe designed for gladiatorial combat, now festering with scarlet rot.

Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.
fields.location: Dropped by Rotten Duelist enemies in the Consecrated Snowfield.

fields.name: Torch
fields.description:
This torch's tip is wrapped in oil-soaked rags and set on fire.
The flame can illuminate dark locales, or be used to attack enemies.

Can be raised up when equipped in the left hand,
illuminating more of the surrounding area.
fields.location: Purchased from Kale, the merchant at the Church of Elleh in Limgrave for 200 runes. Later available from the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold after obtaining Kale’s Bell Bearing.

fields.name: Steel-Wire Torch
fields.description:
Torch wound with metal wire. The flame can illuminate dark locales, or be used to attack enemies.

Heavier than a normal torch, but the heated filament boosts fire damage dealt.
fields.location: Found in Castle Morne in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Lift site of grace, progress through the castle, descend a ladder, and look for a chest near the lower ramparts—this torch is inside.

fields.name: St. Trina's Torch
fields.description:
Candlestand torch that burns with a light-purple flame. The carvings depict St. Trina, but in adult form, somewhat unnervingly.

The light-purple flame induces sleep.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the southern part of the Altus Plateau, inside the Witchbane Ruins. The chest is located in the ruins near a large statue.

fields.name: Ghostflame Torch
fields.description: Metal torch that burns with cold ghostflame. Tool of the Fallen Hawks who prowl the underground rivers. When the band's last embers were used up in their long search, they began to burn the bones of their fellows, acquiring the cold ghostflame, but sealing their fate as dwellers of the underground for all eternity.
fields.location: Dropped by a Death Rite Bird boss that appears at night in the Consecrated Snowfield.

fields.name: Beast-Repellent Torch
fields.description:
A torch which burns oil infused with a special incense. The aroma pacifies wild beasts.

Torches such as these were used to keep unwelcome beasts away from treasure troves hidden in caves.
fields.location: Sold by the Isolated Merchant in the Dragonbarrow region of Caelid. The merchant’s shack is located on a high cliff west of the Divine Tower of Caelid.

fields.name: Sentry's Torch
fields.description: Torch given to protectors of the Erdtree. Its flames are bestowed with a special incantation which allows the bearer to see assassins cloaked in veils. Furnished on behalf of the Erdtree and the Grace-Given Lord such that a Night of Black Knives will never come again.
fields.location: Sold by the Hermit Merchant in the Leyndell Capital Outskirts. The merchant’s shack is located on the western side of the main road leading into the city.

fields.name: Buckler
fields.description:
A small metal roundshield. The bump in the center is designed to parry.

A well-timed parry deflects an enemy's attack, breaking their stance and leaving them open to a critical hit. Though risk is inherent, this shield favors aggression.
fields.location: Sold by Gatekeeper Gostoc in Stormveil Castle for 1,500 Runes, or from the Twin Maiden Husks if Gostoc is killed.

fields.name: Perfumer's Shield
fields.description:
Golden shield used by the perfumers of Leyndell during military service.

Made to be thin and light of weight, even those lacking strength can employ this immunity-boosting shield.
fields.location: Dropped by Perfumer enemies in Leyndell and Volcano Manor.

fields.name: Man-Serpent's Shield
fields.description:
Small copper dome-shaped roundshield carried by the man-serpents of Mt. Gelmir.

Said to have been tempered in lava, it boasts great resistance to fire.
fields.location: Dropped by Man-Serpent enemies in Volcano Manor.

fields.name: Rickety Shield
fields.description:
A creaky old wooden shield, circular in shape. Roughly reinforced with vines.

There are countless other shields available of better make. This piece of scrap isn't worth the effort of equipping.
fields.location: Dropped by skeleton enemies wielding this shield in Limgrave and Liurnia.

fields.name: Pillory Shield
fields.description:
Pillory made to punish serious felons, used as a shield. Though made of good, sturdy wood, it is only a makeshift tool and performs as such.

Perhaps due to its use as a device with which the guilty were made to endure prolonged suffering, it raises vitality.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds beneath Leyndell.

fields.name: Beastman's Jar-Shield
fields.description:
Shield fashioned from a tall broken jar carried by the beastmen of Farum Azula. There is a particular knack to wielding it.

The beastmen have always fired earthenware jars for the express purpose of making shields. Such are their ways, strange though they are.
fields.location: Dropped by Beastman enemies in Farum Azula, specifically those patrolling the lower areas of the crumbling city.

fields.name: Red Thorn Roundshield
fields.description:
A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield.

Its emblem is an ancient thorn design. Though it isn't much, it boosts fire damage negation.
fields.location: Dropped by undead enemies in the Weeping Peninsula and Liurnia.

fields.name: Scripture Wooden Shield
fields.description:
A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield.

An ancient cipher engraving lines the circumference. Though it isn't much, it boosts holy damage negation.
fields.location: Dropped by undead enemies in the Weeping Peninsula and Liurnia.

fields.name: Riveted Wooden Shield
fields.description:
Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield.

The design riveted to the center represents both sword and tree.
fields.location: Dropped by soldier enemies in Limgrave and the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Blue-White Wooden Shield
fields.description:
Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield.

The design is said to represent the stars of the night sky, portending fate.
fields.location: Dropped by albinauric enemies in Liurnia and the Village of the Albinaurics.

fields.name: Rift Shield
fields.description:
Small metal roundshield depicting a sinister rift.

An antiquated charm that glares back at an enemy, it boosts focus.
fields.location: Dropped by undead enemies in the Weeping Peninsula and Liurnia.

fields.name: Iron Roundshield
fields.description:
An ordinary small roundshield made of metal. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.

Finely balanced, this shield is easy to use.
fields.location: Dropped by soldier enemies in Limgrave and Liurnia.

fields.name: Gilded Iron Shield
fields.description:
Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.

Though the gold leaf is peeling and the effect is slight, it still boosts holy damage negation.
fields.location: Dropped by soldier enemies in Altus Plateau and Leyndell.

fields.name: Ice Crest Shield
fields.description:
Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.

The ice crest originates from a Carian princess. Though the effect is slight, it boosts magic damage negation and resistance to frost.
fields.location: Dropped by soldier enemies in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Smoldering Shield
fields.description:
Small shield made upon Mt. Gelmir forged from uncooling lava.

Resists frost with its heat, and can even be used to deal fire damage if wielded as a weapon.
fields.location: Dropped by Fire Monk enemies in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Spiralhorn Shield
fields.description: Small shield of antlers arranged in an eddy-like pattern. If used to attack a foe, the shield's antlers inflict blood loss. Once given to a Tarnished warrior who cultivated close ties to the ancestral followers. Though the effect is only slight, it boosts immunity, robustness, and focus.
fields.location: Dropped by Ancestral Follower enemies in Siofra River and Nokron.

fields.name: Coil Shield
fields.description:
Armament designed for gladiatorial combat. Rises above its peers as a particularly showy specimen.

The sculpted bronze snake is a poisonous breed, boosting the wielder's resistance to poison.
fields.location: Dropped by snake enemies in Volcano Manor.

fields.name: Kite Shield
fields.description:
A standard medium-sized metal shield.

Metal shields reliably negate physical damage when guarding, a trait which made them highly trusted on the battlefield.
fields.location: Dropped by soldier enemies in Limgrave and Liurnia, or found as loot in various ruins.

fields.name: Marred Leather Shield
fields.description:
Leather shield of Stormveil soldiers. Much like the castle, it is marred by mottling and thorns.

Some say it is the curse of grafting which causes such affliction, while others talk of its root being something altogether more sinister hidden deep within the castle.
fields.location: Dropped by undead enemies in the Weeping Peninsula and Liurnia.

fields.name: Marred Wooden Shield
fields.description:
Wooden shield of Stormveil soldiers. Much like the castle, it is marred by mottling and thorns.

Some say it is the curse of grafting which causes such affliction, while others talk of its root being something altogether more sinister hidden deep within the castle.
fields.location: Dropped by undead enemies in the Weeping Peninsula and Liurnia.

fields.name: Banished Knight's Shield
fields.description:
A tall medium-sized metal shield. Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.
fields.location: Dropped by Banished Knights wielding this shield, most commonly found in Stormveil Castle and the Church of Vows in Caelid.

fields.name: Albinauric Shield
fields.description:
Tall oval shield made of metal carried by young Albinaurics. The ornamentation represents the primordial drop of dew from which they are said to have been created.
Boasts exceptional magic damage negation. The Albinaurics' most formidable foes were sorcerers, after all.
fields.location: The Albinauric Shield is dropped by Albinauric enemies who wield this shield. The easiest place to farm it is on top of the church northwest of the Academy Gate Town Site of Grace in Liurnia of the Lakes, where three Albinaurics with shields can be found. Additional Albinaurics carrying this shield appear in the flooded ruins around Academy Gate Town, as well as in the Consecrated Snowfield and Mohgwyn Palace. The drop rate is low, so you may need to defeat several Albinaurics before obtaining the shield

fields.name: Sun Realm Shield
fields.description:
Shield of honor depicting a city crowned by the sun. It has seen better days.

Much like the wear upon the shield, the Seat of the Sun is long faded away.
fields.location:
The Sun Realm Shield is a rare drop from Skeletal Swordsmen who wield this shield. The best places to farm it are:

The graveyard southeast of the Hermit Merchant’s Shack in Altus Plateau, where sword-and-shield skeletons emerge from the ground.

The cemetery west of Summonwater Village in East Limgrave, and the graveyard around the Church of the Plague in Caelid, where groups of these skeletons spawn.

The drop rate is low, so using the Silver Scarab talisman can help increase your chances

fields.name: Silver Mirrorshield
fields.description:
Shield of radiant silver, festooned with amber and carried by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree.

The shape is said to imitate that of a sacred drop of dew, which inspired the absurd rumor that Loretta herself was an Albinauric.
fields.location: Found in Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree, on a corpse in a side room.

fields.name: Round Shield
fields.description:
A wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal.

Comparatively light for its size, this shield is easy to handle but lacks a true metal shield's ability to negate damage.
fields.location: Starting shield for the Prophet class, also dropped by soldiers in Limgrave.

fields.name: Scorpion Kite Shield
fields.description:
A standard medium-sized metal shield. Highly reputed for its solid build and reliability.

Emblazoned with a yellow scorpion, a warning of surprise attacks and sudden strikes.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Grand Lift of Dectus area, Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Twinbird Kite Shield
fields.description:
Shield featuring a vividly painted twinbird.
The twinbird is said to be the envoy of an outer god, and mother of the Deathbirds.

At dwindling levels of HP, this shield slightly boosts both attack and defense.
fields.location: Found on a corpse at the Consecrated Snowfield, near the Apostate Derelict.

fields.name: Blue-Gold Kite Shield
fields.description:
A standard medium-sized metal shield. Highly reputed for its solid build and reliability.

The design represents the Erdtree foregrounded against a blue sky.
fields.location: Sold by the Nomadic Merchant in East Limgrave, near the Mistwood Outskirts.

fields.name: Brass Shield
fields.description:
On the larger side for a medium-sized shield, the face has been covered in brass.

Commonly employed in the Shattering.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Soldiers wielding this shield, especially near the Gatefront Ruins in Limgrave.

fields.name: Great Turtle Shell
fields.description:
Shield fashioned from a great turtle shell. The natural curve helps it contend with foes' attacks.

The turtle is a symbol of tirelessness, and this shield boosts stamina recovery speed.
fields.location: Found on top of the tower on the island west of the Summonwater Village, Limgrave.

fields.name: Shield of the Guilty
fields.description:
Shield made to venerate a maiden whose eyes were crushed by Briars of Sin before being reborn in these lands.

Venerating the repose of the soul, this shield boosts focus. The briars can be used to attack foes.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Prison Town Church area of Volcano Manor.

fields.name: Carian Knight's Shield
fields.description:
A teardrop-shaped, medium-sized shield embedded with blue glintstones.
Carried by knights who served the Carian royal family.

Excels when facing magic or holy attacks. Just who were these knights preparing to fight?
fields.location: Dropped by a Carian Knight in Raya Lucaria Academy, near the Church of the Cuckoo.

fields.name: Large Leather Shield
fields.description:
A roundshield covered in leather. On the larger side for a medium-sized shield.

Though its damage negation may be lacking compared to a metal shield, it can handle a wider range of attack affinities.
fields.location: Sold by the Nomadic Merchant in East Limgrave, near the Mistwood Outskirts.

fields.name: Horse Crest Wooden Shield
fields.description:
A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle.

The circular horsehead design evokes a swift gallop.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Soldiers in Limgrave and other early areas.

fields.name: Candletree Wooden Shield
fields.description:
A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle.

Thought to represent a surreptitious prophecy of cardinal sin, the lit candle-tree design was forbidden.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the graveyard south of the Church of Irith, Liurnia of the Lakes.

fields.name: Flame Crest Wooden Shield
fields.description:
A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle. Carried by soldiers of the village that is afflicted by frenzy.

The yellow flame is the symbol of the affliction, serving as a warning to those who might approach the village.
fields.location: Dropped by soldiers in Limgrave and found on a corpse in the area.

fields.name: Hawk Crest Wooden Shield
fields.description:
A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle.

Adorned with a long-forgotten crest of Stormveil, ancient in design.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in Stormveil Castle, near the Rampart Tower Site of Grace.

fields.name: Beast Crest Heater Shield
fields.description:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.

Features a beast as its crest, serving to remind warriors not to succumb to the arousal of battle. Fight with passion, but become not its prisoner.
fields.location: Dropped by a Beast Crest Heater Knight in Limgrave, near the Warmaster’s Shack.

fields.name: Red Crest Heater Shield
fields.description:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.

The crest symbolizes red wings.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in Fort Haight, in Limgrave.

fields.name: Blue Crest Heater Shield
fields.description:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.

The crest represents a forest and river.
fields.location: Found on a corpse inside the Church of Pilgrimage, Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Eclipse Crest Heater Shield
fields.description:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.

The sun in eclipse is said to be the symbol of the Wandering Mausoleum where the soulless demigods slumber.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Church of Pilgrimage, on the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Inverted Hawk Heater Shield
fields.description:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.

The inverted hawk is the emblem of the company of slaves ordered to explore the Eternal City.
fields.location: Dropped by Banished Knights in Castle Sol, Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Heater Shield
fields.description:
A medium-sized metal shield, comparatively easy to handle.

Metal shields reliably negate physical damage when guarding, a trait which made them highly trusted on the battlefield.
fields.location: Sold by the Nomadic Merchant in the Weeping Peninsula, south of the Castle Morne Rampart Site of Grace.

fields.name: Black Leather Shield
fields.description:
Roundshield covered in black leather. On the larger side for a medium-sized shield.

From the north, this shield depicts the polar star in rivets of gold. The inside is lined with fur, protecting the carrier from frost.
fields.location: Dropped by Black Knife Assassins, commonly found in Ordina, Liturgical Town (Consecrated Snowfield).

fields.name: Dragon Towershield
fields.description:
Tower shield engraved with a dragon, symbol of protection. Heavy even among greatshields, it possesses exceptional guarding ability.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
fields.location: Dropped by Draconic Tree Sentinel boss at the Farum Greatbridge in Caelid (Dragonbarrow).

fields.name: Distinguished Greatshield
fields.description:
Greatshield featuring sumptuous ornamentation used by the scions of great families.

Due to their excessive size, these shields were at times seen as the hallmark of little lordlings who were too timid to earn a few nicks and scratches.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in Leyndell, Royal Capital, near the Fortified Manor.

fields.name: Crucible Hornshield
fields.description:
Greatshield of red-tinged gold carried by Crucible Knights. Features a great horn.

An ancient holiness dwells within. The crucible horn skewers foes when performing shield bashes.
fields.location: Dropped by Crucible Knights wielding this shield in Siofra Aqueduct, Nokron, Eternal City.

fields.name: Dragonclaw Shield
fields.description:
Greatshield said to have been whittled from the claw of a great, ancient dragon, wielded by grotesque Tree Sentinels who yet serve the Erdtree.

Imbued with lightning.
fields.location: Dropped by the Draconic Tree Sentinel boss at the Capital Outskirts, before the entrance to Leyndell.

fields.name: Briar Greatshield
fields.description:
Greatshield from a foreign land, used by Elemer of the Briar. Attacks with this armament utilize the iron thorns that have been wound around its frame.

Originates from Eochaid, a land of proudly solitary ascetics.
fields.location: Dropped by Elemer of the Briar, the boss of The Shaded Castle in Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Erdtree Greatshield
fields.description:
Weighty greatshield forged of gold carried by the order of Tree Sentinels, heavily equipped knights. Blessed by an old incantation of protection.

The living rampart of the Erdtree, the Tree Sentinels are the standard to which all defenders of the Erdtree aspire.
fields.location: Dropped by the duo of Tree Sentinels boss at the entrance to Leyndell, Royal Capital.

fields.name: Golden Beast Crest Shield
fields.description:
Shield of dull gold with a beast engraved as its crest. Lighter than most greatshields, and subsequently easier to wield.

The beast depicted is Serosh, aged counselor who guides the golden lineage.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the northeast of the Altus Plateau, near the Minor Erdtree Church.

fields.name: Jellyfish Shield
fields.description:
The head of a spirit jellyfish, commonly found floating above sacred ground throughout the Lands Between, wielded without modification as a shield.

The see-through head is extremely light, but its flesh is supple, providing absolutely no protection from piercing attacks.
fields.location: Sitting on a cart surrounded by four giant jellyfish, on the road north of the Foot of the Four Belfries Site of Grace in Liurnia of the Lakes.

fields.name: Fingerprint Stone Shield
fields.description: A great stone shield with an intricately carved fingerprint design. One of the heaviest of all greatshields. Part of the tomb of an ancient god, the Readerless Fingers relayed their message through these imprints, said to be the very seeds from which frenzy first sprouted.
fields.location: Found at the bottom of the Cathedral of the Forsaken, behind the altar in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds beneath Leyndell.

fields.name: Icon Shield
fields.description:
Greatshield painted with a divine scene; the recipience of a blessed tear from the Erdtree. An item that looks back fondly on the age of plenty.

The divine scene acts in and of itself as a sacred invocation; gradually restoring the carrier's HP.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in a small ruined building along the cliffs southeast of the Minor Erdtree in Altus Plateau.

fields.name: One-Eyed Shield
fields.description:
Tricksome shield made from white stone depicting a malformed one-eyed god. The barrel of a firearm pokes through the open mouth.

Once worshipped by the giants, this evil deity is believed to have been slain by Queen Marika.
fields.location: Dropped by the Fire Giant Chief boss at the top of Guardian's Garrison, in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Visage Shield
fields.description:
Tricksome bronze shield depicting the face of a Fire Giant. Several tongues leap from its open mouth.

The dreadful visage and burning flames are designed to remind one of the horror of facing a Fire Giant. In other words, this shield has an instructional function.
fields.location: Dropped by the Mad Pumpkin Head Duo boss in the basement of the Caelem Ruins, located in central Caelid.

fields.name: Spiked Palisade Shield
fields.description:
A large wooden shield covered with spikes. Though relatively light, it lacks in damage negation.

Designed to perform shield bashes, these attacks riddle the enemy with holes, earning it the nickname of "pard shield."
fields.location: Found on a corpse at the end of the wooden bridge leading to the northern entrance of the Grand Lift of Dectus, in northern Caelid.

fields.name: Manor Towershield
fields.description:
An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Depicts the Roundtable Hold, gathering place of champions.

Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in Caria Manor, in the upper levels after defeating Royal Knight Loretta.

fields.name: Crossed-Tree Towershield
fields.description:
An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Emblazoned with an old, interleaving tree.

Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.
fields.location: Dropped by soldiers in Leyndell, Royal Capital.

fields.name: Inverted Hawk Towershield
fields.description:
An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Features an inverted hawk crest.

Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.
fields.location: Dropped by Banished Knights in Castle Sol, Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Ant's Skull Plate
fields.description:
Huge head of one of the giant ants which inhabit the two underground rivers, used without modification as a shield. Excels at repelling enemy attacks.

Giant ants are venomous creatures, granting a boost to immunity when wielding this shield.
fields.location: Dropped by the giant ant enemies in Nokstella, Eternal City.

fields.name: Redmane Greatshield
fields.description: Greatshield shaped like a fang, featuring the crest of red-maned lion. Carried by the Redmane Knights who fought alongside Radahn.
fields.location: Dropped by the Redmane Knight in Redmane Castle, Caelid.

fields.name: Eclipse Crest Greatshield
fields.description:
Metal greatshield painted with a sun in eclipse. Carried by the headless mausoleum knights.

The eclipsed sun, drained of color, is the protective star of soulless demigods. It aids the mausoleum knights by keeping Destined Death at bay.
fields.location: Found in Castle Sol, on a corpse in the church near the main gate.

fields.name: Cuckoo Greatshield
fields.description:
Metal greatshield painted with a peering cuckoo. Carried by the enchanted knights sworn to the academy.

Boasting high magic damage negation, this shield is used to hunt down mages.
"Our enemy is none other than Caria itself."
fields.location: Dropped by Cuckoo Knights in Raya Lucaria Academy.

fields.name: Golden Greatshield
fields.description:
Oval greatshield made of gold, carried by knights who protect the Royal Capital of Leyndell.

Knights of Leyndell are reputed for their sturdiness, exemplified by this shield's exceptional guard capacity.
fields.location: Dropped by gold-armored knights in Leyndell, Royal Capital.

fields.name: Gilded Greatshield
fields.description:
Metal greatshield coated with gold. Carried by knights loyal to Godrick.

The red tinge in the gold coat mirrors the primordial matter that became the Erdtree. The color of homeward yearning.
fields.location: Dropped by Leyndell Knights wielding this shield in Leyndell, Royal Capital.

fields.name: Haligtree Crest Greatshield
fields.description: Metal greatshield depicting the Haligtree with unalloyed gold. Carried by knights who have vowed to serve Miquella's Haligtree. Possesses high holy damage negation. Yet now, with the Haligtree misshapen, this wondrous rendition is a fleeting fantasy.
fields.location: Dropped by two Cleanrot Knights in Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree, near the Drainage Channel Site of Grace.

fields.name: Wooden Greatshield
fields.description:
Wooden greatshield reinforced with a metal ornamentation.

Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.
fields.location: Dropped by soldiers in Leyndell, Royal Capital, and occasionally by other shield-bearing enemies.

fields.name: Lordsworn's Shield
fields.description:
Wooden tower shield. Lightweight for a greatshield and easy to handle.
Commonly used in the Shattering.

Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick soldiers using this shield, found in Limgrave and Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Glintstone Staff
fields.description:
Staff with a glintstone embedded at the tip. A catalyst for casting sorceries.

Sorceries must be memorized first at a site of lost grace, and a staff must be equipped to cast them.
fields.location: Dropped by sorcerer enemies in Raya Lucaria Academy.

fields.name: Crystal Staff
fields.description:
Staff fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enhances Crystalian sorceries.

The Crystalian's faint cogitation is known as the "wisdom of stone." This staff can only be wielded by those of intellect high enough to grasp such wisdom.
fields.location: Found in a chest at the top of the Academy Crystal Cave, behind a boss room in Liurnia of the Lakes.

fields.name: Gelmir Glintstone Staff
fields.description:
Staff with a forked tip, embedded with red glintstones. Enhances lava sorceries.

The Man-Serpents of Mt. Gelmir draw from faith in addition to intelligence to enhance the potency of their sorcery.
fields.location: Found in the Volcano Manor, on a corpse in a room accessed through the prison town area.

fields.name: Demi-Human Queen's Staff
fields.description:
Glintstone staff styled as a scepter. A gift once given to the demi-humans to foster peace, it can be wielded even by those of low intelligence.

Sneered at by fools in the academy.
fields.location: Dropped by the Demi-Human Queen boss in the Demi-Human Forest Ruins, Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Carian Regal Scepter
fields.description:
Magic scepter of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. The glintstone is known as a Carian Blue, enhancing full moon sorceries.

Only those of the highest intelligence may wield this, the finest of all glintstone staves.
fields.location: Trade Remembrance of the Full Moon Queen (Rennala) with Enia at Roundtable Hold.

fields.name: Digger's Staff
fields.description:
Staff of a sorcerer-miner who extracts glintstone from crystal tunnels. The staff itself is a tool used to mine, and the ferrule is also embedded with a glintstone.

Boosts the power of Stonedigger sorceries.
fields.location: Dropped by Glintstone Miner enemies in Sellia Crystal Tunnel and Raya Lucaria Crystal Tunnel.

fields.name: Astrologer's Staff
fields.description:
Staff of the astrologers. A glintstone is embedded in the tip, enabling it to be used as a catalyst for sorceries.

Sorceries must be memorized first at a site of lost grace, and a staff must be equipped to cast them.
fields.location: Starting weapon for the Astrologer class; also sold by the Nomadic Merchant in Liurnia of the Lakes.

fields.name: Carian Glintblade Staff
fields.description:
Staff embedded with a blue glintstone. One of two types of Carian staff.

Gifted to enchanted knights, it enhances Glintblade sorceries.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the Highway Lookout Tower, in eastern Liurnia of the Lakes.

fields.name: Prince of Death's Staff
fields.description:
Staff embedded with sullied amber, said to be a very part of the Prince of Death. Enhances death sorceries.

One of the staves deemed heretical by the academy for its ability to allow sorceries to be augmented through faith in addition to intelligence.
fields.location: Found in Deeproot Depths, on a corpse near the Nameless Eternal City Site of Grace.

fields.name: Albinauric Staff
fields.description:
Short staff with a blue glintstone embedded. Wielded by the Albinaurics of old.

The Albinaurics harbor a secret; they cast sorcery using their innate arcaneness.
fields.location: Found in Volcano Manor, in a small side room near the Guest Hall Site of Grace.

fields.name: Academy Glintstone Staff
fields.description:
Staff of the Academy of Raya Lucaria, embedded with a turquoise glintstone.

Only a recognized sorcerer is permitted to wield this staff.
fields.location: Dropped by sorcerer enemies in Raya Lucaria Academy, or found in a chest in the same area.

fields.name: Carian Glintstone Staff
fields.description:
Staff embedded with a blue glintstone. One of two types of Carian staff.

Given to sorcerers that they might enact the role of knight. Enhances Carian sword sorceries.
fields.location: Found in Caria Manor, on a corpse in the upper level accessed after defeating Royal Knight Loretta.

fields.name: Azur's Glintstone Staff
fields.description:
Staff of the primeval glintstone sorcerer Azur. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone may wield it.

Reduces casting time of all sorceries, but consumes additional FP.
fields.location: Found in Raya Lucaria Academy, in a chest guarded by a Crystallian near the Church of the Cuckoo.

fields.name: Lusat's Glintstone Staff
fields.description:
Staff of the primeval glintstone sorcerer Lusat. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone may wield it.

Enhances power of all sorceries, but consumes additional FP.
fields.location: Dropped by defeating the boss duo (Nox Swordstress & Nox Priest) in Sellia, Town of Sorcery, then opening the chest in Lusat’s room (requires a key from Sellen’s quest).

fields.name: Meteorite Staff
fields.description:
Staff embedded with a dark purple glintstone, said to be the fragment of a meteorite. Boasts high sorcery scaling and boosts gravity sorceries as well.

However, this staff cannot be strengthened in any way.
fields.location: Found on a corpse hanging from a window in the Street of Sages Ruins, in the swamp area of Caelid.

fields.name: Staff of the Guilty
fields.description:
A heretical staff fashioned from a smoldering, withered sapling that turns the blood of sacrifices pierced by it into glintstone. Similar to hex magic.

Sorceries are scaled with faith rather than intelligence when wielding this staff which enhances thorn sorceries in particular.
fields.location: Dropped by Thorn Sorcerers in the Prison Town Church area of Volcano Manor.

fields.name: Rotten Crystal Staff
fields.description:
Staff fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. It festers with scarlet rot.

Enhances Crystalian sorceries.
fields.location: Dropped by the Crystalian mage in Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree (late-game area).

fields.name: Staff of Loss
fields.description:
Staff missing its glintstone. Wielded by sorcerers who believe that discovery comes through acts of asceticism.

This staff only distinguishes itself when casting invisibility sorceries, but that is reason enough for some to wield it.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in Sellia, Town of Sorcery, in eastern Caelid. Climb along rooftops to reach it.

fields.name: Finger Seal
fields.description:
A sacred seal bestowed by a Finger Maiden which serves as a catalyst for casting sacred incantations.

Incantations must be memorized first at a site of grace, and a sacred seal must be equipped to cast them.
fields.location: Sold by the Twin Maiden Husks at the Roundtable Hold for 800 runes.

fields.name: Godslayer's Seal
fields.description:
Sacred seal of the Godskin Apostles, inlaid with obsidian.

Said to represent the manipulation of black flame, this catalyst enhances godslayer incantations.
fields.location: Found in a chest at the bottom of a basement in the Rampart Tower area of Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Giant's Seal
fields.description:
Sacred seal depicting the one-eyed god of the Fire Giants, adorned with braids of red hair.

Sacred seal wielded by Fire Monks and Prelates, this catalyst enhances Giants' Flame incantations.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Giant-Conquering Hero's Grave, located in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Gravel Stone Seal
fields.description:
Sacred seal made from Gravel Stone thought to be an ancient dragon scale. Enhances Dragon Cult incantations of the Royal Capital.

The worship of the ancient dragons does not conflict with belief in the Erdtree. After all, this seal, and lightning itself, are both imbued with gold.
fields.location: Dropped by a Leyndell knight wielding a spear and the Gravel Stone Seal, found near the West Capital Rampart Site of Grace in Leyndell, Royal Capital.

fields.name: Clawmark Seal
fields.description:
Sacred seal granted by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman. A rare trinket which allows incantations to be scaled with strength.

The claw mark represents Gurranq's wrath. Enhances bestial incantations learned from Gurranq.
fields.location: Reward for giving a Deathroot to Gurranq, Beast Clergyman, in the Bestial Sanctum (Caelid).

fields.name: Golden Order Seal
fields.description:
A formless sacred seal depicting the ceremonial observation of Order. Enhances Golden Order Fundamentalist incantations.

Fundamentalism is scholarship in all but name. Scales incantations using both intelligence and faith.
fields.location: Found in a corpse in a room at the Minor Erdtree Church, Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Erdtree Seal
fields.description:
A formless sacred seal decorated with an Erdtree crest, once the focus of religion in the Lands Between.

Even though the Elden Ring is shattered, and the Erdtree has dulled from its former radiance, earnest faith continues to hold the answers.
fields.location: Found on a corpse in the Prison Town Church area of Volcano Manor.

fields.name: Dragon Communion Seal
fields.description:
Formless drakeblood seal with a dragon communion crest. Enhances Dragon Communion incantations.

The sacrificial devouring of the heart gives power.
Indeed, Dragon Communion is too primal in nature for the term "incantation" to be appropriate.
This seal scales incantations with one's arcane attribute.
fields.location: Found in Fringefolk Hero’s Grave, on a corpse behind a chariot trap.

fields.name: Frenzied Flame Seal
fields.description:
Formless sacred seal bestowed by the maiden of the Three Fingers. Enhances incantations of the frenzied flame.

This seal is the mark of the Lord of Frenzied Flame. Scales incantations using strength, dexterity, intelligence, and faith all together.
fields.location: Found in a chest in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds beneath Leyndell, after progressing through the Frenzied Flame questline.

fields.name: Shortbow
fields.description:
Small bow made to fire arrows over great distances. Other than its ability to fire off arrows in rapid succession, it is also well-suited for use on horseback.

To use a bow, arrows must also be equipped.
fields.location: Starting weapon for the Bandit class; also sold by the Twin Maiden Husks at Roundtable Hold.

fields.name: Misbegotten Shortbow
fields.description:
Shortbow wielded by Winged Misbegotten. Fine fur clings to it.

Designed to inflict additional damage by sacrificing range.
fields.location: Dropped by Misbegotten archers in Castle Morne.

fields.name: Red Branch Shortbow
fields.description:
Shortbow of polished red wood. Fashioned by a master craftsman and wielded by pages.

A bow which requires dexterity rather than strength to master.
fields.location: Dropped by skeletal archers in the Consecrated Snowfield.

fields.name: Harp Bow
fields.description:
Bow fashioned from a minstrel's harp. Sonorous tones still resound when firing arrows.

Troubadours sing tales of champions, both in the honorable service of the Erdtree, and the one who spurns honor for blasphemy.
fields.location: Found in the Shaded Castle, on a corpse in the upper levels.

fields.name: Composite Bow
fields.description:
Bow composited from a mix of materials.

Demands high attributes, and is tricky to wield, but is a fearsome tool when mastered.
fields.location: Sold by the Nomadic Merchant in the northwest of the Weeping Peninsula.

fields.name: Longbow
fields.description:
Longbow made to fire arrows over great distances. Compared to a shortbow, arrows fired reach further and deal more damage.

To use a bow, arrows must also be equipped.
fields.location: Sold by the Twin Maiden Husks at the Roundtable Hold after giving them the Bell Bearing from a merchant in Liurnia.

fields.name: Albinauric Bow
fields.description:
Longbow featuring delicate silverwork. Wielded by Albinauric wolfback archers.

This bow requires dexterity over strength to master.
fields.location: Dropped by Albinauric archers in the Consecrated Snowfield.

fields.name: Horn Bow
fields.description:
Longbow made from animal horn. Wielded by the master hunters of the ancestral followers.

Imbues arrows fired with magic damage.
Reveals its true worth when used with magic-infused arrows.
fields.location: Found in Siofra River, on a corpse near the Hallowhorn Grounds.

fields.name: Erdtree Bow
fields.description:
Longbow featuring Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Arrow.

Scales all arrow damage with faith, revealing its true worth when used with holy-infused arrows.
fields.location: Found in a chest inside the Erdtree Sanctuary in Leyndell, Royal Capital.

fields.name: Serpent Bow
fields.description:
Malformed bow in the shape of a pair of poisonous snakes. Imbues arrows with poison through pagan magic, revealing its true worth when used with poison-infused arrows.

Used by assassins known as the Formless Serpents.
fields.location: Found inside the Abandoned Cave in Caelid, on a corpse near the back of the cave.

fields.name: Pulley Bow
fields.description:
Longbow which utilizes a series of pulleys and springs. The complex mechanism, which required advanced mathematical and mechanical understanding to craft, was likely made by a certain genius who learned Golden Order fundamentalism.

Enhances precision while shooting, enabling arrows to fly much further distances.
fields.location: Located at the top of Mt. Gelmir, on a corpse near the First Mt. Gelmir Campsite Site of Grace.

fields.name: Black Bow
fields.description:
Longbow carved from black wood to resemble a blade. One of the most difficult bows to master.

The blade-like body of the bow is light and cuts through the air. Though a longbow, it can be wielded similarly to a shortbow.
fields.location: Found on a corpse atop a rooftop in Leyndell, Royal Capital, near the Avenue Balcony Site of Grace.

fields.name: Lion Greatbow
fields.description:
Greatbow of black iron wielded by General Radahn. Decorated with a lion mane motif.

Imbued with gravitational power of the Starscourge, when used along with Radahn's Spear, it becomes a true weapon of a champion.
fields.location: Given as a reward for defeating Starscourge Radahn in Redmane Castle

fields.name: Golem Greatbow
fields.description:
Greatbow of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Weapon of the Guardian Golem.

Extremely heavy, this greatbow requires enormous strength just to draw, suggesting it was not designed for human use.
fields.location: Dropped by Golem archers found in Limgrave and Caelid.

fields.name: Erdtree Greatbow
fields.description:
Greatbow featuring Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Great Arrow.

Scales all arrow damage with faith, revealing its true worth when used with holy-infused arrows.
fields.location: Found in a chest atop the Minor Erdtree Church in Leyndell, Royal Capital.

fields.name: Greatbow
fields.description:
Enormous greatbow larger than any man. Can not be drawn with any ordinary level of strength, but the force of its shots is extraordinary.

A greatbow can only fire great arrows.
fields.location: Dropped by Lion Guardians in Leyndell, Royal Capital, and can also be found in the Siofra River area.

fields.name: Soldier's Crossbow
fields.description:
A crossbow of simple make, usable by anyone, but lacking in both power and accuracy.

Bolts must be equipped to use a crossbow.
fields.location: Dropped by Godrick Soldiers wielding crossbows, found in Stormveil Castle and Gatefront Ruins.

fields.name: Light Crossbow
fields.description:
Ranged weapon made from a bow fixed to a stock. Deals good damage and is simple to use, but requires reloading after firing.

Bolts must be equipped to use a crossbow.
fields.location: Dropped by soldiers using light crossbows, commonly found in Gatefront Ruins and other early Limgrave camps.

fields.name: Heavy Crossbow
fields.description:
Heavy crossbow with iron limbs, increasing damage dealt.

Commonly employed in the Shattering.
fields.location: Dropped by soldiers wielding heavy crossbows in Fort Haight (Limgrave) and some other soldier camps.

fields.name: Pulley Crossbow
fields.description:
Crossbow made with pulleys and power springs. The complex mechanism, which required advanced mathematical and mechanical understanding to craft, was likely made by a certain genius who learned Golden Order fundamentalism.
One touch fires a volley of bolts. Be warned; large stores of bolts can be quickly spent.
fields.location: Found on the roof of the Craftsman's Shack in Mt. Gelmir, west of the Shack of the Lofty.

fields.name: Full Moon Crossbow
fields.description: One-of-a-kind enchanted crossbow of exquisitely detailed craftsmanship. Made to celebrate the matrimonial union, and reconciliation, between the houses of the Erdtree and the Full Moon, Leyndell and Raya Lucaria. The two rings dance when reloading the weapon. Reveals true worth when used with holy-infused bolts.
fields.location: Found in a bell tower on the rooftops of Raya Lucaria Academy. From the Debate Parlor Site of Grace, navigate across the rooftops, defeat the enemies, and climb the ladder inside the bell tower to find the crossbow in a chest.

fields.name: Arbalest
fields.description:
Large crossbow made from composite materials. One of the largest of all bolt-firing devices.

Its limbs are more pliable than metallic ones, allowing bolts fired from this weapon to pierce even helms forged of steel.
fields.location: Located in Stormveil Castle (West Limgrave). From the main courtyard, head to the ramparts with ballistae. The Arbalest is on the right side of the wall, accessible by dropping down from the upper ramparts and crossing the rooftops.

fields.name: Crepus's Black-Key Crossbow
fields.description:
Black crossbow featuring a long stock. Used for sniping, it has a very long range.

Weapon of Crepus, who served the Two Fingers from the shadows of the Roundtable as the head confessor.
fields.location: Inside Roundtable Hold, behind the first Stonesword Key door (near the blacksmith). Use one Stonesword Key to unlock the door and open the chest inside to claim the crossbow.

fields.name: Hand Ballista
fields.description:
An unconventional ballistic device modelled on a weapon used to besiege castles. Only capable of firing greatbolts.

Perfect for reckless acts such as storming a castle or facing an entire army alone.
fields.location: Found at the top of the Forest Lookout Tower in the Weeping Peninsula, southwest of the Bridge of Sacrifice. The tower is guarded by several soldiers.

fields.name: Jar Cannon
fields.description:
Jar cannon which uses explosives to fire greatbolts. Deals great damage but is slow to reload.

Experimental firearm brought to the assault on Volcano Manor, where it was discovered that no one knew how to use it.
fields.location: Dropped by Demi-Human Queen Margot, the boss at the end of Volcano Cave (Mt. Gelmir, north of the Ninth Mt. Gelmir Campsite).

fields.name: Crimson Amber Medallion
fields.description:
A medallion with crimson amber inlaid.
Boosts maximum HP.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The medallion is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Crimson Amber Medallion +1
fields.description:
A medallion with crimson amber inlaid.
Greatly boosts maximum HP.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The upgraded medallion is on a corpse deeper inside the church.

fields.name: Crimson Amber Medallion +2
fields.description:
A medallion with crimson amber inlaid.
Vastly boosts maximum HP.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The highest upgraded medallion is on a corpse in the deepest part of the church.

fields.name: Cerulean Amber Medallion
fields.description:
A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid.
Boosts maximum FP.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The medallion is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Cerulean Amber Medallion +1
fields.description:
A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid.
Greatly boosts maximum FP.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The upgraded medallion is on a corpse deeper inside the ruins.

fields.name: Cerulean Amber Medallion +2
fields.description:
A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid.
Vastly boosts maximum FP.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The highest upgraded medallion is on a corpse in the deepest part of the ruins.

fields.name: Viridian Amber Medallion
fields.description:
A medallion with viridian amber inlaid.
Boosts maximum stamina.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The medallion is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Viridian Amber Medallion +1
fields.description:
A medallion with viridian amber inlaid.
Greatly boosts maximum stamina.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
fields.location: Found deeper inside the Tombsward Ruins in the Weeping Peninsula. The upgraded medallion is on a corpse in a hidden chamber.

fields.name: Viridian Amber Medallion +2
fields.description:
A medallion with viridian amber inlaid.
Vastly boosts maximum stamina.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
fields.location: Found deeper inside the Tombsward Ruins in the Weeping Peninsula. The highest upgraded medallion is on a corpse in the deepest part of the ruins.

fields.name: Arsenal Charm
fields.description:
An iron charm that resembles a mass of weaponry.
Boosts maximum equipment load.

This talisman was derived from an unusual greatsword once wielded by a hero hungry for vengeance.
fields.location: Found in the Volcano Manor. From the Temple of Eiglay site of grace, explore the manor’s chambers and look for the talisman on a corpse in a side room.

fields.name: Arsenal Charm +1
fields.description:
An iron charm that resembles a mass of weaponry.
Greatly boosts maximum equipment load.

This talisman was derived from an unusual greatsword once wielded by a hero hungry for vengeance.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau. From the Altus Highway Junction site of grace, head north and explore the ruins near the outer wall. The talisman is on a corpse inside a ruined structure.

fields.name: Great-Jar's Arsenal
fields.description:
A charm that resembles a great jar overflowing with weaponry.
Vastly boosts maximum equipment load.

The great jar grants this talisman to their warriors.
Carry as much as you can—grow big and strong.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Erdtree's Favor
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a special blessing of the Erdtree.
Slightly raises maximum HP, stamina, and equip load.

It is said that when the Age of the Erdtree began, such blessings were personally bestowed upon their recipients by Queen Marika herself.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Erdtree's Favor +1
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a special blessing of the Erdtree.
Raises maximum HP, stamina, and equip load.

It is said that when the Age of the Erdtree began, such blessings were personally bestowed upon their recipients by Queen Marika herself.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The upgraded talisman is on a corpse deeper inside the ruins.

fields.name: Erdtree's Favor +2
fields.description:
A legendary talisman depicting a special blessing of the Erdtree.

Greatly raises maximum HP, stamina, and equip load.

It is said that when the Age of the Erdtree began, such blessings were personally bestowed upon their recipients by Queen Marika herself.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The highest upgraded talisman is on a corpse in the deepest part of the ruins.

fields.name: Radagon's Scarseal
fields.description:
An eye engraved with an Elden Rune.
Said to be the seal of King Consort Radagon.

Raises vigor, endurance, strength, and dexterity, but also increases damage taken.

These seals represent the lifelong duty of those chosen by the gods.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Radagon's Soreseal
fields.description:
This legendary talisman is an eye engraved with an Elden Rune, said to be the seal of King Consort Radagon.

Greatly raises vigor, endurance, strength, and dexterity, but also increases damage taken by a similar measure.

Solemn duty weighs upon the one beholden; not unlike a gnawing curse from which there is no deliverance.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse deeper inside the ruins.

fields.name: Starscourge Heirloom
fields.description:
A talisman engraved with a scene from a heroic tale.
Raises strength.

The mightiest hero of the demigods confronted the falling stars alone—and thus did he crush them, his conquest sealing the very fate of the stars.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The heirloom is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Prosthesis-Wearer Heirloom
fields.description:
A talisman engraved with a scene from a heroic tale.
Raises dexterity.

Though born into the accursed rot, when the young girl encountered her mentor and his flowing blade, she gained wings of unparalleled strength.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The heirloom is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Stargazer Heirloom
fields.description:
A talisman engraved with the legend of a queen.
Raises intelligence.

The young astrologer gazed at the night sky as she walked. She had always chased the stars every step of her journey. Then she met the full moon—and, in time, the astrologer became a queen.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The heirloom is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Two Fingers Heirloom
fields.description:
A talisman engraved with the legend of the Two Fingers.
Raises faith.

Fingers cannot speak, yet these were eloquent.
Persistently did they wriggle, spelling out mysteries in the air.
Thus did we gain the words. The words of our faith.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The heirloom is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Silver Scarab
fields.description:
A talisman facsimile of a scarab, the carrier of treasures and precious things.

This silver scarab enhances item discovery.
fields.location: Found in the Abandoned Cave in Caelid. From the Smoldering Wall site of grace, enter the cave and explore the tunnels. The scarab is on a corpse guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Gold Scarab
fields.description:
