A talisman facsimile of a scarab, the carrier of treasures and precious things.

This golden scarab increases the amount of runes obtained from defeating enemies.
fields.location: Found in the Abandoned Cave in Caelid. From the Smoldering Wall site of grace, enter the cave and explore the tunnels. The scarab is on a corpse guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Moon of Nokstella
fields.description:
This legendary talisman is a treasure of Nokstella, the Eternal City.

Increases memory slots.

This talisman represents the lost black moon.
The moon of Nokstella was the guide of countless stars.
fields.location: Found in the Moonlight Altar area in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head north to the altar. The talisman is on a corpse near the altar.

fields.name: Green Turtle Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman in the shape of a green turtle.
Raises stamina recovery speed.

Turtles are known as a nutritious ingredient, symbolic of inexhaustible power.

However, those who hold turtles to be wise creatures consider the practice of eating their meat to be barbarous.
fields.location: Found in the Lake of Rot area in Liurnia. From the Grand Library site of grace, head south to the Rot Lake. The talisman is on a corpse near the water’s edge, guarded by poison-spewing enemies.

fields.name: Stalwart Horn Charm
fields.description:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers.
Raises robustness.
(Robustness governs resistance to blood loss and frost.)

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The charm is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Stalwart Horn Charm +1
fields.description:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers.
Greatly raises robustness.
(Robustness governs resistance to blood loss and frost.)

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
fields.location: Found deeper inside the Tombsward Ruins in the Weeping Peninsula. The upgraded charm is on a corpse in a hidden chamber.

fields.name: Immunizing Horn Charm
fields.description:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers.
Raises immunity.
(Immunity governs resistance to poison and rot.)

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
fields.location: Located in the Abandoned Cave in Caelid. From the Smoldering Wall site of grace, enter the cave and explore the tunnels. The charm is on a corpse guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Immunizing Horn Charm +1
fields.description:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers.
Greatly raises immunity.
(Immunity governs resistance to poison and rot.)

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
fields.location: Found deeper inside the Abandoned Cave in Caelid. The upgraded charm is on a corpse in a more hidden area.

fields.name: Clarifying Horn Charm
fields.description:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers.
Raises focus.
(Focus governs resistance to sleep and madness.)

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The charm is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Clarifying Horn Charm +1
fields.description:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers.
Greatly raises focus.
(Focus governs resistance to sleep and madness.)

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The upgraded charm is on a corpse deeper inside the church.

fields.name: Prince of Death's Pustule
fields.description:
A fetid pustule taken from facial flesh.
Raises vitality.
(Vitality governs resistance to the effects of Death.)

It is said that this pustule came from the visage of the Prince of Death, he who used to be called Godwyn. As First Dead of the demigods, it's said he's buried deep under the capital, at the Erdtree's roots.
fields.location: Found in the Abandoned Cave in Caelid. The pustule is on a corpse inside the cave.

fields.name: Prince of Death's Cyst
fields.description:
A fetid, overgrown cyst taken from facial flesh.
Greatly raises vitality.
(Vitality governs resistance to the effects of Death.)

It is said that this cyst came from the corrupted visage of one unable to die a true Death. Indeed, it comes from the Prince of Death, scion of the golden bough and First of the Dead among the demigods.
fields.location: Dropped by the boss of the Abandoned Cave in Caelid. The cyst is obtained after defeating the boss.

fields.name: Mottled Necklace
fields.description:
A vividly-colored accoutrement precious to the ancestral followers.

Raises immunity, robustness, and focus.

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The necklace is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Mottled Necklace +1
fields.description:
A vividly-colored accoutrement precious to the ancestral followers.

Greatly raises immunity, robustness, and focus.

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
fields.location: Found deeper inside the Tombsward Ruins in the Weeping Peninsula. The upgraded necklace is on a corpse in a hidden chamber.

fields.name: Bull-Goat's Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting the horns of a bull-goat.
Raises poise.

Bull-goats are associated with the stout and mighty Tragoth, said to be unflinching in combat—now a silent comrade to those who fight.
fields.location: Found in the Dragonbarrow Cave, which is in Caelid’s northern region. Navigate through the cave, defeat the two Bear bosses, and you’ll find the talisman in a chest inside the boss room.

fields.name: Marika's Scarseal
fields.description:
An eye engraved with an Elden Rune.
Said to be the seal of Queen Marika.

Raises mind, intelligence, faith, and arcane, but also increases damage taken.

These seals represent the lifelong duty of those chosen by the gods.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Marika's Soreseal
fields.description:
This legendary talisman is an eye engraved with an Elden Rune, said to be the seal of Queen Marika.

Greatly raises mind, intelligence, faith, and arcane, but also increases damage taken by a similar measure.

Solemn duty weighs upon the one beholden; not unlike a gnawing curse from which there is no deliverance.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse deeper inside the ruins.

fields.name: Warrior Jar Shard
fields.description:
Shard of a shattered warrior jar.

Boosts the attack power of skills.

Scraps of stewed flesh cling to the shard, and tatters of ornaments can be seen mingled within the slime. Relics of ancient royal warriors, perhaps.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The shard is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Shard of Alexander
fields.description:
Shard of the late Alexander, a shattered warrior jar.

Greatly boosts the attack power of skills.

Scraps of stewed flesh cling to the shard, and tatters of ornaments can be seen mingled within the slime. Relics of a red-haired champion, it would seem.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The shard is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Millicent's Prosthesis
fields.description:
Part of the golden prosthesis used by Millicent.
The hand is locked into a fist that once raised a sword aloft.

Boosts dexterity and raises attack power with successive attacks.

The despair of sweet betrayal transformed Millicent from a mere bud into a magnificent flower. And one day, she will be reborn—as a beautiful scarlet valkyrie.
fields.location: Awarded for completing part of Millicent’s questline. After reaching the end of her quest at Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree, you can choose to assist Millicent in her final battle. If you help her and she survives, you’ll receive Millicent’s Prosthesis as a reward

fields.name: Magic Scorpion Charm
fields.description:
A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen.
Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that shimmers with magic.

Raises magic attack power, but lowers damage negation.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, proceed to the rooftops and cross the bridges. The charm is on a corpse in a side area.

fields.name: Lightning Scorpion Charm
fields.description:
A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen.
Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that sparks with lightning.

Raises lightning attack power, but lowers damage negation.
fields.location: Located in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The charm is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Fire Scorpion Charm
fields.description:
A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen.
Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that burns with fire.

Raises fire attack power, but lowers damage negation.
fields.location: Found in the Caelid region. From the Smoldering Wall site of grace, head into the nearby ruins. The charm is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Sacred Scorpion Charm
fields.description:
A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen.
Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart with a blessed glow.

Raises holy attack power, but lowers damage negation.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The charm is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Red-Feathered Branchsword
fields.description:
A talisman adorned with red feathers, once used in ancient death rituals.
Raises attack power when HP is low.

The heart sings when one draws close to death, and a glorious end awaits those who cling so tenaciously to life.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The weapon is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Ritual Sword Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman patterned after swords used in ritual combat held to honor the Erdtree.

Raises attack power when HP is at maximum.

The practice had died out by the age of King Consort Radagon, but remains of the arenas where ritual combat took place can still be found in every land.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The talisman is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Spear Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a spear and a soldier.
Enhances the counterattacks that are unique to thrusting weapons.

Spears are standard weapons for soldiers in the Lands Between. They made it possible to respond to a ferocious foe with an equally ferocious counterattack.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Hammer Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a hammer and a knight.
Enhances stamina-reducing attacks against a blocking opponent.

Hammers are highly effective against shield-bearing foes, so much so that they are known as "knight-killers."
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Winged Sword Insignia
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a raised prosthetic blade.
An honor bestowed upon the knights who fought alongside Malenia the Severed.

Raises attack power with successive attacks.

The wings symbolize Malenia and her undefeated prowess. Though she never knew relief from the accursed rot she was born into, her blade was forever beautiful—and relentless.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The insignia is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Rotten Winged Sword Insignia
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a raised prosthetic blade.
An honor bestowed upon the valkyries who serve the Goddess of Rot.

Greatly raises attack power with successive attacks.

The four sisters were born in the Swamp of Aeonia, and came to the Haligtree under the aegis of Gowry. And yet, those buds were doomed to never blossom.
fields.location: Found in the Abandoned Cave in Caelid. From the Smoldering Wall site of grace, enter the cave and explore the tunnels. The insignia is on a corpse guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Dagger Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a dagger and a surgeon.
Enhances critical hits.

The white-garbed field surgeons come to the aid of friend and foe alike by dealing a final deadly thrust to spare them from the prolonged agony of a mortal wound. A sense of mercy is a catalyst for bloodlust.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Arrow's Reach Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting three arrows.
Carried by hunters of beasts.

Increases the effective range of bows.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Fourth Church of Marika site of grace, head south to the Poison Mist Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse inside the ruins, guarded by poison-spewing enemies.

fields.name: Blue Dancer Charm
fields.description:
A cloth doll depicting a dancer garbed in blue.
An ancient heirloom of some sort.

Raises attack power with lower equipment load.

The dancer in blue represents a fairy, who in legend bestowed a flowing sword upon a blind swordsman. Blade in hand, the swordsman sealed away an ancient god—a god that was Rot itself.
fields.location: Located in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The charm is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Twinblade Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a twinblade and a confessor.
Enhances the final hit ending a chain of attacks.

The twinblade technique is a tradition of the confessors, who closely guard the secret of how they preserve the momentum of their attacks. Thus is the final strike of their onslaught all the more deadly.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The talisman is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Axe Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting an axe and a warrior.
Enhances charge attacks.

The Lord who led the Long March bore an axe, and his loyal warriors honored him by wielding axes of their own, making them very effective at dealing decisive blows.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Lance Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a lance and a knight.
Enhances attacks while on horseback.

Knights on horseback are deadly foes. They see all below from their lofty position, meeting little meaningful resistance as they charge ahead.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau. From the Minor Erdtree Church, head east to a ruined building. The talisman is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Arrow's Sting Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting three iron arrows.
Carried by soldiers long ago.

Raises attack power of arrows and bolts.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau. From the Minor Erdtree Church, head east to a ruined building. The talisman is on a corpse inside, guarded by several enemies.

fields.name: Lord of Blood's Exultation
fields.description:
A talisman depicting the exultation of the Lord of Blood.

Raises attack power when blood loss occurs in the vicinity.

"Render up your offerings of blood to your Lord. Drench my consort's chamber. Slake his cocoon's thirst. His awakening shall herald the dawn of our dynasty."
fields.location: Dropped by Mohg, Lord of Blood, in the Mohgwyn Palace. After defeating the boss, the talisman is available.

fields.name: Kindred of Rot's Exultation
fields.description:
A talisman depicting the exultation of pests.

Raises attack power when poisoning or rot occurs in the vicinity.

"Rot for the scarlet goddess. O scarlet blossoms, flourish in distant lands, and return to us, the unwanted children."
fields.location: Obtained by defeating the boss of the Abandoned Cave in Caelid. The talisman is dropped after the fight.

fields.name: Claw Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a claw and an assassin.
Enhances jump attacks.

The assassins of Ravenmount are killers by trade. They assail their victims while dressed as birds of prey.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Roar Medallion
fields.description:
A bronze medallion depicting a roaring giant.
Enhances roars and breath attacks.

In ancient times, the giants were mortal enemies of the Erdtree. Their bellowing roars desolated nature, triggered avalanches, and whipped up storms of flame.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The medallion is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Curved Sword Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a curved sword and a swordsman.
Enhances guard counters.

It is said that a blind swordsman was the originator of this technique—the art of allowing one's opponent to strike so as to leave them vulnerable to a well-timed reply.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Companion Jar
fields.description:
A talisman given by the jars to their friends.
Raises potency of thrown jars.

Though the jars are brought to life by human flesh and blood, they are all rather kindly folk. Perhaps they were made to be better than their innards.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The jar is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Perfumer's Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a set of perfume bottles.
Raises potency of perfume items.

There are gardens known only to the perfumers. Whether hidden on the fringes of the highlands, or obscured by shadows inside caves, the flowers blossom in secret, waiting to impart their scent.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau. From the Minor Erdtree Church, head east to a ruined building. The talisman is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Graven-School Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a school of graven mages, the nightmare of the academy.

Raises potency of sorceries.

The primeval current is a forbidden tradition of glintstone sorcery. To those who cleave to its teachings, the act of collecting sorcerers to fashion them into the seeds of stars is but another path of scientific inquiry.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The talisman is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Graven-Mass Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman depicting the first school of graven mages—a nightmare that would continue to haunt the academy.

Greatly raises potency of sorceries.

The primeval current is a forbidden tradition of glintstone sorcery. To those who cleave to its teachings, the act of collecting sorcerers to fashion them into the seeds of stars is but another path of scientific inquiry.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The talisman is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Faithful's Canvas Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman bearing an icon that depicts a group of masked figures.
Raises potency of incantations.

The figures represent the flock at prayer, their firm belief in the intangible inspiring even the solitary founder of their religion.

What is faith if not an affirmation?
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Flock's Canvas Talisman
fields.description:
A talisman bearing an icon that depicts a mass of masked figures.
Greatly raises potency of incantations.

The figures represent the flock at prayer, their firm belief in the intangible inspiring even the solitary founder of their religion.

What is faith if not an affirmation?
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The talisman is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Old Lord's Talisman
fields.description:
A legendary talisman depicting the ancient king whose seat lies at the heart of the storm beyond time.

Extends the duration of sorceries and incantations.

It is said that the ancient royal city of Farum Azula has been slowly crumbling since time immemorial.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The talisman is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Radagon Icon
fields.description:
A legendary talisman depicting the Elden Lord Radagon.
Shortens the casting time of sorceries and incantations.

As the husband of Rennala of Caria, the red-haired Radagon studied sorcery, and as the husband of Queen Marika, he studied incantations. Thus did the hero aspire to be complete.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The icon is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Primal Glintstone Blade
fields.description:
An old glintstone blade that has been stained with blood.

Reduces FP consumption of sorceries and incantations at the cost of maximum HP.

The old sorcerers would slice open their hearts with these blades to imbue a primal glintstone with their soul, and thus did they die.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, proceed to the rooftops and cross the bridges. The talisman is on a corpse in a side area.

fields.name: Godfrey Icon
fields.description:
A legendary talisman depicting the Elden Lord Godfrey.
Raises charge attack power of sorceries, incantations, and skills.

Godfrey was a ferocious warrior. When he vowed to become a lord, he took the Beast Regent Serosh upon his back to suppress the ceaseless lust for battle that raged within.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The icon is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Glintstone Pebble
fields.description:
The most basic glintstone sorcery of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching magical projectiles at foes.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion.

This is a universal first step on the journey to true knowledge of sorcery.
fields.location: Purchased from Sorceress Sellen at the Waypoint Ruins in Limgrave after you meet her for the first time.

fields.name: Great Glintstone Shard
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching large magical projectiles at foes.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion.

Those unworthy of the stone crown typically end their brief journey into sorcery here.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The spell is on a corpse in one of these chambers.

fields.name: Dragoncrest Shield Talisman +2
fields.description:
Wrought iron talisman depicting a trio of ancient dragons.
Vastly boosts physical damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The upgraded talisman is on a corpse deeper inside the church.

fields.name: Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman
fields.description:
Legendary talisman of wrought iron depicting a massive ancient dragon.
Enormously boosts physical damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The talisman is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Swift Glintstone Shard
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching swift magical projectiles at foes.
This sorcery can be used without delay after performing another action.

Those unworthy of the stone crown typically end their brief journey into sorcery here.
fields.location: Purchased from Sorceress Sellen at the Waypoint Ruins in Limgrave after you meet her for the first time.

fields.name: Spelldrake Talisman +1
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a duo of blue ancient dragons.
Greatly boosts magic damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The talisman is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Spelldrake Talisman +2
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a trio of blue ancient dragons.
Vastly boosts magic damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
fields.location: Found deeper within the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave in the Mountaintops of the Giants. The talisman is on a corpse in a more secluded chamber.

fields.name: Glintstone Cometshard
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Fires a magical comet with a trailing tail.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging enhances potency.

A sorcery of the Karolos Conspectus, the most venerable of the academy.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, proceed to the rooftops and cross the bridges. The spell is on a corpse in a side area, overlooking the main courtyard.

fields.name: Comet
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Fires a great magical comet.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging enhances potency.

The greatest of the Karolos Conspectus's sorceries, that only a very few sorcerers have ever mastered.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor, head to the rooftops and cross the bridges. The spell is on a corpse in a side area, overlooking the main courtyard.

fields.name: Flamedrake Talisman +2
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a trio of red ancient dragons.
Vastly boosts fire damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The upgraded talisman is on a corpse deeper inside the church.

fields.name: Shard Spiral
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Fires twin projectiles that form a spiral as they travel. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion.
Charging enhances potency.

A sorcery of the Karolos Conspectus, the most venerable of the academy. This was the product of a failed attempt to create a new comet.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, proceed to the rooftops and cross the bridges. The spell is on a corpse in a side area, overlooking the main courtyard.

fields.name: Boltdrake Talisman +1
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a duo of yellow ancient dragons.
Greatly boosts lightning damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The talisman is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Boltdrake Talisman +2
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a trio of yellow ancient dragons.
Vastly boosts lightning damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The talisman is on a corpse in a deeper side chamber.

fields.name: Glintstone Stars
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Fires three magic shooting stars that pursue the target.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances potency.

A sorcery of the Olivinus Conspectus, which attracts sorcerers from Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The spell is on a corpse in one of these chambers.

fields.name: Haligdrake Talisman +1
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a duo of golden ancient dragons.
Greatly boosts holy damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
fields.location: Located in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The talisman is on a corpse in a side chamber guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Haligdrake Talisman +2
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a trio of golden ancient dragons.
Vastly boosts holy damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
fields.location: Found deeper within the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave in the Mountaintops of the Giants. The talisman is on a corpse in a more secluded chamber.

fields.name: Star Shower
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Fires six magic shooting stars that pursue the target.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances potency.

The most difficult to master of the Olivinus Conspectus sorceries.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The spell is on a corpse in one of these chambers, often guarded by academy sorcerers.

fields.name: Pearldrake Talisman +1
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a duo of pearlescent ancient dragons.
Greatly boosts non-physical damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
fields.location: Located in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The talisman is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Pearldrake Talisman +2
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a trio of pearlescent ancient dragons.
Vastly boosts non-physical damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.
And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
fields.location: Found deeper within the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave in the Mountaintops of the Giants. The talisman is on a corpse in a more secluded chamber.

fields.name: Crystal Barrage
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Fires a volley of glintstone crystal shards.
Charging increases potency.

A sorcery of the Crystal Cadre, a group of sorcerers who pursue the wisdom of stone—the secrets locked in the faint cogitation of the Crystalians.
fields.location: Found in the Academy Crystal Cave in Liurnia. After navigating the cave and defeating the boss, the spell is on a corpse in the final chamber.

fields.name: Glintstone Arc
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Fires a horizontal arc of magic that spreads outward.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion.

Granted to sorcerers who depart from the academy to embark on journeys, in order to fend off large groups of would-be adversaries. Fools often roam in packs.
fields.location: Purchased from Sorceress Sellen at the Waypoint Ruins in Limgrave after you meet her for the first time.

fields.name: Cannon of Haima
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Lobs an explosive magic projectile that flies in an arc.
Charging enhances potency.

Drawn from the conspectus of Haima, the adjudicator of the academy, this sorcery employs might as a means to quell conflict.
fields.location: Located in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed to the Debate Parlor and then up the stairs to the rooftops. The spell is found on a corpse in a side area, overlooking the courtyard.

fields.name: Crystal Burst
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Fires a burst of glintstone crystal shards.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging increases potency.

A sorcery of the Crystal Cadre, a group of sorcerers who pursued the wisdom of stone—the secrets locked in the faint cogitation of the Crystalians.
fields.location: Located in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The spell is on a corpse in one of these side chambers.

fields.name: Shatter Earth
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Imbues the ferrule of the caster's staff with magic, then thrusts it into the ground to create a magical shockwave.
Allows one follow-up attack.

A Stonedigger sorcery used by the glintstone miners of the crystal tunnel. At the academy, use of this sorcery was a stigma that marked out failed scholars.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The spell is on a corpse in one of these chambers.

fields.name: Rock Blaster
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Imbues the ferrule of the caster's staff with magic, then thrusts it into the ground to create a massive magical shockwave.

Hold to continue moving without striking the ground, and then push the end of the staff into enemies.

An enhanced version of the glintstone miners' Stonedigger sorcery.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The spell is on a corpse in one of these chambers.

fields.name: Rancorcall
fields.description:
Sorcery of the servants of Death.

Summons vengeful spirits that chase down foes.
Charging enhances potency.

Once thought lost, this ancient death hex was rediscovered by the necromancer Garris.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau. From the Minor Erdtree Church, head east to a ruined building. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by several enemies.

fields.name: Explosive Ghostflame
fields.description:
Sorcery of the servants of Death.

Strike the ground with the staff, triggering an explosion of ghostflame that burns the surrounding area.

In the time when there was no Erdtree, death was burned in ghostflame. Deathbirds were the keepers of that fire.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Ancient Snow Valley Ruins site of grace, head east to a ruined tower. The spell is on a corpse inside the tower.

fields.name: Fia's Mist
fields.description:
Sorcery of Fia, the Deathbed Companion.

Creates a deathly mist before the caster, which inflicts Death blight upon those who enter.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances range of the mist.

This sorcery was developed to oppose the Roundtable Hold, and is effective only against the Tarnished.
fields.location: Obtained by completing Fia’s questline in the Deeproot Depths. After her quest concludes, the spell is found on her body at her final location.

fields.name: Tibia's Summons
fields.description:
Sorcery of the servants of Death.

Summons a group of Those Lost in Death.
Three skeletons will appear some distance from the caster and attack foes before disappearing.

The dead have long been left to wander; what they need is leadership.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau. From the Minor Erdtree Church, head east to a ruined building. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by several enemies.

fields.name: Death Lightning
fields.description:
Incantation that channels the power of the ancient dragon Fortissax, now corrupted by Death.

Strikes surroundings with a storm of Death lightning.
Inflicts Death blight upon foes.
Charging extends duration of the storm.

It said that this golden lightning was wielded by Godwyn, who befriended Fortissax.
fields.location: Obtained by defeating Lichdragon Fortissax in the Deeproot Depths. The spell is available for purchase at the Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold after the boss fight.

fields.name: Assassin's Crimson Dagger
fields.description:
An assassin's dagger, misshapen and stained in crimson.
Critical hits restore HP.

This charm is modelled after the darkly gleaming blades used in the Night of Black Knives. Those which gave the demigods their first taste of Death.
fields.location: Dropped by Black Knife Assassin in Deathtouched Catacombs.

fields.name: Assassin's Cerulean Dagger
fields.description:
An assassin's dagger, misshapen and stained in cerulean.
Critical hits restore FP.

This charm is modelled after the darkly gleaming blades used in the Night of Black Knives. Those which gave the demigods their first taste of Death.
fields.location: Dropped by Black Knife Assassin in Black Knife Catacombs.

fields.name: Catch Flame
fields.description:
Incantation originating from a sinister prophecy.

Momentarily sparks flame from the caster's hand.
This incantation can be cast without delay after performing another action.

The flame of ruin is anathema to the Erdtree. But prophets sometimes glimpse it within the faith all the same. Sadly when this occurs their sole reward is banishment.
fields.location: This incantation is given to you by Brother Corhyn at the Roundtable Hold after you first speak to him. If you do not receive it this way, it is also sold by various nomadic merchants throughout the Lands Between.

fields.name: Flame Sling
fields.description:
Incantation originating from a sinister prophecy.

Throws a ball of raging fire.
Charging enhances potency and causes the ball of fire to explode.

The flame of ruin is anathema to the Erdtree. But prophets sometimes glimpse it within the faith all the same. Sadly when this occurs their sole reward is banishment.
fields.location: Purchased from Brother Corhyn at the Roundtable Hold after you first speak to him. Also sold by various nomadic merchants.

fields.name: Flame, Fall Upon Them
fields.description:
One of the incantations that draws directly from the power of the Fire Giants.

Hurls several balls of fire at once.
Charging enhances potency and causes the balls of fire to explode.

There is no record of this incantation in common prayerbooks. Only a select few prelates know of its existence.
fields.location: Found in the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave in the Mountaintops of the Giants. The spell is on a corpse in a hidden side passage.

fields.name: Flame, Cleanse Me
fields.description:
One of the incantations of the Fire Monks.

Creates a fire within that burns away toxins.
Alleviates poison and scarlet rot buildup and cures these ailments.

This incantation leaves the caster with subtle burns—a reminder that they must fear the flame.
fields.location: Found in the Fire Monks’ camp in the Liurnia region. From the Artist’s Shack, head west to the camp and look for the spell on a corpse inside a tent.

fields.name: Flame, Grant Me Strength
fields.description:
Superior incantation of the Fire Monks.

Creates an invigorating fire within that enhances physical and fire-affinity attack power.

This incantation does not burn the caster, and so it is considered forbidden by the guardians of the Flame.
fields.location: Found in the Caelid region, at the Fort Gael site of grace. The spell is on a corpse near the ramparts, guarded by soldiers.

fields.name: Flame, Protect Me
fields.description:
The most ancient of the Fire Monks' incantations.

Creates a fire within that greatly increases fire damage negation.

It is said that this incantation was used during the War against the Giants long ago, during which it protected the champions of the Erdtree.
fields.location: Found in the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave in the Mountaintops of the Giants. The spell is on a corpse in a side chamber, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Sacrificial Twig
fields.description:
A talisman fashioned from a dried twig, so slender that it might snap at the slightest touch.

Prevents rune loss upon death, but will be lost itself in exchange.

Believed to be a twig pruned from the Erdtree long, long ago.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The twig is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Furled Finger's Trick-Mirror
fields.description:
A small, clouded mirror that reflects an image of a golden figure.

Makes the bearer take on the appearance of a Host of Fingers.

One of the ritual implements created by the Tarnished to deceive invaders.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The mirror is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Host's Trick-Mirror
fields.description:
A small, clouded mirror that reflects a flesh-and-blood figure.

Makes the bearer take on the appearance of a summoned cooperator.

One of the ritual implements created by the Tarnished to deceive invaders.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The mirror is on a corpse inside the ruins.

fields.name: Giantsflame Take Thee
fields.description:
One of the incantations that draws directly from the power of the Fire Giants.

Hurls a massive ball of raging fire.
Charging enhances potency and causes the ball of fire to explode.

There is no record of this incantation in common prayerbooks. Only a select few prelates know of its existence.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The spell is on a corpse inside, surrounded by enemies.

fields.name: Flame of the Fell God
fields.description:
This legendary incantation is one of several that draws directly from the power of the Fire Giants.

Releases a ball of raging fire said to be inhabited by a fell god. The fireball floats toward enemies and explodes, setting the area ablaze.

Arghanthy, the chief guardian of the Flame, had kept this incantation a well-kept secret until it was stolen by Adan. The fell god still lurks within the Fire Giants.
fields.location: Found in the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave in the Mountaintops of the Giants. The spell is on a corpse in a secluded chamber, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Lion's Claw
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"Lion's Claw: Skill of the Redmanes, who fought alongside General Radahn. Somersault forwards, striking foes with armament."

Usable on swords, axes, and hammers
(small armaments and thrusting swords excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Impaling Thrust
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

"Impaling Thrust: Skill that lets piercing armaments overcome enemy shields. Build power, then lunge forward for a strong thrust that pierces an enemy's guard."

Usable on armaments capable of thrusting
(colossal weapons excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region, near the Stormhill Shack site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside nearby ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Piercing Fang
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

"Piercing Fang: Skill used by Yura, the Bloody Finger Hunter. Starting with the blade held horizontally, make a powerful thrust that cannot be blocked."

Usable on medium and large armaments capable of thrusting.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Spinning Slash
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

"Spinning Slash: Skill favored by dexterous warriors. Slash foes as your body spins. Additional input allows for a follow-up attack."

Usable on swords, axes, and polearms (colossal weapons excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region, near the Stormhill Shack site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside nearby ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Charge Forth
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

"Charge Forth: Quickly charge forward with the armament at the hip, carrying the momentum into a thrust. Hold to cover a greater distance."

Usable on polearms capable of thrusting, heavy thrusting swords, and twinblades.
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region. From the Gatefront Ruins site of grace, head north to a group of ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Stamp (Upward Cut)
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"Stamp (Upward Cut): Brace armament and step into a low stance that prevents recoil from most enemy attacks. Follow up with a strong attack for an upward strike."

Usable on swords, axes, and hammers (small and medium swords excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region, near the Stormhill Shack site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside nearby ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Stamp (Sweep)
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"Stamp (Sweep): Brace armament and step into a low stance that prevents recoil from most enemy attacks. Follow up with a strong attack for a sweeping strike."

Usable on swords, axes, and hammers (small and medium swords excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region, near the Stormhill Shack site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside nearby ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Blood Tax
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Blood affinity and the following skill:

"Blood Tax: Blood Oath skill granted by the Lord of Blood. Twist to build power, then unleash a flurry of thrusts that rob the target of both their blood and their HP."

Usable on armaments capable of thrusting
(colossal weapons excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau. From the Altus Highway Junction site of grace, head north and explore the ruins near the outer wall. The ash is on a corpse inside a ruined structure.

fields.name: Ash of War: Repeating Thrust
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

"Repeating Thrust: Twist to build power, then unleash a flurry of thrusts."

Usable on armaments capable of thrusting
(colossal weapons excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Wild Strikes
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"Wild Strikes: Swing armament with wild abandon. Hold to continue swinging. Can be followed up with a normal or strong attack."

Usable on axes and hammers as well as curved swords and greatswords (colossal weapons excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Spinning Strikes
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

"Spinning Strikes: Polearm skill that performs continuous spinning attacks. Hold to continue the attack. Can be followed up with a normal or strong attack. Nullifies projectiles such as arrows while spinning."

Usable on polearms (great spears excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region, near the Stormhill Shack site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside nearby ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Double Slash
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

"Double Slash: Skill of superior swordsmen. Perform a crossing slash attack from a low stance. Repeated inputs allow for up to two follow-up attacks."

Usable on swords and polearms capable of slashing (colossal weapons excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region. From the Stormhill Shack site of grace, head south to a group of ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Prelate's Charge
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Flame Art affinity and the following skill:

"Prelate's Charge: Slam armament into the ground to create a surge of flames, then charge in. Hold to continue the charge."

Usable on large and colossal axes and hammers.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The ash is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Ash of War: Unsheathe
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

"Unsheathe: Skill of swordsmen from the Land of Reeds. Sheathe blade, holding it at the hip in a composed stance. Follow up with a normal or strong attack to perform a swift slash attack."

Usable on katana.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The ash is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Ash of War: Square Off
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

"Square Off: This skill starts with the sword held level. Follow up with a normal attack to slash upwards through enemy's guard, or a strong attack to perform a running thrust."

Usable on straight swords.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Giant Hunt
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

"Giant Hunt: Skill developed for confronting gigantic foes. Step forward from a low stance, carrying the momentum into a sudden upward thrust."

Usable on large and colossal weapons capable of thrusting, spears, and twinblades.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, near the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The ash is on a corpse inside the dungeon, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Loretta's Slash
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

"Loretta's Slash: Skill of Loretta the Royal Knight. Leap forward, imbuing the blade with glintstone, then descend, accelerating into a sweeping slash."

Usable on polearms and twinblades.
fields.location: Found in the Caria Manor, Liurnia. From the Manor Lower Level site of grace, explore the manor’s gardens and defeat the spectral knights. The ash is on a corpse in a secluded corner.

fields.name: Ash of War: Poison Moth Flight
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Poison affinity and the following skill:

"Poison Moth Flight: Slash with a poison-infused blade. If the follow-up strike lands on a poisoned foe, it will deal significant damage."

Usable on small and medium swords (twinblades excepted).
fields.location: Found in Caelid, near the Smoldering Wall site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside nearby ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Spinning Weapon
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

"Spinning Weapon: Defensive skill employed by Carian princesses. Lifts armament into mid-air, then makes it spin violently. Those it touches will suffer successive attacks."

Usable on small and medium swords, axes, and hammers, as well as polearms and staves (great spears excepted)
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region, near the Stormhill Shack site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside nearby ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Storm Assault
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

"Storm Assault: One of the skills that channel the tempests of Stormveil. Leap forward through surrounding storm winds and thrust armament downward. The attack will produce more storm winds at the point of impact."

Usable on polearms capable of thrusting, heavy thrusting swords, and twinblades.
fields.location: Found in the Volcano Manor, inside the Temple of Eiglay. The ash is on a corpse in a side room.

fields.name: Ash of War: Stormcaller
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

"Stormcaller: One of the skills that channel the tempests of Stormveil. Spin armament to create surrounding storm winds. Repeated inputs allow for up to two follow-up attacks."

Usable on swords capable of slashing, axes, hammers, and polearms (small and colossal weapons excepted)
fields.location: Obtained by defeating the boss Lichdragon Fortissax in the Deeproot Depths. The ash is available after the boss fight.

fields.name: Ash of War: Sword Dance
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

"Sword Dance: Quickly close in to perform a series of spinning upward slashes. Follow up with an additional input to finish with a downward slash."

Usable on swords, axes, and polearms capable of slashing (colossal weapons and great spears excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Glintblade Phalanx
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

"Glintblade Phalanx: Skill used by the enchanted knights who served the Carian royal family. Form an arch of magic glintblades overhead, which will attack foes automatically. Follow up with a strong attack to chain this skill into a lunging thrust."

Usable on swords as well as polearms capable of thrusting (colossal weapons excepted).
fields.location: Located in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The ash is on a corpse in one of these chambers.

fields.name: Ash of War: Sacred Blade
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

"Sacred Blade: Grants armament's attacks holy essence and fires off a golden blade projectile. The armament retains its holy essence for a while."

Usable on melee armaments (whips, fists, and claws excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Caria Manor, Liurnia. From the Manor Lower Level site of grace, explore the manor’s gardens and defeat the spectral knights. The ash is on a corpse in a secluded corner.

fields.name: Ash of War: Ice Spear
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Cold affinity and the following skill:

"Ice Spear: Skill of the warriors who served Lunar Princess Ranni. Spin armament to release cold magic, then channel it into a piercing spear of ice."

Usable on polearms capable of thrusting and twinblades.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, proceed to the rooftops and cross the bridges. The ash is on a corpse in a side area.

fields.name: Ash of War: Glintstone Pebble
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

"Glintstone Pebble: Skill that employs the glintstone sorcery of the same name. Follow up with a strong attack to chain this skill into a lunging thrust, performed while the armament is still imbued with glintstone."

Usable on swords as well as polearms capable of thrusting (colossal weapons excepted).
fields.location: Purchased from Sorceress Sellen at the Waypoint Ruins in Limgrave after you meet her for the first time.

fields.name: Ash of War: Bloody Slash
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Blood affinity and the following skill:

"Bloody Slash: Blood Oath skill granted by the Lord of Blood. From a low stance, coat the blade in your own blood to unleash a rending blood slash in a wide arc."

Usable on swords (colossal weapons excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region. From the Gatefront Ruins site of grace, head north to a group of ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Lifesteal Fist
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Occult affinity and the following skill:

"Lifesteal Fist: Skill that demonstrates mastery of the art of controlling vital energies.
A slow, controlled punch with an energy-infused fist that renders foes unconscious and steals their HP. Only effective against foes of human build."

Usable on fists and claws.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The ash is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Ash of War: Eruption
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Fire affinity and the following skill:

"Eruption: Skill of the knights who serve at Volcano Manor. Slam armament into the ground, spawning roiling lava which spouts up upon release."

Usable on large and colossal swords, axes, and hammers.
fields.location: Found in the Volcano Manor. From the Temple of Eiglay site of grace, explore the manor’s chambers and look for the ash on a corpse in a side room.

fields.name: Ash of War: Prayerful Strike
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

"Prayerful Strike: Raise armament aloft in prayer, then slam it into the ground. This inspired blow restores HP to the self and nearby allies if it successfully hits."

Usable on axes and hammers.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Gravitas
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

"Gravitas: Skill originating from the Alabaster Lords, who had skin of stone. Thrust the armament into the ground to create a gravity well. In addition to dealing damage, this attack pulls enemies in."

Usable on melee armaments (small armaments and whips excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Storm Blade
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

"Storm Blade: Lost skill of Stormveil. Surround armament with shearing storm winds that can be fired forward. Can be fired in rapid succession."

Usable on swords (colossal weapons and twinblades excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The ash is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Ash of War: Earthshaker
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"Earthshaker: Thrust armament into the ground, then gather strength to unleash an earth-shaking shockwave. Follow up with a strong attack to swing the armament in a sweeping strike."

Usable on greataxes, great hammers, great spears, and colossal weapons.
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region. From the Coastal Cave site of grace, head south to a group of ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Golden Land
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

"Golden Land: Thrust armament into the ground, then gather strength to unleash a blast of sacred energy that coalesces into golden darts. Follow up with a strong attack to swing the armament in a sweeping strike."

Usable on greataxes, great hammers, great spears, and colossal weapons.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau, near the Minor Erdtree Church. The ash is on a corpse inside a ruined building guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Flaming Strike
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Fire affinity and the following skill:

"Flaming Strike: Skill that emits flame in a wide frontward arc. Follow up with a strong attack to perform a lunging, sweeping strike. This will also coat the armament in fire."

Usable on melee armaments (colossal weapons and whips excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region. From the Agheel Lake North site of grace, head east to a group of ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Thunderbolt
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Lightning affinity and the following skill:

"Thunderbolt: Skill used by the capital's ancient dragon cult. Raise armament aloft to call down a bolt of lightning. Can be fired in rapid succession."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the East Capital Rampart site of grace, descend the elevator and explore the city streets. The ash is on a corpse near Leyndell Knights.

fields.name: Ash of War: Lightning Slash
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Lightning affinity and the following skill:

"Lightning Slash: Call down a bolt of lightning into armament, then swing it down to create an explosive shock. The armament retains the lightning enchantment for a while."

Usable on swords, axes, and hammers.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the East Capital Rampart site of grace, descend the elevator and explore the city streets. The ash is on a corpse near Leyndell Knights.

fields.name: Ash of War: Carian Grandeur
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

"Carian Grandeur: Carian royal prestige embodied in a skill. Transform blade into a magical greatsword and swing it down. Can be charged to increase its power by up to two levels."

Usable on swords (colossal weapons excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Caria Manor, Liurnia. From the Manor Lower Level site of grace, explore the manor’s gardens and defeat the spectral knights. The ash is on a corpse in a secluded corner of the gardens.

fields.name: Ash of War: Carian Greatsword
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

"Carian Greatsword: Carian royal prestige embodied in a skill. Transform blade into a magical greatsword and swing it down. Can be charged to increase its power."

Usable on swords (colossal weapons excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Caria Manor, Liurnia. From the Manor Lower Level site of grace, explore the manor’s gardens and defeat the spectral knights. The ash is on a corpse in a secluded corner of the gardens.

fields.name: Ash of War: Vacuum Slice
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

"Vacuum Slice: Lost skill of ancient heroes. Hold the armament aloft to surround it with a shearing vacuum, then launch it forwards as a blade-like projectile."

Usable on swords and axes (colossal axes excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Black Flame Tornado
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Flame Art affinity and the following skill:

"Black Flame Tornado: Spin armament overhead and then plunge it into the ground to summon a raging vortex of black flames. Hold to create an initial flame tornado while spinning the armament."

Usable on polearms and twinblades.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The ash is on a corpse inside, surrounded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Sacred Ring of Light
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

"Sacred Ring of Light: Skill used by the commanders of the Cleanrot Knights. Gather a sacred ring of light in the armament, then fire it forwards. Can be fired in rapid succession."

Usable on polearms (great spears excepted).
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the East Capital Rampart site of grace, descend the elevator and explore the city streets. The ash is on a corpse near Leyndell Knights.

fields.name: Ash of War: Blood Blade
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Blood affinity and the following skill:

"Blood Blade: Wound self to coat the armament with blood, then unleash an airborne blood blade that causes hemorrhaging. Can be fired in rapid succession."

Usable on small and medium swords.
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region. From the Stormhill Shack site of grace, head south to a group of ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Phantom Slash
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Quality affinity and the following skill:

"Phantom Slash: Skill inspired by the fond remembrances of the Night's Cavalry. Creates an apparition of the knights' former instructor who guides a joint lunging upward swing. Additional input allows for a follow-up attack."

Usable on polearms and twinblades (great spears excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The ash is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Ash of War: Spectral Lance
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Occult affinity and the following skill:

"Spectral Lance: Skill of the headless Mausoleum Knights. Hurl a phantasmic spear at foes."

Usable on polearms (reapers excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The ash is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Ash of War: Chilling Mist
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Cold affinity and the following skill:

"Chilling Mist: Coat armament in frost, and then slash, spreading frigid mist forwards. The armament retains its frost for a while."

Usable on melee armaments (whips, fists, and claws excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside the ruins, near a group of enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Poisonous Mist
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Poison affinity and the following skill:

"Poisonous Mist: Bathe armament in poison, and then slash, spreading toxic mist forwards. The armament retains its poison for a while."

Usable on melee armaments (whips, fists, and claws excepted).
fields.location: Found in Caelid, near the Smoldering Wall site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside nearby ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Shield Bash
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

"Shield Bash: Brace behind shield before using bodyweight to ram foes while maintaining guarding stance. Weaker enemies will be shoved backwards, and can even be staggered."

Usable on all shields.
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region, near the Stormhill Shack site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside nearby ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Barricade Shield
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

"Barricade Shield: Skill made famous by Sir Neidhardt. Focus your energy into the shield, temporarily hardening it to deflect greater blows."

Usable on all shields.
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region. From the Gatefront Ruins site of grace, head north to a group of ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Parry
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

"Parry: Use this skill in time with a foe's melee attack to deflect it and break that foe's stance. This provides an opening to perform a critical hit."

Usable on daggers, curved swords, thrusting swords, fists, claws, and small and medium shields.
fields.location: Purchased from Knight Bernahl at Warmaster’s Shack.

fields.name: Ash of War: Carian Retaliation
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

"Carian Retaliation: Swing the shield to dispel incoming sorceries and incantations, transforming the magic into retaliatory glintblades. Can also be used in the same way as a regular parry."

Usable on small and medium shields.
fields.location: Found in the Caria Manor, Liurnia. From the Manor Lower Level site of grace, explore the manor’s gardens and defeat the spectral knights. The ash is on a corpse in a secluded corner of the gardens.

fields.name: Ash of War: Storm Wall
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

"Storm Wall: Swing the shield to create a wall of storm winds in front of you, deflecting arrows and other such physical projectiles. Can also be used in the same way as a regular parry."

Usable on small and medium shields.
fields.location: Found in the Volcano Manor, inside the Temple of Eiglay. The ash is on a corpse in a side room.

fields.name: Ash of War: Golden Parry
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

"Golden Parry: Perform an Erdtree incantation and swing the shield to deflect enemy attacks and break their stance. Effective even at a slight distance."

Usable on small and medium shields.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the East Capital Rampart site of grace, descend the elevator and explore the city streets. The ash is on a corpse near Leyndell Knights.

fields.name: Ash of War: Shield Crash
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

"Shield Crash: Two-hand the shield and charge forwards while maintaining guard. Weaker enemies will be shoved backwards and can even be staggered. Hold to extend the duration of the charge forwards."

Usable on all shields.
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region, near the Stormhill Shack site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside nearby ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: No Skill
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament and replaces any skill present with the following:

"No skill: This armament has no skill. If the armament in the other hand has a skill, that skill will be used instead."

Usable on shields and torches.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Thops's Barrier
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

"Thops's Barrier: Erect a magical forcefield while swinging the shield to deflect sorceries and incantations. Can also be used in the same way as a regular parry."

Usable on small and medium shields.
fields.location: Given to you by Thops after assisting him with his research in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Complete his questline to receive the ash.

fields.name: Ash of War: Enchanted Shot
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

"Enchanted Shot: Archery skill that enlivens the arrow with spiritual essence. The resulting shot will fly faster than regular shots and change its trajectory to follow the target."

Usable on light bows and longbows.
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region. From the Gatefront Ruins site of grace, head north to a group of ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Sky Shot
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

"Sky Shot: Archery skill performed from a low stance. Ready the bow, then fire an arrow high up into the air, arcing so as to strike the enemy from above when it comes down."

Usable on light bows and longbows.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Rain of Arrows
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants no affinity to an armament, but imparts the following skill:

"Rain of Arrows: Archery skill performed from a low stance. Ready the bow, then fire a burst of arrows into the sky to shower the enemy with projectiles."

Usable on all bows.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Lightning Ram
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Lightning affinity and the following skill:

"Lightning Ram: Skill inspired by tumbling rams. Let out a bleat, then tumble forwards, clad in lightning. Tumbles can be repeated in rapid succession."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau, near the Minor Erdtree Church. The ash is on a corpse inside a ruined building.

fields.name: Ash of War: Flame of the Redmanes
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Fire affinity and the following skill:

"Flame of the Redmanes: Skill of the Redmanes, who fought alongside General Radahn. Produce a powerful burst of flames in a wide frontward arc."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in the Caelid region. From the Caelid Highway South site of grace, head north to a group of ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Ground Slam
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"Ground Slam: Jump up high into the air and crash down on the ground ahead. The resulting pratfall sends a powerful shockwave in all directions."

Usable on all melee armaments.
