fields.location: Found in the Volcano Manor, inside the Temple of Eiglay. The ash is on a corpse in a side room.

fields.name: Ash of War: Golden Slam
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

"Golden Slam: Skill of the avatars who protect Minor Erdtrees. Jump up high into the air and crash down on the ground ahead. The resulting pratfall sends golden shockwaves in all directions."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Located in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The ash is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Ash of War: Waves of Darkness
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Magic affinity and the following skill:

"Waves of Darkness: Plunge armament into the ground to release three waves of darkness. Follow up with a strong attack to swing the armament in a sweeping strike."

Usable on greataxes, great hammers, great spears, and colossal weapons.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The ash is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Ash of War: Hoarah Loux's Earthshaker
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"Hoarah Loux's Earthshaker: Slam both hands onto the ground to violently shake the earth and unleash a shockwave. Follow up with an additional input to slam the ground again."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Obtained by defeating Hoarah Loux, Warrior, in the Mountaintops of the Giants. The ash is available after the boss fight.

fields.name: Ash of War: Sacred Order
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

"Sacred Order: Skill of the Golden Order fundamentalist knights. Perform a salute and grant the armament holy essence. Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The ash is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Ash of War: Shared Order
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

"Shared Order: Skill of the Golden Order fundamentalist knights. Grant the armament and those of nearby allies holy essence. Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave. The ash is on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Ash of War: Seppuku
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Blood affinity and the following skill:

"Seppuku: A forbidden technique used by swordsmen from the Land of Reeds. Plunge the blade into your stomach to stain it with blood. Increases attack power and improves ability to inflict blood loss."

Usable on swords as well as polearms capable of thrusting (small and colossal weapons excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Cragblade
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"Cragblade: Skill that manipulates gravity. Bury the armament in the ground, pulling rocks from the earth to reinforce it. Increases attack power and makes it easier to break enemy stance."

Usable on melee armaments (whips excepted).
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region. From the Agheel Lake North site of grace, head east to a group of ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Barbaric Roar
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"Barbaric Roar: Let loose a bestial roar to rally the spirit and increase attack power. While active, strong attacks change to savage combo attacks."

Usable on melee armaments (daggers, thrusting swords, and whips excepted).
fields.location: Dropped by a Teardrop Scarab in Mistwood.

fields.name: Ash of War: War Cry
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"War Cry: Give a war cry to rally the spirit and increase attack power. While active, strong attacks change to charging attacks."

Usable on melee armaments (daggers, thrusting swords, and whips excepted).
fields.location: Dropped by a Teardrop Scarab in Limgrave.

fields.name: Ash of War: Beast's Roar
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Keen affinity and the following skill:

"Beast's Roar: Unleash a beastly roar, rending the air as a forward-travelling projectile."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region. From the Coastal Cave site of grace, head south to a group of ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Troll's Roar
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"Troll's Roar: Look into the distance and let out an intense roar, generating a powerful shockwave that blows back surrounding foes. Follow up with a strong attack to slam the armament down."

Usable on large and colossal swords, axes, and hammers.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Ash of War: Braggart's Roar
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"Braggart's Roar: Declare your presence with a boastful roar. Raises attack power, defense, and stamina recovery speed."

Usable on melee armaments (daggers, thrusting swords, and whips excepted).
fields.location: Dropped by a Teardrop Scarab in the Altus Plateau.

fields.name: Ash of War: Endure
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Heavy affinity and the following skill:

"Endure: Assume an anchored stance to brace for incoming attacks, briefly boosting poise. Damage taken while using this skill is reduced."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in the Limgrave region. From the Stormhill Shack site of grace, head south to a group of ruins. The ash is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Ash of War: Vow of the Indomitable
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

"Vow of the Indomitable: Skill of the ancient warriors of the Erdtree. Hold shield aloft to imbue yourself with golden power, granting momentary invincibility."

Usable on all shields.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the East Capital Rampart site of grace, descend the elevator and explore the city streets. The ash is on a corpse near Leyndell Knights.

fields.name: Ash of War: Holy Ground
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Sacred affinity and the following skill:

"Holy Ground: Raise shield to create an Erdtree-consecrated area that continuously restores HP and boosts defense for self and allies inside it."

Usable on all shields.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Church of Pilgrimage. The ash is on a corpse inside the church.

fields.name: Ash of War: White Shadow's Lure
fields.description:
This Ash of War grants an armament the Occult affinity and the following skill:

"White Shadow's Lure: Hold armament in a brief, silent prayer to create a white shadow. The apparition lures in foes of human build who are not in combat, drawing their aggression. Effective on demi-humans even if they are already in a combat state."

Usable on all melee armaments.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace. The ash is on a corpse inside the Tombsward Ruins.

fields.name: Gavel of Haima
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Creates a magical greathammer and slams it down.
Allows one follow-up attack.

Drawn from the scholarly conspectus of Haima, the adjudicator of the academy, this sorcery employs might as a means to quell conflict.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, proceed to the rooftops and cross the bridges. The spell is on a corpse in a side area, overlooking the main courtyard.

fields.name: Terra Magica
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Draws an academy sigil upon the ground, raising the magic strength of those within.

Once, the sigil would be cast from the highest belfry of the academy, covering the entire institution's grounds. This spell allows such vivid experience of spell-casting success, it turns many a fledgling into a true sorcerer in a flash of newfound understanding.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, proceed to the rooftops and cross the bridges. The spell is on a corpse in a side area, overlooking the main courtyard.

fields.name: Starlight
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Creates a small, floating star light that illuminates surroundings.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion.

Granted to sorcerers who depart from the academy to embark on journeys. Even during the blackest nights, sojourns underground, or imprisonment in gaol, the stars are never far from a sorcerer's side.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, proceed to the rooftops and cross the bridges. The spell is on a corpse in a side area, overlooking the main courtyard.

fields.name: Comet Azur
fields.description:
Legendary sorcery devised by Azur, primeval sorcerer.

Fires a tremendous comet in a torrent akin to the distant starry expanse, the place said to be the origin of glintstone.
Hold to continue releasing the sorcery's power.

When Azur glimpsed into the primeval current, he saw darkness. He was left both bewitched and fearful of the abyss.
fields.location: Obtained in Mt. Gelmir. From the Hermit Village site of grace, follow the path up to the ruins where Primeval Sorcerer Azur sits. The spell is found on his body after you interact with him.

fields.name: Founding Rain of Stars
fields.description:
The eldest primeval sorcery, said to have been discovered by an ancient astrologer. A sorcery of legendary status.

Summons a dark cloud of stars overhead. Shortly after, the cloud will release a violent deluge of star rain. This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging increases potency.

Thought to be the founding glintstone sorcery. The glimpse of the primeval current that the astrologer saw became real, and the stars' amber rained down on this land.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants, inside the Heretical Rise tower. Solve the puzzle by casting a spell from the nearby ruins to reveal the path inside the tower.

fields.name: Stars of Ruin
fields.description:
Legendary sorcery devised by Lusat, primeval sorcerer.

Fires twelve dark shooting stars that pursue the target.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging increases potency.

When Lusat glimpsed into the primeval current, he beheld the final moments of a great star cluster, and upon seeing it, he too was broken.
fields.location: Obtained by completing Sorceress Sellen’s questline. After her quest concludes, the spell is found on her body in the Grand Library of Raya Lucaria.

fields.name: Glintblade Phalanx
fields.description:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.

Creates a defensive arch of magic glintblades overhead, which automatically attack nearby foes.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion.

Bestowed upon the enchanted Carian knights, who combined this art with their swordsmanship to maintain pressure upon their foes, striking in waves of steel and sorcery.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The spell is on a corpse in one of these chambers.

fields.name: Carian Phalanx
fields.description:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.

Creates a defensive arch of numerous magic glintblades overhead, which automatically attack nearby foes.
This sorcery can be used cast while in motion.

An enhanced version of the glintblade sorcery used by enchanted knights.
fields.location: Rewarded by defeating Preceptor Miriam in the Carian Study Hall. After you defeat her during Ranni’s quest, the spell is yours.

fields.name: Greatblade Phalanx
fields.description:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.

Creates a defensive arch of larger magic glintblades overhead, which automatically attack nearby foes.

Used by the enchanted troll knights.
They were the comrades of the young Rennala, bound by oath.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The spell is on a corpse in one of these chambers.

fields.name: Rennala's Full Moon
fields.description:
Sorcery symbolic of the Carian queen.

Uses the caster as a vessel to incarnate a full moon, then sends it floating toward foes. The full moon dispels all sorcery that touches it, and temporarily reduces magic damage negation for those it strikes.

Queen Rennala encountered this enchanting moon when she was young, and later, it would bewitch the academy.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, proceed to the rooftops and cross the bridges. The spell is on a corpse in a side area, overlooking the main courtyard.

fields.name: Ranni's Dark Moon
fields.description:
Legendary sorcery symbolic of the Carian queen.

Uses the caster as a vessel to incarnate a cold, dark moon, then sends it floating toward foes. The dark moon dispels all sorcery that touches it, and temporarily reduces magic damage negation for those it strikes.

This moon was encountered by a young Ranni, led by the hand of her mother, Rennala. What she beheld was cold, dark, and veiled in occult mystery.
fields.location: Found in Chelona’s Rise, Mountaintops of the Giants. Solve the puzzle by defeating the three spirit turtles around the tower to gain access to the spell inside.

fields.name: Magic Downpour
fields.description:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.

Summons a mass of magic that fires projectiles over a wide area.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging extends duration.

Said to have been taught by the Crystalians to mark the swearing of the old concord.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, proceed to the rooftops and cross the bridges. The spell is on a corpse in a side area, overlooking the main courtyard.

fields.name: Loretta's Greatbow
fields.description:
Sorcery used by Royal Knight Loretta.

Creates a magic greatbow and fires a great arrow.
Charging enhances potency. Hold to keep the great arrow nocked.

It is said that the bow was Loretta's favored weapon.
fields.location: Found in the Caria Manor, Liurnia. From the Manor Lower Level site of grace, explore the manor’s gardens and defeat the spectral knights. The spell is on a corpse in a secluded corner of the gardens.

fields.name: Loretta's Mastery
fields.description:
Sorcery used by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree.

Creates a magic greatbow and fires four great arrows simultaneously.
Charging enhances potency. Hold to keep the great arrows nocked.

Developed by Loretta after her long, bloody journey to seek out a place where the Albinaurics could live in peace.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Castle Sol Rooftop site of grace, proceed through the castle and defeat the boss. The spell is on a corpse in the final chamber.

fields.name: Magic Glintblade
fields.description:
An old sorcery of the Carian royal family.

Creates a sigil overhead, from which an enemy-seeking glintblade appears after a brief delay.
This sorcery can be used while in motion. Charging increases the delay.

Said to be the prototype of the sword-phalanx sorceries wielded by royal enchanted knights.
fields.location: Purchased from Sorceress Sellen at the Waypoint Ruins in Limgrave after you meet her for the first time.

fields.name: Glintstone Icecrag
fields.description:
Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch.

The glintstone serves as a conduit, launching a mass of cold magic.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion.

The snowy crone taught the young Ranni to fear the dark moon as she imparted her cold sorcery.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The spell is on a corpse in one of these chambers.

fields.name: Zamor Ice Storm
fields.description:
Ice sorcery of the Town of Zamor.

Strike the ground with the staff to create a freezing tornado.
Charging enhances potency.

Cloaked in icy tempests, the knights of Zamor have challenged the Fire Giants since ancient times.
fields.location: Found in the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave in the Mountaintops of the Giants. Navigate the dungeon and locate the spell on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Freezing Mist
fields.description:
Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch.

Releases a cold mist before the caster.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion. Charging enhances range of the mist.

The snowy crone taught the young Ranni to fear the dark moon as she imparted her cold sorcery.
fields.location: Obtained by trading a Dragon Heart with the Dragon Communion Priestess at any Dragon Communion Altar. Defeat a frost dragon to receive the required heart.

fields.name: Carian Greatsword
fields.description:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.

Conjures a magic greatsword and then delivers a sweeping blow.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly.

Armed with this spell, sorcerers gain the strength of knights, their loyalty sworn to the moon.
fields.location: Found in Liurnia of the Lakes. Travel to the Carian Study Hall, accessible after obtaining the Carian Inverted Statue from Ranni’s quest. The spell is on a corpse in one of the study hall’s upper rooms.

fields.name: Adula's Moonblade
fields.description:
Sorcery of Adula, the Glintstone Dragon.

Conjures a cold magic greatsword, then delivers a sweeping blow that launches a blade-like projectile of frost.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly.

Adula, a devourer of sorcerers, was bested by Ranni and subsequently swore a knightly oath to her Dark Moon.
fields.location: After defeating Adula, the glintstone dragon found near the Cathedral of Manus Celes in the Mountaintops of the Giants, you will receive this spell. Adula guards the entrance to Ranni’s final destination, and upon her defeat, the spell is yours to wield.

fields.name: Carian Slicer
fields.description:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.

Conjures a magic sword and delivers a swift sweeping slash. 
This sorcery can be used without delay after performing another action.

Even among the Carian sword sorceries, this is a notably effective technique.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, proceed to the courtyard and look for a corpse near the fountain. The spell is on this body, guarded by a few academy sorcerers.

fields.name: Carian Piercer
fields.description:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.

Conjures a magic greatsword to impale foes.
Charging lengthens the initial step in.

This sorcery forms a counterpart to Carian Greatsword.
Highly lethal when used against single foes riding alone.
fields.location: Found in the Caria Manor in Liurnia. From the Manor Lower Level site of grace, explore the manor’s gardens and defeat the spectral knights. The spell is on a corpse in a secluded corner of the gardens.

fields.name: Scholar's Armament
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Enchants armament held in the right hand with magic-affinity attacks.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion.

Taught to the Knights of the Cuckoo by the academy as payment for their contract.
fields.location: Purchased from Sorceress Sellen at the Waypoint Ruins in Limgrave after you meet her for the first time.

fields.name: Scholar's Shield
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Enchants shield held in the left hand with additional damage negation.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion.

Taught to the Knights of the Cuckoo by the academy as payment for their contract.
fields.location: Purchased from Sorceress Sellen at the Waypoint Ruins in Limgrave after you meet her for the first time.

fields.name: Lucidity
fields.description:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.

Alleviates buildup of sleep and madness.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion.

The Carian knights never waver.
fields.location: Found in the Raya Lucaria Crystal Tunnel in Liurnia. Navigate the tunnel and defeat the boss. The spell is on a corpse in the final chamber.

fields.name: Frozen Armament
fields.description:
Sorcery said to have been used by the old snow witch.

Enchants armament held in the right hand with frost.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion.

The snowy crone taught the young Ranni to fear the dark moon as she imparted her cold sorcery.
fields.location: Purchased from the Nomadic Merchant near the Raya Lucaria Academy in Liurnia. The merchant is located near the Artist’s Shack.

fields.name: Shattering Crystal
fields.description:
Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians.

Creates a mass of crystal, then shatters it in a forward burst.
Charging enhances potency.

The Crystalians are inorganic beings, yet they live. They cleave close to the ideals of the primeval current, and as such, they are revered guests of the sorcerers.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The spell is on a corpse in one of these chambers.

fields.name: Crystal Release
fields.description:
Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians.

Creates a mass of crystal, then shatters it to scour a wide area with a violent rain of crystal shards.

This sorcery is used by high-ranking adepts among the Crystalians. Some also call this sorcery "the Crystal Sun."
fields.location: Found in the Academy Crystal Cave. After defeating the boss, explore the cave further to find the spell on a corpse in a hidden alcove.

fields.name: Crystal Torrent
fields.description:
Sorcery of the mysterious Crystalians.

Creates a mass of crystal, then fires off shards in rapid succession.
Hold to continue firing shards.

The wrath of the Crystalians encapsulated in sorcery. Each shard is of substantial size, making even a stray blow capable of inflicting a severe wound.
fields.location: Obtained by defeating the Crystalian trio in the Academy Crystal Cave. After the boss fight, the spell is found on a corpse in the final chamber.

fields.name: Ambush Shard
fields.description:
One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.

Launches a projectile from a distance removed from the caster, so as to strike the enemy from behind.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly.

The Sellian sorcerers were assassins, and it is said that they often hunted their fellows.
fields.location: This spell is found in the Sellia, Town of Sorcery, located in Caelid. Enter the town and solve the puzzle by lighting the braziers atop the three towers. Once you have lit all three, the chest containing Ambush Shard will unlock in one of the structures within Sellia.

fields.name: Night Shard
fields.description:
One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.

Swiftly fires a semi-invisible projectile.
This sorcery can be used without delay after performing another action.

The Sellian sorcerers were assassins, and it is said that they often hunted their fellows.
fields.location: Found in Sellia, Town of Sorcery, Caelid. After lighting the three braziers in the towers, the spell is found in a chest inside one of the town’s buildings.

fields.name: Night Comet
fields.description:
One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.

Fires a semi-invisible magic comet.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly and while in motion. Charging enhances potency.

The Sellian sorcerers were assassins, and it is said that they often hunted their fellows.
fields.location: Found in Sellia, Town of Sorcery, Caelid. After lighting the three braziers in the towers, the spell is found in a chest inside one of the town’s buildings.

fields.name: Thops's Barrier
fields.description:
The lifelong pursuit of Thops the Bluntstone.

Creates a magic forcefield that deflects sorceries and incantations.
Hold to continuously create barriers.

Future generations will learn. They will know the foolishness of the sneering sorcerers who ridiculed this theory, little realizing that it was in fact a discovery worthy of a new conspectus of the academy.
fields.location: Given to you by Thops after assisting him with his research in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Complete his questline to receive the spell.

fields.name: Carian Retaliation
fields.description:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.

Swing your staff to dispel incoming sorceries and incantations, using their power to retaliate with glintblades.

This was the Carian royal family's secret means to prepare against the disloyalty of the academy. The moon and stars would one day go their separate ways.
fields.location: Given by Preceptor Miriam in the Carian Study Hall. After you encounter her and progress through the area, she will drop the spell as a reward.

fields.name: Eternal Darkness
fields.description:
Forbidden sorcery of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.

Creates a space of darkness that draws in sorceries and incantations.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion.

Originally a lost sorcery of the Eternal City; the despair that brought about its ruin made manifest.
fields.location: Found in the Sellia Hideaway dungeon in Caelid. Navigate through the tunnels to a chamber guarded by a Teardrop Scarab. The spell is dropped by the scarab when defeated.

fields.name: Unseen Blade
fields.description:
One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.

Enchants armament held in right hand, making it completely invisible.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion.

Used by Sellian assassins to present themselves as unarmed sorcerers.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The spell is on a corpse in one of these chambers.

fields.name: Unseen Form
fields.description:
One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.

Makes the caster semi-invisible.
While on horseback, effect extends to cover the mount.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion.

The Sellian assassins considered every option that aided their dirty work.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The spell is on a corpse in one of these chambers.

fields.name: Meteorite
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.

Summons a void that emits a rain of small meteorites.
Hold to continue the effect.

This sorcery originates from the Onyx Lords, who had skin of stone, and were called lords in reverential fear of their destructive power.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, proceed to the rooftops and cross the bridges. The spell is on a corpse in a side area, overlooking the main courtyard.

fields.name: Meteorite of Astel
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.

Summons a void that emits a hail of meteorites.
Hold to continue the effect.

A manifestation of the power with which Astel leveled the Eternal City.
fields.location: Found in the Consecrated Snowfield. From the Ordina, Liturgical Town site of grace, head northeast to a group of ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Rock Sling
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.

Pulls a clump of rocks from the earth and sends them flying.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion.

A gravitational technique studied by the young Radahn. His master was an Alabaster Lord with skin of stone.
fields.location: Found in the Street of Sages Ruins, Caelid. The spell is in a chest inside a ruined building, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Gravity Well
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.

Fires a projectile of condensed gravitational force. Those struck by it will be pulled toward the caster.
Charging enhances potency.

A gravitational technique studied by the young Radahn. His master was an Alabaster Lord with skin of stone.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Debate Parlor site of grace, proceed to the rooftops and cross the bridges. The spell is on a corpse in a side area, overlooking the main courtyard.

fields.name: Collapsing Stars
fields.description:
One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.

Fires numerous gravitational projectiles. Any foes struck will be pulled toward the caster.
Charging enhances potency.

A gravitational technique mastered by the young Radahn.
"I thank you for your tutelage, for now I can challenge the stars."
fields.location: Located in Sellia, Town of Sorcery. After lighting the three braziers in the towers, the spell is found in a chest inside one of the town’s buildings.

fields.name: Magma Shot
fields.description:
One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir.

Fires a lump of magma that explodes on contact.
Charging enhances potency.

After discovering the ancient hexes of Gelmir, Rykard, son of Queen Rennala, brought them back into practical use as new forms of sorcery.
fields.location: Found in Mt. Gelmir. From the Hermit Village site of grace, head north to a ruined tower. The spell is on a corpse inside the tower.

fields.name: Gelmir's Fury
fields.description:
One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir.

Conjures a surge of magma from the earth, covering the area.
Charging extends the surge of magma.

This sorcery is held to represent the fury of the volcano, but the arrogance of attempting to harness it is solely that of men and serpents.
fields.location: Found in Mt. Gelmir. From the Hermit Village site of grace, head north to a ruined tower. The spell is on a corpse inside the tower.

fields.name: Roiling Magma
fields.description:
One of the sorceries developed from the magma of Mt. Gelmir.

Fires a lump of condensed magma that explodes a short delay after hitting the target.
Charging enhances potency and further delays the explosion.

After discovering the ancient hexes of Gelmir, Rykard, son of Queen Rennala, brought them back into practical use as new forms of sorcery.
fields.location: Found in Mt. Gelmir. From the Hermit Village site of grace, head north to a ruined tower. The spell is on a corpse inside the tower.

fields.name: Rykard's Rancor
fields.description:
The terrible power of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy.

Summons searing spirits that leave a trail of delayed explosions in their wake.

These spirits manifest from the rancor of heroes who met a violent end. The lord granted them an audience, whereupon they were welcomed by the maw of the great serpent—and within the serpent's bowels, they became the lord's kin.
fields.location: Found in Mt. Gelmir. From the Hermit Village site of grace, head north to a ruined tower. The spell is on a corpse inside the tower.

fields.name: Briars of Sin
fields.description:
An aberrant sorcery discovered by exiled criminals.
Theirs are the sorceries most reviled by the academy.

Wounds the caster with thorns of sin, creating a spiral of bloodthorns.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly, up to three times.

The guilty, their eyes gouged by thorns, lived in eternal darkness. There, they discovered the blood star.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The spell is on a corpse in the ruins, guarded by a group of enemies.

fields.name: Briars of Punishment
fields.description:
An aberrant sorcery discovered by exiled criminals.
Theirs are the sorceries most reviled by the academy.

Wounds the caster with thorns of punishment, sending a trail of bloodthorns running over the ground to impale enemies from below.
This sorcery can be cast repeatedly.

The guilty, their eyes gouged by thorns, lived in eternal darkness. There, they discovered the blood star.
fields.location: Rewarded by completing the questline of Thorn Sorcerer Sellen. After her quest concludes, the spell is found on her body in the Grand Library of Raya Lucaria.

fields.name: Ancient Death Rancor
fields.description:
Sorcery of the servants of Death.

Summons a horde of vengeful spirits that chase down foes. Charging enhances potency.

They are cinders of the ancient death hex, raked from the fires of ghostflame by Deathbirds.
fields.location: Found in the Consecrated Snowfield region, in the hidden catacombs beneath the Yelough Anix Ruins. Navigate through the catacombs, defeating the Death Rite Birds and other enemies, and you’ll discover the spell on a corpse in a secluded chamber.

fields.name: Oracle Bubbles
fields.description:
Sorcery of the claymen who served as priests in the ancient dynasty.

Produces several small magical bubbles that drift towards foes before they naturally pop.
Charging increases the delay before the bubbles pop.

The claymen search for lost oracles within their bubbles.
fields.location: Found in the Siofra River region. From the Worshippers’ Woods site of grace, head west to a group of ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by ancestral followers.

fields.name: Great Oracular Bubble
fields.description:
Sorcery of the claymen who served as priests in the ancient dynasty.

Produces a gigantic magical bubble that drifts towards foes before it naturally ruptures.
Charging increases the delay before the bubble pops.

The claymen search for lost oracles within their bubbles.
fields.location: Found in the Siofra River region. From the Worshippers’ Woods site of grace, head west to a group of ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by ancestral followers.

fields.name: O, Flame!
fields.description:
Incantation of the Fire Monks.

Momentarily sparks roaring flame from the caster's hand.
Charging enhances potency.

The Giants' Flame still smolders upon the distant northern mountaintop, and the Fire Monks are its guardians.
fields.location: Purchased from Brother Corhyn at the Roundtable Hold after you first speak to him. Also sold by various nomadic merchants.

fields.name: Whirl, O Flame!
fields.description:
Superior incantation of the Fire Monks.

Creates a spiraling stream of fire that burns the area before the caster.
Charging enhances potency and reach.

Fire beguiles those who gaze into it. And so the guardians of the Flame are also its worshippers.
fields.location: Purchased from Brother Corhyn at the Roundtable Hold after advancing his questline.

fields.name: Burn, O Flame!
fields.description:
One of the incantations that draws directly from the power of the Fire Giants.

Raises a series of flame pillars around the caster.
Charging further increases the number of flame pillars.

The Fire Giants borrowed from the power of a fell god, and still they were defeated. Yet their failure released them from their solitary curse: to serve as keepers of the Flame for eternity.
fields.location: This incantation is obtained by defeating the Fire Giant in the Mountaintops of the Giants. After the boss fight, the spell is available for purchase at the Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold.

fields.name: Black Flame
fields.description:
A black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles.

Throws a ball of raging black fire.
Charging enhances potency and causes the fireball to explode.

Black flame is weighty. After dealing damage it continues to sap foes' HP for a very short time.
fields.location: Found in Stormveil Castle. From the Liftside Chamber site of grace, head outside and make your way to the rooftops. The spell is on a corpse guarded by a large bird, located near the area where you encounter Godrick Knights.

fields.name: Surge, O Flame!
fields.description:
Superior incantation of the Fire Monks.

Creates a stream of fire to burn the area before the caster.
This incantation can be cast while in motion. Hold to maintain the effect.

The Giants' Flame is the flame of ruin, capable of burning the Erdtree. And so, following the War against the Giants, its ruinous blaze was sealed, and guardians were appointed to watch over it.
fields.location: Purchased from Brother Corhyn at the Roundtable Hold after you first speak to him. Also sold by various nomadic merchants.

fields.name: Scouring Black Flame
fields.description:
A black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles.

Sweeps a wide area before the caster with black flame.
Charging enhances range.

The black flame could once slay gods. But when Maliketh sealed Destined Death, the true power of the black flame was lost.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Ancient Snow Valley Ruins site of grace, head east to a ruined tower. The spell is on a corpse inside the tower.

fields.name: Black Flame Ritual
fields.description:
Superior black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles.

Summons a circle of black flame pillars around the caster.
Charging increases the size of the circle.

The Gloam-Eyed Queen led the apostles. It is said that she was an Empyrean chosen by the Fingers.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east into the ruins. The spell is on a corpse in a small building, surrounded by enemies.

fields.name: Black Flame Blade
fields.description:
A black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles.

Engulfs armament held in the right hand with black flame.
This incantation can be cast without delay after performing another action.

Black flame is weighty. After dealing damage it continues to sap foes' HP for a very short time.
fields.location: Found in Stormveil Castle. From the Liftside Chamber site of grace, proceed through the castle and look for a corpse in a side room, guarded by Godrick Soldiers.

fields.name: Black Flame's Protection
fields.description:
A black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles.

Summons black fire within, increasing physical damage negation. However, sacred flasks and other such forms of HP restoration are impaired.

The Apostles were all embraced by the Gloam-Eyed Queen, and the black flame was their armor within.
fields.location: Located in the Altus Plateau. Travel to the northwest part of the plateau, near the outer wall of Leyndell. The spell is found on a corpse in a ruined structure, guarded by several enemies.

fields.name: Noble Presence
fields.description:
Ancient power of the Godskin Nobles.

Thrust out belly with gusto to produce a shockwave that knocks back nearby foes.
Charging enhances potency, knocking enemies into the air.

Once a sign of the gods' wrath, this incantation became a trophy of the Nobles' god hunt.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The spell is on a corpse inside, surrounded by enemies.

fields.name: Bloodflame Talons
fields.description:
A Blood Oath incantation, granted by the Lord of Blood.

Creates bloodflame lacerations before the caster, which explode in an instant.
This incantation can be cast repeatedly.

After dealing damage, bloodflame continues to build up onset of blood loss for a very short time.
fields.location: Obtained by defeating the Bloody Finger Hunter Yura’s invader at the Second Church of Marika in Altus Plateau. After the invasion, the spell is on a corpse in the church.

fields.name: Bloodboon
fields.description:
Sacred incantation of Mohg, Lord of Blood.

Thrust arm into the body of the Formless Mother, then scatter the bloodflame to set the area ablaze.
This incantation can be cast while in motion.

The mother of truth craves wounds. When Mohg stood before her, deep underground, his accursed blood erupted with fire, and he was besotted with the defilement that he was born into.
fields.location: Dropped by defeating Mohg, Lord of Blood, in the Mohgwyn Palace. After the boss fight, the incantation will be available for purchase at the Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold.

fields.name: Bloodflame Blade
fields.description:
A Blood Oath incantation, granted by the Lord of Blood.

Engulfs armament held in the right hand with bloodflame.
This incantation can be cast while in motion.

After dealing damage, bloodflame continues to build up onset of blood loss for a very short time.
fields.location: Found in Liurnia of the Lakes. From the Rose Church, head south to a group of ruins near the lake. The spell is on a corpse inside a ruined building, guarded by a giant crab.

fields.name: Barrier of Gold
fields.description:
One of the incantations of Erdtree Worship.

Greatly increases magic damage negation for the caster and nearby allies.
Hold to continue praying and delay activation.

This incantation was used by the champions of the Erdtree in the First and Second Liurnian Wars, during which the red-haired Radagon joined the heroes' ranks.
fields.location: This incantation is located in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the East Capital Rampart site of grace, head down the nearby elevator and proceed through the city streets. The spell is found on a corpse near a group of Leyndell Knights, tucked away in a corner overlooking the city.

fields.name: Protection of the Erdtree
fields.description:
A superior incantation of Erdtree Worship.

Increase damage negation for all affinities except physical, for both the caster and nearby allies.
Hold to continue praying and delay activation.

In the beginning, everything was in opposition to the Erdtree. But through countless victories in war, it became the embodiment of Order.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the East Capital Rampart site of grace, descend the nearby elevator and proceed through the city streets. The spell is on a corpse near a group of Leyndell Knights.

fields.name: Rejection
fields.description:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.

Produces a shockwave that knocks back nearby foes.
Charging increases the size of the shockwave.

Hark, Tarnished! If you truly walk in faith, you must be prepared to reject all else.
fields.location: Purchased from Brother Corhyn at the Roundtable Hold after you first speak to him.

fields.name: Wrath of Gold
fields.description:
Superior Erdtree Worship incantation.

Produces a golden shockwave that knocks back nearby foes.
Charging increases the size of the shockwave.

This incantation was discovered when the Elden Ring was shattered, and it was feared as a sign of the Erdtree's wrath.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the East Capital Rampart site of grace, descend the nearby elevator and proceed through the city streets. The spell is on a corpse near a group of Leyndell Knights.

fields.name: Urgent Heal
fields.description:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.

Heals a small amount of HP.
This incantation can be cast while in motion.

The Two Fingers has high hopes for the Tarnished; that even if they should be wounded, even should they fall, they will continue to fight for their duty.
fields.location: Purchased from Brother Corhyn at the Roundtable Hold after you first speak to him.

fields.name: Heal
fields.description:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.

Heals HP for the caster and nearby allies.
Hold to continue praying and delay activation.

The Two Fingers has high hopes for the Tarnished; that even if they should be wounded, even should they fall, they will continue to fight for their duty.
fields.location: Purchased from Brother Corhyn at the Roundtable Hold after you first speak to him.

fields.name: Great Heal
fields.description:
Superior incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.

Greatly heals HP for the caster and nearby allies.
Hold to continue praying and delay activation.

The Two Fingers has high hopes for the Tarnished; that even if they should be wounded, even should they fall, they will continue to fight for their duty.
fields.location: Purchased from Brother Corhyn at the Roundtable Hold after advancing his questline.

fields.name: Lord's Heal
fields.description:
Incantation bestowed by the Two Fingers upon the Tarnished deemed worthy of becoming a lord.

Heals a massive amount of HP for the caster and nearby allies.
Hold to continue praying and delay activation.

Tarnished—O, Tarnished! Seek the Erdtree and stand before Marika, its Queen. Become the Elden Lord!
fields.location: Purchased from Brother Corhyn at the Roundtable Hold after advancing his questline.

fields.name: Erdtree Heal
fields.description:
One of the ancient Erdtree incantations.

Heals a vast amount of HP for the caster and nearby allies.
Hold to continue praying and delay activation.

The Erdtree once flourished with abundance—yet it was only for a fleeting moment. Such is the course of all life.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the Avenue Balcony site of grace, descend the stairs and look for a corpse inside a small chapel, guarded by a Leyndell Knight.

fields.name: Blessing's Boon
fields.description:
One of the ancient Erdtree incantations.

Grants a blessing to the caster and nearby allies, gradually restoring HP.
Hold to continue praying and delay activation.

Blessings once fell like tears from the Erdtree, and this incantation is but a lingering remnant of their power.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The spell is on a corpse inside, surrounded by enemies.

fields.name: Blessing of the Erdtree
fields.description:
One of the ancient Erdtree incantations.

Grants a greater blessing to the caster and nearby allies, gradually restoring a large amount of HP.
Hold to continue praying and delay activation.

The Erdtree once flourished with abundance—yet it was only for a fleeting moment. Such is the course of all life.
fields.location: This incantation is found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the Avenue Balcony site of grace, head south and descend the stairs. The spell is on a corpse in a small chapel, guarded by a Leyndell Knight.

fields.name: Cure Poison
fields.description:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.

Alleviates poison buildup and cures poison.
This incantation can be cast while in motion.

The Two Fingers has high hopes for the Tarnished; that even if they should be wounded, even should they fall, they will continue to fight for their duty.
fields.location: This incantation is found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Fourth Church of Marika site of grace, head south to the Poison Mist Ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside the ruins, guarded by poison-spewing enemies.

fields.name: Lord's Aid
fields.description:
Incantation bestowed by the Two Fingers upon the Tarnished deemed worthy of becoming a lord.

Alleviates buildup of poison, blood loss, and sleep for the caster and nearby allies. Additionally, cures poison.

Hold to continue praying and delay activation.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau, near the Minor Erdtree Church. Head east to a ruined building—the spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by several enemies.

fields.name: Flame Fortification
fields.description:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.

Increases fire damage negation.
This incantation can be cast while in motion.

Follow the path that has been set for you, and you will make enemies of all others: the monks, the sorcerers, the ancient dragon knights, and the scions of gold. Heed me—the Lands Between offers no welcome to the Tarnished.
fields.location: Purchased from the Nomadic Merchant located in the Weeping Peninsula, near the Fourth Church of Marika.

fields.name: Magic Fortification
fields.description:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.

Increases magic damage negation.
This incantation can be cast while in motion.

Follow the path that has been set for you, and you will make enemies of all others: the monks, the sorcerers, the ancient dragon knights, and the scions of gold. Heed me—the Lands Between offers no welcome to the Tarnished.
fields.location: Purchased from the Nomadic Merchant at the Bellum Church in Liurnia. The merchant’s camp is just outside the church ruins.

fields.name: Lightning Fortification
fields.description:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.

Increases lightning damage negation.
This incantation can be cast while in motion.

Follow the path that has been set for you, and you will make enemies of all others: the monks, the sorcerers, the ancient dragon knights, and the scions of gold. Heed me—the Lands Between offers no welcome to the Tarnished.
fields.location: Purchased from the Nomadic Merchant located at the Bellum Church in Liurnia. The merchant’s camp is just outside the church ruins.

fields.name: Divine Fortification
fields.description:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' faithful.

Increases holy damage negation.
This incantation can be cast while in motion.

Follow the path that has been set for you, and you will make enemies of all others: the monks, the sorcerers, the ancient dragon knights, and the scions of gold. Heed me—the Lands Between offers no welcome to the Tarnished.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula, at the Church of Pilgrimage. The spell is on a corpse inside the church, guarded by wandering nobles.

fields.name: Lord's Divine Fortification
fields.description:
Incantation taught to Gideon the All-Knowing by the Two Fingers.

Greatly increases holy damage negation for the caster and nearby allies.
Hold to continue praying and delay activation.

Gideon gained true knowledge after his long exchange with the Two Fingers—discovering all had been broken long ago; that the trembling fingers, bent with age, and the Erdtree itself, were no exception.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the East Capital Rampart site of grace, descend the nearby elevator and proceed through the city streets. The spell is on a corpse near a group of Leyndell Knights.

fields.name: Night Maiden's Mist
fields.description:
One of the night sorceries of Sellia, Town of Sorcery.

Releases a life-sapping silver mist before the caster, dealing damage to all caught within, including the caster.
This sorcery can be cast while in motion.

Below Sellia, the Eternal City of Nokron sleeps. This sorcery originates from the maidens of that place.
fields.location: Found in Nokron, Eternal City. From the Ancestral Woods site of grace, head west to a group of ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by ancestral followers.

fields.name: Assassin's Approach
fields.description:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' servants, who once served as the assassins of the Roundtable Hold.

Completely silences the footsteps of the caster. Additionally, reduces fall damage and the sound produced by falling.
This incantation can be cast while in motion or crouching.

The assassins were charged with eliminating Tarnished who had strayed from guidance.
fields.location: This incantation is found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside the ruins, near a group of enemies.

fields.name: Shadow Bait
fields.description:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' servants, who once served as the assassins of the Roundtable Hold.

Creates a pale gold shadow before the caster, luring foes of human build and attracting their aggression.
This incantation can be cast while in motion or crouching, and will still affect foes that are already in a combat state.

It is said that those beguiled by the shadow see within it a hated foe.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside the ruins, near a group of enemies.

fields.name: Darkness
fields.description:
Incantation of the Two Fingers' servants, who once served as the assassins of the Roundtable Hold.

Creates a veil of darkness that conceals the caster.
This incantation can be cast while in motion or crouching.

The assassins were themselves once Tarnished who had strayed from guidance, and they pursued their duty in the darkness that is without grace.
fields.location: Found in the Cathedral of the Forsaken beneath Leyndell, Royal Capital. After descending into the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds, locate the underground cathedral. The spell is on a corpse near the area where you find Mohg’s boss arena.

fields.name: Golden Vow
fields.description:
An incantation of Erdtree Worship.

Increases attack power and defense for the caster and nearby allies.
Hold to continue praying and delay activation.

This incantation has been taught to knights of the royal capital for generations, and knights sent on distant expeditions lean on it as a source of courage.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau, near the Corpse-Stench Shack. From the shack, head north to a group of ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by enemies.

fields.name: Discus of Light
fields.description:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.

Produces a ring of light and fires it forwards. The ring of light returns to a position close to the caster before disappearing.
This incantation can be cast repeatedly.

A gift from the young Miquella to his father, Radagon.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau, near the Minor Erdtree Church. From the church, head west to a group of ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside a ruined building.

fields.name: Triple Rings of Light
fields.description:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.

Produces three rings of light and fires them forwards. The rings of light return to a position close to the caster before disappearing.
This incantation can be cast repeatedly.

A gift from the young Miquella to his father, Radagon.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The spell is on a corpse inside, surrounded by enemies.

fields.name: Radagon's Rings of Light
fields.description:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
A gift of gratitude to the young Miquella from his father, Radagon.

Produces a golden ring of light and fires it across a wide area.
Charging enhances range.

And yet, the young Miquella abandoned fundamentalism, for it could do nothing to treat Malenia's accursed rot. This was the beginning of unalloyed gold.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Giant’s Gravepost site of grace, head east to a ruined church. The spell is on a corpse inside, surrounded by enemies.

fields.name: Elden Stars
fields.description:
This legendary incantation is the most ancient of those that derive from the Erdtree.

Creates a stream of golden shooting stars that assail the area.

It is said that long ago, the Greater Will sent a golden star bearing a beast into the Lands Between, which would later become the Elden Ring.
fields.location: Found in the Deeproot Depths. From the Great Waterfall Crest site of grace, head east to a ruined structure. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by several enemies.

fields.name: Law of Regression
fields.description:
Incantation of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
One of the key fundamentals.

Heals all negative statuses, dispels special effects, and reveals mimicry in all its forms.

The fundamentalists describe the Golden Order through the powers of regression and causality. Regression is the pull of meaning; that all things yearn eternally to converge.
fields.location: Found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the Avenue Balcony site of grace, descend the nearby stairs and look for a hidden path leading to a small chapel. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by a Leyndell Knight.

fields.name: Immutable Shield
fields.description:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.

Enchants shield held in the left hand with the light of regression, increasing all forms of non-physical damage negation and ailment resistance.

Two concepts form the basis for Golden Order fundamentalism. One is the law of regression, to which this incantation relates.
fields.location: Found in the Raya Lucaria Crystal Tunnel in Liurnia. Navigate the tunnel and defeat the boss. The spell is on a corpse in the final chamber.

fields.name: Litany of Proper Death
fields.description:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
Used by hunters of Those Who Live in Death.

Creates an image of Order, dealing holy damage to nearby foes. This incantation is especially damaging to Those Who Live in Death. Any felled by this incantation cannot be revived.

The role of the hunters is to stamp out defiled reason—all for the perfection of the Golden Order.
fields.location: Found in the Roundtable Hold. Advance Brother Corhyn’s questline or purchase it from him after progressing his story.

fields.name: Law of Causality
fields.description:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
One of the key fundamentals.

Manifests a small ring of causality within that allows the caster to automatically retaliate upon receiving a certain number of blows.

The fundamentalists describe the Golden Order through the powers of regression and causality. Causality is the pull between meanings; that which links all things in a chain of relation.
fields.location: Found in the Academy of Raya Lucaria. From the Schoolhouse Classroom site of grace, proceed through the classrooms and into the side rooms. The spell is on a corpse in one of these chambers.

fields.name: Order's Blade
fields.description:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
Used by hunters of Those Who Live in Death.

Enchants armament held in the right hand with holy-affinity attacks. This incantation is especially damaging to Those Who Live in Death. Any felled by this incantation cannot be revived.

The role of the hunters is to stamp out defiled reason—all for the perfection of the Golden Order.
fields.location: Found in the Roundtable Hold. Advance Brother Corhyn’s questline or purchase it from him after progressing his story.

fields.name: Order Healing
fields.description:
One of the incantations of the Golden Order fundamentalists.
Used by hunters of Those Who Live in Death.

Alleviates death blight buildup.

The noble Goldmask lamented what had become of the hunters. How easy it is for learning and learnedness to be reduced to the ravings of fanatics; all the good and the great wanted, in their foolishness, was an absolute evil to contend with.

Does such a notion exist in the fundamentals of Order?
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau. From the Minor Erdtree Church, head east to a ruined building. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by several enemies.

fields.name: Bestial Sling
fields.description:
Incantation taught by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman.

Swiftly flings a number of sharp rock shards.
This incantation can be cast without delay after performing another action.

It is said that in the time before the Erdtree, stones were the first weapons of the beasts who had gained intelligence.
fields.location: Given by Gurranq at the Bestial Sanctum after you present him with Deathroot. He will provide this spell early in his questline.

fields.name: Stone of Gurranq
fields.description:
Superior incantation taught by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman.

Hurls a boulder before the caster.
This incantation can be cast repeatedly.

Long ago, Gurranq was a beast of such terrifying ferocity that his former name meant "Death of the Demigods."
fields.location: Given by Gurranq, Beast Clergyman, at the Bestial Sanctum in Caelid after presenting him with a Deathroot.

fields.name: Beast Claw
fields.description:
Incantation taught by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman.

Creates beast claws that rend the land with shockwaves.
Charging enhances potency.

This incantation represents the fury of Gurranq, his bestial nature returned, as much as it does his restless agitation.
fields.location: Obtained by giving a Deathroot to Gurranq, Beast Clergyman, at the Bestial Sanctum in Caelid. As you continue to offer Deathroot to Gurranq, he will eventually reward you with Beast Claw.

fields.name: Gurranq's Beast Claw
fields.description:
Superior incantation taught by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman.

Creates beast claws that rend surroundings with shockwaves.

Long ago, Gurranq was a beast of such terrifying ferocity that his former name meant "Death of the Demigods."
fields.location: Already described as “Beast Claw” (obtained from Gurranq at the Bestial Sanctum after giving him Deathroot).

fields.name: Bestial Vitality
fields.description:
Incantation taught by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman.

Fills the body with bestial vigor, restoring HP over a period of time.

Having gained intelligence, the beasts must have felt how their wildness slipped away as civilization took hold.
fields.location: Another reward from Gurranq at the Bestial Sanctum for offering Deathroot. Continue his quest and he will grant you this healing incantation.

fields.name: Bestial Constitution
fields.description:
Incantation taught by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman.

Fills the body with bestial vigor, alleviating buildup of frost and blood loss.

Having gained intelligence, the beasts must have felt how their wildness slipped away as civilization took hold.
fields.location: Also received from Gurranq at the Bestial Sanctum after giving him enough Deathroot. Progress through his quest and he will hand over this spell as a reward.

fields.name: Lightning Spear
fields.description:
One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult.

Summons a lightning spear and hurls it before the caster.
Charging causes a lightning bolt to strike the point of impact.

Long ago, Godwyn the Golden defeated the ancient dragon Fortissax, and befriended his fallen foe—an event that gave rise to the ancient dragon cult in the capital.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Church of Pilgrimage site of grace, head south to the Fourth Church of Marika. The spell is on a corpse inside the church.

fields.name: Ancient Dragons' Lightning Strike
fields.description:
A secret incantation of the capital's ancient dragon cult.

Summons a red bolt of lightning that scatters and spreads around the surrounding area.
Charging enhances the range of the lightning bolt.

Spoken of in legend, red lightning is the weapon wielded by the ancient dragons.
fields.location: This incantation is found in Leyndell, Royal Capital. From the East Capital Rampart site of grace, head north and descend the elevator. Proceed through the ruins and look for a corpse on a ledge overlooking the city, guarded by Leyndell Knights.

fields.name: Lightning Strike
fields.description:
One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult.

Summons a bolt of lightning that scatters and spreads around the surrounding area.
This incantation can be cast repeatedly.

Ancestors of the modern dragons, the ancient dragons had scales of Gravel Stone and wielded lightning as their weapon. It is said that once they attacked Leyndell, the Royal Capital.
fields.location: Obtained by trading a Dragon Heart with the Dragon Communion Priestess at the Cathedral of Dragon Communion in Caelid. Defeat a lightning-wielding dragon to acquire the required heart.

fields.name: Frozen Lightning Spear
fields.description:
Incantation that channels the power of the Dragonkin Soldiers.

Creates a spear of ice lightning and stabs it into the ground from above. On impact, the spear will burst into trails of lightning advancing forwards.

The Dragonkin were born in the Eternal City, where they knew no true sky, nor true lightning. Instead, ice lightning was their weapon.
fields.location: Obtained by trading the Dragon Heart of a lightning dragon with the Dragon Communion Priestess at the Cathedral of Dragon Communion in Caelid.

fields.name: Honed Bolt
fields.description:
One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult.

Summons a bolt of lightning to strike foes from above.
This incantation can be cast repeatedly.

Long ago, Godwyn the Golden defeated the ancient dragon Fortissax, and befriended his fallen foe—an event that gave rise to the ancient dragon cult in the capital.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau. From the Minor Erdtree Church, head east to a ruined building. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by several enemies.

fields.name: Ancient Dragons' Lightning Spear
fields.description:
A secret incantation of the capital's ancient dragon cult.

Creates a spear of red lightning and stabs it into the ground from above. On impact, the spear will burst into trails of lightning covering the area.

Spoken of in legend, red lightning is the weapon wielded by the ancient dragons.
fields.location: Found in Crumbling Farum Azula. From the Dragon Temple site of grace, navigate the ruins and descend the stairs to a chamber where a corpse holds the spell. The area is guarded by several lightning-wielding enemies.

fields.name: Fortissax's Lightning Spear
fields.description:
Incantation that channels the power of the ancient dragon Fortissax.

Creates two spears of red lightning and stabs them into the ground from above, one after another. On impact, each spear will burst into trails of lightning covering the area.

During the War of the Ancient Dragons, these twin red lightning stakes were the hallmark of one ancient dragon who was called the mightiest boulderstone.
fields.location: Obtained by defeating Lichdragon Fortissax in the Deeproot Depths. The spell is available for purchase at the Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold after the boss fight.

fields.name: Lansseax's Glaive
fields.description:
Incantation that channels the power of the ancient dragon Lansseax.

Creates a red-lightning glaive and sweeps the area from above. This attack unleashes trails of lightning.

Lansseax was the sister of Fortissax. It is said that she took the form of a human to commune with the knights as a priestess of the ancient dragon cult.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau. From the Abandoned Coffin site of grace, head east and look for a lightning-wielding dragon near the cliffs. Defeat or interact with the dragon to receive the spell.

fields.name: Electrify Armament
fields.description:
One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult.

Enchants armament held in the right hand with lightning-affinity attacks.

Long ago, Godwyn the Golden defeated the ancient dragon Fortissax, and befriended his fallen foe—an event that gave rise to the ancient dragon cult in the capital.
fields.location: Purchased from the Nomadic Merchant near the Raya Lucaria Academy in Liurnia. The merchant is located near the Artist’s Shack.

fields.name: Vyke's Dragonbolt
fields.description:
Incantation of Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold.

Summons red lightning to bolster both the caster's body and their armament held in the right hand. Enchants armament with lightning-affinity attacks and increases maximum equipment load. However, lightning damage negation will be reduced.

Of all the knights, Vyke the Dragonspear was the one Lansseax loved the most.
fields.location: Found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. From the Ancient Snow Valley Ruins site of grace, head east to a ruined tower. The spell is on a corpse inside the tower.

fields.name: Dragonbolt Blessing
fields.description:
Superior incantation of the capital's ancient dragon cult.

Summons lightning to bolster the caster's body. Attacks become easier to deflect and resistance to all ailments is increased. However, lightning damage negation will be reduced.

Only those loved by dragons can survive the ordeal of cladding their bodies in lightning.
fields.location: Purchased from the Isolated Merchant at the Isolated Merchant’s Shack in the Weeping Peninsula. Travel to the southernmost point of the peninsula to find the merchant.

fields.name: Dragonfire
fields.description:
One of the incantations of Dragon Communion.

Transforms caster into a dragon to spew flaming breath.
Charging extends duration.

Incantation of those who have hunted dragons and feasted upon their hearts. Theirs is a pure and overwhelming power.
fields.location: Also obtained by trading a Dragon Heart with the Dragon Communion Priestess at a Dragon Communion Altar. Any dragon heart can be used to unlock this spell at the altar.

fields.name: Agheel's Flame
fields.description:
Superior incantation of Dragon Communion.
Channels the power of the flying dragon Agheel.

Transforms caster into a dragon to spew flaming breath from above.
Charging extends duration. This incantation can be used while jumping.

The dead gazed at the skies over the lakes of Limgrave, praying that the dragons' flames would burn them to ash.
fields.location: This incantation is obtained by trading the Dragon Heart of Flying Dragon Agheel with the Dragon Communion Priestess at the Dragon Communion Altar in Limgrave. After defeating Agheel at Agheel Lake, bring his heart to the altar to acquire the spell.

fields.name: Magma Breath
fields.description:
One of the incantations of Dragon Communion.

Transforms caster into a wyrm to spew magma breath.
Allows one follow-up attack.

Those who have performed the Dragon Communion will find their humanity slowly slipping away. Once they fully succumb to their fate, they are left no more than wyrms that crawl the earth.
fields.location: Obtained by trading the Dragon Heart of Magma Wyrm Makar with the Dragon Communion Priestess at the Cathedral of Dragon Communion in Caelid. Defeat Makar in the Ruin-Strewn Precipice to receive his heart.

fields.name: Theodorix's Magma
fields.description:
Superior incantation of Dragon Communion.
Channels the power of the great wyrm Theodorix.

Transforms caster into a great wyrm to spew a large volume of magma breath.
Allows one follow-up attack.

The name of the ancient troll warrior Theodorix lives on—as a hero of the War against the Giants.
fields.location: Obtained by trading the Dragon Heart of Magma Wyrm Theodorix with the Dragon Communion Priestess at the Cathedral of Dragon Communion in Caelid. Defeat Theodorix in the Mountaintops of the Giants to receive his heart.

fields.name: Dragonice
fields.description:
One of the incantations of Dragon Communion.

Transforms caster into a dragon to spew icy breath.
Charging extends duration.

Those extraordinary individuals who perpetuate Dragon Communion are called the dragon-hearted.
fields.location: Obtained by trading the Dragon Heart of a Glintstone Dragon with the Dragon Communion Priestess at a Dragon Communion Altar. This includes dragons found in Liurnia and Caelid.

fields.name: Borealis's Mist
fields.description:
Superior incantation of Dragon Communion.
Channels the power of Borealis, the Freezing Fog.

Transforms caster into a dragon to spew icy breath from above.
Charging extends duration. This incantation can be cast while jumping.

The ice dragons were once lords of the mountaintops long ago, until they were defeated by the Fire Giants and chased from the peak.
fields.location: This incantation is obtained by trading the Dragon Heart of Borealis, the Freezing Fog, with the Dragon Communion Priestess at the Dragon Communion Altar in Liurnia. After defeating Borealis in the Mountaintops of the Giants, bring his heart to the altar to acquire the spell.

fields.name: Rotten Breath
fields.description:
One of the incantations of Dragon Communion.

Transforms caster into a dragon to spew scarlet rot breath.
Charging extends duration.

Those extraordinary individuals who perpetuate Dragon Communion are called the dragon-hearted.
fields.location: Obtained by trading a Dragon Heart with the Dragon Communion Priestess at the Cathedral of Dragon Communion in Caelid. Defeat a rot-infested dragon to receive the required heart.

fields.name: Ekzykes's Decay
fields.description:
Superior incantation of Dragon Communion.
Channels the power of Ekzykes, the Decaying.

Transforms caster into a dragon to spew scarlet rot breath from above.
Charging extends duration. This incantation can be cast while jumping.

Ekzykes, Dragon Communion Revenger, did not forget his hatred even as he succumbed to the scarlet rot.
fields.location: Obtained by trading the Dragon Heart of Decaying Ekzykes with the Dragon Communion Priestess at the Cathedral of Dragon Communion in Caelid. Defeat Ekzykes near the Caelid Highway North to receive his heart.

fields.name: Glintstone Breath
fields.description:
One of the incantations of Dragon Communion.

Transforms caster into a dragon to spew magic breath.
Charging extends duration.

Those extraordinary individuals who perpetuate Dragon Communion are called the dragon-hearted.
fields.location: Obtained by trading a Dragon Heart with the Dragon Communion Priestess at any Dragon Communion Altar. Defeat a glintstone dragon to receive the required heart.

fields.name: Smarag's Glintstone Breath
fields.description:
Superior incantation of Dragon Communion.
Channels the power of Smarag, the Glintstone Dragon.

Transforms caster into a dragon to spew magic breath from above.
Charging extends duration. This incantation can be cast while jumping.

Smarag was a devourer of sorcerers, and over time, his body became corrupted by their glintstones.
fields.location: Obtained by trading the Dragon Heart of Glintstone Dragon Smarag with the Dragon Communion Priestess at the Cathedral of Dragon Communion in Caelid. Defeat Smarag at the Academy of Raya Lucaria to receive his heart.

fields.name: Placidusax's Ruin
fields.description:
Power gleaned from the remembrance of Dragonlord Placidusax.

Transforms caster into the Dragonlord to spew golden breath from above.
This incantation can be cast while jumping.

These are the dying wails of the Dragonlord who once dwelled eternally beyond time.
fields.location: Obtained by defeating Dragonlord Placidusax in Crumbling Farum Azula. The spell is available for purchase at the Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold after the boss fight.

fields.name: Dragonclaw
fields.description:
One of the incantations of Dragon Communion.

Transforms caster into a dragon to tear through foes with dragon claws.
Allows one follow-up attack.

Incantation of those who have hunted dragons and feasted upon their hearts. Theirs is a pure and overwhelming power.
fields.location: Location: Obtained by trading a Dragon Heart with the Dragon Communion Priestess at any Dragon Communion Altar. Defeat any large dragon and bring its heart to the altar to acquire the spell.

fields.name: Dragonmaw
fields.description:
One of the incantations of Dragon Communion.

Transforms caster into a dragon to bite enemies before them.

Incantation of those who have hunted dragons and feasted upon their hearts. Theirs is a pure and overwhelming power.
fields.location: Unlocked by trading a Dragon Heart with the Dragon Communion Priestess at a Dragon Communion Altar. Defeat a large dragon to receive the heart required.

fields.name: Greyoll's Roar
fields.description:
Superior incantation of Dragon Communion.
Channels the power of Greyoll, the Elder Dragon.
An incantation of legendary status.

Transforms caster into a dragon to emit a terrible roar, reducing the attack power and defense of nearby enemies.

Greyoll was the mother of all dragons, dwarfing all who stood before her like a looming mountain.
fields.location: Obtained by trading the Dragon Heart of Elder Dragon Greyoll with the Dragon Communion Priestess at the Cathedral of Dragon Communion in Caelid. Defeat Greyoll near Fort Faroth to receive his heart.

fields.name: Pest Threads
fields.description:
Incantation of the servants of rot.

Secretes countless sticky threads, launching them forwards.

A technique of the pale pests who crawl through the lands afflicted by scarlet rot; the abandoned children of the goddess.
"Do you have an interest in rot incantations?"
fields.location: Found in the Lake of Rot, Liurnia. From the Grand Cloister site of grace, head west to a group of ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by pests.

fields.name: Swarm of Flies
fields.description:
A Blood Oath incantation, shared from the Lord of Blood's power.

Releases a swarm of bloodflies before the caster to assault foes. The vile swarm deals damage and builds up onset of blood loss.
This incantation can be cast while in motion.

The new palace of the Lord of Blood lies in a swamp of festering blood, and these flies are said to spawn from excrement in that land.
fields.location: Found in the Mohgwyn Palace area. From the Palace Approach Ledge-Road site of grace, head west into the blood lake. The spell is on a corpse near a group of blood-splattered enemies.

fields.name: Poison Mist
fields.description:
Incantation of the servants of rot.

Releases a poisonous mist before the caster.
This incantation can be cast while in motion.

Those who dwell within poison know rot all too well. The death that begets life, that comes to all equally. That is to say: it is the cycle of rebirth put into practice.
fields.location: Purchased from the Nomadic Merchant at the Bellum Church in Liurnia. The merchant’s camp is just outside the church ruins.

fields.name: Poison Armament
fields.description:
Incantation of the servants of rot.

Enchants armament held in the right hand with poison.
This incantation can be cast while in motion.

Those who dwell within poison know rot all too well. The death that begets life, that comes to all equally. That is to say: it is the cycle of rebirth put into practice.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside the ruins, near a group of enemies.

fields.name: Scarlet Aeonia
fields.description:
Technique of Malenia, the Goddess of Rot.

Creates a gigantic flower that blooms into an explosion of scarlet rot.
