Each time the scarlet flower blooms, Malenia's rot advances. It has bloomed twice already. With the third bloom, she will become a true goddess.
fields.location: Obtained by defeating Malenia, Blade of Miquella, in Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree. The spell is available for purchase at the Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold after the boss fight.

fields.name: Inescapable Frenzy
fields.description:
Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers.

Causes the yellow flame of frenzy to blaze from the caster's eyes. The caster then latches onto foes, spreading the madness.
This incantation also causes buildup of madness in the caster, and is only effective against Tarnished.

To gaze into one another's eyes is truly the most intimate form of human contact.
fields.location: Found in Liurnia, near the Frenzied Flame Village. From the Church of Inhibition, head west to a group of ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside a ruined building.

fields.name: The Flame of Frenzy
fields.description:
Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers.

Causes the yellow flame of frenzy to burst forth from the caster's eyes.
Charging increases the range of the burst.

The flame of frenzy deals damage and causes buildup of madness. This incantation also causes buildup of madness in the caster, and is only effective against Tarnished.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside the ruins, near a group of enemies.

fields.name: Unendurable Frenzy
fields.description:
Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers.

Causes the yellow flame of frenzy to violently burst forth from the caster's eyes.
Hold to continue channeling the flame. This incantation can be used while in motion.

It is the maddening pain and unstoppable tears of those afflicted with the flame of frenzy brought into being.
fields.location: Found in Liurnia, near the Frenzied Flame Village. From the Church of Inhibition, head west to a group of ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside a ruined building.

fields.name: Frenzied Burst
fields.description:
Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers.

Releases concentrated blasts of the yellow flame of frenzy from the caster's eyes.
Charging enhances potency, enabling the blasts to penetrate the enemy's guard.

In times past, every single person who attempted to control the flame of frenzy succumbed to madness after a desperate internal struggle. This incantation is testament to a meager victory.
fields.location: Found in Liurnia, near the Frenzied Flame Village. From the Church of Inhibition, head west to a group of ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside a ruined building.

fields.name: Howl of Shabriri
fields.description:
Incantation originating from the maddening Three Fingers.

Releases a maddening shriek that causes madness buildup in foes nearby.
This incantation also causes madness buildup in the caster and makes enemies more likely to target them.

It is said that the sickness of the flame of frenzy began with Shabriri, the most reviled man in all history.
fields.location: Found in the Weeping Peninsula. From the Castle Morne Rampart site of grace, head south to the Tombsward Ruins. The spell is on a corpse inside the ruins, near a group of enemies.

fields.name: Aspects of the Crucible: Tail
fields.description:
One of the ancient Erdtree incantations.

Creates a supple tail that sweeps through foes before the caster.
Charging enhances potency.

This is a manifestation of the Erdtree's primal vital energies—an aspect of the primordial crucible, where all life was once blended together.
fields.location: Located in the Deeproot Depths. From the Great Waterfall Crest site of grace, head east to a ruined building. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by a Crucible Knight.

fields.name: Aspects of the Crucible: Horns
fields.description:
One of the ancient Erdtree incantations.

Creates a mighty horn on the caster's shoulder to gore foes from a low stance.
Charging allows the caster to barrel into foes before delivering the final attack.

This is a manifestation of the Erdtree's primal vital energies—an aspect of the primordial crucible, where all life was once blended together.
fields.location: Found in Stormveil Castle. From the Liftside Chamber site of grace, head outside and make your way to the rooftops. The spell is on a corpse in a side chamber, guarded by a knight.

fields.name: Aspects of the Crucible: Breath
fields.description:
One of the ancient Erdtree incantations.

Creates a throat pouch on the caster's neck, allowing them to spew fiery breath while walking.
Charging increases duration of the breath.

This is a manifestation of the Erdtree's primal vital energies—an aspect of the primordial crucible, where all life was once blended together.
fields.location: Obtained by defeating Crucible Knight Ordovis in the Auriza Hero’s Grave, located in the eastern part of Leyndell’s outer wall. After the boss fight, the spell is yours.

fields.name: Black Blade
fields.description:
Power gleaned from the remembrance of Maliketh.

Caster creates an illusory black blade, then leaps forward to deliver a spinning slash that emits a wave of light.
This can be followed up with one additional attack.

This blade was once imbued with Destined Death. In addition to dealing damage, it reduces foes' maximum HP and continues to sap their current HP for a very short time.
fields.location: This spell is obtained by defeating Maliketh, the Black Blade, in Crumbling Farum Azula. After the boss fight, the incantation will be available for purchase at the Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold.

fields.name: Fire's Deadly Sin
fields.description:
Incantation originating from a deeply ominous prophecy.

Sets both the caster and the surrounding area ablaze with raging flames. The caster's body will remain engulfed in flame for a while, burning them and any who draw near. Charging enhances potency.

The prophet despaired, looking up at the Erdtree, for soon the kindling would burst into flame, bringing ruin.

"The burning of the Erdtree is the first cardinal sin. That is not the domain of mere men."
fields.location: Found in the Giant-Conquering Hero’s Grave in the Mountaintops of the Giants. Navigate the dungeon and locate the spell on a corpse in a side chamber.

fields.name: Golden Lightning Fortification
fields.description:
An incantation of Erdtree Worship.

Greatly increases lightning damage negation for the caster and nearby allies.
Hold to continue praying, delaying the effect.

This incantation was used by the knights of the Erdtree during the assault by the great ancient dragon Gransax, and the bitter War of the Ancient Dragons that followed.
fields.location: Found in the Altus Plateau. From the Minor Erdtree Church, head east to a ruined building. The spell is on a corpse inside, guarded by several enemies.

fields.name: Milady
fields.description: An elegant greatsword notable for its refined length yet light construction. Its noble origins allow swift, graceful swings, earning it the moniker favored by aristocrats.
fields.location: Can be found in a treasure chest at the top of a stone watchtower near the Castle Front in Gravesite Plain (Shadow of the Erdtree DLC).

fields.name: Godskin Swaddling Cloth
fields.description: A sacred talisman sewn from the skin of new apostles; its supple touch is said to nurture deadly ambition. The Gloam-Eyed Queen cradles it as a boon for future godslayers.
fields.effects: Successive attacks restore HP (approx. 3% of max HP per proc).
fields.location: Obtained after defeating the Spiritcaller Snail boss in the Spiritcaller's Cave, east Mountaintops of the Giants.

fields.name: Black Dumpling
fields.description: A pitch-black mask forced on the unwilling, heightening pain and madness within. This grim headpiece amplifies a desire for chaos and suffering.
fields.effects: Increases attack power by 10% for 60 seconds when inflicted with
fields.location: Dropped rarely by first-generation Albinaurics found in Volcano Manor and Leyndell.

fields.name: Carian Filigreed Crest
fields.description: A finely crafted talisman bearing the intricate patterns of Carian royalty. Worn by sorcerers who value the efficient use of their mystical skills.
fields.effects: Reduces FP cost of weapon skills by 25%.
fields.location: Purchased from Iji the Blacksmith at the Road to the Manor in Liurnia.

fields.name: Greatshield Talisman
fields.description: A talisman depicting a knight holding a greatshield. The knights of Leyndell once modeled themselves after the Tree Sentinels. Their purpose is to protect that which deserves protection, and thus the shield always comes before the sword.
fields.effects: Greatshield Talisman reduces the stamina damage taken while bloc
fields.location: Found in a large carriage chest east of the Erdtree-Gazing Hill Site of Grace in the Altus Plateau. Beware of three fire-arrow balistae guarding the carriage.

fields.name: Dual Magma Blade build
fields.description: Dual Magma Blade build that has an ash of war for the main damage, as well as the light attacks at close combat to deal large amounts of fire damage. This could also be a counter attack playstyle using the inherent magma blade.

fields.name: Icerind Hatchet build
fields.description: Icerind Hatchet main way of dealing damage is the Hoarfrost stomp ash of war as well as its base moveset to maximise the cold attunement. The combat style is versatile as it can range from medium to close range.

fields.name: Dual Icerind Hatchet build
fields.description: Dual Icerind Hatchet that does pure physical damage depending on what ash of is in use, has a good moveset for close quarter combat that can deal frost damage, but also another playstyle would be jump attacks especially with the claw talisman. This weapon scales with dexterity to further increase the damage.

fields.name: Stormhawk Axe build
fields.description: The Stormhawk Axe weapon scales well with strength and dexterity. It requires a medium to close range counter attack combat style especialy with its unique ash of war thunderstorm. This should be used alongside the heavy attacks to punish large windows that more dangerous oponents will have. Buffs like Golden Vow should be used to aid the user in combat.

fields.name: Black Bow build
fields.description: The Black Bow needs a long to medium range user to deal sufficient damage use the quick attacks as well as the ash of war barrage. The user should also utilise bleed and poison build up if possible to get extra damage. The golden vow buff will increase defense and attack. Arrow's Sting talismans will increase the damage of every arrow to aid the barrage of attacks.

fields.name: Black Bow and Serpent Bow build
fields.description: The Black Bow & Serpent Bow are used to build up both bleed and poison. Poison arrows won't need to be used as that is inherent on the Serpent Bow. It uses a long to medium range combat style with a very quick ash of war barrage and the user should use the quick attacks on the black bow to maximise damage. The user should maintain distance as much as possible to avoid damage and to increase survivability. The user should scale in dexxterity and faith to increase the status effect damage.

fields.name: Hookclaws build
fields.description: The Hookclaws weapon is a short range rapid damage dealer. This weapon can do quick successive attacks especially when two-handed speeding up the blood bleed damage. Bloodflame blade should be utilised to increase the bleed damage as well as the lord of blood's exultaition. Alongside the quick attack playstyle, jump attacks could also become the main source of damage especially with the added damage through the claw talisman. The white mask is used again to increase the bleed damage. Thr Rotten Winged sword talisman is to increase the successive attack damage.

fields.name: Greatsword (Gut's sword) build
fields.description: Guts Greatsword has high poise damage that can be from the heavy attacks and the ash of war lion's claw, this means the user has to play a close combat style. Jump attacks can also be mixed in for the claw talisman damage increase and poise.

fields.name: Greatsword (Gut's sword) and Bloodstained Dagger build
fields.description: Guts Greatsword and Bloodstained dagger need a full close combat playstyle, that leads with charged heavies and the lion's claw ash of war, while the dagger is a backup weapon for quick attack punishes. The greatsword heavily scales with strength, and is suggested to have high endurance and vigor beside it. Jump attacks, charged heavy attacks, and lion's claw attacks all deal large amounts of poise damage allowing the user to get many riposts to deal extra damage.

fields.name: Maliketh's Black Blade build
fields.description: Maliketh's Black Blade scales with strength, dex and faith. The playstyle should consist of close to medium range combat. The user should apply destined death first to the opponent after buffs, and then follow with jump attacks and so on.

fields.name: Maliketh's Black Blade & Black Knife build
fields.description: Maliketh's Black Blade & Black Knife weapons are both used to apply destined death upon the opponent, followed by jump and heavy attacks from black blade and quick attack from the black knife. These weapons can be played both in a medium to close combat playstyle. Another option is to use the seal to use the incantation of black blade to deal extra damage with destined death. These weapons scale with strength, dex and faith.

fields.name: Zweihander build
fields.description: Zweihander is a greatsword that scales heavily on strength. With heavy charged attacks and the giant crusher ash of war large amounts of damage can be produced. Points into endurance and vigor is suggested.

fields.name: Starscourge Greatsword
fields.description: The Starscourge Greatsword weapon scales strength, dex and intelligence. The starcaller cry ash of war should be utilised to do gravity magic damage, as well as using the greatsword as a two-handed weapon to have two greatswords that do good poise damage. Jump attacks should be used when possible or when counter attacking in its close combat playstyle.

fields.name: Grafted Blade Greatsword build
fields.description: Grafted Blade Greatsword requires high amounts of strength, endurance and vigor. This weapon has very high poise damage that can be built up by charged heavy attacks and jump attacks for a close combat playstyle. Before fights begin the user is suggested to use 4 buffs consisting of flame, grant me strength, golden vow, commander o neil's weapon ash of war, and the main weapon grafted blade greatsword ash of war.

fields.name: Prelate's Inferno Crozier build
fields.description: Prelate's Inferno Crozier scales with strength, dex, and intelligence. Using charged heavies and the ash of war it can lead to good poise damage and very high fire damage. It is recommended to use the buffs of flame, grant me strenght and the commader o neil's weapon ash of war to increase physical damage.

fields.name: Ghiza's Wheel build
fields.description: Ghiza's Wheel requires large amounts of strength and dexterity scaling. Buffs should be applied for extra endurance and physical damage. A close combat style will be used as well as counter-attacks to punish enemies. The source of damage will be done by the ash of war, charged heavies and jump attacks. These will do great physical damage and poise damage.

fields.name: Giant Crusher build
fields.description: Giant Crusher weapon requires high levels in strength, endurance and vigor. The combat style will consist of jump attacks, charged heavies, and finally the ash of war lion's claw. These will do high amounts of poise and physical damage along with the added damage from the buffs.

fields.name: Rotten Greataxe build
fields.description: Rotten Greataxe requires high amounts of strength, dexterity, and vigor. Combat style will consist of close range punishment and attacks. These will be the ash of wars and charged heavies. Jump attacks can also be introduced to deal as much rotten and apply bleed as well.

fields.name: Dual Bandit's Curved Sword build
fields.description: Dual Bandit's Curved Sword scales off dexterity and strength. The user's playstyle should consist of close-quater jump and quick attacks for quick successive damage and rapid bleed build up. To get extra bleed the user can use the ash of war seppuku or the bloodflame blade incantation, and the buffs can boost the stamina and damage.

fields.name: Magma Blade build
fields.description: Magma Blade has its own unique ash of war which is the Magma Shower. This is a fact skill that does physical and fire damage. It also leaves a small area of magma on the ground to keep dealing fire damage and stance damage to the opponent. Majority of the combat will be close combat and punishing the opponents large open windows with the ash of war.

fields.name: Wing of Astel build
fields.description: Wing of Astel is meant for close combat, utilised well with its Nebula ash of war. This ash of war can be against many foes and large opponents to deal stance and magic damage.

fields.name: Wing of Astel build
fields.description: The Wing of Astel build emphasizes a combination of melee and ranged magic attacks. Use the charged heavy attacks for their projectile attacks to chip away at enemies or exploit their weaknesses from a distance. Utilize Nebula to dispatch groups of enemies, inflict high stance damage on larger foes, or burst down bosses when they are vulnerable. Buff up with Terra Magica before engaging in critical moments, and use Carian Slicer for quick, close-range damage bursts. Consider dual-wielding curved swords, like another Wing of Astel or a Magic-infused Bandit's Curved Sword, for even higher melee damage output.

fields.name: Scavenger's Curved Sword build
fields.description: The focus is on aggressive attacks with dual curved swords to rapidly inflict bleeding. The Scavenger's Curved Sword excels at chaining hits, maximizing the benefits of talismans such as the Rotten Winged Sword Insignia and Millicent's Prosthesis. Initiate engagements with jump attacks, enhanced by the Claw Talisman, to immediately inflict damage and begin building bleed. When facing tougher enemies or those resistant to bleed, use the Seppuku Ash of War on both swords for a boost to bleed build-up and damage output. Manage health carefully, as Seppuku consumes HP. Utilize the Flask of Wondrous Physick before intense battles for temporary boosts in damage or poise. Consider Incantations such as Bloodflame Blade to further increase bleed build-up, or Dragon Communion Incantations for supplemental damage and crowd control, adapting strategy to the enemy or situation.

fields.name: Eclipse Shotel build
fields.description: The Eclipse Shotel combines melee combat with the Death Flare weapon art. Engage in close-quarters combat using the curved sword's fast attack speed. This allows you to chain hits to maximize the effects of talismans that boost damage on successive strikes. The weapon's design allows it to bypass a portion of enemy shield defenses, making it effective against guarded foes. Utilize the Death Flare skill to inflict Death Blight buildup on opponents, particularly in PvP, where it can lead to instant death. Against enemies immune to Death Blight, the explosion from Death Flare still provides solid damage and stance breaking potential. Before engaging in difficult encounters, empower yourself with Incantation buffs like Golden Vow and Flame, Grant Me Strength, and activate your Flask of Wondrous Physick for added damage and survivability. Adapt your approach based on the enemy: exploit Death Blight buildup against Tarnished opponents, or leverage the holy damage and explosive power of Death Flare against other foes.

fields.name: Scimitar build
fields.description: Employ the Scimitar's rapid attack speed to deliver a flurry of blows, particularly when dual-wielding, to quickly inflict damage and apply status effects like bleeding or poison. The fast attack chains benefit greatly from talismans that boost damage with successive hits. Utilize jump attacks, enhanced by the Claw Talisman, as a primary opener to close distances and initiate offense. Experiment with different Ashes of War like Spinning Slash for aggressive engagements or Bloodhound's Step for evasive maneuvers and advantageous positioning. When facing challenging enemies or bosses, consider using temporary boosts from the Flask of Wondrous Physick and Incantation buffs like Golden Vow for increased damage and durability. Adapt your strategy to the enemy type, focusing on bleed buildup for susceptible foes or prioritizing raw physical damage against those resistant to status effects. Be mindful of stamina management, especially when power stancing, to avoid being caught off guard.

fields.name: Scimitar Dual Wield build
fields.description: Employ the Scimitar's rapid attack speed to deliver a flurry of blows, particularly when dual-wielding, to quickly inflict damage and apply status effects like bleeding or poison. The fast attack chains benefit greatly from talismans that boost damage with successive hits. Utilize jump attacks, enhanced by the Claw Talisman, as a primary opener to close distances and initiate offense. Experiment with different Ashes of War like Spinning Slash for aggressive engagements or Bloodhound's Step for evasive maneuvers and advantageous positioning. When facing challenging enemies or bosses, consider using temporary boosts from the Flask of Wondrous Physick and Incantation buffs like Golden Vow for increased damage and durability. Adapt your strategy to the enemy type, focusing on bleed buildup for susceptible foes or prioritizing raw physical damage against those resistant to status effects. Be mindful of stamina management, especially when power stancing, to avoid being caught off guard.

fields.name: Bloodhound's Fang build
fields.description: The Bloodhound's Fang build excels through a combination of melee strikes, the weapon's special skill, and Incantation buffs. Begin by empowering the weapon with Bloodflame Blade, adding fire damage and boosting bleed buildup, which synergizes with the Fang's innate bleed effect. Engage opponents with standard attacks and charged attacks, particularly the powerful second R2 which can be a great finisher. Leverage the Bloodhound's Finesse skill for both offensive and defensive purposes. The initial uppercut delivers significant damage, while the backward somersault provides valuable invincibility frames for dodging attacks or creating distance. Follow up with a strong attack after the initial skill to teleport towards your foe and deliver another potent strike,. Against enemies susceptible to bleed, the rapid attacks combined with Bloodflame Blade and the Lord of Blood's Exultation talisman will quickly inflict blood loss, leading to devastating damage bursts,. Utilize Flask of Wondrous Physick buffs before challenging encounters to temporarily maximize damage or defensive capabilities. Consider using jump attacks, enhanced by the Claw Talisman, for even greater damage potential. This build's strength lies in its aggressive melee combat combined with the strategic use of Bloodhound's Finesse for both offense and defense, allowing for adaptability in various combat scenarios.

fields.name: Zamor Curved Sword build
fields.description: The Zamor Curved Sword's moveset and Zamor Ice Storm weapon skill are its strengths. The light attack chain involves spinning slashes that move the player forward, suitable for aggressive engagements. The charged heavy attack's second hit is a powerful double slash. Zamor Ice Storm inflicts frostbite, dealing damage and reducing enemy defenses, according to Elden Ring Wiki. Use this skill to stagger enemies, control an area, or apply frostbite quickly. Be aware of the skill's short range and the weapon's slower swing speed. Combine the weapon's attacks with jump attacks, especially when dual-wielding, to maximize damage and utilize the Claw Talisman's boost. Consider using the Bloodhound's Fang alongside the Zamor Curved Sword for both bleed and frost buildup, or focus solely on a Dex/Quality build for strong physical damage. Before challenging encounters, activate your Flask of Wondrous Physick and use Incantation buffs to enhance your damage output and survivability. Choose your strategy based on the enemy type, leveraging the frostbite against vulnerable foes or relying on raw damage and the weapon's unique moveset for others.

fields.name: Dual Zamor Curved Sword build
fields.description: The Zamor Curved Sword's moveset and Zamor Ice Storm weapon skill are its strengths. The light attack chain involves spinning slashes that move the player forward, suitable for aggressive engagements. The charged heavy attack's second hit is a powerful double slash. Zamor Ice Storm inflicts frostbite, dealing damage and reducing enemy defenses, according to Elden Ring Wiki. Use this skill to stagger enemies, control an area, or apply frostbite quickly. Be aware of the skill's short range and the weapon's slower swing speed. Combine the weapon's attacks with jump attacks, especially when dual-wielding, to maximize damage and utilize the Claw Talisman's boost. Consider using the Bloodhound's Fang alongside the Zamor Curved Sword for both bleed and frost buildup, or focus solely on a Dex/Quality build for strong physical damage. Before challenging encounters, activate your Flask of Wondrous Physick and use Incantation buffs to enhance your damage output and survivability. Choose your strategy based on the enemy type, leveraging the frostbite against vulnerable foes or relying on raw damage and the weapon's unique moveset for others.

fields.name: Monk's Flame Sword build
fields.description: The Monk's Flameblade's strength lies in its base damage, Dexterity scaling, and versatile Ash of War. Begin by using Flask of Wondrous Physick and Incantation buffs like Golden Vow or Flame, Grant Me Strength. Use standard attacks, jump attacks, and the chosen Ash of War. For example, use Spinning Slash to engage multiple foes or inflict significant damage. Against fire-vulnerable enemies, infuse the weapon with a Fire affinity and utilize Incantations like Black Flame or Bloodflame Blade to maximize damage output. Maintain a medium distance combat style.

fields.name: Dual Monk's Flame Sword build
fields.description: The Monk's Flameblade's strength lies in its base damage, Dexterity scaling, and versatile Ash of War. Begin by using Flask of Wondrous Physick and Incantation buffs like Golden Vow or Flame, Grant Me Strength. Use standard attacks, jump attacks, and the chosen Ash of War. For example, use Spinning Slash to engage multiple foes or inflict significant damage. Against fire-vulnerable enemies, infuse the weapon with a Fire affinity and utilize Incantations like Black Flame or Bloodflame Blade to maximize damage output. Maintain a medium equip load for nimble movement and effective dodging in combat for an aggressive combat style.

fields.name: Morgott's Curved Sword build
fields.description: This build focuses on aggressive melee combat and strategic weapon skill use. Incantation buffs, such as Golden Vow and Flame, Grant Me Strength, increase offense and defense. The Flask of Wondrous Physick provides temporary boosts. Engage enemies with standard sword attacks, utilizing speed and range. The moveset, including wide sweeping light and running attacks, is effective against multiple enemies. The charged heavy attack can also be used for roll catches. Use the Cursed-Blood Slice skill in attack rotations to stagger enemies, with the fire explosion contributing to bleed buildup. This skill's hyper armor enables confident hit trading. The Lord of Blood's Exultation talisman provides a significant attack boost when triggering hemorrhage. Frenzied Burst can be used for high single-target damage against distant or evasive foes, even penetrating shields. Prioritize the fire damage from Cursed-Blood Slice against enemies vulnerable to fire. Tailor the strategy based on the enemy: exploit bleed vulnerabilities or rely on raw damage output and the moveset's versatility for other encounters.

fields.name: Black Knife build
fields.description: This build combines fast melee attacks with the unique effects of the Black Knife and Incantations. Increase offense and defense by using buffs like Golden Vow and Flame, Grant Me Strength. Activating your Flask of Wondrous Physick adds temporary boosts. Engage enemies with quick standard dagger attacks and charged heavy attacks to maximize talisman benefits. The Black Knife's Blade of Death skill is crucial. It launches a holy projectile that damages enemies and reduces their maximum HP for a period. Combining Blade of Death with the Black Blade Incantation can stack health-reducing debuffs for even greater boss damage. Consider switching to an off-hand Erdsteel Dagger with a different damage type or focusing more on Incantations like Black Flame for enemies resistant to holy damage. Using the Black Knife in the off-hand while wielding a weapon with a high critical rating like the Misericorde in the main hand can be beneficial against opponents vulnerable to critical hits. Manage FP effectively to ensure frequent use of Blade of Death and Incantations, potentially using FP-restoring talismans or Flask charges. Adapting weapon and Incantation choices based on enemy type and resistances is key to success.

fields.name: Dual Black Knife build
fields.description: This build combines fast melee attacks with the unique effects of the Black Knife and Incantations. Increase offense and defense by using buffs like Golden Vow and Flame, Grant Me Strength. Activating your Flask of Wondrous Physick adds temporary boosts. Engage enemies with quick standard dagger attacks and charged heavy attacks to maximize talisman benefits. The Black Knife's Blade of Death skill is crucial. It launches a holy projectile that damages enemies and reduces their maximum HP for a period. Combining Blade of Death with the Black Blade Incantation can stack health-reducing debuffs for even greater boss damage. Consider switching to an off-hand Erdsteel Dagger with a different damage type or focusing more on Incantations like Black Flame for enemies resistant to holy damage. Using the Black Knife in the off-hand while wielding a weapon with a high critical rating like the Misericorde in the main hand can be beneficial against opponents vulnerable to critical hits. Manage FP effectively to ensure frequent use of Blade of Death and Incantations, potentially using FP-restoring talismans or Flask charges. Adapting weapon and Incantation choices based on enemy type and resistances is key to success.

fields.name: Misericorde build
fields.description: The Misericorde build focuses on exploiting the high critical damage. Buffs like Golden Vow and Flame, Grant Me Strength, along with the Flask of Wondrous Physick, further increase critical damage. The Misericorde's light attacks can be used to chip away at enemies while awaiting parry or stance-break chances. Infusing the Misericorde with an elemental affinity, such as Fire or Lightning, allows criticals to bypass normal split damage resistance thresholds. This may increase critical damage more effectively than a pure physical infusion, particularly at lower levels.

fields.name: Misericorde build
fields.description: The Misericorde build focuses on exploiting the dagger's high critical damage. Parrying attacks with a shield opens enemies for a critical strike. Alternatively, break their stance with a strong Ash of War from a secondary weapon, such as Flame of the Redmanes. Buffs like Golden Vow and Flame, Grant Me Strength, along with the Flask of Wondrous Physick, further increase critical damage. The Misericorde's light attacks can be used to chip away at enemies while awaiting parry or stance-break chances. Infusing the Misericorde with an elemental affinity, such as Fire or Lightning, allows criticals to bypass normal split damage resistance thresholds. This may increase critical damage more effectively than a pure physical infusion, particularly at lower levels.

fields.name: Reduvia build
fields.description: This approach uses the Reduvia's speed and bleed effect, along with the Blood Blade skill. Focus on swift strikes to build up bleed. The Blood Blade projectile can initiate bleed buildup from a safe distance or add extra damage and buildup at close range. For enemies resistant to bleed, use the dagger's physical damage output. Maintaining a moderate FP pool for frequent Blood Blade use is important. Consider Incantation buffs like Golden Vow or Bloodflame Blade to further enhance damage and bleed effects, especially against tougher enemies.

fields.name: Dual Reduvia build
fields.description: Power stancing two Reduvias significantly increases the speed of bleed buildup, as each strike from both daggers contributes to the bleed meter. This is an aggressive playstyle that aims to quickly trigger hemorrhage. Use rapid L1 attacks and jump attacks, capitalizing on talismans like the Rotten Winged Sword Insignia for increased damage with successive hits. While having two Reduvias allows for more rapid attacks, the Blood Blade skill's effectiveness doesn't double simply by having two daggers. However, the sheer number of hits when dual wielding will lead to more bleed procs overall. Be mindful of stamina consumption when dual wielding, as the increased attack speed can quickly deplete it. Buff with Incantations and the Flask of Wondrous Physick before engaging in critical moments to maximize the damage potential of this aggressive build.

fields.name: Wakizashi build
fields.description: This approach leverages the Wakizashi's speed, bleed buildup, and chosen Ash of War. Focus on rapid strikes and Quickstep for evasion and setting up attacks. Apply Incantation buffs like Golden Vow for increased damage and defense. Conserve FP for the chosen Ash of War. Utilize the Wakizashi's ability to be buffed by Magic or consumables to further enhance its damage output, depending on the enemy's weaknesses.

fields.name: Dual Wakizashi build
fields.description: Power stancing two Wakizashis offers a flurry of attacks, rapidly building up bleed on susceptible enemies. Focus on chaining L1 attacks and jump attacks to maximize the benefit of successive attack talismans like the Rotten Winged Sword Insignia. Be mindful of stamina consumption when dual wielding, as the increased attack speed can deplete it quickly. Before engaging in critical moments, enhance damage output and survivability using Incantation buffs and the Flask of Wondrous Physick. Remember that the power-stance moveset of two Wakizashis is slower than the normal dagger moveset, according to Elden Ring Wiki.

fields.name: Wakizashi & Uchigatana build
fields.description: This setup provides the katana power stance moveset, which includes powerful wide swings, while retaining the benefits of the Wakizashi in the left hand. Parry can be equipped on the Wakizashi for parrying opportunities or Quickstep for evasion. This hybrid approach allows for aggressive melee combat with the katana's reach and moveset, complemented by the utility and low weight of the Wakizashi. Utilize the katana's Ash of War for stance breaks or area control, and consider jump attacks to take advantage of the combined damage of both weapons. Buff with Incantations like Golden Vow for added power.

fields.name: Cinquedea build
fields.description: This approach uses the Cinquedea's high base damage and Strength scaling for close-quarters combat. Use standard dagger attacks and Quickstep to position for optimal hits and evade incoming attacks. The main damage output comes from the Cinquedea's physical damage, supported by buffs like Golden Vow or Flame, Grant Me Strength, and Flask of Wondrous Physick charges. Bestial Incantations like Beastial Sling can be used for quick ranged attacks or for breaking enemy poise. Using Bestial Vitality provides a passive heal. The Cinquedea's quick attacks complement the swiftness of Beastial Sling.

fields.name: Dual Cinquedea build
fields.description: While this doesn't provide a specialized powerstance moveset, dual wielding Cinquedeas offers faster attacks than a single dagger, leading to higher damage output over time. This approach capitalizes on the damage bonus provided by using two Cinquedeas and the high attack speed of dual daggers. The focus is on aggressive melee combat, using standard attacks and jump attacks to inflict damage rapidly. Buffs like Golden Vow and Flame, Grant Me Strength further enhance the physical damage. Bestial Incantations like Beastial Sling can still be integrated into this playstyle for ranged attacks and poise damage. Manage stamina carefully when dual wielding, as the increased attack speed can deplete it quickly. Before critical engagements, use Incantation buffs and the Flask of Wondrous Physick to maximize damage and survivability.

fields.name: Grafted Dragon build
fields.description: This build relies on the Grafted Dragon's strong physical and fire damage, along with the Bear Witness! skill. Focus on charging heavy attacks for high stance damage, which can open enemies for critical strikes or a devastating Bear Witness! attack. According to Reddit, these attacks are swift and hard-hitting. The Ash of War, Bear Witness!, is effective against large enemies and groups because of its wide area of effect and lingering flames. Manage FP carefully to ensure frequent use of Bear Witness! against challenging enemies. Before engaging, enhance offense and defense with Incantation buffs like Golden Vow or Flame, Grant Me Strength, and Flask of Wondrous Physick charges. A shield can supplement this build for defense, particularly against agile or heavily-hitting opponents.

fields.name: Two Handing Iron Balls build
fields.description: This aggressive style involves power-stancing two Iron Balls to deliver a rapid barrage of heavy attacks. The focus is on overwhelming enemies with sustained damage and quickly breaking their stance. Charged heavy attacks, especially with two weapons, can be highly effective. The Rotten Winged Sword Insignia or Millicent's Prosthesis further boosts damage with the consecutive hits from dual wielding. However, stamina management is crucial, as the aggressive attack patterns consume it quickly. Utilize the Bull-Goat's Talisman for increased poise during attacks, allowing you to trade hits more effectively. Use buffs and Flask of Wondrous Physick charges strategically before engaging in combat to maximize damage output

fields.name: Two Handing Star Fist build
fields.description: This build uses an aggressive dual-wielding combat style, utilizing the Star Fists' innate bleed and high Strength scaling for rapid damage and stance breaking. The faster power-stance moveset should be used, particularly against bosses, to quickly break their posture and inflict hemorrhage. Charged heavy attacks, especially when dual wielding, are very effective for damage and stance breaking. Talismans like the Rotten Winged Sword Insignia boost damage with consecutive hits. Use Incantation buffs such as Golden Vow or Flame, Grant Me Strength before critical moments to maximize damage output. Manage stamina carefully, as the aggressive attack patterns will deplete it quickly, and consider using the Bull-Goat's Talisman for increased poise during attacks. Adapt the strategy based on enemy type and resistance to physical and bleed damage.

fields.name: Chainlink Flail build
fields.description: This approach utilizes the Chainlink Flail's raw physical damage, enhanced by Strength scaling and charged heavy attacks. Buff with Incantations like Golden Vow and Flame, Grant Me Strength, and activate the Flask of Wondrous Physick to maximize damage. Use charged heavy attacks to break enemy stance, taking advantage of the Axe Talisman. The chosen Ash of War, such as Cragblade or Barbaric Roar, should be integrated into the attack pattern to boost damage, stance breaking, or provide hyper armor for trading hits. Adapt to the situation, using the flail's strike damage against enemies resistant to slash or pierce attacks.

fields.name: Dual Chainlink Flail build
fields.description: Dual wielding Chainlink Flails is an aggressive strategy for fast and consistent damage. Prioritize the quick L1 attacks and jump attacks, especially when power stancing, to build up bleed and capitalize on the damage boost from successive hit talismans. Be mindful of stamina management due to the fast attacks. Buff with Incantations like Golden Vow for increased damage and survivability. Consider using jump attacks and the Claw Talisman for burst damage, as dual wielding attacks are consecutive and not simultaneous. Ensure enough poise to avoid interruption during attacks.

fields.name: Glintstone Staff build
fields.description: The Azur's Glintstone Staff build focuses on maximizing casting speed to unleash a constant stream of sorceries, prioritizing offensive pressure over raw damage per cast. The trade-off is higher FP consumption, which is managed through a higher Mind stat, talismans like the Radagon Icon (providing virtual Dexterity to cap casting speed), and the Cerulean Hidden Tear for temporary infinite FP bursts, crucial for spells like Comet Azur. While Azur's Staff doesn't specifically boost any school of sorcery, its speed benefit is ideal for high-damage spells and for maintaining pressure in both PvE and PvP. The Elden Ring Wiki indicates that the 40 virtual Dexterity provided by Azur's staff means you don't need to invest as many points into Dexterity to reach the casting speed cap.

fields.name: Carian Regal Sceptor build
fields.description: This build leverages the Carian Regal Scepter's high Intelligence scaling and passive boost to Moon sorceries to inflict significant damage, especially with spells like Rennala's Full Moon and Ranni's Dark Moon. The focus is on maximizing sorcery damage through high Intelligence and supportive talismans like the Magic Scorpion Charm and Graven-Mass Talisman. While the staff doesn't boost casting speed like Azur's, the Radagon Icon can compensate. The Carian Regal Scepter's strengths lie in its high damage potential and reliability as a primary casting tool for Intelligence builds. The Elden Ring Wiki notes that the staff provides a 10% boost to Moon sorceries.

fields.name: Carian Regal Sceptor & Meteorite Staff build
fields.description: This approach maximizes sorcery damage and adaptability by pairing the Carian Regal Scepter with a secondary staff. While the Carian Regal Scepter remains the primary casting tool for its superior overall scaling, the off-hand staff provides a passive damage bonus to specific spell types: Carian Sword sorceries with the Carian Glintstone Staff, or Gravity spells with the Meteorite Staff. This allows for a wider array of high-damage spells without needing to constantly re-equip your primary staff, offering greater strategic flexibility in combat. The ability to passively buff specific schools of magic in the off-hand allows the primary staff to maintain its high scaling for all other sorceries. Reddit users confirm that buffs from the off-hand staff apply when casting with the main hand.

fields.name: Meteorite Staff build
fields.description: Focus on maintaining distance while using sorceries. Prioritize Rock Sling against magic-resistant foes. Utilize Collapsing Stars or Gravity Well for tactical enemy manipulation. Use buffs like Golden Vow and Flame, Grant Me Strength, along with the Flask of Wondrous Physick's buffs, for burst damage against tougher enemies. Rock Sling is boosted by the Meteorite Staff. Mastering charged spells and using Terra Magica strategically will maximize damage output.

fields.name: Meteorite Staff & Carian Regal Sceptor build
fields.description: In the dual-wielding approach, the upgraded staff in the main hand (like the Carian Regal Scepter) becomes the primary casting tool for its superior scaling, while the Meteorite Staff in the off-hand provides a passive 30% boost to gravity sorceries. This means you'll still get a damage increase when casting gravity spells like Rock Sling, Collapsing Stars, Gravity Well, and Meteorite or Meteorite of Astel, even if not using the Meteorite staff to cast. To further optimize damage for specific situations, swap out the off-hand Meteorite Staff for another staff that buffs a different school of magic.

fields.name: Greataxe build
fields.description: Engage in close-quarters combat, utilizing the Greataxe's potent attacks and the Lion's Claw Ash of War to stagger and punish enemies. Focus on charged heavy attacks and jumping attacks to deal maximum damage and break enemy stance. Remember to two-hand the Greataxe to gain a 50% Strength bonus, increasing damage output and meeting stat requirements more easily. Scaling primarily comes from Strength, maximizing physical damage and Weapon Skill effectiveness. Invest heavily in Vigor for survivability and Endurance to manage heavy armor and sustain attacks. Use consumable buffs strategically before engaging tough foes to further amplify damage and defensive capabilities.

fields.name: Overwhelm enemies with a flurry of attacks, particularly jump attacks and the extended attack strings that dual-wielding provides. If using greataxes with passive effects like bleed or rot, leverage the rapid hits to build up these status effects quickly. Focus on mastering the dual-wielding attack patterns, including L1 attacks which utilize both weapons. Scaling is primarily driven by Strength, maximizing the physical damage of both Greataxes. Invest heavily in Vigor for health and Endurance to manage equip load and stamina. Strategic use of the chosen Ashes of War and consumable buffs will further enhance damage output and survivability in challenging encounters.
Dual Greataxe build
fields.description: Overwhelm enemies with a flurry of attacks, particularly jump attacks and the extended attack strings that dual-wielding provides. If using greataxes with passive effects like bleed or rot, leverage the rapid hits to build up these status effects quickly. Focus on mastering the dual-wielding attack patterns, including L1 attacks which utilize both weapons. Scaling is primarily driven by Strength, maximizing the physical damage of both Greataxes. Invest heavily in Vigor for health and Endurance to manage equip load and stamina. Strategic use of the chosen Ashes of War and consumable buffs will further enhance damage output and survivability in challenging encounters.

fields.name: Dual Great Omenkiller greateaxe build
fields.description: This build maximizes the Great Omenkiller Cleaver's potential by powerstancing two Heavy-infused Cleavers. It focuses on Strength scaling, aiming for 80 Strength to increase physical damage. The Omensmirk Mask provides a Strength boost and poise, while Raptor's Black Feathers amplify jumping attacks. The Claw Talisman enhances jump attacks further, and Lord of Blood's Exultation and White Mask offer attack buffs when blood loss occurs. This build utilizes the Cleaver's innate bleed and the Cragblade Ash of War. The build also includes high Vigor, Endurance for heavy armor, and Faith (25) for incantations such as Golden Vow and Flame, Grant Me Strength. The strategy involves using buffs, followed by powerstanced jump attacks, and chaining them with the Cleaver's standard attacks and Ash of War. This quickly overwhelms enemies and triggers bleed, activating damage bonuses from talismans and the White Mask.

fields.name: Axe of Godrick build
fields.description: The single-wielding strategy leverages the Axe of Godrick's innate Strength and Quality scaling, particularly when wielded two-handed for the 1.5x Strength multiplier, allowing for powerful heavy attacks and skills. The Shard of Alexander talisman is essential to significantly boost the damage of the "I Command Thee, Kneel!" skill, making it a potent tool for area denial and staggering, while the Axe Talisman amplifies the damage of charged heavy attacks, a core part of this weapon's moveset. High poise armor (like Lionel's or Bull-Goat sets) and the Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman ensure survivability during aggressive melee engagements. The strategy involves initiating with buffs (if applicable, such as Golden Vow), then using standard attacks and charged R2s to build damage and stagger, before unleashing "I Command Thee, Kneel!" to capitalize on openings and stun enemies, ensuring to utilize the Stonebarb Cracked Tear in the Flask of Wondrous Physick for enhanced poise damage and the Spiked Cracked Tear for stronger charged attacks.

fields.name: Axe of Godrick & Rusted Anchor build
fields.description: The dual-wielding strategy focuses on maximizing damage output through rapid, powerstanced attacks, particularly jump attacks. The Axe of Godrick is paired with another Heavy-infused Greataxe like the Rusted Anchor, chosen for its excellent Strength scaling (achieving A-scaling with Heavy infusion) and Pierce damage type. This setup shines with the Claw Talisman, which boosts jump attack damage by 15%, making these attacks highly effective for initiating combat and dealing burst damage. The Rotten Winged Sword Insignia further enhances damage output by increasing attack power with successive hits, ideal for the continuous nature of dual-wielding strikes. While "I Command Thee, Kneel!" from the Axe of Godrick remains available for AoE and stagger, the focus shifts to overwhelming enemies with a barrage of powerstanced jump attacks and sequential strikes. High Endurance (35-40) is crucial to manage the increased stamina consumption of dual-wielding and heavy armor, ensuring sustained aggression and the ability to dodge effectively, while the Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman still provides vital physical damage reduction. The Stonebarb Cracked Tear and Spiked Cracked Tear in the Flask of Wondrous Physick can still be utilized to enhance poise damage and, to a lesser extent, charged attacks during this highly aggressive playstyle.

fields.name: Rusted Anchor build
fields.description: The single-wielding strategy centers on the Rusted Anchor's excellent Strength scaling. This is especially true when infused with Heavy and wielded two-handed. This maximizes damage output. The weapon's piercing damage type is key, benefiting from the Spear Talisman. This increases damage by 15% on counter-attacks, which happen frequently. The Axe Talisman enhances charged heavy attacks, while Braggart's Roar buffs overall attack and modifies R2 attacks into powerful combos. This strategy emphasizes landing heavy and counter-attacks, using high poise armor, such as the Lionel's or Bull-Goat sets. Also, potential buffs like Golden Vow or Flame, Grant Me Strength, if Faith is used, can help. The Flask of Wondrous Physick with Stonebarb Cracked Tear and Spiked Cracked Tear amplifies poise damage and charged attacks. The strategic gameplay involves setting up buffs, engaging with strong attacks, timing for counter-hits, and trading blows confidently due to high poise.

fields.name: Dual Rusted Anchor build
fields.description: The dual-wielding approach uses two Rusted Anchors for maximum offensive pressure and damage output, especially through jump attacks. Both axes primarily scale with Strength, making high investment in this stat crucial. The Claw Talisman is vital, boosting jump attack damage by 15%, turning powerstanced jump attacks into devastating openers. The Rotten Winged Sword Insignia increases attack power with successive hits. While the weapon's default skill, Barbaric Roar, can be used to buff damage, incorporating Ashes of War like Cragblade or Wild Strikes on both weapons further diversifies offensive options. High Endurance is necessary to manage the equip load of two heavy weapons. The Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman provides physical damage reduction to facilitate trading blows. This strategy emphasizes constant aggression, initiating with powerful jump attacks, followed by chains of powerstanced attacks to build up damage quickly.

fields.name: Winged Greathorn build
fields.description: The single-wielding strategy focuses on the Winged Greathorn's unique strengths, primarily its Strength and Dexterity scaling. It performs best with high investment in these stats. The "Soul Stifler" skill, boosted by the Shard of Alexander talisman, is a key tool, allowing you to debuff enemies by temporarily reducing their defense, making them more susceptible to your attacks. Combining this with the increased damage from charged attacks (buffed by the Axe Talisman), allows for heavy burst damage. Maintaining high poise with heavy armor, like Lionel's or Bull-Goat sets, allows you to withstand hits while delivering powerful blows. The Ritual Sword Talisman rewards playing at full HP, encouraging careful engagement and evasion. The strategic flow involves initiating with "Soul Stifler" to weaken enemies, followed by a series of two-handed heavy and charged attacks to maximize damage, potentially incorporating buffs like Golden Vow if Faith is incorporated into the build. The Stonebarb Cracked Tear further aids in breaking enemy stances.

fields.name: Dual Winged Greathorn build
fields.description: The dual-wielding strategy for the Winged Greathorn emphasizes aggressive, continuous damage output through powerstanced attacks. High Strength and Dexterity are crucial for maximizing the damage of both axes. The core offensive revolves around powerstanced jump attacks, significantly enhanced by the Claw Talisman. These attacks deal high damage and quickly build up enemy stance. According to TheGamer, powerstancing weapons of the same class allows for devastating attack combinations. Successive hits activate the Rotten Winged Sword Insignia, further boosting attack power and making sustained offense incredibly effective. High Endurance is essential for managing the increased stamina cost of dual-wielding heavy weapons and wearing heavy armor. The Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman helps absorb physical damage while trading blows. The Shard of Alexander will still boost the single "Soul Stifler" skill available. This strategy focuses on relentless pressure and quickly overwhelming enemies with a barrage of powerstanced attacks and jump attacks, constantly triggering damage bonuses.

fields.name: Butchering Knife build
fields.description: The single-wielding strategy for the Butchering Knife centers on maximizing its Dexterity scaling and exploiting its unique passive healing effect. Infusing the weapon with Keen affinity ensures optimal scaling. The strategy involves using the chosen Ash of War, such as Barbaric Roar (or others like Wild Strikes), which can be significantly boosted by the Shard of Alexander talisman, allowing for more potent attacks and more frequent hits to proc the healing. High poise armor, like Lionel's or Bull-Goat sets, is vital to absorb hits and avoid interruptions during attacks. The Winged Sword Insignia further encourages aggressive play by increasing damage with successive hits, amplifying the healing and damage output. The Godfrey Icon will boost the charged attacks while the Green Turtle Talisman aids in stamina recovery. The Flask of Wondrous Physick's Thorny Cracked Tear and Opaline Bubbletear respectively enhance successive attack damage and provide a crucial layer of defense. The core combat flow involves applying buffs (if using Faith for buffs like Golden Vow), then engaging aggressively, using a mix of standard attacks, charged attacks, and the chosen Ash of War to continually hit the enemy and regenerate health while dealing damage.

fields.name: Dual Butchering Knife build
fields.description: The dual-wielding strategy aims to maximize the Butchering Knife's healing and damage output through relentless, powerstanced attacks, particularly jump attacks. Both axes are Keen infused to benefit from high Dexterity scaling. The Claw Talisman is a cornerstone of this build, boosting jump attack damage by 15%, making these attacks devastating for initiating combat and dealing burst damage. Constant, rapid attacks are also crucial to activate the Rotten Winged Sword Insignia, which increases attack power with successive hits, providing a continuous damage boost. High Endurance is essential for managing the increased stamina cost of dual-wielding heavy weapons and wearing heavy armor. The Great-Jar's Arsenal can alleviate equip load concerns, while the Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman offers physical damage reduction for trading blows effectively. The Shard of Alexander will still boost the chosen Ash of War on the main hand. This strategy emphasizes aggressive offense, using jump attacks to initiate, followed by chains of powerstanced attacks to continuously hit enemies, dealing damage, triggering healing, and maximizing the successive attack bonus from the talismans. Maintaining stamina for attacking and dodging is key to this high-pressure playstyle.

fields.name: Gargoyle's Black Axe build
fields.description: The single-wielding strategy centers on the Gargoyle's Black Axe's combination of Physical and Holy damage, primarily scaling with Strength and Faith. High investment in these stats maximizes the weapon's damage output, especially when wielded two-handed. The War Cry weapon skill, boosted by the Shard of Alexander talisman, is a key component, increasing attack power and modifying strong attacks into potent charging attacks. High poise armor, such as Lionel's or Bull-Goat sets, is crucial for withstanding enemy attacks during these animations. Further boosting the holy damage output is the Sacred Scorpion Charm, and the Ritual Sword Talisman rewards playing at full health. Gameplay involves leading with incantations like Golden Vow or Flame, Grant Me Strength (if utilizing the off-hand seal), then initiating with War Cry to activate the attack buff and altered R2s. These charging attacks, along with standard R1s, should be used to break enemy stance and deliver heavy blows. The Flask of Wondrous Physick, containing the Holy-Shrouding Cracked Tear and Stonebarb Cracked Tear, further amplifies Holy damage and aids in stance breaking.

fields.name: Gargoyles' Black Axe & Envoy's Greathorn build
fields.description: The dual-wielding approach focuses on overwhelming enemies with relentless powerstanced attacks and Holy damage output. High Strength and Faith investment are crucial for maximizing the damage of both Gargoyle's Black Axes. The Sacred Scorpion Charm is essential here, providing a significant boost to the Holy damage from both weapons, making each hit more impactful. The Claw Talisman is pivotal for this strategy, as it drastically increases the damage of powerstanced jump attacks, making them a primary means of initiating combat and dealing burst damage. High Endurance (35-40) is necessary to manage the stamina consumption of two heavy axes and maintain heavy armor. The Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman offers crucial physical damage negation. The Godfrey Icon can further enhance the charged attacks performed after using the War Cry skill on the main hand weapon. This strategy revolves around aggressive, continuous offense, initiating with devastating jump attacks, followed by chains of powerstanced attacks to rapidly deplete enemy health and stance, capitalizing on the boosted Holy damage and successive hit bonuses.

fields.name: Battle Hammer build
fields.description: The single-wielding strategy for the Battle Hammer relies heavily on its excellent Strength scaling, maximized by wielding it two-handed. The primary focus is on delivering powerful blows and exploiting enemy weaknesses through stance breaks, aided by the Stonebarb Cracked Tear. The Shard of Alexander is crucial for enhancing your chosen Ash of War, such as Lion's Claw for its high damage and poise breaking potential or Braggart's Roar for its beneficial stat buffs. The Axe Talisman further increases damage from charged attacks, which are a strong component of the Battle Hammer's moveset, according to the Elden Ring Wiki. High poise armor (like Lionel's or Bull-Goat sets) and the Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman ensure you can withstand hits and trade blows effectively. Gameplay involves leading with buffs, strategically using the Ash of War to deal burst damage or stagger, and following up with heavy and charged attacks to break enemy stances and maximize damage.

fields.name: Dual Battle Hammer build
fields.description: The dual-wielding strategy with two Battle Hammers emphasizes relentless offense and staggering opponents through continuous powerstanced attacks. High Strength investment remains paramount for maximizing the damage of both hammers. The Claw Talisman is a key component, significantly boosting the damage of the primary offensive maneuver: powerstanced jump attacks. These attacks deal high damage and rapidly build up enemy stance. On Reddit, users discuss that while not always optimal, dual-wielding Great Hammers can be effective in breaking poise. The Rotten Winged Sword Insignia further enhances damage by increasing attack power with successive hits, ideal for the continuous nature of dual-wielding attacks. High Endurance (35-40) is essential for managing the stamina drain from wielding two heavy weapons and wearing heavy armor. The Great-Jar's Arsenal or Erdtree's Favor +2 aids in managing equip load. This strategy involves initiating with powerful jump attacks, followed by sustained powerstanced attacks, and strategically using the main hand's Ash of War (boosted by the Shard of Alexander) to capitalize on openings and stun enemies.

fields.name: Great Mace build
fields.description: The single-wielding strategy for the Great Mace focuses on maximizing its Strength scaling, especially when two-handing, and delivering crushing blows. The Heavy infusion combined with high Strength investment ensures optimal damage. The Shard of Alexander is essential for boosting the chosen Ash of War, such as Cragblade, which not only increases physical damage but also significantly improves stance damage, allowing for quicker stance breaks. The Axe Talisman further enhances charged heavy attacks, a core part of the Great Mace's offensive. Heavy armor, such as Lionel's or Bull-Goat sets, combined with the Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman, provides the necessary poise and defense to withstand enemy attacks. The Flask of Wondrous Physick, with the Stonebarb Cracked Tear and Spiked Cracked Tear, is used to amplify poise damage and charged attacks, further enhancing stance breaking and burst damage. The strategic approach involves applying buffs (like Flame, Grant Me Strength if Faith is used), engaging with standard and charged attacks, and strategically using the chosen Ash of War to stagger enemies, then following up with critical hits or more heavy attacks.

fields.name: Great Mace & Great Stars build
fields.description: The dual-wielding strategy with Great Maces (or a Great Mace paired with another suitable Great Hammer like the Great Stars) emphasizes relentless offensive pressure and staggering opponents through continuous powerstanced attacks, particularly jump attacks. High Strength investment remains paramount for maximizing the damage of both hammers. The Claw Talisman is a key component, significantly boosting the damage of powerstanced jump attacks, making them a primary offensive maneuver for initiating combat and dealing burst damage. The Rotten Winged Sword Insignia further enhances damage by increasing attack power with successive hits, ideal for the continuous nature of dual-wielding attacks. High Endurance (35-40) is essential for managing the stamina drain from wielding two heavy weapons and wearing heavy armor. The Great-Jar's Arsenal helps manage equip load without compromising mobility. This strategy involves initiating with powerful jump attacks, followed by sustained powerstanced attacks, and strategically using the main hand's Ash of War (boosted by the Shard of Alexander) to capitalize on openings and stun enemies, focusing on rapidly depleting enemy health and stance while minimizing interruptions from enemy attacks.

fields.name: Curved Great Club build
fields.description: The single-wielding strategy for the Curved Great Club focuses on maximizing its Strength scaling, primarily achieved by wielding it two-handed. The weapon has a D scaling in Strength and Dexterity at standard. Infusing it with the Heavy affinity improves its Strength scaling to B, according to Maxroll. The Shard of Alexander is crucial for enhancing the chosen Ash of War, such as Cragblade, which increases both physical and stance damage, allowing for quicker stance breaks. The Axe Talisman further enhances the potent charged heavy attacks, a key part of the Curved Great Club's moveset, according to YouTube. High poise armor (like Lionel's or Bull-Goat sets) and the Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman provide the necessary defense to withstand enemy attacks. The Flask of Wondrous Physick, with the Stonebarb Cracked Tear and Spiked Cracked Tear, is used to amplify poise damage and charged attacks, further enhancing stance breaking and burst damage. The strategic approach involves applying buffs (like Flame, Grant Me Strength if Faith is used), engaging with standard and charged attacks, and strategically using the chosen Ash of War to stagger enemies, then following up with critical hits or more heavy attacks.

fields.name: Curved Great Club & Large Club build
fields.description: The dual-wielding strategy with Curved Great Clubs (or a Curved Great Club paired with another suitable Great Hammer like the Large Club) emphasizes relentless offensive pressure and staggering opponents through continuous powerstanced attacks, particularly jump attacks, according to YouTube. High Strength investment remains paramount for maximizing the damage of both hammers. The Claw Talisman is a key component, significantly boosting the damage of powerstanced jump attacks, making them a primary offensive maneuver for initiating combat and dealing burst damage, according to YouTube. The Rotten Winged Sword Insignia further enhances damage by increasing attack power with successive hits, ideal for the continuous nature of dual-wielding attacks. High Endurance (35-40) is essential for managing the stamina drain from wielding two heavy weapons and wearing heavy armor. The Great-Jar's Arsenal helps manage equip load without compromising mobility. This strategy involves initiating with powerful jump attacks, followed by sustained powerstanced attacks, and strategically using the main hand's Ash of War (boosted by the Shard of Alexander) to capitalize on openings and stun enemies, focusing on rapidly depleting enemy health and stance while minimizing interruptions from enemy attacks.

fields.name: Celebrant's Skull build
fields.description: The single-wielding strategy for the Celebrant's Skull leverages its inherent Strength scaling, maximized by two-handing, and its unique rune-generating passive. Infusing it with the Heavy affinity optimizes damage output. The Shard of Alexander is crucial for boosting the chosen Ash of War, such as Barbaric Roar, which increases attack power and alters strong attacks into powerful combos, leading to more frequent hits and rune gains. Heavy armor, like Lionel's or Bull-Goat sets, and the Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman ensure survivability during aggressive engagements. The Axe Talisman enhances charged attacks, a potent aspect of this weapon's moveset, while the Godfrey Icon provides further boosts to charged attacks. The strategy involves applying buffs, engaging with standard and charged attacks, and utilizing the enhanced Ash of War to maximize hits and generate runes while dealing heavy damage and breaking enemy stance, synergizing with the Stonebarb Cracked Tear in the Flask of Wondrous Physick for increased poise damage.

fields.name: Dual Celebrant's Skull build
fields.description: The dual-wielding strategy with two Celebrant's Skulls focuses on overwhelming enemies with relentless powerstanced attacks and maximizing rune generation through continuous hits. High Strength investment remains paramount for both hammers (Heavy infused) to ensure optimal damage. The Claw Talisman is a key component, significantly boosting the damage of powerstanced jump attacks, making them a primary offensive maneuver for initiating combat and dealing burst damage. The Rotten Winged Sword Insignia further enhances damage by increasing attack power with successive hits, ideal for the continuous nature of dual-wielding strikes and maximizing rune gains through more frequent hits. High Endurance (35-40) and the Great-Jar's Arsenal are essential for managing the stamina drain and equip load of two heavy weapons and armor. This strategy involves initiating with powerful jump attacks, followed by sustained powerstanced attacks, and strategically using the main hand's Ash of War (boosted by the Shard of Alexander) to capitalize on openings, focusing on rapidly depleting enemy health and stance while continuously collecting runes.

fields.name: Envoy's Longhorn build
fields.description: The single-wielding strategy for the Envoy's Longhorn centers on maximizing its powerful Bubble Shower skill and holy damage output. High Faith is the most crucial scaling stat, as both the weapon's Holy damage and Bubble Shower scale heavily with it, with the skill gaining a damage bonus based on this attribute. The Shard of Alexander is essential for significantly boosting Bubble Shower's damage, while the Envoy Crown provides a unique 15% bonus to bubble skills, further amplifying its effectiveness. High poise armor, like Lionel's or Bull-Goat sets, allows you to withstand hits during the Bubble Shower animation and deliver attacks. The Sacred Scorpion Charm enhances Holy damage, while the Carian Filigreed Crest reduces the significant FP cost of Bubble Shower, allowing for more frequent use. The strategic approach involves applying Faith-based buffs (using a seal like the Godslayer's Seal or Erdtree Seal), then finding the optimal distance to unleash Bubble Shower, aiming to connect with as many bubbles as possible, especially against large enemies,. The Holy-Shrouding Cracked Tear and Faith-Knot Crystal Tear in the Flask of Wondrous Physick further boost Holy damage and Faith for maximum Bubble Shower impact.

fields.name: Envoy's Longhorn & Marika's Hammer build
fields.description: The dual-wielding strategy with two Envoy's Longhorns focuses on overwhelming enemies with relentless powerstanced attacks and Holy damage output. High Faith remains paramount for maximizing the damage of both hammers and their powerful Bubble Shower skills. The Claw Talisman is a key component, significantly boosting the damage of powerstanced jump attacks, making them a primary offensive maneuver for initiating combat and dealing burst damage. The Envoy Crown is essential for boosting Bubble Shower damage from both weapons. According to a YouTube video, the Envoy Crown increases bubble attack damage. The Sacred Scorpion Charm provides a significant boost to the Holy damage from both weapons, making each hit and each bubble more impactful. High Endurance (35-40) is essential for managing the stamina drain from wielding two heavy weapons and wearing heavy armor. The Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman offers crucial physical damage negation while trading blows. This strategy involves initiating with powerful jump attacks, followed by sustained powerstanced attacks, and strategically using Bubble Shower from both Longhorns to capitalize on openings, focusing on rapidly depleting enemy health and stance while minimizing interruptions from enemy attacks. The Holy-Shrouding Cracked Tear and Faith-Knot Crystal Tear further boost Holy damage and Faith for maximum Bubble Shower impact.

fields.name: Great Stars build
fields.description: The single-wielding strategy for the Great Stars revolves around its inherent Strength scaling, maximized by wielding it two-handed (Heavy infused), and exploiting its innate bleed and healing. The Shard of Alexander is crucial for boosting the chosen Ash of War, like Wild Strikes, which provides numerous hits for continuous healing and bleed buildup, according to Reddit. The Axe Talisman enhances charged attacks, a powerful part of this weapon's moveset, further increased by the Godfrey Icon. High poise armor (Lionel's or Bull-Goat sets) and the Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman ensure survivability during aggressive engagements. The strategy involves applying buffs (if using Bloodflame Blade, which requires Faith and Arcane), engaging with standard and charged attacks, and utilizing the enhanced Ash of War to maximize hits for healing and bleed buildup while dealing heavy damage and breaking enemy stance, synergizing with the Stonebarb Cracked Tear in the Flask of Wondrous Physick for increased poise damage.

fields.name: Great Stars & Battle Hammer build
fields.description: The dual-wielding strategy with two Great Stars (Heavy infused) focuses on overwhelming enemies with relentless powerstanced attacks, maximizing bleed buildup, and healing. High Strength investment is paramount for both hammers' damage. The Claw Talisman is a key component, significantly boosting the damage of powerstanced jump attacks, making them a primary offensive maneuver for initiating combat and dealing burst damage. The Rotten Winged Sword Insignia further enhances damage by increasing attack power with successive hits, ideal for the continuous nature of dual-wielding strikes and maximizing healing. The Lord of Blood's Exultation talisman provides a significant damage boost when bleed occurs, which will be frequent with two Great Stars. According to YouTube, dual-wielding Great Stars can quickly build up blood loss to break boss stances. High Endurance (35-40) and the Great-Jar's Arsenal are essential for managing the stamina drain and equip load of two heavy weapons and armor. This strategy involves initiating with powerful jump attacks, followed by sustained powerstanced attacks, and strategically using the main hand's Ash of War (boosted by the Shard of Alexander) to capitalize on openings and stun enemies, focusing on rapidly depleting enemy health and stance while continuously healing and applying bleed.

fields.name: Dual Great Stars build
fields.description: The dual-wielding strategy with two Great Stars (Heavy infused) focuses on overwhelming enemies with relentless powerstanced attacks, maximizing bleed buildup, and healing. High Strength investment is paramount for both hammers' damage. fields.name: Rotten Battle Axe build
fields.description: The single-wielding strategy centers on the Rotten Greataxe's unique ability to inflict Scarlet Rot buildup with each hit. According to the Elden Ring Wiki, it causes 65 Scarlet Rot buildup. The primary scaling choice depends on preference: either maximizing Strength with a Heavy infusion for high raw damage when two-handing, or focusing on Dexterity (Keen infusion) for faster attacks and potentially quicker Rot application, despite the base D Strength and C Dexterity scaling. The Kindred of Rot's Exultation talisman is crucial, as it boosts attack power by 20% when Scarlet Rot is inflicted on nearby enemies, which will happen frequently, according to a YouTube video. The Shard of Alexander is essential for enhancing the chosen Ash of War (like Cragblade for extra damage and stance breaking, or Lion's Claw for burst damage). High poise armor (like Lionel's or Bull-Goat sets) and the Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman ensure survivability during aggressive engagements. The strategy involves applying buffs (if applicable), engaging with standard and charged attacks to build up Scarlet Rot, and strategically using the enhanced Ash of War to deal heavy damage while the Rot passively drains enemy health. The Stonebarb Cracked Tear in the Flask of Wondrous Physick further aids in breaking enemy stances.

fields.name: The dual-wielding strategy with two Rotten Greataxes focuses on overwhelming enemies with rapid powerstanced attacks and maximizing Scarlet Rot buildup. According to TheGamer, the Rotten Greataxe is an excellent choice for its innate Scarlet Rot buildup. High Strength (Heavy infusion) or Dexterity (Keen infusion) are crucial for maximizing the damage of both Greataxes. The Claw Talisman is a key component, significantly boosting the damage of powerstanced jump attacks, making them a primary offensive maneuver for initiating combat and rapidly building up status effects, according to Reddit. The Rotten Winged Sword Insignia further enhances damage by increasing attack power with successive hits, ideal for the continuous nature of dual-wielding strikes. The Kindred of Rot's Exultation talisman is essential for boosting attack power once Scarlet Rot is active on enemies. High Endurance (35-40 or more) is vital for managing the stamina drain from wielding two heavy weapons and wearing heavy armor. The Mushroom Crown further boosts attack power when rot or poison is nearby. This strategy involves initiating with powerful jump attacks, followed by sustained powerstanced attacks, and strategically using the main hand's Ash of War (boosted by the Shard of Alexander) to capitalize on openings, focusing on rapidly depleting enemy health and stance while continuously applying Scarlet Rot and benefiting from the associated damage boosts.
